record.title: 880-03 Kashf al-lithām ʻan asʼilat al-anām : manuscript / Ḥusayn ibn Muḥammad al-Maḥallī.
record.note: On folio 1a: "Kitāb Kashf al-lithām ʻan asʼilat al-anām, taʼlīf al-Imām al-ʻallāmah al-Shaykh Ḥusayn al-Maḥallī, raḥimahu Allāh. Āmīn."
On folio 1a: Quotations from the poetry of the author and his son Aḥmad.
On folio 1b: "... wa-sammaytuhu Kashf al-lithām ʻan asʼilat al-anām ..."

Author's colophon: "Wa-Allāh aʻlam. Wa-hādhā ākhir mā aradnā jamʻahu, jaʻalahu Allāh khāliṣan li-wajhihi al-karīm wa-mukhalliṣan min hawl al-karb al-ʻaẓīm, wa-fataḥa ʻalá man talaqqāhu bi-qalb salīm."

Translation of the author's colophon: "God is more knowledgeable. This is the end of what we wanted to compile. May God render it purely for the sake of His gracious face, and a means for deliverance from the torment of the horrible distress [Judgment Day]. May He reward him who wholeheartedly accepts it."

Copyist's colophon: "Wa-hādhihi al-nuskhah nuqilat min musawwadat muʼllifihā al-Shaykh Ḥusayn al-Maḥallāwī, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-ʻulūmihi wa-al-muslimīn. Thumma inna al-muʼallif bayyaḍa wa-jamaʻa nuskhatahu fī 15 shahr Shawwāl, sanat 1155. <Āmīn>. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat hādhihi al-nuskhah yawm al-Arbaʻ al-mubārak, 14 shahr Rajab al-ḥarām, alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat alf wa-miʼah khamsah wa-thamānīn <1175>. Wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb. In tajid ʻayban fa-sudda al-khalalā // jalla man lā fīhi ʻaybun wa-ʻalā."

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "This copy was transcribed from the draft of its author al-Shaykh Ḥusayn al-Maḥallāwī, may God benefit [us] and the Muslims by his sciences. The author then wrote and compiled a fair copy, on 15 Shawwāl, 1155 [13 December, 1742]. <Amen>. This copy was completed on blessed Wednesday, 14 Rajab, 1185 [23 October, 1771]. <1175>. God is more knowledgeable of what is correct. If you were to find a blemish close the gap // Mighty and Sublime is the One in whom no blemish exists."

record.title: Diary describing travels in Italy and Switzerland : manuscript.
record.note: Date is extrapolated based on the stationary from the Grand Hotel Locarno that is dated "190_" with the end digit left blank to be filled in. Of the years from 1900 to 1909, the dates and days of the week in the diary align with the year 1906.

Three different types of stationary are included. Four sheets are from the Grand Hotel Locarno with an engraved headpiece of the hotel and surrounding landscape. Two sheets are from Hotel Bear in Grindelwald bearing a wood engraving illustration of the hotel and nearby glacier accompanied by two other decorative illustrated scenes. Two sheets are from the Grand Hotel Thunerhof with an engraved headpiece of the hotel alongside Hotel Bellevue.

record.title: Draft announcement on the employment of boys from the Blue Coat Hospital in Manchester : manuscript.

record.title: Letter from Edward Fullbrook to an unidentified recipient : manuscript.
record.note: "In the matter of a petition filed on behalf Edward Fullbrook, formerly of Summer-town, St Giles', Oxford, and late of Woodcott, Southstoke, Oxford, Yeoman, being a person of unsound mind, and a prisoner in the gaol of Oxford Castle, in the County of Oxford. Whereas it appears to the court, by the record of William Henry Ashhurst, esq. one of Her Majesty's Justices of the Peace for the said county, made and certified to the court by the said Justice of the Peace, according to the statue in that behalf, that the said prisoner is of unsound mind, and therefore incapable of taking the benefit of the said act in such manner as a person of sound mind might do ... it is ordered and appointed, that application shall be made to the court for the discharge of the said prisoner, at the court-house, in Portugal Street, Lincoln's-Inn-Fields, on the 25th day of November 1839, at the hour of ten in the forenoon precisely, in order that the court may proceed to the discharge of said prisoner, if otherwise entitled thereto according to the true intent and meaning of the said act."--London Gazette, 1839 November 1.

record.title: Letter from James I to an unidentified recipient : manuscript.
record.note: On the folded sheet, there is writing on only the recto of the first page. The other pages are blank.

record.title: Letter from Albert, Prince Consort, to Prince Victor of Hohenlohe-Langenburg : manuscript.
record.note: There is writing on only one side of the folded leaf.
Date of production is derived from the date of Prince Ernst's death.

record.title: Letter from Albert, Prince Consort, to an unidentified recipient : manuscript.
record.note: There is writing on only two pages of the folded sheet. The recto pages are decorated with a gold crown stamp in the top left corner.

The Mr. Meyer referenced in the letter may likely be William Meyer, Stallmeister and Master of the Horse, who was a part of the royal household. He retired from royal service in 1871. The Lord Albemarl referenced in the letter may likely be William Keppel, 4th Earl of Albemarle, who was the Master of Horse, under Lord Melbourne.

Recipient of the letter is possibly Thomas Percival (1740-1804).

record.title: Sir Henry Holland papers, 1805-1868 (bulk 1805-1843).
record.note: Box 1 contains six volumes: "Essays on Various Subjects" including "On the Doctrine of Necessity" and "On the Nature & Origin of Human Passions & Affections," with a translation from Sophocles laid in, 1805-1806; "Journal in Spain," 1812; "Journal in Lombardy, Austria, Prussia, &c.," 1815; "Sketches in Italy & Germany, Belgium, &c." [includes Hungary and Holland], 1815; "Journal in the North of Italy and France," 1816; and "Journey to Spa" [Belgium and France], 1818. Box 2 contains two volumes: "No. I," 1812; and "Vol. II," 1830-1843.
Boxes 3-6 contain two copies each of Holland's General View of the Agriculture of Cheshire (1813), and Recollections of Past Life (1868). All were cataloged separately.
In contemporary bindings.

record.title: Admission ticket for the Mary Linwood exhibition at Hanover Sqr. Concert Rooms, 1802 : manuscript.

She was then in her ninetieth year." The admission ticket and the portrait are mounted together on a larger sheet of blue paper.

record.note: Manuscript note on inside front cover: “Contains autographs of Schoolmaster Ezekiel Cheever and his son Thomas, and others. The constitution is in the old schoolmaster’s chirography. HMD.”

record.title: Volume of two tracts of John Eliot : manuscript.
record.note: Manuscript note opposite title page: “The two tracts, in these pages following continued, I have copied with the greatest care, with my own hand, from the originals (supposed to be unique) which were in my possession [...] Henry M. Dexter. Hillside, Roxbury. 21 April, 1864.”

record.title: Thomas Cartwright letters against Brownism : manuscript.
record.note: Manuscript note opposite first title page: “Copied for me, in the spring of 1871; by A. A. Burt.”
Manuscript note opposite second title page: “The answer unto a letter of Master Harrisons, which follows, I have copied from a book in Dr. Williams’s Library [...] London, 19 May, 1871. H.M.D.”

record.title: Henry Martyn Dexter abstract of Robert Harrison’s A little treatise vppon the firste verse of the 122. Psalm : manuscript.
record.note: Manuscript note opposite title page: “This is a little book of Robert Harrison’s [...] I have made this abstract from the copy in the British Museum [3090.a.] having given in full the title page and preface, and the pith of what bears upon the Church Government Controversy. 15 Nov. 1871. HMD.”

record.title: Eleazer Wheelock letter to Joseph Bellamy, Bethlehem, Connecticut, 1742 April 11 : manuscript.
record.note: No. 2 of 3 titles bound together.

record.title: James Davenport letter "to the Revd. moderator of ye Association of ye County of Lichfield" : manuscript.
record.note: No. 3 of 3 titles bound together.

record.title: Francis White letter to “Mr. Young” : manuscript.
record.note: Removed from: Francis White, The Philadelphia directory (Philadelphia : Printed by Young, Stewart, and M'Culloch, in Chesnut-Street, M,DCC,LXXXV. [1785]) (call number 2004 1386).

record.title: Dialing notebook : manuscript.
record.note: Bound with John Edwards, Directions for Making the Best Composition of Casting, Grinding and Polishing, and Giving Them the True Parabolic Figure, London, [1783?], and another autograph notebook on astronomical instruments. Number 3 of 3 titles bound together. Volume extent: 356 pages.

record.title: Notebook of astronomical instruments : manuscript.
record.note: Bound with John Edwards, Directions for Making the Best Composition of Casting, Grinding and Polishing, and Giving Them the True Parabolic Figure, London, [1783?], and an autograph notebook on dailing. Number 2 of 3 titles bound together. Volume extent: 356 pages.

record.title: Hans Smit advertisements of medicines : typescript.
record.note: Accompanying typescript note: "One of two copies used as end papers in a copy in contemporary binding of "Sermons of Master John Calvin upon the book of Job" translated out of the French by Arthur Golding. / Colophon: Imprinted at London. Henrie Binneman for Lucas Harrison & George Bishop. Anno. 1574. / These broadsides were noticed in August 1919 and taken out."

record.title: Program for 1914 concert featuring the music and songs of Black composers, performed at Ebenezer Methodist Episcopal Church, Jacksonville, Florida : typescript / printed by Chas. J. Lightsy, 615 W. Duval St.
record.note: Title on the front cover is "Programme : A Chorus of Thirty Voices presents Negro Music as written by the foremost Negro composers under auspices of Ladies' Auxiliary of Provident Hospital at Ebenezer Methodist Episcopal Church."

record.title: Livres de Pierre Lecuire: Exposition à la Bibliothèque Nationale de France : videorecording / Architecte de l'exposition Frédéric Beauclair Réalisation: Jean-Louis Laforêt Assisté de: Jean-François Bauret Arthur Cemin Musique: Erich Wolfgang Korngold.
record.note: The date of the item was estimated based on information from the label and the date of acquisition.
Autograph note on paper adhered to back of case: Gift to the Beinecke Library from Pierre Lecuire. 14.02.2003 2/5.

record.title: Press release containing Willa Robertson's prize-winning essay My experiences with integration : typescript.
record.note: Date estimated from textual clues and Tougaloo Southern Christian College's 1962 name change to Tougaloo College.
On United Negro College Fund letterhead.

record.title: Notes on religion, care of the body, monarchy, and other subjects : manuscript.
record.note: Binding: sheep over wood boards.
To view associated print record, search by call number: Obsorn fpb93.

record.title: Verena Roy notebook : manuscript.
record.note: Dates based on textual information.

record.title: Program for Dark cavalcade : a drama with music, presented by the Negro Little Theatre of Norwalk : typescript.
record.note: Originally stapled together as a single volume; staples removed due to preservation concerns.

record.title: A list and short description of the birds of the United States according to Alexander Wilson's American ornithology : manuscript.
record.note: Date estimated from information printed on original slipcase.
Two pages are numbered 100.

record.title: Richard Polwhele notebooks : manuscript.
record.note: The first ten volumes have been roughly stitched together (much of the sewing now broken), many with their original marble wrappers. The second also sewn together and numbered I-VII.

record.title: Journal and commonplace book of a young lady, 30 September 1794 : manuscript and printed text.
record.note: Pagination: 86; 35, [33, blanks], [12, pages containing pasted-in newspaper scraps, engravings].
Bound in contemporary full calf, red morocco label to front board stamped in gold "Journal" and with a paper label with a title in manuscript "Young lady's journal of 1794" in later hand. Rebacked.

record.title: Diary : manuscript.
record.note: Includes a transcript of the diary provided by the bookseller.

record.title: Copy of letter to Rufus Ingalls and table of distances from Walla Walla to Salt Lake City, 1858 : manuscript.
record.note: Date of copy based on contextual information provided by the items in WA MSS S-4021 In4.

record.title: George Foljambe pocket book recording expenditure in London : manuscript.
record.note: Numbering: 27 unnumbered pages, tabbed index, 90, 2 unnumbered pages.
In contemporary plain vellum wallet binding; faded contemporary ink titling to back cover: George Foljambe ... 1733 ... 1734.

record.title: John Seton notebook of private expenses : manuscript.
record.note: Manuscript in ink; octavo; 18 numbered pages interleaved with blanks, with seven blank leaves at the end; stitched as issued in contemporary limp calf.

record.title: James Weldon Johnson letter, to Charles H. Wesley, 1937 August 11 : manuscript.
record.note: Place of production from stationery: Five Acres, Seekonk Road, Great Barrington, Mass.

record.title: John H. Pleasonton letter to his father, 1823 June 13.
record.note: Autograph letter, signed.

record.title: Citizen Kane : pre-production script, a Mercury Production : typescript / direction-production Orson Welles ; screenplay Herman J. Mankiewicz [and] Orson Welles.
record.note: Typescript draft has original wrappers with split pins. Includes two leaves numbered 69. Autograph note, signed by Harriett Roeg, in pencil on title page: "From the library of Nicolas Roeg."
Accompanying letter is on Beverly Wilshire Hotel stationery.

record.title: Emily Griffin commonplace book : manuscript.
record.note: Pages numbered in ink, the first leaf presumably intended as a title but never completed. Sketches in pen and ink, watercolor and pencil. Paper watermarked 1823. Bound in original dark brown panelled morocco decorated in gilt and blind, spine in compartments, one lettered in gilt ‘Album’, gilt edges.

record.title: Diary and commonplace book : manuscript.
record.note: Original blue paper wrappers.

record.title: 880-02 Berāt of Abdülhamid II : manuscript.
record.note: Romanization supplied by cataloger.
In dīwānī script.
Sultanic tughra and el-Ġāzi (الغازي) written in gold. Rubrication.

record.title: Houghton family leases and library catalogue : manuscript.
record.note: Sewn within contemporary marbled wrappers.

Internal evidence suggests a mid-18th century date for cataloging the library. The watermark (Pro Patria, with countermark GR) suggests that the laid paper dates from around 1750. The latest publication date of the volumes listed is Whiston’s Josephus (London 1737). Perhaps the library left by John Houghton and inherited by his son John.

record.title: Debt acknowledgement of Robert Borthwick of Vergennes to John Love of Shoreham for $200.00 : manuscript.
record.note: Signed: Royall Tyler, Chief Judge of the Sup. Court writ dated January 26 1810.
On verso: Writ of error, thereof Benajah Place et al. vs. John Love, Addison, Jan. 4 1810, no. 1 under new act.

record.title: John Eliot financial accounts and letterbooks : manuscript.
record.note: First volume: Contents page and approximately 140 text pages (numbered to page 96), followed by 16 blank leaves. Bound in green vellum, initialled "J E III" in manuscript to front board. Written in the same neat, clear copper-plate hand, on paper with watermark: Fleur-de-lis above GR; countermark: C Taylor.

Second volume: Letterbook of approximately 170 text pages, and approximately 60 pages of accounts (together 230 pages, excluding a few blanks). Some pages excised at each end. Bound in green vellum, one clasp intact. Ruled in red for accounts. Probably a stationer's book. Text and accounts written in the same neat, clear italic hand, on paper with watermark: Pro Patria above GR. Manuscript inscription laid on back pastedown: "Gulielma Briggins her book March 1734".

record.title: Letter from Henry Rivington Hill to his sister describing George IV's Coronation, 1821 July 26 : manuscript.
record.note: With a detailed hand-drawn map of the procession route, along with the original envelope addressed to "Miss Hannah Maria Hill" and annotated "Containing what I saw of the procession at the Coronation of George the 4th in 1821." Also with a small piece of black fabric claimed to be from the Coronation robe.

record.title: Diplomas and certificates granted to Giovanni Maria : manuscript.
record.note: Contemporary gold-tooled brown leather binding.
First page is decorated with a coat of arms. Next to the coat of arms are a skeleton and a skinless individual. Cherub carrying banner with "In Dei nomine. Amen" on pages three and eleven.

record.title: Buch von den probierten Künsten : manuscript.
record.note: Includes an illustration depicting Helm's concept of a rocket cat, i.e. the use of incendiary devices strapped to animals to penetrate fortifications.

The first leaf begins: "Ain Buech durch ainen Kriegesverstenndgen auss viele probierten Kinsten zusammengezogen, wie ein Zeughauss samptaller Monitur soll gehalten werden. Von Salbetter, Schwefell, Kolen, Pulver, Prechzeug, Fewrpfeil, Mordtfeur, Vergifft, Reuch oder Dempf Wie man sich derselben erweren soll. Auch ainen Bericht der Wagenburg, wie man diselbigen schlagen soll." Dated MDLXX.
Folio 63 is missing.

record.title: Scrapbook with caricatures and other prints, manuscripts, cuttings, drawings, silhouettes, poems]
record.note: With some French and Italian prints including prints from the series: Caricatures parisiennes, Métamorphoses du jour. Scenes of London.
Interest in France and Italy; the Americas; India and the Middle East.
Album is inscribed by "HH", probably Hubert Hutchings, who references his mother Elizabeth Clark Savery Hutchings (1777-1845).
Album paper watermarked "1823".

record.title: Francis A. Harris letter to Benjamin Coates, 1845 January 25 : manuscript.
record.note: Letter written on a 25 x 40 cm sheet of paper folded in half to create pages measuring 25 x 20 cm, then further folded, addressed, and sealed with red wax.

record.title: Samuel Huntington letter, to Heman Swift, 1787 May 17 : manuscript.
record.note: Sections of page detached at folds; some vermin damage; blue paper fragment affixed to bottom of verso.

record.title: Herbert Feis memoir : typescript.
record.note: Donor inherited this copy of the memoir in 2000. Date span of authorship estimated from information in text.

record.title: Thomas Tipton accounts and memoranda book : manuscript.
record.note: Bound in contemporary reverse calf, with a stamp "T. Tipton" on front pastedown.

On recto of front flyleaf: West of England Fire Insurance Company. John Gildon [probably John Gliddon who was secretary from 1807-1810]. West of England Fire Insurance Company was established in 1806 and changed its name to West of England Fire and Life Insurance Company in August of 1808.

record.title: Notebook of poems : manuscript.
record.note: Date estimated from pencilled note on front free endpaper.

record.title: Student notes on and drawings of human anatomy : manuscript.
record.note: Binding: sheets of paper are housed in a contemporary brown marbled paper binding over pasteboard, though unbound. Binding's spine has broken apart; hence, binding now consists of separated front and back cover.

Anatomical drawings: of a skull in profile, of a skull in 3/4 view (manuscript note: non omnis moriar, Στεφανος τους [sic] αθανατοις), of the clavicle and its articulations, of the larynx (3 different perspectives), of the lungs and heart (also includes a sketch of the same drawing; heart itself lifts up to reveal the vascular system), of the male reproductive system (covered by different layers of drawn feathers; includes a copious amount of moveable flaps), of the brain (also with moveable flaps), of the muscles of the ear, and of a man's head. The last drawing is particularly intricate: the top flap shows the man's skin; the three following flaps show muscles; the next shows the skull with an additional flap for the eye; then a flap for the brain matter; final few flaps show a variety of muscles and the larynx. Drawings measure from about 20 x 20 cm to 46.5 cm x 33 cm. They are housed in a large white paper sheet, separately from the notes.

Printed certificate is unsigned, undated, and otherwise unidentified: Theatre London Hospital, Mr. ... has diligently attended ... course of Anatomical Demonstrations and Dissection delivered during the Session ... Certificate was meant to be filled out with manuscript material, but was left unfilled.
Also includes engraved hand-coloured print of an eye: A Diagram of the Human Eye. Published as the Act directs; 1803, J. Murray, Fleet Street.
Sheets with student notes generally consist of multiple sheets of folio paper glued together (up to 9 sheets) and are folded. Longest sheet measures about 195 cm.

record.title: À l'ombre des jeunes filles en fleurs : galley proof, with autograph corrections and additions.
record.note: The text corresponds to pages 28-42 of the 1919 French edition of À l'ombre des jeunes filles en fleurs published by Gallimard, in which the narrator discusses his family's relations with Mr. de Norpois and watches the actress Berma in Racine's rendition of Phaedra.
Date from printer's stamp.

record.title: Naval log book describing voyages and engagements in Central America and China : manuscript.
record.note: Naval log book of thirty-seven leaves, including 72 pages of manuscript entries in ink on pale blue ruled paper, divided into four sections separately paginated: [4],1-17, [3], 1-21, 1-29 pages
Contemporary quarter sheep and marbled boards, binding rubbed and worn, spine mostly perished in later custom case.
Title in manuscript on front free endpaper: Log of a cruise in the U.S. Sloop of War Cyane 1851, 1852, 1853, 1854; at top of page in a different hand: Kept by Daniel C. Brayton, sailmaker.

record.title: Pali-language fragments.
record.note: Layout: 5 lines.
Script: Khmer/Khom.
Binding: no binding; covered in paper wrapper.
Place of creation either Siam (Thailand) or Cambodia due to use of specific, local letter forms. Identified by Trent Walker (personal correspondence).

record.title: Medical manuscript fragment.
record.note: Script: gothic minuscule.
Layout: single column of 27 lines.
Decoration: one large miniature showing a doctor letting a lady's blood in front of a sky and grass background. Rubrication. Large two-line initials in red and blue ink.
Folds in parchment likely indicate fragment's use as binding waste.

record.title: Richard Worsam Meade diary and copy book on his first trip to England and Europe : including details of the extralegal seizure of American vessels by the British Navy : manuscript.
record.note: In duodecimo leatherbound journal, leather covers worn and flaked.
Manuscript accomplished in a mixture of ink and pencil.

30 pages with text, consisting of 20 pages of journal entries, with additional sheet laid in of shorter diary entries, and 10 pages related to accounts, dated December, 1794, through March, 1795, with rest of leaves blank.
Journal entries record Meade’s arrival in England in June, 1795, and portions of his travels through France in August of the same year; journal portion approximately 2100 words.

record.title: Seven fragments from the Aṣṭasāhasrikā Prajñāpāramitā Sūtra.
record.note: Layout: 6 lines.
Script: rañjanā script.
Binding: unbound.

record.title: Collection of treatises, translations, and correspondence : manuscript.
record.note: No binding.

record.title: Aziel Barnes poetry : composed between 1815 and 1843 : manuscript.
record.note: Several passages underlined in red in an unidentified hand.

record.title: 880-02 Rashf al-zulāl min al-siḥr al-ḥalāl : manuscript / Jalāl al-Dīn al-Suyūṭī.
record.note: On folios 17b and 18a seals of "Ibrāhīm."

Colophon: "Wa-hādhā ākhir al-maqāmāt. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābih dhawī al-murūwāt al-dhābbīn ʻan dīnihi bi-ḥadd al-murhafāt wa-sallama taslīman kathīran ilá yawmin tuḍāʻafu fīhi al-ḥasanāt. Balaghat muqābalatan bi-ḥasb al-ṭāqah. Sanat 1270."

Translation of the colophon: "This is the end of the "maqamahs". May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and companions, the virtuous ones, who protect his religion by the edge of the sharp swords, and grant them abundant peace, until that day in which good deeds will be rewarded multiple folds. It was collated to the best of ability in the year 1270."

record.title: Biographies of Muslim leaders : manuscript.
record.note: Title of "Mawāsim al-ibtihāj fī istimāʻ mukhtaṣar al-Miʻrāj" from folio 1a.
Title of "Durrat al-ʻiqd al-ʻaqīq wa-zahrat al-ghuṣn al-rashīq fī manāqib Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā al-Sayyid al-sanad Abī Bakr al-Ṣiddīq" from folio 17a.
Title of "Qurrat aʻyun al-aḥbāb fī baʻḍ manāqib Abī Ḥafṣ Sayyidinā ʻUmar ibn al-Khaṭṭāb" from folio 31a.
Title of "al-Fatʹḥ wa-al-bushrá fī manāqib al-Zahrā" from folio 43a.
Title of "al-Maqāṣid al-fukhrá fī baʻḍ manāqib al-Sayyidah Khadījah al-Kubrá" from folio 48a.
Title of "al-ʻIqd al-thamīn fī manāqib al-Sayyidah ʻĀʼishah Umm al-Muʼminīn" from folio 53a.
Title of "Manāqib Sayyidī Abī Ṣāliḥ al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Qadir al-Jīlānī" from folio 59a.
Title of "Nubdhah fī manāqib Sayyidī ʻAbd al-Qādir al-Jīlānī" from folio 67a.

Incipit of "Mawāsim al-ibtihāj fī istimāʻ mukhtaṣar al-Miʻrāj": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Ḥamdan li-man nawwara al-wujūd wa-maḥā ʻan muḥayyāh qatām al-aḥzān wa-qashaʻa ʻan samāʼ ṭalʻatihi ghawāsiq al-bawn bi-ishrāq shumūs al-isrá [al-Isrā] ..."

Incipit of "Durrat al-ʻiqd al-ʻaqīq wa-zahrat al-ghuṣn al-rashīq fī manāqib Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā al-Sayyid al-Sanad Abī Bakr al-Ṣiddīq": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī aṭlaʻa fī samāʼ al-sharaf shams al-durrah al-Muḥammadīyah sāṭʻat al-ḍiyāʼ wa-al-anwār wa-asṭaʻa nūr al-kamāl zāhiran fī jabhat al-dhāt al-Aḥmadīyah musarbalatan bi-malābis al-jamāl wa-al-asrār ..."

Incipit of "Qurrat aʻyun al-aḥbāb fī baʻḍ manāqib Abī Ḥafṣ Sayyidinā ʻUmar ibn al-Khaṭṭāb": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Ayā man qarraba ilá ḥaḍrat mushāhadatihi man ikhtārahiu min ʻibādih wa-iṣṭafāh wa-ijtabā [wa-ijtabá] li-mukālamatihi man ṣaluḥa li-mujālasatihi wa-saqāhu min ṣafwat ʻuqār muwānasatihi mā ṣaffāh ..."

Incipit of "al-Fatʹḥ wa-al-bushrá fī manāqib al-Zahrā": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Ḥamdan li-man jaʻala maḥabbat ahl bayt Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, fāṭimatan ʻan irtiḍāʻ thady mā lā yarḍāh wa-nawwara layālī wujūdihim bi-miṣbāḥ al-Sayyid al-abarr ..."

Incipit of "al-Maqāṣid al-fukhrá fī baʻḍ manāqib al-Sayyidah Khadījah al-Kubrá": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-mannān bi-Muḥammad ibn ʻAdnān wa-al-shukr lillāh al-ḥannān bi-majmaʻ al-raʼfah wa-al-iḥsān wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām minhu ʻalá khayr al-kirām wa-ʻalá jamīʻ al-anbiyāʼ al-fikhām wa-ʻalá al-āl wa-al-aṣḥāb wa-al-atbāʻ ..."

Incipit of "al-ʻIqd al-thamīn fī manāqib al-Sayyidah ʻĀʼishah Umm al-Muʼminīn": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Subḥāna man zayyana nuḥūr man shāʼ bi-mā shāʼ min jawāhir al-qabūl wa-al-iqbāl wa-adhāqahu min ḥumayyā ḥubbihi fa-intashá min ʻuqār dhālika al-zulāl ..."

Incipit of "Manāqib Sayyidī Abī Ṣāliḥ al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Qadir al-Jīlānī": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-qādir alladhī arsala ʻalá ʻabdihi saḥāʼiba al-fatʹḥ wa-al-ʻirfān wa-jaʻalahu bāzan ashhab ilá awj al-maʻālī ṭāyir wa-quṭban nayyiran bayna kawākib al-akhdān ..."

Incipit of "Nubdhah fī manāqib Sayyidī ʻAbd al-Qādir al-Jīlānī": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī arsala Sayyidinā Muḥammad, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, bi-kāmil al-sharīʻah wa-khāliṣ al-dīn wa-ḥallá jīd risālatihi bi-bāhir al-khawāriq wa-ayyadahu bi-kumāt al-aṣḥāb al-muhtadīn ... Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-muftaqir ilá faḍl al-Karīm al-munjī Jaʻfar ibn Ḥasan ibn ʻAbd al-Karīm al-Barzanjī: Hādhihi nubdhah min aḥwāl al-quṭb al-Rabbānī wa-al-ghawth al-ṣamadānī ... Sayyidinā al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Qādir al-Jīlānī ..."
Secundo folio of "Mawāsim al-ibtihāj fī istimāʻ mukhtaṣar al-Miʻrāj": dūnihi Jibrīl wa-jamīʻ.
Secundo folio of "Durrat al-ʻiqd al-ʻaqīq wa-zahrat al-ghuṣn al-rashīq fī manāqib Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā al-Sayyid al-Sanad Abī Bakr al-Ṣiddīq": durr majdihi bi-ḍiyāʼ.
Secundo folio of "Qurrat aʻyun al-aḥbāb fī baʻḍ manāqib Abī Ḥafṣ Sayyidinā ʻUmar ibn al-Khaṭṭāb": al-muʼminīn Sayyidinā ʻUmar ibn al-Khaṭṭāb.
Secundo folio of "al-Fatʹḥ wa-al-bushrá fī manāqib al-Zahrā": qāʼilahā ʻan waṣmat al-nifāq.
Secundo folio of "al-Maqāṣid al-fukhrá fī baʻḍ manāqib al-Sayyidah Khadījah al-Kubrá": qāla khayr nisāʼihā Maryam.
Secundo folio of "al-ʻIqd al-thamīn fī manāqib al-Sayyidah ʻĀʼishah Umm al-Muʼminīn": bi-surūr jawāhir kuntu lak.
Secundo folio of "Manāqib Sayyidī Abī Ṣāliḥ al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Qadir al-Jīlānī": lawāmiʻ al-anwār wa-aṣḥābihi.
Secundo folio of "Nubdhah fī manāqib Sayyidī ʻAbd al-Qādir al-Jīlānī": hādhihi nubdhah min aḥwāl.

On folio 1a: "Mawāsim al-ibtihāj fī istimāʻ mukhtaṣar al-Miʻrāj min taʼlīf al-ḥaqīr Ṣiddīq al-Madanī ibn ʻUmar Khān tilmīdh al-Shaykh Sayyidī Muḥammad al-Sammān nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi. Āmīn."

On folio 17a: "Hādhihi Durrat al-ʻiqd al-ʻaqīq wa-zahrat al-ghuṣn al-rashīq fī manāqib Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā al-Sayyid al-Sanad Abī Bakr al-Ṣiddīq, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu wa-arḍāh wa-afāḍ ʻalaynā min hibāt fayḍihi wa-jadwāh, taʼlīf al-muftaqir ilá ʻafw Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn ʻabduhu Muḥammad Taqī al-Dīn ibn al-Shaykh ʻUmar ibn al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Qādir Amīn al-Zarʻah al-Faqīh al-Ḥanafī al-Makkī, kāna Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayh. Āmīn."

On folio 31a: "Hādhihi Qurrat aʻyun al-aḥbāb fī baʻḍ manāqib Abī Ḥafṣ Sayyidinā ʻUmar ibn al-Khaṭṭāb, raḍiya Allāh taʻālá ʻanhu wa-arḍāh wa-jaʻala al-Jannah munqalabahu wa-mathwāh wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."
On folio 43a: "al-Fatʹḥ wa-al-bushrá fī manāqib al-Zahrā lil-marḥūm Mawlānā al-Sayyid Muḥammad al-Jafrī, khādim al-Shaykh Muḥammad al-Sammān, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi. Āmīn."

On folio 48a: "al-Maqāṣid al-fukhrá fī baʻḍ manāqib al-Sayyidah Khadījah al-Kubrá li-sibṭihā al-aḥrá wa-najlihā al-ajrá al-faqīr al-ghanī ʻAbd Allāh Mīrghanī, kāna Allāh la-hu wa-al-Muslimīn."
On folio 53a: "al-ʻIqd al-thamīn fī manāqib al-Sayyidah ʻĀʼishah Umm al-Muʼminīn li-Mawlānā al-marḥūm Muḥammad al-Jafrī raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá. Āmīn."
On folio 59a: "Hādhihi Manāqib Sayyidī Abī Ṣāliḥ al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Qādir al-Jīlānī, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu wa-amaddanā bi-madadihi. Āmīn."

On folio 60a, the geneaology of the Sufi Shaykh ʻAbd al-Qādir al-Jīlānī is given as: "al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Qādir ibn Mūsá ibn ʻAbd Allāh ibn Yaḥyá al-Zāhid ibn Muḥammad ibn Dāwūd ibn Mūsá al-Jawn ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Maḥḍ ibn al-Ḥasan al-Muthanná ibn al-Ḥasan al-Sibṭ ibn Sayyidinā ʻAlī ibn Abī Ṭālib wa-ibn al-Sayyidah Fāṭimah bint Rasūl Allāh."
Folios 65 and 66 are blank.
On folio 67a: "Hādhihi Nubdhah fī manāqib Sayyidī ʻAbd al-Qādir al-Jīlānī, raḍiya Allāh taʻālá ʻanhu wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

Colophon of "Mawāsim al-ibtihāj fī istimāʻ mukhtaṣar al-Miʻrāj": "Tammat Mawāsim al-ibtihāj fī istimāʻ mukhtaṣar al-Miʻrāj min taʼlīf al-Shaykh Ṣiddīq ibn ʻUmar Khān tilmīdh Sayyidī al-Shaykh Muḥammad al-Sammān, 22 shahr Rajab al-fard, sanat 1209 [12 February, 1795]. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."

Translation of the colophon of "Mawāsim al-ibtihāj fī istimāʻ mukhtaṣar al-Miʻrāj": "The copy of Mawāsim al-ibtihāj fī istimāʻ mukhtaṣar al-Miʻrāj of al-Shaykh Ṣiddīq ibn ʻUmar Khān, a student of Sayyidī al-Shaykh Muḥammad al-Sammān was completed on 22 Rajab, 1209 [12 February, 1795]. Praise be to God the Lord of the Universe."

Colophon of "Durrat al-ʻiqd al-ʻaqīq wa-zahrat al-ghuṣn al-rashīq fī manāqib Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā al-Sayyid al-Sanad Abī Bakr al-Ṣiddīq": "Subḥāna Rabbika Rabb al-ʻIzzah ʻammā yaṣifūn, wa-salāmun ʻalá al-Mursalīn, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālii wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon of "Durrat al-ʻiqd al-ʻaqīq wa-zahrat al-ghuṣn al-rashīq fī manāqib Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā al-Sayyid al-Sanad Abī Bakr al-Ṣiddīq": "Glory be to God, the Lord of Glory. He is more sublime than what they describe. May peace be upon the Messengers. Praise be to God the Lord of the Universe. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and all his companions. Amen."

Colophon of "Qurrat aʻyun al-aḥbāb fī baʻḍ manāqib Abī Ḥafṣ Sayyidinā ʻUmar ibn al-Khaṭṭāb": "Subḥāna Rabbika Rabb al-ʻIzzah ʻammā yaṣifūn, wa-salāmun ʻalá al-Mursalīn, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Tamm. Tamm. Tamm. Tamm."

Translation of the colophon of "Qurrat aʻyun al-aḥbāb fī baʻḍ manāqib Abī Ḥafṣ Sayyidinā ʻUmar ibn al-Khaṭṭāb": "Glory be to God, the Lord of Glory. He is more sublime than what they describe. May peace be upon the Messengers. Praise be to God the Lord of the Universe. It is concluded. It is concluded. It is concluded. It is concluded."
Colophon of "al-Fatʹḥ wa-al-bushrá fī manāqib al-Zahrā": "Tamma wa-kamula bi-ʻawn Allāh wa-ḥusn tawfīqih."
Translation of the colophon of "al-Fatʹḥ wa-al-bushrá fī manāqib al-Zahrā": "It is concluded and completed by the help of God and His abundant benevolence."

Colophon of "al-Maqāṣid al-fukhrá fī baʻḍ manāqib al-Sayyidah Khadījah al-Kubrá": "Wa-hādhā khatm al-Maqāṣid wa-al-Fātiḥah ʻalá al-Maqāṣid wa-ʻalá nīyat kull qāṣid. Wa-kamula bi-ʻawn Allāh wa-ḥusn tawfīqih. Allāhum ighfir li-kātibihi wa-li-qārīhi wa-li-nāẓirihi. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon of "al-Maqāṣid al-fukhrá fī baʻḍ manāqib al-Sayyidah Khadījah al-Kubrá": "This is the end of 'al-Maqāṣid'. May [Sūrat] al-Fātiḥah be on 'al-Maqāṣid' and on the intentions of all seekers. It is completed by the help of God and His abundant benevolence. I beseech God to forgive its author, its reader and those who look into it. Amen."
Colophon of "al-ʻIqd al-thamīn fī manāqib al-Sayyidah ʻĀʼishah Umm al-Muʼminīn": "Tammat bi-ʻawn Allāh wa-ḥusn tawfīqih yawm al-Jumʻah waqt al-ẓuhr. Āmīn. Āmīn. Tamm."

Translation of the colophon of "al-ʻIqd al-thamīn fī manāqib al-Sayyidah ʻĀʼishah Umm al-Muʼminīn": "It is completed by the help of God and His abundant benevolence on Friday noon. Amen. Amen. It is completed."
Colophon of "Manāqib Sayyidī Abī Ṣāliḥ al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Qadir al-Jīlānī": "Tamma wa-kamula bi-ʻawn Allāh wa-ḥusn tawfīqih. Tamm. Tamm. Tamm."

Translation of the colophon of "Manāqib Sayyidī Abī Ṣāliḥ al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Qadir al-Jīlānī": "It is concluded and completed by the help of God and His abundant benevolence. It is concluded. It is concluded. It is concluded."

Colophon of "Nubdhah fī manāqib Sayyidī ʻAbd al-Qādir al-Jīlānī": "Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Āmīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Tamm. Tamm. Tamm."

Translation of the colophon of "Nubdhah fī manāqib Sayyidī ʻAbd al-Qādir al-Jīlānī": "Praise be to God the Lord of the Universe. Amen. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and all his companions. It is completed. It is concluded. It is concluded."

record.title: 880-02 al-Fatʹḥ al-mubīn bi-sharḥ al-Arbaʻīn : manuscript / Shihāb al-Dīn Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn Ḥajar al-Haythamī.
record.note: Table of contents (folio 1a-1b).
On case: "Sharḥ al-Arbaʻīn li-Ibn Ḥajar."

On folio 1a: Two ownership statements: 1. "Fī nawbat al-faqīr al-Sayyid Muḥammad Ṣādiq al-Maydānī bi-thaman [price erased]." 2. "Fī maktabat al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá Muḥammad Ḥasan ibn al-Sayyid Muḥammad al-Qūwatlī sanat 1267 fī 18 Shaʻbān al-mukarram al-muʻaẓẓam al-mufakhkham."

On folio 1a: Names of scholars and some death dates statements: al-Sayyid Taqī al-Dīn al-Ḥiṣnī (died 18 Dhū al-Ḥijjah, 1129), al-Shaykh ʻUthmān al-Shamʻah al-Shāfiʻī (died Tuesday, 19 Ṣafar, 1126), al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Kuzbarī (died 1264), al-Shaykh ʻAbd Allāh al-Kuzbarī (died 1265), al-Shaykh Aḥmad al-Muslim ibn al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Kuzbarī (started teaching in 1265), al-Shaykh Abū al-Mawāhib al-Ḥanbalī (died Wednesday, 30 Shawwāl, 1126), al-Shaykh ʻUthmān ibn Ḥammūdah al-Shāfiʻī (died Friday, end of Rabīʻ al-Awwal, 1120, in Damascus), al-Shaykh Ḥāmid al-ʻAṭṭār (died 1264), al-Shaykh Salīm Afandī al-ʻAṭṭār (started teaching instead of al-Shaykh Ḥāmid al-ʻAṭṭār, probably his father). Written by Muḥammad Ḥasan ibn al-Sayyid Muḥammad al-Qūwatlī, 18 Shaʻbān, 67 [1267].

On folio 2a: "Kitāb al-Fatʹḥ al-mubīn Sharḥ al-Arbaʻīn lil-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻallāmah al-humām barakat al-Muslimīn Shihāb al-millah wa-al-dīn niʻmat Allāh taʻālá ʻalayhi fī al-ʻālamīn Aḥmad Shihāb al-Dīn ibn Ḥajar al-Haythamī al-Makkī raḥmahu Allāh taʻālá. Āmīn."

Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min tanjīz hādhihi al-nuskhah al-mubārakah ṣabīḥat yawm al-Sabt al-mubārak shābiʻ ʻashar min shahr Dhī al-Ḥijjah min shuhūr sanat tisʻah ʻashar wa-miʼah wa-alf min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah ʻalá ṣāḥibihā azká al-salām wa-al-taḥīyah ʻalá yad afqar al-wará wa-aḥwajihim ilá Allāh taʻālá ʻAbd al-Salām ibn ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad ibn Manṣūr al-Dihnah, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."

Translation of the colophon: "This blessed copy was completed on the morning of blessed Saturday, 17 Dhū al-Ḥijjah, the year 1119 of the Hijrah of the Prophet, best peace and greetings be upon Him, by the poorest and the most needy to God the Most High, ʻAbd al-Salām ibn ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad ibn Manṣūr al-Dihnah, may God forgive him, his parents, and all Muslims. Amen. Praise be to God the Lord of the Universe."

record.title: 880-02 al-Īḍāḥ fī al-nikāḥ wa-al-bāh : manuscript / Jalāl al-Dīn al-Suyūṭī.
record.note: Table of contents (folios 1b-2a): "Hādhihi Fihrist hādhā al-kitāb al-musammá bi-al-Īḍāḥ."

On folio 1a: Kitāb al-bāh fī rujūʻ al-shaykh ilá al-ṣibāh [ṣibāh] taʼlīf al-ajall Jalāl al-Dīn al-Suyūṭī nafaʻanī Allāh bi-ʻulūmih wa-al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Wa-yalīhi nukat wa-ḥikāyāt wa-qarʻah."
On front cover: "Fī al-Īḍāḥ lil-Suyūṭī."
Text: Folios 2b-46b.
On folios 47a-48a: various anecdotes, intrigues and jokes.
Colophon: "Intahá Kitāb al-Īḍāḥ lil-Suyūṭī."
Translation of the colophon: "The book of al-Īḍāḥ by al-Suyūṭī is concluded."

record.title: 880-02 ʻAlam al-malāḥah fī ʻilm al-filāḥah : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Ghanī al-Nābulusī.
record.note: On folio 1a: "Hādhā Kitāb ʻAlam al-malāḥah fī ʻilm al-filāḥah taʼlīf quṭb al-ʻārifīn Sayyidī ʻAbd al-Ghanī al-Nābulusī nafaʻanā Allāh wa-al-Muslimīn bi-madadihi. Āmīn. M."
On folio 1a: "Yā Kubaykij iḥfaẓ al-waraq."
On case: "al-Malāḥah bi-al-filāḥah li-Sayyidī ʻAbd al-Ghanī al-Nābulusī."

Author's colophon: "Wa-qad kamula mā sammaynāhu 'ʻAlam al-malāḥah fī ʻilm al-filāḥah'. Wa-katabahu jāmiʻuhu al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá mawlāhu al-khabīr ʻAbd al-Ghanī ibn al-Nābulusī khatama Allāh la-hu bi-al-ḥusná wa-amaddahu bi-al-madad al-asná, wa-dhālika fī ṣabīḥat nahār al-Ithnayn al-thāmin min shahr Shawwāl sanat sabʻ wa-ʻishrīn wa-miʼah wa-alf min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah ḥāmidan Allāh taʻālá wa-muṣalliyan wa-musalliman ʻalá Rasūl Allāh wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi wa-atbāʻihi wa-aḥzābihi ajmaʻīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the author's colophon: "Concluded is what I titled 'ʻAlam al-malāḥah fī ʻilm al-filāḥah' [Banner of beauty in the science of agriculture]. It was written by its compiler the poor to his knowledgeable Lord ʻAbd al-Ghanī ibn al-Nābulusī, may God grant him an agreeable end and a glorious strength, on Monday morning, 8 Shawwal, 1127 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [7 October, 1715]. I praise God the Most High and pray upon the Messenger of God and upon his family, his companions, his followers and all his parties. Amen."

Copyist's colophon: "Wa-qad waqaʻa al-farāgh min kitābat hādhihi al-nuskhah al-mubārakah ʻashīyat yawm al-Khamīs al-khāmis wa-al-ʻishrīn min shahr Dhī al-Qaʻdah, sanat wāḥid wa-thamānīn wa-miʼatayn wa-alf min hijrat man tammat fī jamīʻ aṣḥābihi al-ʻadālah wa-khutimat bi-hi ṣaḥāʼif al-nubūwah wa-al-risālah, ʻlayhi wa-ʻalá ālihi al-kirām wa-aṣḥābihi al-ʻiẓām mā yadūmu ilá qiyām al-sāʻah wa-sāʻat al-qiyām min al-ṣalāh al-lāʼiqah bi-hi wa-bi-him wa-al-salām, wa-dhālika ʻalá yad al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá mawlāhu al-ghanī Aḥmad ibn Ibrāhīm ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān Azkiyah, adāma Allāh saḥāʼib riḍwānihi ʻalayhi wa-ʻalá al-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Tammat wa-bi-al-khayr ʻammat. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the copyist colophon: "This blessed copy was completed on Thursday evening, 25 Dhū al-Qaʻdah, 1281 [21 April, 1865] of the Hijrah of Him in whose companions justice was established, and in Him the sheets of the Prophecy and the Message were sealed (May the most decent prayer and peace be upon him and upon his honorable family and great companions, continuously, until the day of judgment and the hour of resurrection), by the servant of his Rich Lord, Aḥmad ibn Ibrāhīm ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān Azkiyah, may God bestow upon him, and upon all Muslims the clouds of his satisfaction. Praise be to God the Lord of the Universe. It is completed and in widespread goodness concluded."

record.title: 880-02 Taqyīdāt ʻalá Sharḥ al-ʻAllāmah al-Saʻd ʻalá matn al-ʻAqāʼid al-Nasafīyah : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad ibn ʻArafah al-Dasūqī al-Mālikī.
record.note: Text: Folios 1a-42a; folios 43-46 are blank.

On folio 1a: "Hādhihi Taqyīdāt ʻalá sharḥ al-ʻAllāmah al-Saʻd ʻalá matn al-ʻAqāʼid al-Nasafīyah jamaʻtuhā min taqrīr Shaykhinā al-Shaykh ʻAlī al-ʻAdawī al-Mālikī ḥāla al-dars. Tamm." "Jāmiʻuhā al-faqīr Muḥammad ʻArafah al-Dasūqī al-Mālikī al-Burhānī." "Yaqūlu kātibuhu: Hādhihi ṣūrat mā katabahu al-muʼallif wa-huwa al-ʻAllāmah al-Dasūqī ʻalá nuskhatihi allatī bi-khaṭṭihi wa-innamā athbattuhu ʻalá hādhihi al-nuskhah bi-hādhihi al-ʻibārah muḥāfaẓatan ʻalá ittibāʻ nuskhat al-muʼallif al-maktūb ʻalayhā dhālika, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi fī al-dārayn. Āmīn."

Colophon: Colophon missing; text ends abruptly with: "wa-mithl dhālika yuqālu fī al-mashmūm, fa-al-rāʼiḥah al-qāʼimah bi-al-misk laysat hiya al-mashmūmah bal al-mashmūm rāʼiḥah ukhrá khalaqahā Allāh taʻālá qāʼimah bi-al-hawá [bi-al-hawāʼ] bi-sabab mujāwarat al-hawá [al-hawāʼ] lil-jurm dhī al-rāʼiḥah. Qawluhu 'wa-huwa qūwah mūdaʻah fī al-ʻuṣbatayn' ..."

record.title: 880-02 Mukhtaṣar Qawāʻid al-Zarkashī : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Wahhāb ibn Aḥmad al-Shaʻrānī.
record.note: On folio 1a: "Mukhtaṣar Kitāb Qawāʻid al-Zarkashī lil-Shaʻrāwī taghammadahu Allāh bi-raḥmatihi. Āmīn." "Mukhtaṣar Qawāʻid al-Zarkashī."

On folio 1a ownership statements as follows: "Mālikuhu Abū al-Isʻād al-Shuʻaybī al-Anṣārī al-Ḥusaynī." "Fī silk mulk Abū al-Isʻād al-Shuʻaybī al-Anṣārī al-Ḥusaynī al-Qādirī al-Ḥawālikī ʻufiya ʻanh." "Mālikuhu kātibuhu Abū al-Isʻād ʻufiya ʻanh." "Thumma ṣāra fī nawbat al-faqīr Abū al-Isʻād al-Shuʻaybī al-Anṣārī al-Ḥusaynī al-Qādirī." "Ṣār fī mulk al-faqīr ʻAbd al-Jawwād ibn al-faqīr Shuʻayb al-Shāfiʻī al-Anṣārī fī awākhir Dhī al-Qaʻdah al-Ḥarām sanat 1019 [13 February, 1611]." "al-Faqīr Aḥmad Abū al-Mawāhib ibn al-faqīr ʻAbd al-Jawwād Shuʻayb al-Shāfiʻī al-Anṣārī [...?]." "Thumma min baʻdihi ṣār fī silk mulk Abū al-Isʻād al-Shuʻaybī al-Qādirī [... ...?]." "Faded seal".

On folio 1a: "Wa-fīhi 'Kitāb al-Ishārah ilá sīrat Rasūl Allāh' ... muʼallifuhu al-Shaykh ʻAlāy al-Dīn al-Maṣlaṭāy ..." (Probably: "al-Ishārah ilá sīrat al-Muṣṭafá wa-tārīkh man baʻdahu min al-khulafāʼ" / by ʻAlāʼ al-Dīn Mughalṭāy ibn Qalīj, 1290 or 1291-1360 or 1361).
On folio 37b eight verses of poetry praising al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Wahhāb al-Shaʻrānī and giving the date of his death on Monday, 3 Jumād al-Awwal, 973 (6 December, 1665) by his son ʻAbd al-Raḥmān.

Colophon: "Wa-li-yakun dhālika ākhir al-qawāʻid al-muntakhabah min Qawāʻid al-Zarkashī, raḥimahu Allāh ... Wa-kāna farāghī min taʼlīfihi bi-tārīkh sābiʻ ʻashar Dhī al-Ḥijjah sanat 1011 [28 May, 1603] wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá man lā nabī baʻdah. Yaqūlu kātibuhu al-faqīr Shuʻayb ibn Aḥmad: Katabtu hādhihi al-nuskhah al-mubārakah min nuskhah saqīmah jiddan, fa-taḥtāju hādhihi ilá al-muqābalah, wa-al-aṣl al-manqūl minhu yaḥtāj ilá dhālika min bāb awlá wa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻalī al-ʻaẓī ..."

Translation of the colophon: "Let this be the end of the rules selected from Qawāʻid al-Zarkashī [The Rules of al-Zarkashī], may God have mercy upon him ... I finished writing it on 17 Dhū al-Ḥijjah, 1011 [28 May, 1603]. Praise be to God alone, and prayer be upon Him, who no prophet comes after Him. The copyist of the manuscript, the poor Shuʻayb ibn Aḥmad, says: I copied this blessed treatise from a very bad copy which needs to be collated, let alone the original source from which it was copied. There is no power nor might except in God the Sublime, the All Mighty ..."

record.title: 880-03 al-Maqāmāt al-Ḥarīrīyah : manuscript / al-Qāsim ibn ʻAlī al-Ḥarīrī.
record.note: On folio 1a: "Kitāb al-Maqāmāt al-Ḥarīrīyah fī al-mawāʻiẓ wa-al-ādāb wa-al-aḍāḥīk wa-al-aḥājī. Ṣāḥibuhā wa-mālikuhā al-faqīr Baḥr Aḥmad, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn. A.M.Y.N. [Āmīn])

On folio 1a: Two verses of poetry attributed to Jār Allāh al-Zamakhsharī (Zamakhsharī, Maḥmūd ibn ʻUmar, 1075-1144) praising al-Ḥarīrī and his Maqāmāt: "Uqsimu billāh wa-āyātihi // wa-mashʻar al-ḥajji wa-mīqātihi. Anna al-Ḥarīrīya ḥarrīyun bi-an // taktuba bi-al-tibri Maqāmātihi."
Colophon: "Qad tammat Maqāmāt al-Ḥarīrī bi-ʻawn Allāh al-ghanī."
Translation of the colophon: "The Maqāmāt of al-Ḥarīrī are concluded by the help of the rich God."

record.title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyat al-Amīr al-Kabīr ʻalá Sharḥ al-Samarqandīyah lil-Mullawī : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Amīr al-Kabīr.
record.note: The manuscript is wrapped in an issue of "al-Ādāb" Egyptian weekly periodical (ʻadad 94, yawm al-Ithnayn, 26 Ṣafar, sanat 1307 - 21 Uktūbir, sanat 1889, al-sanah al-thālithah). On the last page of the issue (page 472) is written in pencil the name of "Muḥammad Ramaḍān al-Madanī al-Kutubī" who seems to be the manuscripts dealer.

On folio 1a: "Hādhihi Ḥāshiyat al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah al-baḥr al-fahhāmah farīd ʻaṣrihi wa-waḥīd dahrihi Sayyidinā wa-shaykh mashāyikhinā Sayyidī Muḥammad al-Amīr al-Miṣrī ʻalá al-Mullawī al-Ṣaghīr fī al-istiʻārāt."
Text: Folios 1b-21b; folios 22-24 are blank.

Colophon: "Intahat bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ḥusn ʻawnihi wa-tawfīqihi ʻalá yad kātibihi bi-nafsihi ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Ṭarābulusī [... ... ...] tāba Allāh ʻalayhi wa-ʻalá jamīʻ al-Muslimīn wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn fī ṣabīḥat yawm al-Jumʻah sanat [ithnatayn] wa-khamsīn wa-miʼatayn wa-alf. ʻĀm 1252."

Translation of the colophon: "The copy is ended by the praise of God and his abundant help and benevolence, by the handwriting of the copyist ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Ṭarābulusī [... ... ...] for himself, may God forgive him and all Muslims. Praise be to God the Lord of the Universe. On Friday morning, the year 1252."

record.title: 880-03 al-Risālah al-Qushayrīyah : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Karīm ibn Hawāzin al-Qushayrī.
record.note: Pages of the manuscript are numbered in Indian numerals: 1-138.

The manuscript is wrapped in an issue of the Egyptian newspaper "al-Ahrām": "Yawm al-Sabt, 2 Ughusṭus, sanat 1616 [1919], 5 Dhū al-Qaʻdah, sanat 1337, 26 Abīb, sanat 1635, al-sanah al-khāmisah wa-al-arbaʻūn, al-ʻadad 12883."
On folio 1a: "Risālat al-Qushayrī." "Hādhihi Risālat al-Qushayrī."

Colophon: "Wa-hunā tamma mā waffaqa al-Jalīl bi-mannihi wa-ḥusn tawfīqih yawm al-Thalāth al-mubārak 29 [tisʻah] wa-ʻishrīn maḍat min shahr al-Ḥijjah, khitām sanat wāḥid wa-sabʻīn wa-miʼatayn wa-alf, sanat 1271 min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon: "Here ends what the Glorified One facilitated by His generosity and abundant benevolence, on blessed Tuesday, 29 Dhū al-Ḥijjah, 1271 of the Hijrah of the Prophet. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and companions. Amen."

record.title: Sir Harry Trelawny diary : manuscript.
record.note: Dated on front cover: Augst. 17, Septembr 3d 1785.

record.title: 880-02 Fatʹḥ al-mutaʻāl ʻalá al-qaṣīdah al-musammāh bi-Lāmīyat al-afʻāl : manuscript / Ḥamad ibn Muḥammad al-Ṣaʻīdī al-Mālikī.
record.note: At the head of folio 1a: "lil-Shaykh Yūnus Khalīlī yukmilu la-hu."
Colophon: Colophon missing; text ends abruptly with "... aḍḍahu rammahu ay aṣlaḥ al-ʻamal. Intahá. Wa-lammā ..."

record.title: 880-02 al-Jawhar al-maknūn fī ṣadaf al-thalāthat al-funūn : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Muḥammad al-Akhḍarī.
record.note: Incipit (folio 1b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-ṣallá Allāh wasallam ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi. Qāla al-Shaykh al-faqīh, al-ʻallāmah al-nabīh, al-walī al-zāhid, al-almaʻī al-nāqid Abū Zayd Sayyid ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn al-Shaykh Sayyid Ṣaghīr, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá. Āmīn: al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-badīʻ al-hādī // ilá bayāni mahyaʻ al-rashādi ..."
Text folios 1b-8b; folios 9 and 10 are blank.
Author's colophon: "Tamma bi-shahri al-Ḥijjati al-maymūni // mutammimi niṣfa ʻāshir al-qurūni. Abyātuhā tisʻūna baʻda miʼatayn // wa-zidʹhā wāḥidatan bi-dūni mayn."
Translation of the author's colophon: "It ended in the blessed month of Dhū al-Ḥijjah, at the end of the middle of the tenth century of al-Hijrah, in exactly two hundred and ninety one verses."

Copyist's colophon: "Kamula bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ḥusn ʻawnih wa-tawfīqih fī 23 Rabīʻ Awwal sanat 1266. Allāhumma yā ʻaẓīm al-minnah habb li-kātibihi al-Jannah. Allāhumma ikhtim la-nā bi-ḥusn al-khātimah wa-ikfinā sharra al-dunyā wa-ʻadhāb al-ākhirah. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "It is completed by the praise of God and His abundant help and benevolence on 23 Rabīʻ Awwal, 1266 [6 February, 1850]. O God of great benevolence grant Paradise to the copyist. O God grant us the good end and deliver us from the evil of this world and the torment of the Hereafter."

record.title: 880-02 al-Minaḥ al-Ilāhīyah bi-sharḥ baʻḍ al-awrād al-Bakrīyah : manuscript / ʻAlī ibn ʻAbd al-Barr al-Wanāʼī.
record.note: In fair, rather large and thick naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of "Awrād al-ṣabāḥ wa-al-masāʼ wa-al-ṣalawāt al-khams" in red; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Kitāb al-Minaḥ al-Ilāhīyah bi-sharḥ baʻḍ al-awrād al-Bakrīyah lil-ʻAllāmah al-Sayyid ʻAlī al-Wanāʼī al-Shāfiʻī, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu. Āmīn."

On folio 2b: "Wa-sammaytuhu al-Minaḥ al-Ilāhīyah bi-sharḥ baʻḍ al-awrād al-Bakrīyah. Wa-qad rawaytuhā ʻan qudwatī fī al-ṭarīq al-Imām ʻalá al-taḥqīq al-Shihāb Aḥmad al-Dardīr ʻalayhi raḥmat al-ʻazīz al-qadīr wa-ʻan al-ʻumdah al-nāṣiḥ al-ʻallāmah al-ṣāliḥ Shihāb al-Dīn Aḥmad ibn al-ʻallāmah Aḥmad Jumʻah al-Bujayrimī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá wa-ghyrihimā."

The manuscript is wrapped in an issue of al-Ahrām Egyptian daily newspaper: "Yawm al-Thulāthāʼ, 29 Yūliyū, sanat 1919, 1 Dhū al-Qaʻdah, sanat 1337, 22 Abīb, sanat 1635, al-sanah al-khāmisah wa-al-arbaʻūn, al-ʻadad 12879."

Author's colophon: "Wa-fī hādhā al-qadr kifāyah li-man ḥuffa bi-al-ʻināyah wa-ʻalayka bi-kutub al-aʼimmah taʻlam mā tafaḍḍala bi-hi al-ʻAẓīm al-Aʻẓam. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Tamm."

Translation of the author's colophon: "This amount is sufficient for those who are covered by [God's] providence. Thereafter, you need to read the books of the scholars that you may learn what the Mighty Great One has graciously bestowed [upon us]. May God pray on our master Muhammad, his family and companions and grant them peace. It is completed".

record.title: 880-02 Risālah fī sharḥ qawlihi taʻālá Innamā yaʻmuru masājida Allāh : manuscript / ʻUmar ibn ʻAlī al-Ṭaḥlāwī.
record.note: On folio 1a: "Hādhihi Risālah fī sharḥ qawlihi taʻālá Innamā yaʻmuru masājida Allāh taʼlīf al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah al-Shaykh ʻUmar al-Ṭaḥlāwī al-Mālikī ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-lil-Muslimīn ʻalá al-tamām wa-al-kamāl wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá kull ḥāl wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad. Āmīn."

Colophon: "Wa-ṣādafa tamām taʼlīf hādhihi al-risālah yawm al-Khamīs, thānī ʻashar Shaʻbān sanat 1147, alf wa-miʼah sabʻah wa-arbaʻīn. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min hādhihi al-nuskhah ʻalá yad al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Shabrāwī fī al-yawm al-thānī min al-thulth al-thālith min al-shahr al-khāmis min al-ʻām al-thāmin min al-ʻushr al-khāmis min al-qarn al-thānī ʻashar min Hijrat al-nabī al-ʻāqib ʻalayhi al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām."

Translation of the colophon: "This epistle was completed on Thursday, the twelfth of Shaʻbān, the year 1147, one thousand one hundred and forty seven. It was copied by the poor and despised ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Shabrāwī on the second day of the third part of the fifth month of the eighth year of the fifth tenth of the twelfth century of the last Prophet, may prayer and peace be upon Him."

record.title: 880-02 al-Maqālah al-sanīyah li-dalāʼil al-ashkāl al-ramlīyah : manuscript / Abū ʻAbd Allāh al-Zinātī.
record.note: On folio 2b: "Wa-sammaytuhā al-Maqālah al-sanīyah li-dalāʼil al-ashkāl al-ramlīyah."

Colophon: "Wa-fī hādhā al-qadr kifāyah wa-Allāh walī al-hidāyah wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá al-mabdaʼ wa-al-khitām wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. [Intahá] wa-tamm."

Translation of the colophon: "This amount is sufficient. God is the lord of guidance. Praise be to God at the beginning and at the end. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and companions and grant them peace. [It is finished] and completed."

record.title: 880-02 al-Aḥkām al-muhimmah fī shurūṭ Ahl al-Dhimmah : manuscript / Ḍiyāʼ al-Dīn Abū al-Hudá ʻAlamī.
record.note: On folio 1a: "al-Aḥkām al-muhimmah fī shurūṭ Ahl al-Dhimmah takhrīj al-faqīr ilá Allāh subḥānahu wa-taʻālá al-Mawlá Ḍiyāʼ al-Dīn Abī al-Hudá ʻAlamī ḥam [ḥāmī] al-Sunnah, raḥimahu Allāh."
Text: Folios 1a-5b; folio 6 is blank.

On folio 5b, an anecdote about the thirteen "mamsūkhūn" (those transformed into animals and inanimate objects and the reasons for their transformation), quoted from Ḥashiyat al-ʻAlqamī (Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān, 1492-1556) ʻalá al-Jāmiʻ al-ṣaghīr (of al-Suyūṭi, 1445-1505): al-Fīl (elephant), al-dubb (bear), al-khinzīr (pig), al-qird (monkey), al-jirrīth (eel), al-ḍabb (lizard), al-waṭwāṭ (bat), al-ʻaqrab (scorpion), al-Zuhrah (Venus), al-duʻmūṣ (tadpole), al-ʻankabūt (spider), al-arnab (rabbit), Suhayl (Canopus).
Colophon: Colophon missing; the author ends his work with: "... Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

record.title: 880-01 Ashkāl al-taʼsīs min Kitāb Iqlīdis : manuscript.
record.note: In nastaʻlīq script, in black ink on white paper; keywords in red; geometrical diagrams in gold; some notes on the margins; some wormholes without loss of text; catchwords.
Text folios 1a-13a; folio 14 is blank.
On folio 1a: "Ashkāl al-taʼsīs."

Colophon: "Tamma al-Taʼsīs wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ wa-al-maʼāb fī awāʼil shahr Jumādá al-Ākhir sanat iḥdá wa-sabʻīn wa-alf [min hijrat] man la-hu al-ʻizz wa-al-sharaf."

Translation of the colophon: "The 'Taʼsīs' (Basis, Foundation) is completed at the beginning of Jumādá al-Ākhir, of the year 1071 [of the Hijrah] of Him to whom belongs glory and honor. God is more knowledgeable of what is right. To Him is the reference and returning."

record.title: 880-02 Faṣl al-khiṭāb fī uṣūl lughat al-Aʻrāb : manuscript / Nāṣīf ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Yāzijī al-Lubnānī.
record.note: Text folios 3a-30b; folios 1-2, 31-36 are blank.
Pages are numbered 1-72.

Colophon: "Qāla al-faqīr ilayhi taʻālá Nāṣīf ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Yāzijī al-Lubnānī: Hādhā mā aradtu taʻlīqahu fī hādhā al-kitāb min uṣūl hādhihi al-ṣināʻah muqtaṣiran ʻalá dāniyāt al-quṭūf min al-muhimmāt al-muṭaridah dūna al-daqāʼiq wa-al-shawārid taqrīban li-fahm mā yuqraʼu minhu wa-ḥifẓ mā yufhamu ʻalá annī muʻtarifun bi-al-quṣūr ʻan istīfāʼ mā ḥarrarahu al-qawm fa-innī qad taṭaffaltu ʻalá faḍalāt min kalāmihim wa-ayna al-Thurayyā min yad al-mutanāwil. Intahá wa-Allāh aʻlam. M."

Translation of the colophon: "The poor to the Almighty Nāṣīf ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Yāzijī al-Lubnānī says: This is what I wanted to introduce in this book, regarding the fundamentals of this art. I have limited myself to the easiest and the straightforward of the most important, excluding the minute and the irregular, so that what is being read is easier to understand and what is comprehendible can be memorized. I admit that I did not present in detail what the authorities on the subject have written. I am no more than a parasite on the leftovers of their words. How can one reach Pleiades! It is completed. God is more knowledgeable."

record.title: 880-02 Ikmāl al-dīn wa-itmām al-niʻmah : manuscript / Abū Jaʻfar Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī ibn al-Ḥusayn ibn Mūsá ibn Bābawayh al-Qummī.
record.note: Text folios 1b-271a.
On preliminary leaf: The stamp of "Maktabat al-Ṭayyār al-Khāṣṣah - Baghdād. Taʼassasat 1947 M - 1366 H. al-ʻAdad 011. Muʼassisuhā Hāshim ʻAbd al-Bāqī al-Ṭayyār."
Author's name from folio 2a.

On folio 271a an ownership statement dated 1199 Hijrī (1784 or 1785): "Mimmā manna bi-hi al-Malik al-Jalīl ʻalá ʻabdihi al-ḍaʻīf al-dhalīl Mūsá ibn Sayyid ʻAlī ibn Sayyid Yūsuf ibn Kāẓim al-Mūsawī nasaban wa-al-Hīn Abzalī [?] nisbatan. Raḥima Allāh wālidayhi man laqāhu wa-rajjaʻahu ilá ṣāḥibihi, wa-laʻan Allāh man laqāhu wa-saraqahu wa-lam yurajjiʻhu ilá ṣāḥibihi wa-ḥarāmun ʻalayhi an yanẓura fīhi. Sanat tisʻah wa-tisʻīn wa-alf wa-miʼah [1199 (1784 or 1785)]."

Colophon: "Tammat. al-Ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá al-itmām wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyid al-anām wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi al-muntakhabīn ilá yawm al-qiyām. Qad waqaʻa al-farāgh fī yawm al-Sabt muʼarrakhan 20 shahr Jumādá al-Thānī sanat 1034 fī Qaryat Hāndūkafarḥay [?] min maḍāfāt baldah muʻaẓẓamah [...?] ṣānahā Allāh taʻālá ʻan āfāt al-du[hū]r. Tamm. Tamm. Tamm. [Illegible seal]."

Translation of the colophon: "It is concluded. Praise be to God that it [the manuscript] is completed. May prayer and peace be upon the Master of the Nations [Prophet Muḥammad] and upon his family and chosen companions till Judgment Day. It was completed on Saturday, dated 20 Jumādá al-Thānī, the year 1034 [30 March, 1625] at the village of Hāndūkafarḥay [?], a dependency of the exalted town of [...?], may the Almighty God protect it from the calamities of time. Completed. Completed. Completed. [Illegible seal]."

record.title: 880-02 Irshād al-sārī fī sharḥ al-Bukhārī. Volume 2 : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Qasṭallānī.
record.note: Text folios 2a-441b.
On folio 1a in pencil: "Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn Abī Bakr ibn ʻAbd al-Malik al-Qasṭallānī. al-Juzʼ al-thānī min irshād al-sārī fī Sharḥ al-Bukhārī.
Author's colophon: "... wa-qad faraghtu min taʼlīfihi wa-kitābatihi fī yawm al-Sabt sābiʻ ʻishrīn Rabīʻ al-Thānī sant ʻashrah wa-tisʻmiʼah ḥāmidan muṣalliyan musalliman."

Translation of the author's colophon: "... I finished the composition and writing of [the book] on Saturday, 27 of Rabīʻ al-Thānī, the year 916 [13 August, 1510], with praise, prayer and request from God to grant peace [for the Prophet Muḥammad]."

Copyist's colophon: "Tamma al-kitāb al-mubārak bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnihi wa-ḥusn tawfīqihi. Wa-kāna al-farāgh minhu yawm al-Arbiʻāʼ al-mubārak fī shahr Shawwāl sanat thintayn wa-arbaʻīn wa-alf min al-Hijrah ʻalá yad afqar al-ʻibād wa-aḥwajihim ilá Allāh taʻālá Aḥmad ibn al-Shaykh Aḥmad al-Anshāṣī al-Shāfiʻī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-kull al-Muslimīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "The blessed book is completed by the praise of God, His help and abundant benevolence. The copying was concluded on blessed Wednesday in the month of Shawwal, the year 1042 of the Hijrah [April/May, 1730] by the hand of the poorest of the poor and the most needy to God, may He be praised, Aḥmad ibn al-Shaykh Aḥmad al-Anshāṣī al-Shāfiʻī, may God forgive him and his parents and all Muslims. Amen."

record.title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyah ʻalá Marāqī al-falāḥ : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Ṭahṭāwī.
record.note: On folio 1a: "Hādhihi Ḥāshiyat al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah al-mudaqqiq al-fahhāmah al-Sayyid Aḥmad al-Ṭaḥṭāwī ʻalá Sharḥ Nūr al-īḍāḥ wa-najāt al-arwāḥ al-musammá bi-Marāq [bi-Marāqī] al-falāḥ lil-ʻallāmah faqīh al-ṭabʻ Ḥasan al-Shurunbulālī al-Ḥanafī."

Author's colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh minhā yawm al-Jumʻah tāsiʻ shahr Shaʻbān al-mukarram qubayl al-zawāl alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat 1210, wa-qad ibtadaʼtuhā fī al-ʻām al-sābiq qabla naẓīr hādhā al-shahr bi-qalīl wa-ikhtaṭaftu kitābatahā fī ayyām al-biṭālāt al-mutakhallilah athnāʼ al-durūs. Wa-Allāh aʻlam."

Translation of the author's colophon: "The writing of the manuscript was concluded on Friday, the ninth of the honored month of Shaʻbān before sunset in the year 1210 Hijrī [18 February, 1796]. I started writing it last year shortly before the present month [i.e. the month of Rajab], having snatched the time for writing it intermittently during recesses between the teaching days. God is more knowledgeable."
Copyist's colophon: "Tammat kitābatuhā ʻalá yad al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá Muḥammad al-Ṭahwīhī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-lil-Muslimīn wa-li-man daʻá la-hu bi-khayr. Āmīn."

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "The copy was concluded by the hand of the poor to God the Almighty, Muḥammad al-Ṭahwīhī, may God forgive him and the Muslims and those who invoke God on his behalf to be good to him."

record.title: 880-02 Marāqī al-falāḥ bi-imdād al-Fattāḥ sharḥ Nūr al-īḍāḥ wa-najāt al-arwāḥ : manuscript / Ḥasan ibn ʻAmmār al-Shurunbulālī.
record.note: The manuscript contains 22 numbered quires each of which contains 10 leaves, except quires 1, 8, 9, 21 and 22 which contain 8 leaves each, but the text is complete with nothing missing.

On folio 1a: "Hādhā Sharḥ Nūr al-īḍāḥ wa-najāt al-arwāḥ lil-Shaykh al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah wa-al-baḥr al-fahhāmah shaykh mashāyikh al-Islām Sayyidī Ḥasan al-Shurunbulānī al-Ḥanafī taghammadahu Allāh bi-al-raḥmah wa-al-ruḍwān. Āmīn."
On folio 1a, a note by one of the readers of the manuscript: "Ṭālaʻ ʻAbd al-Wahhāb Ṣūfī fī hādhā al-kitāb sanat 1263 [1846/1847], fataḥa Allāh ʻalayhi. Āmīn."
The last three leaves are blank.

Colophon: "Katabahu li-nafsihi al-ʻabd al-faqīr wa-al-mudhnib al-ḥaqīr al-muqirr bi-al-taqṣīr al-rājī ʻafwa rabbihi al-qadīr Ḥasan Ḥubayshī al-Ḥanafī ʻāmalahu Allāh taʻālá bi-luṭfihi al-khafī wa-ajrāhu Allāh ʻalá ʻawāyid birrihi al-khafī ibn al-marḥūm al-Ḥājj Hilālī al-shahīr bi-Ibn al-Ḥijāzī bi-Dimyāṭ, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayh wa-li-wālid wālidayh wa-li-man qaraʼa fīhi wa-li-man samiʻahu wa-li-man ṣaḥḥaḥa fīhi laḥnahu wa-li-man daʻā la-hu bi-al-raḥmah wa-al-riḍwān. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min hādhā al-kitāb fī yawm al-Aḥad al-mubārak alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat alf wa-miʼah wa-arbaʻat ʻashar. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-qad tamma bi-khayr."

Translation of the colophon: "Copied by the poor servant, for himself, he who admits his sin and deficiency and hopes for the forgiveness of his Almighty God, Ḥasan Ḥubayshī al-Ḥanafī the son of the departed al-Ḥājj Hilālī al-shahīr bi-Ibn al-Ḥijāzī, in Dimyāṭ [Damietta, Egypt], may God treat him according to His hidden kindness and lead him unto the paths of His hidden righteousness. May God forgive him, his parents and the father of his parents and those who read this book, those who listen to it, those who correct its mistakes, and those who invoke God to grant him [the copyist] mercy and acceptance. The copying of this book was completed on blessed Sunday [name of the month not mentioned] of the year 1114 [1703 or 1704]. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions and grant them peace. Praise be to God the Lord of the Universe. It is finished with success."

record.title: [Psalter].
record.note: Copying of this book was completed on the 30th of Ḫedar.
Between wooden boards with four chain stitches. One column (ff.1r-143r); two columns (ff.143r-154v), 23 lines per page. In black and red ink. Mahdar case.

record.title: An inventory of the household furniture &c belonging to Mr. Stamford at the Scots Arms Little Hermitage Street taken & sold by appraisement to Mr. Willm. Finlay ..., the 31st of Jany. 1799 : manuscript.
record.note: In original marbled wrapper.

record.title: John Ray annotations in Ausonius Popma's De usu antiquae locutionis libri duo : manuscript.
record.note: Note in John Ray's hand at top of title page (partially cut away): At Banks's auction. 16[79?]
Volume also contains annotations in a different, early sixteenth-century hand.

record.title: 880-03 Tafsīr Abī al-Saʻūd : al-musammá Irshād al-ʻaql al-salīm ilá mazāyā al-Kitāb al-Karīm : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad Abū al-Saʻūd.
record.note: Text folios 3b-446a; folios 1-2 are blank.
On the upper left corner of folio 2a: "al-Rubʻ al-thānī".

Colophon: Colophon missing; ends with: "... idh mā min amr dīnī illā wa-huwa yastanidu ilá al-Qurʼān bi-al-dhāt aw bi-wasaṭ, 'wa-hudan' min al-ḍalālah 'wa-raḥmah' yasʼalu bi-hā khayr al-dārayn 'li-qawmin yuʼminūn' ay yuṣaddiqūnahu li-annahum al-muntafiʻūn bi-hi, wa-ammā mā ʻadāhum fa-lā yahtadūna bi-hudāhu wa-lā yantafiʻūn bi-jadwāh. ʻAn Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam: ʻAllimū ariqqāʼakum Sūrat Yūsuf fa-innahu ayyumā Muslim talāhā wa-ʻallamahā ahlahu wa-mā malakat yamīnuhu hawwana Allāh ʻalayhi sakarāt al-mawt wa-aʻṭāhu al-qūwata allā yaḥsuda Musliman."

record.title: 880-02 Multaqá al-abḥur : manuscript / Ibrāhīm ibn Muḥammad al-Ḥalabī.
record.note: On folio 1b-2a: "... Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-muftaqir ilá raḥmat rabbih al-ghanī Ibrāhīm ibn Ḥamad [Muḥammad] ibn Ibrāhīm al-Ḥalabī: Qad saʼalanī baʻḍ ṭālibī al-istifādah an ajmaʻa la-hu kitāban yashtamilu ʻalá masāʼil al-Qudūrī wa-al-Mukhtār wa-al-Kanz wa-al-Wiqāyah bi-ʻibārah sahlah ghayr mughlaqah fa-ajabtuhu ilá dhālik wa-aḍaftu ilayhi baʻḍ mā yuḥtāju ilayhi min masāʼil al-Majmaʻ wa-nubdhah min al-Hidāyah wa-ṣarraḥtu bi-dhikr al-khilāf bayna aʼimmatinā al-ashrāf ... sammaytuhu Multaqá al-abḥur li-yuwāfiq al-ism al-musammá ..."

On folio 179a an endowment statement as follows: "Waqaftu waqfan ṣaḥīḥan sharʻīyan bi-marḍāt Allāh taʻālá bi-sharṭ an lā yubāʻa wa-lā yurhana wa-lā yubaddala, fa-man baddalahu baʻdmā samiʻahu fa-innamā ithmuhu ʻalá allahīna yubaddilūnahu. Inna Allāha samīʻ ʻalīm. Wa-anā al-faqīr Ḥāfiẓ Ibrāhīm, sākin ʻalá Aghā ʻAlī al-faqīr Mullā ʻAbd al-Majīd sākin Qājardhādah bi-madrasatihi. [Seal]. Ibrāhīm Shihāb al-Dīn."

Author's colophon: "Qāla al-faqīr: Hādhā ākhir Multaqá al-abḥur ... wa-Allāh ḥasbī wa-niʻma al-wakīl. Wa-qad tamma tabyīḍuhu bayna al-ṣalātayn min yawm al-Thulāthāʼ thālith ʻashar min Rajab al-muʻaẓẓam, sanat thalāth wa-ʻishrīn wa-tisʻi miʼah ʻalá yad al-faqīr Ibrāhīm ibn Muḥammad ibn Ibrāhīm al-Ḥalabī. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn wa-ʻalá al-tābiʻīn la-hum bi-iḥsān ilá yawm al-dīn."

Translation of the author's colophon: "The poor one said: This is the end of Multaqá al-abḥur ... God suffices me. He is the best advocate. It was completed between the two prayers, on Tuesday, the thirteenth of the sublime month of Rajab, the year nine hundred and twenty three by the hand of the poor Ibrāhīm ibn Muḥammad al-Ḥalabī. Praise be to God the Lord of the Universe. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and all his companions and those who follow them faithfully until Judgement Day."

Copyist's colophon: "Qad waqaʻa al-farāgh min kitābat hādhihi al-nuskhah al-sharīfah li-Ibrāhīm al-Ḥalabī ʻalá yad al-ʻabd al-ḍaʻīf Bilāl ibn Muḥammad, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-ikhwatihi wa-li-akhawātihi wa-aḥsana ilayhā [ilayhim] wa-ilayhi. Tamm."

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "The honorable copy of Ibrāhīm al-Ḥalabī was completed by the hand of the feeble servant Bilāl ibn Muḥammad, may God forgive him, his parents, his brothers and his sisters, and treat them and him with kindness. It is completed."

record.title: 880-03 al-Tabṣirah : manuscript / Abū al-Faraj ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn ʻAlī ibn al-Jawzī.
record.note: The text is preceded by a partial table of contents. Starts with chapter 6 "Majlis fī dhikr ziyārt qabr al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻlayhi wa-sallam", and ends with chapter 42 "Majlis fī dhikr al-faraj baʻda al-shiddah."
Folios 177b-178b contain invocations and anicdotes.

Colophon: "... Wa-wāfaq al-farāgh min taʻlīq hādhihi al-waraqāt fī salkh Rabīʻ al-Ākhir al-mubārak [four illegible words]. ʻAllaqahā li-nafsihi wa-liman shāʼa Allāh taʻālá min baʻdihi al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá raḥmat rabbihi al-ghanī ʻAlī ibn ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Ḥaydar, ḥāmidan wa-muḥassiban wa-muḥawqilan wa-muṣalliyan wa-musalliman." Followed by seven lines of invocations.

Translation of the colophon: "... These leaves were completed at the end of the blessed Rabīʻ al-Ākhir [four illegible words]. Copied by the poor to the mercy of his rich Lord ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Ḥaydar, uttering the invocations of 'Ḥamdalah, Ḥasbalah, Ḥawqalah and Prayer and Peace [upon the Prophet Muḥammad]". Followed by seven lines of invocations.

record.title: Selections from the Qurʼan : manuscript.
record.note: Starts with: "Wa-mā ubarriʼu nafsī inna al-nafsa la-ammāratun bi-al-sūʼ ..."
On folio 63 an attempt to practice copying part of verse 5 of Sūrat al-Raʻd.
On folio 63b an inscription in classical Chinese.
Ends with: "Hādhā balāghun lil-nās wa-li-yundharū bi-hi wa-li-yaʻlamū annamā huwa ilāhun wāḥidun wa-li-yadhdhakkara ulū al-albāb." "Ṣadaqa Allāh al-ʻAẓīm."

record.title: 880-03 al-Kitābān al-rābiʻ wa-al-khāmis min al-Qānūn fī al-ṭibb : manuscript / Ibn Sīnā.
record.note: On folio 1a: "al-Kitāb al-rābiʻ min al-Qānūn lil-Shaykh al-Raʼīs Abī ʻAlī ibn Sīnā, raḥimahu Allāh, wa-yalīhi al-kitāb al-khāmis minhu wa-huwa al-Aqrābādhīn."

On folio 156b: "Fa-hādhā ākhir kitāb [...?] wa-huwa ākhir al-kalām min kitāb [al-kitāb] al-rābiʻ wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh shukran kathīran. Wa-yatlūhu kitāb [al-kitāb] al-khāmis fī al-anqrābādīn. Tammat al-jild al-rābiʻ min al-Qānūn [... ... ... ...] Allāh sākin Kashmar, ghafara Allāh [la-hu] wa-li-wālidayh. 14."
On folio 157a: "al-Kitāb al-khāmis min al-Qānūn lil-Shaykh al-Raʼīs Abī ʻAlī ibn Sīnā, raḥimahu Allāh, wa-huwa akhir al-kutub minhu."

On folio 157b: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Rabbi yassir wa-tammim bi-al-khayr. al-Kitāb al-khāmis min kutub al-Qānūn wa-huwa al-Aqrābādīn. Laqad faraghnā min al-kitāb al-arbaʻah ʻan dhikr al-ʻilam al-naẓarī wa-al-ʻamalī al-ḥāfiẓ lil-ṣiḥḥah wa-ḥāna la-nā an nakhtuma kitāb al-Qānūn, al-kitāb al-khāmis, al-muṣannaf fī al-adwiyah al-murakkabah, li-yakūna kamā al-qarābādīn lil-kitāb ..."

Colophon: "Tamma kitāb al-Aqrābādīn bi-tamāmih min kitāb al-Qānūn fī al-ṭibb lil-Shaykh al-Raʼīs wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá dhālika ḥamdan lā ghāyah la-hā wa-ṣallá [Allāh ʻalá] al-Nabī al-Hāshimī Abṭaḥī [al-Abṭaḥī] wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi ṣalātan lā mithla la-hā. Ḥarrarahu wa-fī sanat thamāniyat ʻashar."

Translation of the colophon: "The book of al-Aqrābādīn of al-Qānūn fī al-ṭibb [Canon of medicine] of the Grand Master [Avicenna] is completed in its entirety. Praise be to God for this without end. May God pray on the Hashimite and Abṭaḥite Prophet [Muḥammad] and his family and companions, a prayer without equal. Copied in the year eighteen."

record.title: 880-02 Tuḥfat al-ṭullāb bi-sharḥ Taḥrīr tanqīḥ al-Lubāb : manuscript / Abū Yaḥyá Zakarīyā ibn Muḥammad al-Anṣārī.
record.note: Colophon: "Katabahu al-faqīr Muḥammad ibn Ismāʻīl al-Ṭībī baladan, al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban li-nafsihi wa-li-man shāʼa min baʻdihi, rājiyan min Allāh al-thawāb al-jazīl min al-Malik al-Jalīl, wa-dhālika yawm al-Arbaʻ al-mubārak, sādis ʻishrīn shahr Ṣafar al-Khayr, min shuhūr sanat 1152, alf wa-miʼah ithnayn wa-khamsīn baʻda al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-atamm al-taslīm."

Translation of the colophon: "Copied by the poor Muḥammad ibn Ismāʻīl al-Ṭībī baladan, al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban for himself and for whomever he wills after him, requesting from God, the Majestic King, to grant him abundant reward, on blessed Wednesday, the twenty sixth of Ṣafar, 1152 [4 June, 1739] of the Hijrah of the Prophet, may the best of prayer and the most perfect of peace be upon him."

record.title: Islamic prayers, invocations and decorations : manuscript.
record.note: Colophon: Last page seems to be missing; ends with a magic square and the katchword "barkamsah".

record.title: 880-02 al-Durrah al-muḍīʼah fī qirāʼāt al-aʼimmah al-thalāthah al-marḍīyah : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn al-Jazarī.
record.note: On the upper left corner of folio 1a in pencil: "Durrah fī al-ʻashrah."
Colophon: "Tammat al-kitāb bi-ʻawn al-Malik al-Wahhāb. Sanat 1209. Sanat 1209."
Translation of the colophon: "The book is completed by the help of the Benevolent King. The year 1209. The year 1209."

record.title: 880-02 Ḥawāshin ʻalá mawāḍiʻ min Sharḥ Taṣrīf al-ʻIzzī : manuscript.
record.note: On folio 2b: "Fa-hādhihi Ḥawāshin ʻalá mawāḍiʻ min Sharḥ taṣrīf al-ʻIzzī lil-ʻAllāmah al-Taftāzānī, qaddasa Allāh sirrahumā, arjū an yaʻumma nafʻuhā wa-yaʻẓuma wa-qʻuhā, innahu huwa al-maʼmūl wa-muḥaqqiq kull masʼūl ..."
At the head of the colophon: "Fī shahr Shawwāl."

On the margin of folio 150a: "Hādhā ākhir al-ḥawāshī allatī katabahā Aḥmad ibn Qāsim al-ʻAbbādī, aʻlá Allāh darajatahu wa-razaqanā Allāh taʻālá khayr al-dārayn bi-barakatihi ʻalá ḥāshiyat Shaykhihi al-ʻAllāmah al-Imām Nāṣir al-Dīn al-Laqānī al-Mālikī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá wa-ʻāmalahu muʻāmalat awliyāʼihi. Āmīn thumma āmīn, yā Rabba al-ʻĀlamīn. M.M.M. Qad waqaʻa taswīd hādhihi al-ḥawāshī ʻalá yad al-ḥaqīr al-faqīr al-muʻtarif bi-al-ʻajz wa-al-taqṣīr al-mutawaghghil bi-al-dhanb al-kathīr al-mutamassik bi-ʻafw Allāh al-malik al-qadīr, al-mutafāʼil wa-al-rājī min al-Mutaʻālī al-Kabīr fī al-dunyā al-ʻilm wa-al-ʻamal bi-hi wa-al-taysīr wa-fī al-ʻuqbá ʻadam al-muʼākhadhah bi-al-fiʻla al-qalīl wa-al-kathīr bi-jāh khātim al-rusl al-bashīr al-nadhīr Muḥyī al-Dīn ibn al-Shaykh al-kabīr."

Colophon: "al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī waffaqanī ʻalá al-tamām, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Rasūlihi sayyid al-anām wa-ʻalá ālihi alladhīna kānū lil-dīn ka-al-aʻlām wa-aṣḥābihi alladhīna qatalū al-kafarah wa-badaʼū al-Islām. Qad tammat al-ḥāshiyah al-musammāh bi-al-Miṣrī al-wāqiʻah ʻalá Saʻd al-Dīn lil-ʻAllāmah al-thānī al-muḥaqqiq al-Taftāzānī, quddisa sirruhu, ʻalá yad aḍʻaf al-ʻibād wa-aḍall sabīl al-rashād Muḥyī al-Dīn -- al-mansūb ilá Shīrawān nāḥiyatan wa-ilá Farsā qaryatan, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-aḥsana ilayhimā wa-ilayhi. Fī yawm al-Sabt waqta al-ʻaṣr. Ibtadaytuhu wa-fī yawm al-Aḥad qabla al-ʻaṣr atmamtuhu -- ibn al-Ḥājjī al-Shaykh Muḥammad al-Khālidī al-Naqshabanidī al-Farsāfī, fī sanat alf wa-miʼatayn wa-tisʻīn wa-sanatayn min Hijrah [al-Hijrah] al-Nabawīyah al-Muṣṭafawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-akmal taḥīyah min jānib Rabb al-Barīyah fī [kull] waqt wa-sāʻah ilá abad al-abadīyah. Āmīn. Tamm."

Translation of the colophon: "Praise be to God who enabled me to complete [the copying of the manuscript], and prayer and peace be upon His Messenger, the master of the nations, and upon his family who were for the faith like banners, and upon his companions who killed the infidels and started Islam. The marginalia titled "al-Miṣrī" [i.e. by the "Egyptian" author Ibn Qāsim al-ʻAbbādī] on the work of Saʻd al-Dīn, the second scholar, the learned al-Taftāzānī, may his secret be sanctified, by the hand of the feeblest slave who has strayed from the guided path, Muḥyī al-Dīn ibn al-Ḥājjī al-Shaykh Muḥammad al-Khālidī al-Naqshabanidī al-Farsāfī, who is from the region of Shīrawān [probably Shirvān (Irān)], from the village of Farsā. May God forgive him and his parents and be kind to them and to him. I started the copying on the afternoon of Saturday and finished it before the afternoon of Sunday, in the year one thousand two hundred ninety two of the Hijrah of the Prophet Muḥammad, may the best of prayer and most perfect of peace be upon him from the Lord of Creation at every time and every hour for ever and ever. Amen. It is completed."
