record.title: 880-02 al-Taʻrīfāt : manuscript / ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Sayyid al-Sharīf al-Jurjānī.
record.note: Incipit of al-Taʻrīfāt: "Rabbi yassir wa-lā tuʻassir. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh ḥaqqa ḥamdih wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá khayr khalqih Muḥammad wa-ālih. Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhihi taʻrīfāt jamaʻtuhā wa-iṣṭilāḥāt akhadhtuhā min kutub al-qawm wa-rattabtuhā ʻalá ḥurūf al-hijāʼ min al-Alif wa-al-Bāʼ ilá al-Yāʼ tasʹhīlan tanāwuluhā lil-ṭālibīn wa-tasīyan [wa-taysīran] taʻāṭīhā lil-rāghibīn wa-Allāh al-hādī wa-ʻalayhi iʻtimādī fī mabdaʼī wa-maʻādī. Bāb al-Alif faṣl al-Bāʼ ..."
Secundo folio of al-Taʻrīfāt: al-Ibtilāʻ ʻibārah ʻan ʻamal.
Incipit of Abwāb al-taṣrīf: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Iʻlam anna abwāb al-taṣrīf khamsah wa-thalāthūn bāban, sittah minhā lil-thulāthī al-mujarrad ..."
Secundo folio of Abwāb al-taṣrīf: an yakūna ʻayn fiʻlihi.

Incipit of List of the irregular feminine words in Arabic: "Rabbi yassir. Wa-maʻrifat al-muʼannath al-samāʻīyah mutaʻassirah wa-ṭarīq maʻrifatihā tatbaʻ naql kalām al-ʻArab, wa-tatabbuʻ kull kalām al-ʻArab mutaʻassir ʻalá al-akthar, wa-naḥnu nadhkuru hāhunā al-muʼannath al-samāʻīyah bi-ḥaythu lā yabqá illā nadiran, wa-nurattibu awāʼilahā ʻalá tartīb ḥurūf al-hijāʼ ..."
Secundo folio of List of the irregular feminine words in Arabic: khayl, khamr wa-jamīʻ asmāʼ al-khamr.
In fair, rather small naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink on thin white and yellow paper; headings and keywords in red; extensive commentaries on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a in pencil: "Taʻrīfāt-i Sayyid."
Text of al-Taʻrīfāt folios 3b-83.

Colophon of al-Taʻrīfāt: "Qad tamma al-kitāb. Wa-qad waqaʻa al-farāgh min taḥrīr al-kitāb sanat 1112. Wa-yawm al-Ithnayn tammat al-kitāb al-musammá bi-Taʻrīfāt al-Sayyid al-Sharīf bi-ʻawn Allāh al-malik al-wahhāb min yad al-ḍaʻīf al-Sayyid Muṣṭafá ibn Sayyid Ismāʻīl ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayh. M.M.M."

Translation of the colophon of al-Taʻrīfāt: "The book is concluded. The copying of the book was completed in the year 1112. On Monday the copying of the book "Taʻrīfāt al-Sayyid al-Sharīf" was ended by the hand of the feeble al-Sayyid Muṣṭafá ibn Sayyid Ismāʻīl, may God forgive him and his parents."
Colophon of Abwāb al-taṣrīf: "Tammat al-kitāb bi-ʻawn Allāh al-malik wahhāb [al-wahhāb] fī Arzanah-ʼi Rūm sanat 1109. M.M.M."
Translation of the colophon of Abwāb al-taṣrīf: "The book is completed by the help of God the King who gives abundantly, in Arzanah-ʼi Rūm, the year 1109."

List of the irregular feminine words in Arabic ends with: "... wa-al-ḥurūf al-maʻnawīyah naḥwa fī wa-ʻalá wa-ashbāhuhumā kulluhā muʼannath samāʻīyah. Nuqila min Maẓhar, raḥmat Allāh ʻalayh. Tammat."

record.title: 880-01 Ḥadīth Miʻrāj Muḥammad Rasūl Allāh : manuscript.
record.note: In clear, small Maghribī script, in brown ink on white paper; catchwords.
On the upper left corner of folio 1a: "Allāhumma ṣallī ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālih."

Colophon: Colophon missing. Ends with an invocation "... Allāhumma ifʻal bī wa-bihim ʻājilan wa-ājilan fī al-dīn wa-al-dunyā wa-al-ākhirah mā anta la-hu ahl, innaka ghafūr ḥalīm jawwād karīm raʼūf raḥīm, sabʻat marrāt. Intahá."

record.title: Islamic laws, doctrines, prayers and literature : manuscript.
record.note: Title of Kitāb al-dumūʻ from folio 55a.
Title of Kitāb Ādāb al-akl from folio 57b.
Title of Kitāb Ādāb al-nikāḥ from folio 68a.
Title of Tanwīr al-ghabash fī faḍl al-Sūdān wa-al-Ḥabash from folio 134b.
Title of Bāb al-ʻAql ḥujjat Allāh ʻalá khalqih from folio 135a.
Title of Excerpts from Tuḥfat al-albāb fī ʻajāʼib al-buldān from folio 141a.
Title of Excerpts from Ḥayāt al-ḥayawān al-kubrá from folio 142b.

Incipit of Poem on the seven voluntary fasts in Islam: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbih wa-sallama taslīman. Ayarghabu [Atarghabu] ajran li-qiyāmi [lil-qiyāmi] taṭawwuʻan // ʻalayka bi-ayyāmin rawtʹhu [rawatʹhā] al-awāʼilu. Wa-ʻiddatuhā sabʻu min al-ʻāmi kullihi // wa-fī ṣawmihā lil-ṣāʼimīna faḍāʼilu ..."

Incipit of Kitāb al-dumūʻ: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbih wa-sallama taslīman. Qāla al-Shaykh al-Faqīh al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah Abū ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ʻAlī al-Jawzī, raḥimahu Allāh wa-raḍiya ʻanh: al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī ikhtaraʻa al-ashyāʼ bi-laṭīf qudratih wa-badīʻ ṣanʻatih fa-aḥsana fīmā ikhtaraʻa, wa-abdaʻ al-mawjūdāt ʻalá ghayr mithāl, fa-lā sharīka la-hu fīmā abdaʻ. Allafa al-laṭīf wa-al-kathīf min aʻdād āḥād al-jawāhir wa-jamaʻa li-yufrida bi-al-waḥdānīyah kull maṣnūʻ ..."

Incipit of Kitāb Ādāb al-akl: "Kitāb Ādāb al-akl. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-sallama taslīman. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī aḥsana tadbīr al-kāʼināt fa-khalaqa al-khalq wa-al-samāwāt wa-anzala al-māʼ al-furāt min al-muʻṣirāt fa-anshaʼa al-ḥayy wa-al-nabāt wa-qaddara al-arzāq wa-al-aqwāt wa-ḥafiẓ bi-al-maʼkūlāt qiwá al-ḥayawānāt wa-aʻāna ʻalá al-ṭāʻāt wa-al-aʻmāl al-ṣāliḥāt wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá Muḥammad dhī al-muʻjizāt al-bāhirāt ..."

Incipit of Kitāb Ādāb al-nikāḥ: "Kitāb Ādāb al-nikāḥ. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad al-Nabī al-karīm wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī lā tuṣādifu sihām al-awhām fī ʻajāʼib ṣanʻatih majrá wa-lā tarjiʻu al-ʻuqūl ʻan awāʼil badāʼiʻihi illā wālihatan ḥayrá wa-lā tazālu laṭāʼifu ʻamalihi niʻmatan ʻalá al-ʻālamīn tatrá, fa-hiya tatawālá ʻlayhim ikhtiyāran wa-qahran ..."

Incipit of Miscellaneous Ḥadīths and advices: "Wa-min baʻḍ taʼālif al-Aḥādīth: Man dakhala ʻalá marīḍ an yaḍaʻa yadahu ʻalá jabīnihi aw mawḍiʻ min jasadihi wa-an yadʻwa la-hu li-qawlihi, ʻalayhi al-salām: Mā min ʻabdin Muslimin yaʻūdu marīḍan lā yaḥḍuru ajaluhu fa-yaqūlu nasʼalu Allāh al-ʻaẓīm rabb al-ʻarsh al-ʻaẓīm an yashfiyaka wa-yuʻāfiyaka illā shafāhu Allāh ..."

Incipit of Tanwīr al-ghabash fī faḍl al-Sūdān wa-al-Ḥabash: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam taslīman. Kitāb Tanwīr al-ghabash taʼlīf al-Shaykh al-Faqīh al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah Jamāl al-Dīn Abū al-Faraj al-Jawzī, raḥimahu Allāh. Qāla, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu fī wa-ṣīyatihi li-waladih Abū al-Qāsim: Innī kafaytuka istiʻārat al-kutub li-annī taraktu laka miʼat taʼlīf min taṣnīfī minhā fī al-tafsīr wa-al-Ḥadīth wa-ghayr dhālika ... Qāla al-Shaykh al-Faqīh al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ḥāfiẓ Jamāl al-Dīn wa-qudwat al-aʼimmah wa-al-muḥaddithīn Abū al-Faraj ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn ʻAlī al-Jawzī, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu wa-nafaʻanā bi-barakātihi. Āmīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī ikhtāra min jamīʻ al-makhlūqāt al-insān thumma iṣṭafá minhu ahl al-taqwá wa-al-iḥsān thumma jaʻala ʻalá maḥall naẓarihi al-qulūb lā al-abdān ..."

Incipit of Bāb al-ʻAql ḥujjat Allāh ʻalá khalqih: "Bāb al-ʻAql ḥujjat Allāh ʻalá khalqih wa-huwa mālik al-qalb wa-amīr al-jasad wa-wazīr al-rūḥ wa-tarjumān al-ʻabd wa-bi-hi yaqaʻu al-tadbīr wa-tathbut al-ḥujjah. Wa-huwa ʻaqlān, ʻaql mawhūb wa-ʻaql maksūb. Fa-al-ʻaql al-mawhūb huwa alladhī wahaba Allāh ʻazza wa-jall lil-ʻulamāʼ yumayyizūn bi-hi al-ḥaqq wa-al-bāṭil, wa-al-ʻaql al-maksūb huwa alladhī ishtarakat [fīhi] jamīʻ al-khalāʼiq wa-uʻṭiya minhu lil-malāʼikah wa-banī Ādam wa-al-bahāʼim ..."

Incipit of Questions and answers on Islamic law: "al-Ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman. Qāla al-Shaykh Sayyidī al-Ḥasan ibn Masʻūd al-Yūsī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá wa-raḍiya ʻanh, fī baʻḍ ajwibatihi fī al-ṣalāh ʻalá al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, fī al-wird, hal huwa lāzimah am lā ..."

Incipit of An anecdote regarding the encounter of Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-ʻĀbid with al-Khaḍir and Ilyās: "al-Ḥamdu lillāh. Dhakara Abū Bakr al-Muṭawwiʻī ʻan Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-ʻĀbid qāl: Kuntu jālisan fī Bayt al-Maqdis ʻinda Bāb Sulaymān, ʻlayhi al-salām, yawm al-Jumʻah baʻda al-ʻaṣr, idh jāʼa ilayya shakhṣān, aḥaduhumā yushbihu khilqtuhu khilqatanā wa-al-ākhar ʻaẓīm al-khalq, kānat jabhatuhu ʻarīḍatan wa-kāna fīhā athar ḍarbah wa-sallamā ʻalayya ..."

Incipit of Excerpts from Tuḥfat al-albāb fī ʻajāʼib al-buldān: "al-Ḥamdu lillāh. Dhukira fī Tuḥfat al-albāb fī ʻajāʼib al-buldān anna fī balad al-Sūdān ummah bilā ruʼūs wa-qad dhakarahum al-Shaʻbī fī kitāb Sīrat al-mulūk. Wa-qad dhakara anna fī bilād al-Maghrib ummah min walad Ādam kulluhum nisāʼ wa-lā yaʻīshu fī arḍihim dhakar ..."

Incipit of Excerpts from Ḥayāt al-ḥayawān al-kubrá: "Wa-min kitāb Ḥayāt al-ḥayawān. Ḥarf al-Yāʼ. Yājūj wa-Mājūj, summū bi-dhālika li-kathratihim. Wa-qīl huwa ism Aʻjamī ghayr mushtaq. Qāla Muqātil: Hum walad Yāfit ibn Nūḥ, ʻlayhi al-salām. Wa-ammā qawlu man qāl anna Ādam nāma wa-iḥtalam wa-iltaṣaqa manīyuhu bi-al-turāb fa-tawallada minhu hādhā al-ḥayawān fa-mardūd bi-ʻadam iḥtilām al-anbiyāʼ ʻalayhim al-salām ..."
Secundo folio of Kitāb al-dumūʻ: ilayhi wa-rajaʻ wa-ashhadu.
Secundo folio of Kitāb Ādāb al-akl: taslīman. al-Ḥamdu lillāh.
Secundo folio of Kitāb Ādāb al-nikāḥ: wa-qālū inna ʻĪsá.
Secundo folio of Miscellaneous Ḥadīths and advices: fī jawāzihi bi-asmāʼ Allāh.
Secundo folio of Tanwīr al-ghabash fī faḍl al-Sūdān wa-al-Ḥabash: ʻalá mā hiya ʻalayh.
Secundo folio of Bāb al-ʻAql ḥujjat Allāh ʻalá khalqih: wa-qalb madhbūḥ wa-qalb maṭrūḥ.
Secundo folio of Questions and answers on Islamic law: wa-kataba Sayyidī Muḥammad.
Secundo folio of An anecdote regarding the encounter of Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-ʻĀbid with al-Khaḍir and Ilyās: wa-ʻalá ṭarīqat rajul.
Secundo folio of Excerpts from Tuḥfat al-albāb fī ʻajāʼib al-buldān: mattá buniyat hādhihi al-madīnah.
Secundo folio of Excerpts from Ḥayāt al-ḥayawān al-kubrá: aḥaduhumā lil-ākhar ṣār.
In fair, small Maghribī script, in black ink on white paper; headings, keywords and markings in red; catchwords.
On the back of the front cover a leaf is glued which contains some folkloric medicinal recipes.
On folio 1a a poem in eight verses about the seven voluntary fasts in Islam.

On folios 55b-57b different anecdotes about: The faithful Jinn (muʼminū al-Jinn) and whether they can enter Paradise and can see God, whether women can see God in Paradise, whether a man can marry a female Jinn (jinnīyah), the seven categories of keeping vigil in prayer at night (marātib iḥyāʼ al-layl), enumeration of the virtuous nights and days (bayān al-layālī wa-al-ayyām al-fāḍilah).
On folios 87b-100b a collection of miscellaneous Ḥadiths and advices on permissable and prohibited acts.
On folio 140b: a. Two Ḥadīths on the pursuit of knowledge. b. On God the cause of all causes. c. Six verses on when not to return greetings.
On folio 147a-147b several scribbles in illegible Maghribī hand writing: Ḥadīths, anecdotes, the numerical values of the letters of the Arabic alphabet (ḥisāb al-jummal).
Colophon of Poem on the seven voluntary fasts in Islam. Colophon missing. Ends with: Wa-thālithu ayyām al-Muḥarrami innahu // jalīlun wa-ʻĀshurāʼu [wa-ʻĀshūrāʼu] fīhi aqāwilu."

Colophon of Kitāb al-dumūʻ (folio 55a): "Intahá Kitāb al-Dumūʻ. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh wa-ilayhi al-rujūʻ. Wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad dhī al-majd wa-al-maqām al-marfūʻ wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi ulī al-ikhlāṣ lillāh wa-al-khushūʻ. Wa-raḥima Allāh man allafahu wa-kātibahu wa-kāsibahu wa-qāriyahu wa-sāmiʻahu wa-mustaʻmilahu wa-li-man daʻā lahum bi-al-maghfirah wa-al-raḥmah. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. ʻĀm 1181."

Translation of the colophon of Kitāb al-dumūʻ: "Kitāb al-Dumūʻ has ended. Praise be to God. To Him is the returning. May prayer and peace be upon our Master Muḥammad who has the glorious and sublime status, and on his family and companions who are loyal and submissive to God. May God have mercy on its author, its copyist, he who benefits from it, its reader, he who listen to it, its user, and on him who asks God to forgive them and have mercy upon them. Praise be to God the Lord of the Universe. The year 1181."

Colophon of Kitāb Ādāb al-akl: Colophon missing. Ends with: "... wa-qāla ayḍan: ʻAjibtu li-man yadkhulu al-ḥammām ʻalá al-rīq thumma yuʼakhkhiru al-akl baʻda an yakhruja kayfa lā yamūtu. Wa-ʻajibtu li-man iḥtajama thumma bādara al-akl kayfa lā yamūtu. Wa-qāla ayḍan lam ara shayʼan anfaʻu lil-wabāʼ min duhn al-banafsaj yuddahanu bi-hi wa-yushrab."

Colophon of Kitāb Ādāb al-nikāḥ: "Wa-hādhā alladhī wajadnā fa-qayyadnāh min baʻḍ al-awrāq, wa-lam najid lahum [la-hā] awwalan wa-lā ākhiran wa-fīhim [wa-fīhā] batr wa-tamzīq min ṭūl al-zamān ʻalayhim [ʻlayhā]. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman. Wa-ākhir daʻwānā an al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."

Translation of the colophon of Kitāb Ādāb al-nikāḥ: "This is what we found and recorded from some leaves, but we did not find to them neither a beginning nor an end. There were in them gaps and tearing due to the passage of time. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and companions and grant them peace. We conclude with: Praise be to God the Lord of the Universe."

Colophon of Miscellaneous Ḥadīths and advices: "Wa-hādhā mā wajadnāhu muqayyadan fa-qayyadnāh wa-lillāh katabnāh. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman kathīran athīran ilá yawm al-dīn wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. ʻAlá [yad] ʻabdihi Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī al-Ḥassānī, ghafara Allāh la-hu. Āmīn ʻĀm 1181."

Translation of Miscellaneous Ḥadīths and advices: "This is what we found written and we recorded. We copied it for the sake of God. May God pray on our Master and Lord Muḥammad and on his family and companions and grant them abundant and pleasant peace until Judgement Day. Praise be to God the Lord of the Universe. Copied by His slave Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī al-Ḥassānī, may God forgive him. Amen. The year 1181 Hijrī [1767 or 1768]."

Colophon of Tanwīr al-ghabash fī faḍl al-Sūdān wa-al-Ḥabash: "Kamula bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ḥusn ʻawnih Kitāb Tanwīr al-ghabash fī faḍl al-Sūdān wa-al-Ḥabash taʼlīf al-Shaykh al-Faqīh al-Imām al-ʻĀlim Jamāl al-Dīn Abū al-Faraj al-Jawzī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá wa-raḍiya ʻanhu. Āmīn. Wa-al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn ʻalá yad al-ʻabd al-mudhnib ʻubayd Allāh wa-aqall al-ʻabīd Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī al-Ḥassānī, ghafara Allāh la-hu, yawm al-Jumʻah ākhir )26) maḍat min Dhī al-Ḥijjah ʻām 1181 [14 May, 1768]."

Translation of the colophon of Tanwīr al-ghabash fī faḍl al-Sūdān wa-al-Ḥabash: "The book of Tanwīr al-ghabash fī faḍl al-Sūdān wa-al-Ḥabash by al-Shaykh al-Faqīh al-Imām al-ʻĀlim Jamāl al-Dīn Abū al-Faraj al-Jawzī (May the exalted God have mercy upon him and be pleased with him. Amen) is completed by the praise of God and His abundant help. Praise be to God the Lord of the Universe. Copied by the guilty slave, the little slave of God and the least among the slaves, Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī al-Ḥassānī, may God forgive him, on Friday, the end of the 26th of Dhū al-Ḥijjah, the year 1181 [14 May, 1768]."

Colophon of Bāb al-ʻAql ḥujjat Allāh ʻalá khalqih. Colophon missinng. Ends with: "... wa-lā yuṣghī al-muʼmin al-ʻāqil li-khurāfat man yaqūlu al-maʻbūdāt al-bāṭilāt maʻa Allāh ka-al-aṣnām wa-al-Shams wa-al-Qamar hiya al-manfīyah li-annahā layst bi-ālihah li-ḥudūthihā wa-iftiqārihā wa-lā muthbitah li-wujūdihā wa-thubūtihā. Qāla Allāh taʻālá: 'Inna alladhīna tadʻūna min dūn Allāh ʻibādun amthālukum' wa-lam yaqul ālihah mithlī, wa-shattāna mā bayna mā istaghraqatʹhu al-ʻubūdīyah wa-bayna mā wajabat la-hu al-ulūhīyah. H. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman."

Colophon of Questions and answers on Islamic law: "Kutiba hādhā min baʻḍ al-awrāq waqafa ʻalayhim [ʻalayhā] Sayyidī Muḥammad ibn Ibrāhīm al-Tāghazūtī wa-ʻallama ʻalayhim [ʻalayhā] bi-ʻalāmatihi. Wa-naqalahā ʻabd Allāh Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī al-Ḥassānī, ghafara Allāh la-hu. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon of Questions and answers on Islamic law: "This was copied from some leaflets found by Sayyidī Muḥammad ibn Ibrāhīm al-Tāghazūtī which he marked by his own handwriting. Copied by the slave of God Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī al-Ḥassānī, may God forgive him. Amen."

Colophon of An anecdote regarding the encounter of Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-ʻĀbid with al-Khaḍir and Ilyās: "Manqūl min kitāb al-Tādilī, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu wa-nafaʻanā bi-barakātihi. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon of An anecdote regarding the encounter of Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-ʻĀbid with al-Khaḍir and Ilyās: "Copied from the book of al-Tādilī, may God be pleased with him and benefit us with his blessings. Amen."

Colophon of Excerpts from Tuḥfat al-albāb fī ʻajāʼib al-buldān. Colophon missing. Ends with: "... Fa-lā taʻjaban yā hādhā mimmā raʼaytahu // fa-kullu umūr al-dunyā hādhā maṣīruhā. H."

Colophon of Excerpts from Ḥayāt al-ḥayawān al-kubrá. Colophon missing. Ends abruptly with: Yanāmu bi-iḥdá muqlatayhi wa-yattaqī // bi-ukhrá al-aʻādī fa-huwa yaqẓānu nāʼimu. Wa-ghayruhu ..."

record.title: 880-02 Tāj al-tarājim fī ṭabaqāt al-Ḥanafīyah : manuscript / al-Qāsim ibn ʻAbd Allāh ibn Quṭlūbughā.
record.note: On folio 1a: "Tāj al-tarājim lil-ʻAllāmah al-muḥaqqiq al-Shaykh Qāsim ibn Quṭlūbughā al-Ḥanafī tilmīdh al-muḥaqqiq Ibn al-Humām [probably Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd al-Wāḥid, 1388-1459 or 1460] ʻalayhi al-raḥmah wa-al-ruḍwān."

On title page a short biography of the author (Ibn Quṭlūbughā), a short biography of another Ḥanafī scholar "al-Shaykh Zayn ibn Nujaym" (Ibn Nujaym, Zayn al-Dīn ibn Ibrāhīm, died 1563), and the dates of birth and death of al-Shaykh ʻAlī al-Maqdisī (probably ʻAlī ibn Ghānim al-Maqdisī, 1514-1596), in different hands.
On folio 1a an ownership note: "Dakhal fī milk al-faqīr ilayhi Ḥasan Ṭāhā al-Dāwūdī al-Dījānī, ʻafá Allāh ʻanhu fī 7 Ṣafar sanat 1290 [6 April, 1873]".
On the last leaf (folio 39b) several folkloric medicinal recipes.

Colophon: "Tamma hādhā al-kitāb al-mubārak bi-ḥamd Allāh subḥānah wa-taʻālá wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá Rasūlih al-nabī al-ummī wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbih ajmaʻīn ʻalá yad afqar al-ʻibād wa-aḥwajihim ilá Rabbih Yawm al-Tanād yawm ʻaṭsh al-akbād al-faqīr Zakarīyā ibn Ṣāliḥ ibn Yaḥyá al-Dayrī al-Ḥanafī al-ʻAbsī al-Khālidī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayh wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn wa-li-man qaraʼa fī hādhā al-kitāb wa-daʻá la-hu bi-al-maghfirah. Āmīn. Wa-dhālika fī 6 shahr Rabīʻ al-Thānī al-wārid bi-al-tahānī min shuhūr sanat 1307."

Translation of the colophon: "This blessed book is completed by the praise of God, may He be exalted and glorified. May prayer be upon His Messenger, the Illiterate Prophet, and upon his family and all his companions. Copied by the poorest and the neediest to his Lord on the Day of Judgement, the day when livers thirst, the poor Zakarīyā ibn Ṣāliḥ ibn Yaḥyá al-Dayrī al-Ḥanafī al-ʻAbsī al-Khālidī, may God forgive him, his parents and all Muslims. May God also forgive those who read this book and implore Him to forgive him [the copyist]. Amen. Dated 6 Rabiʻ al-Thānī of the year 1307 [15 December, 1627], may it bring good tidings."

record.title: 880-02 ʻIqd al-laʼālī li-Badʼ al-amālī : manuscript / Raḍī al-Dīn Abū al-Qāsim ibn al-Ḥusayn al-Bakrī al-Maqdisī.
record.note: On folio 1a: "Hādhā Kitāb Sharḥ Badʼ al-amālī, al-musammá bi-ʻIqd al-laʼālī ʻalá ʻaqīdat Badʼ al-amālī lil-Shaykh al-Imām wa-al-asad al-humām walī Allāh taʻālá al-Shaykh al-Maqdisī al-Ḥanafī, laṭafa Allāh bi-hi fī al-jalī wa-al-khafī wa-nafaʻanā bi-hi. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Tamm."

On folio 1a an ownership statement: "Dakhala fī milk al-faqīr ilayhi subḥānah Ḥusayn Ṭāhā Turbadār Sayyidinā, ʻalá Nabīyinā wa-ʻalayhi ṣalawāt al-Malik al-Wadūd. Q 6. Fī Rabīʻ Thānī, sanat 1202 [January/February 1788]. Mushtarā [Mushtará] min al-Shaykh Ḥasan al-Shihlī."
Leaf 40 is blank; text folios 1b-39a.

Colophon: "Wa-Allāh taʻālá aʻlam, wa-huwa subḥānahu al-masʼūl an yujzila lil-nāẓim min faḍlih al-ʻaẓīm thawābah wa-yūfiyahu min iḥsānih al-ʻamīm ḥisābah wa-an yakhtuma la-nā wa-li-aḥibbāʼinā bi-al-ḥusná wa-yajmaʻanā fī mustaqarr raḥmatih al-asná. Āmīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá al-tamām wa-al-khitām wa-azká al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá miṣbāḥ al-ẓalām wa-ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi al-aʼimmah al-aʻlām mā walaja al-nahār fī al-ẓalām. Allāhumma ighfir li-kātibihi."

Translation of the colophon: "God, may He be exalted, is more knowledgeable. He is, may He be glorified, in charge of bestowing His abundant favor and plentiful rewards on the versifier. May He seal our life and the life of our beloved ones with his favor. May He gather us in the abode of His glorious mercy. Amen. Praise be to God for the completion and the end of this work. May the best of prayers and peace be upon the torch in the darkness [Prophet Muḥammad], and upon his family and companions, the prominent leaders, as long as the light of day penetrates the darkness. May God forgive the copyist."

record.title: 880-03 al-Isʻāf fī aḥkām al-awqāf : manuscript / Ibrāhīm ibn Mūsá al-Ṭarābulusī.
record.note: Text folios 1b-50b.

On folio 1a: "Kitāb al-Isʻāf fī aḥkām al-awqāf jamʻ al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah al-qudwah al-ruḥalah Shaykh al-Islām Burhān al-Dīn al-Ṭarābulusī al-Ḥanafī taghammadahu Allāh bi-raḥmatihi wa-ruḍwānih. Āmīn. Āmīn."
On folio 1a: Two verses of poetry attributed to al-Fakhr al-Rāzī (probably Fakhr al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn ʻUmar al-Rāzī, 1149 or 1150-1210).
On folio 1a an ownership statement: "Dakhalt fī milk al-faqr [al-faqīr] Ḥusayn Ṭāhā al-Dāwūdī al-Dījānī, ʻufiya ʻanhu. Āmīn. Awwal Shawwāl sanat 1290 [22 November, 1873]."
On folio 1a four erased ownership statements and two illegible seals.

Colophon: Colophon missing, as the last page is missing. Ends with: "... wa-law qāla 'ʻalá qarābatī min abī wa-ummī' wa-kāna la-hu qarābah min qibal abīh faqaṭ wa-ukhrá min qibal ummihi faqaṭ kāna al-waqf bayna al-farīqayn niṣfayn sawāʼ tasāwá al-ʻadad aw ikhtalaf wa-yakūnu niṣf ..."

record.title: 880-02 Zīj-i Gūrgānī : manuscript / Ulugh Beg.
record.note: Colophon: Colophon missing.

record.title: Islamic prayers, Qurʼan recitation and Sufi literature : manuscript.
record.note: Title of Bāb Maʻrifat al-Islām wa-al-īmān from folio 3a.
Title of Shurūṭ al-bāṭinah fī aʻmāl al-ṣalāh from folio 14b.
Title of al-Sharʻ fī al-ṣalāh from folil 18b.
Title of Sufi mystical tract on how to know God and be one with Him supplied by cataloger.
Title of Sharṭ al-ṣalāh from colophon (folio 45b).
Title of Nūr al-muṣallī from folio 46b.
Title of Risālah tataʻallaqu bi-al-tajwīd from incipit (folio 65b).

Incipit of Maʻrifat al-Islām wa-al-īmān: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Rasūlihi Muḥammad Sayyid al-anbiyāʼ wa-al-mursalīn. Qāla al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ajall al-zāhid Aḥmad ibn al-Islām: Bāb Maʻrifat al-Islām wa-al-īmān, wa-al-aṣl fīhi mā ruwiya ʻan ʻAbd Allāh ibn ʻUmar, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhumā, annahu qāl: Kāna al-julūs ʻinda Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam idhā [idh] ḥaḍara shakhṣ bi-aḥsan bizzah wa-ajmal ṣūrah wa-jalasa ʻinda Rasūl Allāh ..."

Incipit of Shurūṭ al-bāṭinah fī aʻmāl al-ṣalāh: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Rasūlihi Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi ajmaʻīn. Wa-ammā Shurūṭ al-bāṭinah fī aʻmāl al-ṣalāh sittah, aḥaduhā ḥuḍūr al-qalb fī jamīʻ al-ṣalāh, wa-thānīhā al-tafahhum bi-maʻná al-qirāʼah kullihā li-anna man lā yafhamu maʻnāhā lā yaḥṣalu riḍāʼ al-Raḥmān ..."

Incipit of al-Sharʻ fī al-ṣalāh: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Iʻlam anna al-Sharʻ fī al-ṣalāt bi-al-ʻilm, wa-huwa an yaʻlama amrun [amran] min awāmir Allāh taʻālá wa-yaʻlamahā ka-mā umira bi-hi. Awwal mā yafʻalu minhā al-qiyām wa-al-nīyah, thumma al-takbīr, thumma al-tawajjuh, thumma al-taʻawwudh, thumma al-tasmiyah, thumma al-qirāʼah, thumma al-rukūʻ, thumma al-iʻtidāl, thumma al-sujūd al-awwal ..."

Incipit of Sufi mystical tract on how to know God and be one with Him: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī nawwara qulūb al-ʻārifīn bi-al-tawḥīd wa-al-ʻirfān wa-shaqqa [wa-shafá] ʻuyūb al-muwaḥḥidīn bi-al-ṭāʻāt wa-tark al-ʻiṣyān, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá man bi-hi hadá Allāh ahl al-Islām wa-al-īmān Muḥammad Sayyid al-khalq min al-ins wa-al-jinn ..."

Incipit of Sharṭ al-ṣalāh: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-ammā arkān [al-ṣalāh] fa-tisʻat ʻashar ruknan. al-Awwal al-nīyah, wa-shurūṭuhā sittah. al-Awwal an yaqṣuda al-ṣalāh, wa-al-thānī an yuʻayyina al-ṣalāh ka-al-ẓuhr wa-al-ʻaṣr wa-al-Jumaʻah wa-ghayrihin ..."

Incipit of Nūr al-muṣallī: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī nawwara wujūdahu bi-hādhā al-Kitāb wa-[alqá?] faraḥ qulūbuhu bi-sabab qirāʼat al-Kitāb, wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi ajmaʻīn. Ammā baʻd, fa-hādhā al-kitāb al-ismuhu Nūr al-muṣallī min kalām al-Shaykh Abī Bakr, qaddasa Allāh rūḥahu al-ʻazīz. Wa-fī hādhā al-kitāb khamsat abwab [abwāb]. al-Bāb al-awwal fī tartīb al-wālḍūʼ [al-wuḍūʼ]. al-Bāb al-thānī fī tartīb ghasl al-janābah. al-Bāb al-thālith fī tartīb afʻāl al-ṣalāh ..."

Incipit of Risālah tataʻallaqu bi-al-tajwīd: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn wa-al-ʻāqibah lil-muttaqīn wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi ajmaʻīn. Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhihi Risālah yataʻallaqu [tataʻallaqu] bi-al-tajwīd. Faṣl fī al-iẓhār. Iʻlam anna al-nūn al-sākinah wa-al-tanwīn idhā laqiyā ḥurūf al-ḥalq yuẓharān ..."
Secundo folio of Maʻrifat al-Islām wa-al-īmān: Bāb Maʻrifat al-Islām.
Secundo folio of Shurūṭ al-bāṭinah fī aʻmāl al-ṣalāh: li-anna man lā yafhamu maʻnāhā.
Secundo folio of al-Sharʻ fī al-ṣalāh: thumma al-iʻtidal [al-iʻtidāl].
Secundo folio of Sufi mystical tract on how to know God and be one with Him: al-muwaḥḥidīn wa-jizyat al-muʻtaqidīn.
Secundo folio of Sharṭ al-ṣalāh: ʻalayhi fāʼitah in kānat.
Secundo folio of Nūr al-muṣallī: Abī bakr qaddasa Allāh.
Secundo folio of Risālah tataʻallaqu bi-al-tajwīd: wa-hiya A H ʻ Ḥ Gh Kh.
The Arabic parts are written in naskh script (Jāwī style), in black ink on Indonesian white paper.
On the back of the front and back covers are texts in Javanese script.
Colophon of Maʻrifat al-Islām wa-al-īmān: "Tammat. Wa-Allāh aʻlam."
Translation of the colophon: "It is concluded. God is more knowledgeable."
Colophon of Shurūṭ al-bāṭinah fī aʻmāl al-ṣalāh: "Tammat. Wa-Allāh aʻlam."
Translation of the colophon of Shurūṭ al-bāṭinah fī aʻmāl al-ṣalāh: "It is concluded. God is more knowledgeable."
Colophon of al-Sharʻ fī al-ṣalāh: "Tammat kitāb [al-Sharʻ fī] al-ṣalāh [three illegible words]. Wa-Allāh aʻlam."
Translation of al-Sharʻ fī al-ṣalāh: "The book of al-Sharʻ fī al-ṣalāh [three illegible words] is concluded. God is more knowledgeable."

Colophon of Sufi mystical tract on how to know God and be one with Him: Colophon missing. Text ends with: "... fa-law lam yaqbal Allāh shahādatahum bi-dhālika la-radda ʻalayhim fī dhālika, fa-takūnu al-ʻurfīyah ʻinda Allāh maqbūlan, wa-huwa al-maṭlūb, wa-billāh al-tawfīq."
Colophon of Sharṭ al-ṣalāh: "Tammat kitām musammá bi-al-Sharṭ al-ṣalāh. Wa-Allāh aʻlam."
Translation of the colophon: The book titled Sharṭ al-ṣalāh is concluded. God is more knowledgeable."
Colophon of Nūr al-muṣallī: "Tammat kitāb Nūr al-ṣalāh. Wa-Allāh aʻlam."
Translation of the colophon of Nūr al-Muṣallī: "The book of Nūr al-ṣalāh is concluded. God is more knowledgeable."
Colophon of Risālah tataʻallaqu bi-al-tajwīd: "Tammat al-kitāb bi-ʻawn al-Malik al-Wahhāb. Wa-Allāh aʻlam."
Translation of the colophon: "The book is concluded by the help of the Abundantly Giving King."

record.title: Prayers and invocations for seeking God's protection : manuscript.
record.note: Text folios 1b-11b.

Interspersed in the text is an invocatory refrain, repeated ten times, in red ink: "Aʻdāʼunā lan yaṣilū ilaynā bi-al-nafs wa-lā bi-al-wāsiṭah, lā qudrata lahum ʻalá īṣāl al-sūʼ ilaynā bi-ḥāl min al-aḥwāl" (Our enemies will not be able to reach us, neither in person nor by proxy. They have no power to inflict harm on us under any circumstances).
Colophon: "Katabahu al-mudhnib al-Sayyid Muḥammad Rāsim min talāmīdh Muḥammad Dhākr [al-mulaqqab] bi-Ḥāfiẓ al-Qurʼān, ghufira la-humā, sanat 1267 H."

Translation of the colophon: "Copied by the guilty al-Sayyid Muḥammad Rāsim, a student of Muḥammad Dhākir [nicknamed] Ḥāfiẓ al-Qurʼān [Memorizer of the Qurʼān], may God forgive both of them, in the year 1267 Hijrī [1850 or 1851]."

record.title: Biography of the Nasrides rulers : manuscript.
record.note: In small Maghribī script, in brown ink on white paper; headings, keywords and markings in red; catchwords. The last leaf is missing. Folio 79 is repaired but it is defective and illegible.
Text folios 2b-79b.
On folios 1a-2a: Illegible scribbles on Islamic law in a different hand.
Colophon: The colophon is missing.

record.title: 880-01 Qiṣṣat futūḥ Ifrīqīyah. Al-Sifr 1 : manuscript.
record.note: In fair Maghribī script, in brown ink on white paper; headings, keywords and markings in red; the first ten leaves are in a different hand and seem to have replaced the original; catchwords. The leaves are affected by dampness, but the text is legible, some are repaired without loss of text.
Text folio 1a-155b.

On folios 1a an advice on generosity, written in light blue ink, bearing the name and signature of al-Sayyid al-Ṭūfī al-Mālikī, Mudīr ʻĀmm Maʻhad al-Futūḥ al-Malakī, starts with: "Kun karīman kay tanāla bi-qurbinā nūran wa-ʻilman ..."
On folio 10b an invocation in a different hand.

Colophon: "Wa-hādhā muqtaḍá al-sifr al-awwal min al-Mahdīyah wa-ilá Sāṭīf ... Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá al-tamām wa-al-ikmāl ʻalá yad ... Aḥmad ibn Ibrāhīm min Banī Ṣāliḥ ... Wa-kāana al-farāgh minhu ʻashīyah yawm al-Arbaʻ awwal shahr Shaʻbān ʻām thalāth wa-thamānīn wa-alf ..."

Translation of the colophon: "This is the end of the first book dealing with [the conquest] from al-Mahdīyah to Sāṭīf ... Praise be to God on completing its copying by ... Aḥmad ibn Ibrāhim of Banī Ṣāliḥ ... The copying was completed on Wednesday evening, the beginning of Shaʻbān, 1083 [22 November, 1672] ..."

record.title: Islamic doctrines : manuscript.
record.note: Title of Arkān al-Islām from folio 1b.
Title of Sullam al-tawfīq ilá maḥabbat Allāh ʻalá al-taḥqīq from folio 29a.

Incipit of Arkān al-Islām: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu Allāh [lillāh] Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn ʻalá umūr al-dunyā wa-al-dīn, wa-ṣallá Allāh wa-sallam ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad khātim al-nabī [al-nabīyīn] wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn, wa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻalī al-ʻaẓīm. Fa-qāla: Arkān al-Islām khamsah: Shahādat an lā ilāha illā Allāh wa-anna Muḥammadan Rasūl Allāh, wa-iqām al-ṣalāh, wa-ītāʼ al-zakāh, wa-ṣawm Ramaḍān, wa-ḥajj al-Bayt ..."

Incipit of Sullam al-tawfīq ilá maḥabbat Allāh ʻalá al-taḥqīq: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-ashhadu an lā ilāha illā Allāh waḥdah lā sharīka lah, wa-ashhadu anna Muḥammadan ʻabduhu wa-rasūluhu, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-al-tābiʻīn. Ammā baʻd, fa-hādhā juzʼ laṭīf yassarahu Allāh taʻālá fīmā yajibu taʻallumuhu wa-taʻlīmuhu wa-al-ʻamal bi-hi lil-khāṣṣ wa-al-ʻāmm. Wa-al-wājib mā waʻada Allāh fāʻilahu bi-al-thawāb wa-tawaʻʻada tārikahu bi-al-ʻiqāb. Wa-sammaytuhu Sullam al-tawfīq ilá maḥabbat Allāh ʻalá al-taḥqīq ..."
Secundo folio of Sullam al-tawfīq ilá maḥabbat Allāh ʻalá al-taḥqīq: mā waʻada Allāh fāʻilahu.
On folio 1a two lines in Javanese script and crude drawings of what seems to be a snake, a sword, two birds and a larva (probably a talisman of some kind).
On folios 26b, 27a-28a scribbles in Arabic and in Javanese (in Arabic script).

Colophon of Arkān al-Islām: Colophon missing. Ends with: "... al-amwāl allatī talzamu fīhā zakāh sittat anwāʻ: al-Naʻam, wa-al-naqdayn, wa-al-muʻashsharāt [al-muʻarrashāt], wa-amwal al-tijārah, wa-al-rikāz, wa-al-miʻdān [al-maʻādin]. Tammat [... ... ...]. Wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb."

Colophon of Sullam al-tawfīq ilá maḥabbat Allāh ʻalá al-taḥqīq: Colophon missing. Text ednd abruptly with: "... aw ʻinda ruʼyat jamʻ wa-ḥshr qāʼim fa-lam nughādir minhum aḥadan, yaqṣudu al-istikhfāf ..."

record.title: Treatises on magic, astrology, alchemy and Sufism : manuscript.
record.note: Title of the codex supplied by cataloger.

Incipit of the Talisman : "Aqsamtu ʻalaykum ayyuhā al-arwāḥ al-ʻulwīyah wa-al-suflīyah al-mustakhrajūn min taksīr hādhihi al-ḥurūf al-sharīfah al-muwakkalūn wa-al-ḥākimūn ʻalayhā, yā Fakhāʼīl, yā Khaḍāʼīl ..."

Incipit of Miftāḥ Kitāb Sāmūr Hindī: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī aẓhara dhawāt al-ʻālimīn bi-amrihi al-qadīm, wa-nawwara al-ʻārifīn bi-tilāwat asmāʼihi al-ʻaẓīm, wa-al-ṣalāh al-dāʼimah ʻalá muẓhir al-dhāt Nabīyih Muḥammad Dhī al-wajh al-karīm wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-awlādihi alladhīna uẓhirū min ʻālam al-rūḥ ilá ʻālam al-jism bi-al-faḍl al-ʻamīm ..."
Secundo folio of Miftāḥ Kitāb Sāmūr Hindī: amīdh darkah bayn.

Incipit of Alchemy recipes: "Mabqalah qarībah. Taʼkhudh ʻalá barakat Allāh, taʼkhudh min shaʻr ithnay ʻashar ūqiyah wa-min wa-min [repeated] al-ṣābūn [ṣābūn] al-ḥukamā qadr thalāthīn, yaʻnī thamāniyah wa-tisʻīn dirham, tusḥaq farādah thumma tusḥaq maʻa baʻḍ saḥqan balīghan ..."
Secundo folio of Alchemy recipes: fī muddat laylah.

Incipit of Second collection of alchemy recipes: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Talaqqaynā hādhihi [hādhā] al-ʻilm min Sharīf Sayyidī Ḥasan min Diyār Bakr fī sanat1172, ibtidāʼ kull shahr kalimatayn. ʻĀsha baʻda dhālika arbaʻat ʻashar sanah ḥattá kamulat asmāʼuhā ramzan. Wa-lam kamulat kulluhā, yaʻnī tarkībuhā. ʻAinda al-tarkīb tawaffā [tuwuffiya] fī Muḥarram sanat 1185."
Secundo folio of Second collection of alchemy recipes: ʻalá kānūn ʻalá nār.
Incipit of Taswīdah: "Khudh ʻalá barakat Allāh taʻālá min al-kibrīt al-mistakkāwī ūqīyah wa-min al-zinjafr ūqīyah ..."
Title of Miftāḥ Kitāb Sāmūr Hindī from folio 2b.
On folio 34a an ownership statement: "Ṣāḥibī wa-mālikī Nuʻmān Afandī Madanī al-Ḥanafī, khādim al-Ḥaram al-Sharīf. 1246 Hijrī (1830/1831).

Colophon of the Talisman: "Tammat. Naqaltuhu min risālah taḥrīran fī Jumāda Thānī sanat 1175, wa-raʼaytuhu fī sanat 1162, thumma naqaltuhu fī Jumād Thānī [signature] Tawakkulī Muṣṭafá."

Translation of the colophon of the Talisman: "It is completed. I copied it from a treatise in Jumād Thānī, 1175 [December 1761/January 1762], having seen it in 1162 [December 1748/January 1749] and copied it in Jumād Thānī [signiture], Tawakkulī Muṣṭafá."
Colophon of Miftāḥ Kitāb Sāmūr Hindī: Colophon missing. Ends with numerical calculations.

Colophon of of Alchemy recipes: Colophon missing. Ends with: "... wa-in kāna yafḍulu fīhi shayʼ udmushu marratan ukhrah [ukhrá] ḥattá lā yafḍula fīhi min al-māʼ shayʼ wa-yaṣīr mithl al-isfīdāj dawwim minhā ʻalá 6 qamar yaṣīr ibrīzan kāmilan."

Colophon of Second Alchemy recipes. Colophon missing. Ends with: "... wa-in lam yaghūṣ shammiʻhu bi-waznah min al-miftāḥ, shayʼ fa-shayʼ jarribhu, wa-in waqf awḍiʻ ʻalayh min al-miftāḥ waznah wa-qaṭṭirhu wa-rudda al-qāṭir ʻlayh thāniyan wa-thālithan, wa-ammā thālith marrah lam yaḥmil qābilat qizāz yaṭlīh raṣāṣ aw ṣīnī hindī, hādhā nuqṭat al-ḥāriqah ʻalá al-dhahab wa-al-fiḍḍah."

record.title: 880-03 Fatʹḥ al-qarīb al-mujīb fī sharḥ alfāẓ al-Taqrīb : manuscript / Abū ʻAbd Allāh Muḥammad ibn Qāsim al-Ghazzī.
record.note: Text folios 3b-223b.

Author's colophon: "Wa-hādhā ākhir kitāb Ghāyat al-ikhtiṣār bi-lā iṭnāb. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabbinā al-munʻim al-wahhāb. Wa-laqad allaftuhu khilāl muddah yasīrah wa-al-marjū mimman [yajidu] fīhi [... ... ...] dhī baṣīrah [...] ṣaghīrah ..."

Translation of the author's colophon: "This is the end of Ghāyat al-ikhtiṣar in brief. Praise be to God our generous and abundantly giving Lord. I wrote it in a short time. It is requested that anyone who finds in it [... ... ...] he who has vision [...] small ..."
Copyist's colophon: Colophon missing.

record.title: Islamic philosophical and doctrinal treatises : manuscript.
record.note: Title of the codex supplied by cataloger.
Title of al-Farq bayna al-ʻilm wa-al-maʻrifah from folio 3a.
Title of Bahjat al-ʻulūm fī sharḥ Bayān ʻAqīdat al-uṣūl from folio 53a.
Title of Taʻlīq ʻalá Sittūn masʼalah fī al-fiqh from folio 87bb.
Title of Sharḥ kalimatay al-shahādah from colophon (folio 149b).
Title of Bāb "Faḍl al-ʻaṣā" form folio 150a.

Incipit of al-Farq bayna al-ʻilm wa-al-maʻrifah: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī akhraja ʻibādahu min al-ʻadam ilá wujūd wa-jarrahum bi-tawfīqihi ʻan ghasaq al-jahl ilá al-shuhūd wa-amarahum ilá al-ṣalawāt al-khams bi-al-rukūʻ wa-al-sujūd li-taḥṣīl al-niʻam wa-ḥawāʼij al-maqṣūd ..."

Incipit of Bahjat al-ʻulūm fī sharḥ Bayān ʻAqīdat al-uṣūl: Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Rabbi yassir wa-lā tuʻassir. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī nawwara qulūb al-muʼminīn bi-nūr hidāyatih wa-asʼaluka bi-riḍāka fī taʼlīf al-mukhtaṣar ... wa-sammaytuhā Bahījat al-ʻulūm fī al-sharḥ [sharḥ] fī Bayān ʻaqīdat al-uṣūl wa-Allāh al-mustaʻān ..."

Incipit of Taʻlīq ʻalá Sittūn masʼalah fī al-fiqh: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá ashraf al-mursalīn Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Ammā baʻd, fa-hādhihi [fa-hādhā] taʻlīq ʻalá al-muqaddimah al-maʻrūfah bi-al-Sittīn masʼalah al-mansūbah lil-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻāmil Ibn ʻAbbās Aḥmad al-Zāhid taghammadahu Allāh bi-raḥmatih, yaḥullu alfāẓahā wa-yutimmu mafādahā. Wa-asʼalu Allāh min faḍlihi al-jazīl an yanfaʻa [bi-hā], fa-huwa ḥasbī wa-niʻma al-wakīl ..."

Incipit of Sharḥ kalimatay al-shahādah: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-Allāh al-muʻīn ʻalá man sharaḥa bi-faḍlihi al-ʻamīm. Wa-Allāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi wa-sallam. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn kamā yanbaghī li-jalālihi wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Muḥammad wa-ālihi. Qāla al-muṣannif, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá Jinān [?], raḍiya Allāh ʻanh: Iʻlam anna kalimatay al-shahādah mimmā yajibu ʻalá kull mukallaf ..."

Incipit of Bāb "Faḍl al-ʻaṣā": "Bāb Faḍl al-ʻaṣā. Qāla al-faqīh, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu: Rawá Maymūn ibn Mamrān ʻan Ibn ʻAbbās: Imasāk al-ʻaṣā sunnat al-anbiyāʼ wa-zayn al-ṣāliḥīn wa-silāḥ ʻalá al-aʻdāʼ yaʻnī al-kalb wa-al-ḥayyah ..."
Secundo folio of al-Farq bayna al-ʻilm wa-al-maʻrifah: ʻalayhi bi-ḥaythu lā yakhfá.
Secundo folio for Bahjat al-ʻulūm fī sharḥ Bayān ʻAqīdat al-uṣūl: bi-shafāʻatihi ṣallá.
Secundo folio of Taʻlīq ʻalá Sittūn masʼalah fī al-fiqh: Allāh bi-raḥmatih yaḥullu.
Secundo folio of Sharḥ kalimatay al-shahādah: ṣaddaqa bi-qalbihi mā lam.

The codex is written in fair and large naskh script (Jawī style), in black ink on Indonesian paper called "Daluang" which is manufactured from the bark of a certain native tree called "saeh"; headings, keywords and markings in red; numerous marginal and interlinear notes in Javanese (Arabic script). Ample spaces are left between the lines to accommodate the notes and the translation into Javanese; some wormholes, mainly marginal.
On folio 52a Ḥadīth: al-Ḥarrāthūn min ummatī, fa-inna nahāruhum jihād wa-layluhum ṭawāf wa-nawmuhum kaffārah li-mā maḍá min dhunūbihim ..."
On folios 86b-87a, a quotation attributed to "Iḥyāʼ ʻulūm al-dīn" of al-Ghazzālī about seeing the moon in the month of Ramaḍān.
On folios 150b-151b prayers and invocations in Javanese and Arabic.

Colophon of al-Farq bayna al-ʻilm wa-al-maʻrifah: Colophon missing. Ends with: "... al-Zuhd thalāthat aḥrūf [aḥruf], Zāʼ wa-Hāʼ wa-Dāl. Fa-al-Zāʼ zād al-maʻād, wa-al-Hāʼ hudá fī al-dunyā, wa-al-Dāl dāma ʻalá ṭāʻat Allāh taʻālá wa-al-humām al-ʻābid raḥmat Allāh ʻlayhi wa-ʻalá aṣḥābihi ajmaʻīn bi-barakat Muḥammad Sayyid al-mursalīn bi-raḥmatika yā arḥam al-rāḥimīn. Tammat. Wa-Allāh aʻlam."

Colophon of Bahjat al-ʻulūm fī sharḥ Bayān ʻAqīdat al-uṣūl: "... Wa-nakhtumu al-kitāb bi-ṣalāt al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam: Allāhumma innī asʼaluka salāmah fī al-dīn wa-ʻāfiyah fī al-jasad wa-ziyādah fī al-ʻilm wa-jazīlan fī al-ākhirah bi-sabab barakat ismika al-karīm, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi ajmaʻīn. Āmīn. Yā Rabba al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-Allāh aʻlam. Tammat. Wa-Allāh aʻlam. Āmīn." In a different hand: "al-Tawfīq. Tammat al-kitāb al-Sharḥ al-Samarqandī."

Translation of the colophon of Bahjat al-ʻulūm fī sharḥ Bayān ʻAqīdat al-uṣūl: "We conclude the book by the invocation of the Prophet, may God pray on him and grant him peace [...]. It is concluded. God is more knowledgeable. And in a different handwriting: [May we have] success. The book of "Sharḥ al-Samarqandī" is concluded."

Colophon of Taʻlīq ʻalá Sittūn masʼalah fī al-fiqh. Colophon missing. Ends with "... wa-tumattiʻunā bi-al-naẓar ilá wajhika al-karīm maʻa aḥibbāʼika al-aṣfiyāʼ al-aḥyāʼ wa-al-abrār, wa-ṣallá Allāh taʻālá [ʻalá] afḍal al-khalq Sayyidinā Muḥammad kullamā dhakaraka al-dhākirūn wa-sahá wa-ghafila ʻan dhikrika al-ghāfilūn, wa-sallama taslīman kathīran. Tammat."
Colophon of Sharḥ kalimatay al-shahādah: "Tammat al-kitāb al-musammá bi-hā [bi-]Sharḥ kalimatay al-shahādah, wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb."
Translation of Sharḥ kalimatay al-shahādah: "The book titled Sharḥ kalimatay al-shahādah is concluded. God is more knowledgeable of what is correct."

Colophon of Bāb "Faḍl al-ʻaṣā" is missing. Ends with: "... Wa-ruwiya ʻan al-Nabī ṢM annahu qāl: Man balagha al-arbaʻīn sanah wa-lam yuʼkhadh [yaʼkhudh] al-ʻaṣá [al-ʻaṣā] ʻallahu min al-ʻujb wa-al-kibr. Bustān al-ʻārifīn."

record.title: 880-01 Takmilat Tafsīr al-Qurʼān al-Karīm : manuscript.
record.note: On folios 1b-3a prayers and invocations in Arabic in different hands.
Text folios 3b-114b.
Colophon: Colophon missing; ends with: "... wujūhakum wa-aydiyakum ilá al-marāfiq ..."

record.title: 880-02 Ijāzah min ʻAlī Riḍā ibn Yūnus al-Jānakī al-Fātsawī al-Fazmawī ilá tilmīdhihi al-Ḥājj ʻAbd al-Qādir ibn ʻAlī al-Bāzārjīfī : manuscript / ʻAlī Riḍā ibn Yūnus al-Jānakī al-Fātsawī al-Istānbūlī.
record.note: In clear naskh taʻlīq script, in black ink, on white paper; keywords in red; the opening page has a handsome heading in gold, red and blue. All sentences are separated by gold discs. All pages are ruled in gold, blue and black. The teacher's seal appears at the very end of the certificate, dated 1312 Hijrī (1894/1895). Folio 12a contains some rubrics in gold.

Colophon: "Hādhihi ṣūrat ijāzatī wa-sanadī fī al-Kitāb wa-al-Sunnah fī naqlīyāt al-ʻulūm wa-ʻaqlīyātihā lil-akh fī Allāh al-ṣāliḥ al-Ḥājj ʻAbd al-Qādir ibn ʻAlī al-Bāzārjīfī, wa-anā al-faqīr ilá Allāh al-ghanī ʻAlī Riḍā ibn Yūnus al-Jānakī al-Fātsawī mawlidan wa-al-Istānbūlī mawṭinan, fī al-yawm al-khāmis min Dhī al-Qaʻdah iḥdá wa-ʻishrīn wa-thalāthmiʼah wa-alf, ʻalá al-Nabī ṣalawāt Allāh alf alf. [Seal of] ʻAlī Riḍā 1312."

Translation of the colophon: "This is a representation of my Ijāzah (Certificate), including my chain of masters, related to the Qurʼān and Sunnah concerning the traditional and intellectual sciences, to the brother in the Good God, al-Ḥājj ʻAbd al-Qādir ibn ʻAlī al-Bāzārjīfī. Issued by me, I, the poor to the affluent God, Riḍā ibn Yūnus al-Jānakī al-Fātsawī mawlidan wa-al-Istānbūlī mawṭinan, dated 5 Dhū al-Qaʻdah, 1321 of the Hijrah [23 January, 1904]. May God's prayers be on the Prophet [Muḥammad] thousand thousand times. [Seal of] ʻAlī Riḍā."

record.title: 880-02 Ijāzah min ʻUthmān Nūrī ibn Muḥammad Amīn al-Miyāwardī ilá tilmīdhihi ʻUmar Luṭfī ibn Muḥammad Ḥilmī al-Arkhawī : manuscript / Abū Muḥammad al-Dhihnī ʻUthmān Nūrī al-Ḥanafī al-Miyāwardī.
record.note: In clear naskh taʻlīq script, in black ink, on white paper; the opening page has a handsome heading in gold, red and blue; all the sentences are separated by gold discs; pages are ruled in gold, red, blue and gold; the opening two pages are surrounded with vignette arabesque design in gilt; folio 10a has some rubrications in gold; the teachers seal appears at the very end of the certificate; catchwords.
On front cover: "ʻUmar Luṭfī ibn al-Ḥājj Muḥammad Ḥilmī Afandī al-Arkhawī."

On folio 2a: "Ammā baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá alṭāf rabbihi al-qadīr ... Abū Muḥammad al-Dhihnī ʻUthmān Nūrī al-Ḥanafī al-Miyāwardī mawlidan wa-bidār al-khilāfah al-sanīyah mawṭinan, al-Nāʼib al-Sharʻ bi-Maḥkamat Ghalaṭah ibn Muḥammad Amīn ..."
On folio 4a: "... ʻUmar Luṭfī ibn al-Ḥājj Muḥammad Ḥilmī Afandī al-ʻarīf bi-Munlā Ismāʻīl Zādah al-Arkhawī."

Colophon: "Katabahu al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr al-muḥtāj ilá raḥmat rabbihi al-qadīr ʻUthmān Nūrī ibn Muḥammad Amīn al-Miyāwardī ʻafá ʻanhumā [...] al-ʻAlī al-Bārī. Fī al-yawm al-rābiʻ min Jumādá al-Ākhirah, li-sanat ithnay ʻashrah wa-thalāthimiʼah wa-alf min al-Hijrah [hijrat] man la-hu al-ʻizz wa-al-sharaf." [Seal of] ʻUthmān Nūrī.

Translation of the colophon: "Written by the poor and despised, he who is in need for the mercy of his mighty Lord Nūrī ibn Muḥammad Amīn al-Miyāwardī, may both be forgiven by the Sublime Creator. Issued on the fourth of Jumādá al-Ākhirah, the year 1312 of the Hijrah [3 December, 1894] of Him who has glory and honor [Prophet Muḥammad]. [Seal of] ʻUthmān Nūrī."

record.title: 880-03 Kitāb Tahāfut al-falāsifah wa-al-radd ʻalayhim : manuscript / taṣnīf al-Shaykh al-Imām Abī Ḥāmid Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Ghazzālī.
record.note: On folio 1a: "Kitāb Tahāfut al-falāsifah wa-al-radd ʻalayhim taṣnīf al-Shaykh al-Imām [... ...] Ḥujjat al-Islām, sharaf al-aʼimmah Abī Ḥāmid Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Ghazzālī ʻafā Allāh ʻanh."
On folio 1a: Medical recipes in difficult to read handwriting.
Text folios 1b-97b.

Colophon: Colophon missing. Text ends abruptly with: "... qāṣir ʻan al-iḥāṭah bi-ʻajāʼib al-qudrah, wa-kadhá al-mulḥidah al-munkirah lil-baʻth wa-al-nushūr idhā buʻithū wa-raʼaw ʻajāʼib ṣunʻ Allāh taʻālá fīhi nadimū nadāmatan lā tanfaʻuhum, wa-yataḥassarūn ʻalá juḥūdihim taḥassuran lā yughnīhim, wa-yuqālu lahum hādhā alladhī kuntum bi-hi tukadhdhibūn, ka-alladhī yukadhdhibu bi-al-khawāṣṣ wa-al-ashyāʼ al-gharībah, bal law khuliqa al-insān ʻāqilan ibtidāʼan wa-qīla la-hu inna hādhihi al-nuṭfah al-qadhirah al-mutashābihat al-ajzāʼ tanqasimu ajzāʼuhā al-mutashābihah ..."

record.title: 880-02 al-Qurʼān al-Karīm : manuscript.
record.note: In clear, large and handsome naskh script; in black ink, on white paper; text fully vocalized throughout; six pages are highly illuminated in gold, brown green, yellow, and other colors (folios: 1b-2b, 129b-130a, 284b-285a); headings of the sūrahs (chapters) are written in red; verses are separated by discs in gold and red; the divisions of the Qurʼān are marked in large gold discs or by gold, red, and blue medallions on the margins; pages are framed in one red line and three black lines; edges of about twenty leaves are repaired without loss of text (except in leaves 275-277, where a few words or letters were lost); catchwords.
Colophon: Colophon missing, ends with: "Sūrat al-Nās Makkīyah, wa-hiya sittat āyāt ..."

record.title: 880-02 al-ʻUyūn al-sawāhir fī rawḍat al-zawāhir : manuscript / Masʻūd ibn al-Sayyid Ḥijāzī Masʻūd.
record.note: Text folios: 1a-150a.

On folio 1a: "Hādhā Kitāb al-ʻUyūn al-sawāhir fī rawḍat al-zawāhir li-jāmiʻihi min shāsiʻ al-aqṭār baʻda taṣfiyatihi min daran al-akdār afqar al-ʻibād ilá rabbihi al-maʻbūd Masʻūd ibn al-Sayyid Ḥijāzī Masʻūd, ghafara Allāh dhunūbah wa-satara ʻuyūbah. M."
On spine in printed gold color: "al-ʻUyūn al-sawāhir. Masʻūd Ḥijāzī."

Colophon: "Yaqūlu jāmiʻuhu min shāsiʻ al-aqṭār baʻda taṣfiyatihi min daran al-akdār afqar al-ʻibād ilá rabbihi al-maʻbūd, Masʻūd ibn al-Sayyid Ḥijāzī Masʻūd, al-Jirjāwī baladan, al-Ḥusaynī maḥtidan: Laqad tamma nasj burd hādhā al-kitāb ʻalá minwāl al-kamāl al-mustaṭāb fī Muḥarram al-ḥarām, iftitāḥ sanat 1293, thalāthah wa-tisʻīn wa-miʼatayn wa-alf min Hijrat man kāna yará min al-amām ka-mā kāna yará min al-khalf, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam wa-sharrafa wa-karrama wa-ʻaẓam wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi al-ghurar mā badrun badar wa-najmun ẓahar."

Translation of the colophon: "The compiler, Masʻūd ibn al-Sayyid Ḥijāzī Masʻūd (al-Jirjāwī baladan, al-Ḥusaynī maḥtidan) says: The materials for this book were collected from vast places, after cleansing them of impurities. I have endeavored to compose it in the most perfect way. It was completed at the beginning of Muḥarram, the year 1293 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [28 January, 1876] ..."

record.title: 880-02 Mukhtaṣar Ghunyat al-mutamallī : manuscript / Ibrāhīm ibn Muḥammad ibn Ibrāhīm al-Ḥalabī.
record.note: On folios iib-iiib an elaborate index of contents.
On folio ia a faded seal with the date 1312 [1894/1895].
Folio 167 is missing.

Colophon: "Qad waqaʻa al-farāgh min imlāʼ Ghunyat al-mutamallī fī Sharḥ Munyat al-muṣallī ʻan yad ʻabd [al-ʻabd] al-ḍaʻīf al-naḥīf, al-rājī ilá raḥmat rabbihi al-laṭīf, Muṣṭafá Bik ibn Ḥājjī Muṣṭafá al-Kanqrawī, al-mashhūr bi-Jalabʹzādah, al-sākin bi-Maḥallat al-Shaykh ʻUthmān, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayninā [wa-li-wālidaynā] wa-li-man naẓara fīhi, ākhir yawm al-Jumʻah min Ṣafar al-khayr, waqt al-ẓuhr, li-sanat arbaʻ wa-sittīn wa-miʼah wa-alf. M."

Translation of the colophon: "The copy of Ghunyat al-mutamallī fī Sharḥ Munyat al-muṣallī was completed by Muṣṭafá Bik ibn Ḥājjī Muṣṭafá al-Kanqrawī al-mashhūr bi-Jalabʹzādah ... who resides at Maḥallat al-Shaykh ʻUthmān ... at noon time of the last Friday [probably the 24th] of Ṣafar, 1164 Hijrī [22 January, 1751]."

record.title: [Bill of A. & M. Bradley Dresses, Manchester, for purchases by Mrs. Davenport].
record.note: Records purchases of 6 dresses, trimmings, tape, and cleaning feathers for £13/0/7. Receipt of payment is recorded on 2/7/1821.
"No. 38 Bloom St. Manchester."

record.title: 880-03 Dalāʼil al-khayrāt wa-shawāriq al-anwār fī al-ṣalāh ʻalá al-Nabī al-mukhtār : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Sulaymān al-Jazūlī.
record.note: On folio 2a: "... wa-sammaytuhu bi-Kitāb Dalāʼil al-khayrāt wa-shawāriq al-anwār fī dhikr al-ṣalāh ʻalá al-Nabī al-mukhtār."

Colophon: "Katabahu aḍʻaf al-ḍaʻīf, khādim al-dīn al-ʻarīf, Muṣṭafá al-Ḥalīmī, min talāmīdh Muṣṭafá al-Kūtāhī, ghafara Allāh dhunūbahumā wa-satara ʻuyūbahumā, wa-li-man naẓara ilayhi. Āmīn. Fī sanat thamān wa-miʼatayn wa-alf."

Translation of the colophon: "Copied by the weakest of the weak, servant of the leading religion, Muṣṭafá al-Ḥalīmī, a student of Muṣṭafá al-Kūtāhī, may God forgive the sins of both of them and cover their shortcomings, may He also forgive those who look into it [the manuscript]. Amen. In the year one thousand two hundred and eight."

record.title: 880-01 Kitāb thābit fī aḥkām al-buyūʻ : manuscript.
record.note: In thick and large naskh/taʻlīq script, in black ink on white paper; headings, keywords and markings in red; many marginal notes; catchwords.
Text folios 2b-95b.
On folio 1a invocations and prayer in a different hand.

Colophon: Colophon missing; ends abruptly with: "... fa-in shāʼa bāshara nafsuhu wa-in shāʼa fawwaḍa ilá ghayrih, wa-bi-hi qālat al-thalāthah, wa-la-hu anna al-jawāb thābit mustaḥiqq ʻalá al-khaṣm bi-lisānih ʻaynan li-annahu huwa al-maqdūr la-hu fī al-tawkīl, naqala hādhā al-ḥaqq ilá ghayrih ʻalá wajh lā yuʻribu min al-ḍarar li-ṣāḥib al-ḥaqq wa-huwa ḍarar shiddah ..."

record.title: Islamic prayers and invocations : manuscript.
record.note: Folios 151-164 are blank.
Colophon: No colophon.

record.title: 880-03 Raḥmat al-ummah fī ikhtilāf al-aʼimmah : manuscript / taʼlīf Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn al-Ḥusayn al-Qurshī al-ʻUthmānī.
record.note: Pages also numbered in Indian numerals: 1-474.
Text folios 1b-236b (pages 1-472).
Includes an elaborate index of contents: Folios 237a-237b (pages 473-474).

On folio 1a: "Hādhā Kitāb Ikhtilāf al-aʼimmah, al-musammá, Raḥmat al-ummah, taʼlīf al-ʻĀlim al-ʻallāmah Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn al-Ḥusayn al-Qurashī al-ʻUthmānī Qāḍī Ṣafad al-Shāfiʻī, taghammadahu Allāh bi-ruḍwānih. Āmīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Āmīn."

On the margin of page 472: "... Ṭālaʻa fī hādhā al-kitāb al-mubārak Muḥammad ibn Yūsuf al-Sibāhī bi-Dimashq al-maḥrūsah, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-man daʻá la-hu bi-al-maghfirah. Āmīn. Fī tāsiʻ wa-ʻshrīn shahr al-Ḥijjah sanat arbaʻ wa-ʻishrīn [year not mentioned]."

Author's colophon: "Qāla muʼallifuhu, raḥimahu Allāh raḥmatan wāsiʻah wa-nafaʻanā bi-barakatihi wa-ʻilmih, Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn al-Ḥusayn al-Qurashī al-ʻUthmānī, Qāḍī Ṣafad al-Shāfiʻī: Faraghtu min taʼlīf hādhā al-kitāb al-mubārak fī laylah yusfiru ṣabāḥuhā ʻan nahār al-Thulāthāʼ, ḥādī ʻashar Dhī al-Qaʻdah al-ḥarām, sanata thamānīn wa-sabʻimiʼah bi-rabḍ Ṣafad, ḥamāhā Allāh taʻālá."

Translation of the author's colophon: "The author (Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn al-Ḥusayn al-Qurashī al-ʻUthmānī, the Chief Judge of Ṣafad), may God have abundant mercy upon him, and may He benefit us by his blessing and knowledge, said: I finished writing this blessed book on Tuesday morning, 11 Dhū al-Qaʻdah, 780 Hijrī [9 March, 1379], in the city of Ṣafad, may God protect it."

Copyist colophon: "Qāla kātibuhu al-ʻabd al-faqīr al-muʻtarif bi-al-dhanb wa-al-taqṣīr, al-rājī ʻafwa rabbihi al-qadīr, Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Jafrī [or al-Jaʻbarī (?)] baladan, al-Hāshimī nasaban: Katabtuhu min nuskhah waqaʻat bi-yadī bi-madīnat Salānīk min arḍ al-Rūm, maktūb fīhā: Qāla kātib hādhihi al-nuskhah bi-yadihi al-fāniyah li-nafsih wa-liman shāʼa Allāh min baʻdih, Jaʻfar ibn Ibrāhīm ibn Jaʻfar ibn Sulaymān al-Sanhūrī al-muqrī al-Azʹharī nazīl al-Qāhirah al-maḥrūsah, fī shahr Allāh al-Muḥarram al-ḥarām, sanat khams wa-khamsīn wa-thamānimiʼah. Wa-faraghtu min kitābatihi yawm al-Sabt baʻda al-ẓuhr bi-madīnat Salānīk al-madhkūrah fī thānī ʻashar min shahr Ramaḍān min shuhūr sanat thalāth wa-tisʻmiʼah. Allāhumma ighfir lanā wa-li-wālidaynā wa-li-mashāyikhinā wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn, yā Rabba al-ʻĀlamīn."

Translation of the copyist colophon: "The copyist ... Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Jafrī [or al-Jaʻbarī (?)] baladan, al-Hāshimī nasaban, said: I copied this copy from a copy I saw in the city of Salānīk ... in which was written: The copyist of this book, Jaʻfar ibn Ibrāhīm ibn Jaʻfar ibn Sulaymān al-Sanhūrī al-muqrī al-Azʹharī, copied it for himself ... in Muḥarram, 855 [February/March, 1451]. The present copy was completed on Saturday afternoon, in the afore mentioned city of Salānīk on 12 Ramaḍān, 903 Hijrī [13 May, 1498] ..."

record.title: [Shipping receipt for bales of cottonwool shipped board the Adolphus].
record.note: Transcription, with manuscript text noted in square brackets: "Shipped, by the Grace of God, in good Order and condition by [G. Armistead] in upon the good ship called the [Adolphus] whereof is Master, under God, for this present voyage, [Johann Popp] and now riding at Anchor in the [Roads of Heligoland] and by God's Grace, bound for [Gothenburg or any other port or ports in the Baltic Lay] [T & R fifty bales cottonwool. T & R three bales cottonwool] being marked and numbered as in the margin, and are to be delivered in the like order and condition at the aforesaid Port of [Gothenburg or other] (The Act of God, the King's Enemies, Fire, and all other and every then dangers and accidents of the seas, and of navigation, of whatever nature and kind soever excepted) unto [Order] or to [my] assigns, he or they paying freight for the said goods [as of agreement] with Primage and average accustomed. In witness whereof he Master or Purser of the ship [both] affirmed to [2] bills of lading, all of this tenor and date ; the one of which [2] bills being accomplished, the other [1] to stand void. And so God send the good ship to her desired Port in safety. Amen. Dated in [Heligoland 11th October 1810] [Johann Popp]

record.title: 880-03 Dalāʼil al-khayrāt wa-shawāriq al-anwār fī al-ṣalāh ʻalá al-Nabī al-mukhtār : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Sulaymān al-Jazūlī.
record.note: On folio 2a: "... wa-sammaytuhu bi-Kitāb Dalāʼil al-khayrāt wa-shawāriq al-anwār fī dhikr al-ṣalāh ʻalá al-Nabī al-mukhtār."

On the margins of folios 108a-109b, an "Ijāzah," a certificate in which a teacher (name not mentioned) authorizes his student (name not mentioned) to transmit and teach the book to others. The chain of transmitters ends with the author of the book al-Jazūlī himself: "... ʻan al-muʼallif Abī ʻAbd Allāh Muḥammad ibn Sulaymān al-Jazūlī al-Maghribī al-Shādhilī, quddisa sirruhu al-ʻālĭ."
Colophon: Colophon missing. Ends with: "... Hādhā dhullunā ẓāhir bayna yadayk wa-ḥālunā lā yakhfá ʻalayk, amartanā fa-taraknā wa-nahaytanā ..."

record.title: Treatises on God's unity and other Islamic doctrinal issues : manuscript.
record.note: Incipit of Risālah fī al-tawḥīd: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi. al-Ḥamdu lillāh. Wa-mimmā kataba Abū Muḥammad Sayyidī ʻAbd Allāh al-Habṭī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá wa-raḍiya ʻanhu, li-man yaqifu ʻalayhi munabbihan fīhi ʻalá sharḥ al-ʻaqāʼid al-Islāmīyah wa-al-īmānīyah wa-ghayrihā min al-adhkār al-sharʻīyah, wa-al-ḥaḍḍ bal wa-al-taḥrīḍ ʻalá al-taʻlīm wa-al-ʻilm wa-al-ʻamal bi-hi, wa-hādhā naṣṣuhu: al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī qāla fī Kitābihi alladhī unzila bi-hi Jibrīl al-amīn min ʻind Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad al-makīn ..."
Secundo folio of Risālah fī al-tawḥīd: ilá al-farsh wa-kadhālika.
Incipit of Short poem on "ḥalāl": al-Ḥamdu lillāh. Wa-in tarid maʻrifat al-ḥalāli // khudh mā naẓamnāhu wa-lā tubāli.

Incipit of On the existence of God: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Qāla al-Shaykh al-Imām Abū ʻAmr wa-ʻUthmān ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Salālijī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá wa-raḍiya ʻanhu wa-razaqanā Allāh: Inna al-ʻālam ʻibārah ʻan kull mawjūd siwá Allāh wa-siwá ṣifat dhātihi. Thumma al-ʻālam ʻalá qismayn, jawāhir wa-aʻrāḍ. Fa-al-jawhar huwa al-mutaḥayyiz wa-al-ʻaraḍ huwa al-maʻná al-qāʼim bi-al-jawhar. Faṣl. Wa-al-dalīl ʻalá thubūt al-jawhar tanāhī al-ajsām. Bal al-ajsām fī inqisāmihā ilá aḥad yastaḥīl inqisāmuh, fa-dhālika huwa al-jawhar li-anna al-qismah hiya al-iftirāq wa-al-shayʼ al-wāḥid lā yufāriqu nafsah ..."
Secundo folio of On the existence of God: wa-intifāʼuhā baʻda wujūdihā.

Incipit of Miscellaneous doctrinal issues: "al-Ḥamdu lillāh. Ṣifat Allāh tabāraka wa-taʻālá tanqasimu ilá arbaʻat aqsām, wa-qism al-maʻānī ilá arbaʻat aqsām. Qism lā yataʻallaqu wa-huwa al-ḥayāt [al-ḥayāh], wa-qism yataʻallaqu bi-al-mumkināt wa-huwa faqaṭ dūna al-wājibāt wa-al-mustaḥīlāt wa-huwa al-qidrah wa-al-irādah ..."

Incipit of On the significance of "Lā ilāha illā Allāh": "al-Ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad al-karīm wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman. Qāla al-Shaykh al-zāhid Sayyidī ʻAbd Allāh al-Habṭī, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu wa-nafaʻanā bi-barakātih. Āmīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá kull niʻmah anʻama bi-hā ʻalá jamīʻ al-anām wa-lā niʻmah ajall wa-aʻẓam min niʻam al-Islām, wa-ʻalá Mawlānā Muḥammad al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi wa-dhurrīyatihi al-kirām wa-ʻalá aʼimmat al-ummah maṣābīḥ al-ẓalām. Wa-baʻd, fa-al-tawḥīd rāʼs al-dīn wa-mūjib ruḍwān Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn ..."
Secundo folio of On the significance of "Lā ilāha illā Allāh": fa-man fahimahā fa-li-yaḥmad.

Incipit of Questions and answers about miscellaneous legal and doctrinal issues: "al-Ḥamdu lillāh. Sayyidī, raḍiya Allāh ʻankum wa-arḍākum. Jawābukum lillāh wa-li-Rasūlihi ʻan masʼalat rajul yaqbiḍu ʻalá al-zayt wa-al-shamʻ fī ʻilm al-ghayb, fa-ʻinda wafāt al-ajal lam yaqbiḍ ghallat al-zayt wa-lā ghallat al-shamʻ, mādhā yalḥaqu rabb al-māl ..."
Secundo folio of Questions and answers about miscellaneous legal and doctrinal issues: al-dakhl maʻahā fī dhālik.

Incipit of Questions on doctrinal issues: "al-Ḥamdu lillāh. Suʼila al-Imām shaykh shuyūkhinā Sayyidī al-ʻArabī al-Fāsī, raḥimahu Allāh ʻamman yaqūlu fī ḥaqq al-malāʼikah, ʻalayhim al-salām, innahum dhukūr wa-hal waṣfuhum bi-al-dhukūrīyah aw al-unūthah naqṣ, wa-hal hum ajrām shaffāfah nūrānīyah, fa-ajāb ..."
Secundo folio of Questions on doctrinal issues: wa-maʻa dhālika qad jāʼa.

Incipit of Questions on Islamic law: "al-Ḥamdu lillāh. Suʼila al-ʻAllāmah Sayyidī al-Ḥasan ibn Masʻūd al-Yūsī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá wa-raḍiya ʻanh, ʻan "ṭābah", hal hiy ḥarām, aw ḥalāl, aw makrūhah, fa-ajāba bi-mā naṣṣuhu: al-Jawāb, wa-Allāh al-muwāfiq lil-ṣawāb, hādhihi al-ʻushbah ḥādithah fī al-bilād al-Maghribīyah, fa-lam yūjad ʻalayhā naṣṣ mimman taqaddama min al-fuqahāʼ ..."
Secundo folio of Questions on Islamic law: al-nafs wa-raʼāhā fa-lammā.

Incipit of Legal questions and answers, titled "Taqyīd masāʼil": "Taqyīd masāʼil. al-Ḥamdu lillāh. Sayyidī, raḍiya Allāh taʻālá ʻankum wa-arḍākum wa-mattaʻa al-Muslimīn bi-ṭūl ḥayātikum. Jawābukum al-shāfī al-mubārak al-kāfī lillāh wa-li-Rasūlihi min masāʼil majmūʻah. Fa-saʼala wāḥidun: Karāhat al-ghasl min dūn istitār, hal dhālika al-istitār min nafsihi, aw min al-ghayr ..."
Secundo folio of Legal questions and answers, titled "Taqyīd masāʼil": dirhamān wa-al-maqṣūd wāḥid.
In fair Maghribī script (in different hands), in black ink on white paper, with headings, keywords and markings in red or green, some worm holes with minor loss of text.
The pages of this manuscript are numbered in Arabic numerals: 111-212, which may mean that this manuscript was extracted from another codex.

Risālah fī al-tawḥīd ends with: "... wa-lā taḥsabanna Allāh ghāfilan ʻammā yaʻmalu al-ẓālimūn. Ilá Allāh marjiʻukum fa-yunbiʼukum bi-mā kuntum taʻmalūn. Subḥāna Rabbika Rabbi al-ʻIzzati ʻammā yaṣifūn, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, huwa ḥasbunā wa-niʻma al-wakīl, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."
Short poem on "ḥalāl" ends with: Aw dhahaba ṭullābuhu fī al-ḥalāli // ihdinā yā Rabbu ilá al-ḥalāli. Intahá.

On the existence of God ends with: "... ʻaqīdat Ahl al-Sunnah talaqqāhā al-khalaf ʻan al-salaf, wa-Allāh al-mustaʻān lil-mutamassik bi-hā wa-al-qiyām bi-riʻāyat ḥuqūqihā wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻalī al-ʻaẓīm, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad al-karīm wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

Miscellaneous doctrinal issues ends with: "... man laqiya akhāhu wa-sallama ʻalayhi faqad afshá al-salām, wa-man aṭʻama ahlahu wa-ʻiyālahu ḥattá yushbiʻahum faqad aṭʻama al-ṭaʻām, wa-man ṣāma Ramaḍān wa-min kull shahr thalāthat ayyām fa-qad ṣāma al-ṣiyām, wa-man ṣallá al-ʻishāʼ al-ākhirah fī jamāʻah fa-qad ṣallá wa-al-nās niyām niyām al-Yahūd wa-al-Naṣārá [... ...] darajātuhā, fa-fī al-Tirmidhī al-Jannah miʼat darajah, kull darajah minhā mā bayna al-masāʼ wa-al-ākhar."

On the significance of "Lā ilāha illā Allāh" ends with: "... wa-al-aṣnām laysat bi-ālihah li-annahā ḥādithah wa-laysat bi-manfīyah li-anna al-nafī maʻnāh al-ʻadam wa-al-talāshī wa-al-faqd. Wa-al-aṣnām laysat bi-maʻdūmah wa-lā mutalāshiyah wa-lā mafqūdah bal hiya thābitah mawjūdah, wa-kayfa yantafī man huwa mawjūd, bal yalzamu ʻlayhi al-kadhib, wa-hādhā lā yuʻqal, fa-ifham. Wa-Allāh al-muwāfiq lil-ṣawāb."

Questions and answers about miscellaneous legal and doctrinal issues ends with: "... al-jawāb lil-Faqīh al-ḥāfiẓ al-ḥujjah al-qāḍī al-ʻādil al-muftī al-qudwah Sayyidī Ibrāhīm al-Jalālī, ḥafiẓahu Allāh wa-lā mazīd ʻalá mā qālahu wa-katabahu, wa-kafá bi-hi ḥujjatan, wa-jazāhu Allāh taʻālá khayran wa-ajzá al-ʻulamāʼ al-nāṣiḥīn al-ḥāfiẓīn li-sharīʻat nabīyihim, al-muḥāfiẓīn ʻalá dhurrīyatih wa-al-ṣāʼinīn la-hā mimmā yastaysiru jānibahā al-ẓāhir. Wa-salāmun ʻalá man yaqifu ʻlayhi. Wa-kutiba min khaṭṭ man naqala min khaṭṭ Sayyidī Muḥammad al-ʻArabī, laṭfa Allāh bi-al-jamīʻ, innahu mujīb qarīb. Intahá al-ḥājah minhu."

Questions on doctrinal issues ends with: "... qāla taʻālá fī qiṣṣat Ibrāhīm ʻalayhi al-salām: Inna Allāh yaʼtī bi-al-Shams min al-mashriq wa-yaʼtī bi-hā min al-maghrib, fa-buhita alladhī kafar. Wa-qad kāna [...] Ibrāhīm ʻalayhi al-salām. Fa-man yaʻtaqidu al-nujūm wa-al-aflāk, wa-innamā hādhā min maqālāt ..."
Questions on Islamic law ends with: "... fa-lā ḥanatha ʻalayh. Intahá. Min al-khiṭāb bi-ʻaynihi ʻalá mukhtaṣar Khalīl, raḥimahu Allāh. Intahá."
Legal questions and answers, titled "Taqyīd masāʼil" ends with: "Ammā al-ḥalīb bi-al-ḍarīb Biʻhu wa-lā // tabiʻi al-ziyādah fī [...] fa-yamtaniʻā."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ-i bīst bāb-i asṭurlāb : manuscript / ʻAbd al-ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad ibn Ḥusayn al-Birjandī.
record.note: Title of Sharḥ-i bīst bāb-i asṭurlāb from folio 1a.

Incipit of Sharḥ-i bīst bāb-i asṭurlāb: "Sharḥ-i bīst bāb-i asṭurlāb. Muḥaqqiq mudaqqiq Mullā ʻAbd al-ʻĀlī Parjadī. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Fātiḥat-i khiṭāb dar sih bāb va khātimat-i maqāl dar hamah-i ḥāl-i sipās ... Ammā baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-faqīr ilá rabbihi al-hādī ʻAbd al-ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Barjandī, sharaḥa Allāh ṣadrahu wa-atamma ʻalá samāʼ al-saʻādah badrahu ... bi-muṭālaʻat Kitāb Bīst bāb dar maʻrifat-i aʻmāl-i asṭurlāb ... sulṭān al-ḥukamā al-mutaʼallihīn, mukammil ʻulūm al-awwalīn, makhzan asrār al-ḥikam wa-al-kamāl min maṭliʻ al-anwār al-mayāmīn wa-al-saʻādāt Khawājah Naṣīr al-Ḥaqq wa-al-Dīn Muḥammad al-Ṭūsī ṭayyaba Allāh mashhadah ..."
Secundo folio of Sharḥ bīst bāb-i asṭurlāb: kih raqm-i zadah-i kalk.

Incipit of the Mathematical "lughz": "Hādhā lughz min al-Shaykh Bahāʼ al-Dīn, ʻalayhi al-raḥmah. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Akhbirūnī ʻan ism kitābin aqalluhu min al-ḥurūf al-nūrānīyah wa-aktharuhu min ḥurūf al-zubālīyah, wa-aḥad niṣfayhi yukmilu al-rajul, wa-bi-al-niṣf al-ākhar takmulu al-shahādah ..."
Secundo folio of the Mathematical "lughz": al-Shams ʻan al-ufuq.
In small naskh taʻlīq script, in black ink, on white paper; headings, keywords and markings in red; numerous notes on the margins; numerous astronomical and geometrical diagrams; catchwords.

On folio 1a: Short paragraphs about: Eclipse of the Sun and the Moon (in Arabic); Talismans (in Arabic); Simple way to know the hour of the day (in Arabic); Time spent by "Ahl al-Kahf" "the Seven Sleepers" (in Persian); Mathematical calculations on the beginning of the Hijrī year (in Persian); Quotation from a certain musician "Mūsīqī Mīrzā Muḥammad ʻAlī" (could not be identified) about arithmetic and astronomy (in Persian).
On the margin of folio 78b: "... fa-yaqūlu aḥwaj al-khalq ilá raḥmat rabbihi al-ghanī Muḥammad al-mushtahir bi-Bahāʼ al-Dīn al-ʻĀmilī, ʻufiya ʻanhu ..."
On folios 80a-80b: Some mathematical and geometrical notes and criticism of "al-Muḥaqqiq al-Dawwānī" (probably Muḥammad ibn Asʻad al-Dawwānī, 1426 or 1427-1512 or 1513), in Persian.

Colophon of Sharḥ-i bīst bāb-i asṭurlāb: "al-Ḥamdu lillāh awwalan wa-ākhiran, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Rasūlihi dāyiman mutawātiran. Qad faraghtu min taswīd hādhihi al-awrāq fī Dār al-Khilāfah al-Ṭahrān, fī al-Madrasah al-Nāṣirīyah, al-laylah al-Thulāthāʼ min Ramaḍān, fī sanat 1307 Hijrīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā al-salām."

Translation of the colophon of Sharḥ-i bīst bāb-i asṭurlāb: "Praise be to God in the beginning and in the end. Prayer and peace be upon His messenger, continuously and repeatedly. I finished copying these leaflets at the Abode of the Caliphate, Tehran, at al-Madrasah al-Nāṣirīyah, on Tuesday night, 3 Ramaḍān, 1307 [1890] of the Hijrah [of the Prophet Muḥammad], may peace be upon Him."

Colophon of the Mathematical "lughz": "... Wa-linaqtaṣir ʻalá hādhā al-qadr min al-iṭnāb fī awṣāf dhālika al-kitāb, wa-al-ʻāqil yakfīhi al-ishārah, wa-al-jāhil lā yatanabbah bi-alf ʻibārah. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh awwalan wa-ākhiran. Tamm."

Translation of the colophon of the Mathematical "lughz": "... Let us limit ourselves to this much of verbosity in the description of that book, for the wise understands from a hint, but the ignorant cannot be alerted even with a thousand statements. Praise be to God in the beginning and in the end. It is completed."

record.title: 880-02 Majmaʻ al-baḥrayn wa-multaqá al-nayyirayn : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn ʻAlī ibn al-Sāʻātī.
record.note: Folio 1a contains an index of contents and some legal opinions of Islamic law on different issues, written in a different hand.

On the back of the preliminary leaf an ownership statement: "Ṣāḥib hādhihi al-kitāb Ḥamzah al-Ḥamdī Aqsarāʼī min sulālat Shaykh Jamāl al-Dīn Aqsarāʼī [Probably: Aqsarāʼī, Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad, active 14th century]"
On folio 254b an ownership statement: "Ṣāḥib hādhihi al-kitāb al-Sayyid al-Shaykh Ḥamzah al-Ḥamdī Aqsarāʼī, maʼdhūnan bi-al-iftāʼ. 4 Dhī al-Ḥijjah, sanat 80."

Colophon: "Qāla al-muṣannif, raḥimahu Allāh: Hādhā ākhir Majmaʻ al-baḥrayn wa-multaqá al-nayyirayn, wa-qad ataytu bi-hi ʻalá mā assastuhu min tilka al-qawāʻid, wa-ijtahadtu fī al-tawfīq bayna al-masāʼil al-shawārid, wa-lam atruk min al-kitābayn illā masāʼil yasīrah ṭaraḥtuhā ʻamdan, aw masāʼil ukhar ghayyartu ṣīghatahā ʻamdan, aw zidtu fīhā qaydan īthāran lil-aṣaḥḥ min al-madhāhib wa-al-aqwá, wa-taḥarriyan lil-iḥtiyāṭ fī al-fatwá. Wa-anā multamis mimman yanquluhu an lā yuhmila wājib al-iʻrāb, fa-inna al-mutashābih fīhi jamm, wa-khuṣūṣan fī jināsātihi al-khaṭṭīyah, fa-inna al-iḥtiyāṭ fīhā ḥatm. Wa-Allāh huwa al-mashkūr ʻalá ifāḍat niʻamihi wa-al-masʼūl khātimat al-saʻādah bi-faḍlihi wa-karamih. Tammat. Tārīkh sanat 847."

Translation of the colophon: "The author, may God have mercy upon him, said: This is the end of Majmaʻ al-baḥrayn wa-multaqá al-nayyirayn. I wrote it according to the rules I established. I endeavored to bring into harmony the diverse quoted issues. I did not leave out of the two books except a few issues which I deliberately discarded, or some issues whose structure I deliberately changed, or to which I added a statement to make them compatible with the soundest and most correct opinions, so that one can be prudent in issuing a fatwá [legal opinion]. I request from those who make copies of the book not to neglect the case-endings of the text because of the many similarities in meanings, especially in the handwritten homonyms, to which caution is definitely recommended. God is to be thanked for His abundant blessings. He is the giver of bliss by His favor and generosity. It is completed. Dated in the year 847 [1443 or 1444]."

record.title: Writings on Islamic literature : manuscript.
record.note: Title of Mukhtaṣar Wiqāyat al-riwāyah fī masāʼil al-Hidāyah from reference sources.
Title of Farāʼid al-fawāʼid li-taḥqīq maʻānī al-istiʻārah wa-aqsāmihā from Incipit (folio 190b).
Title of Tarikat al-mayyit from Incipit (folio 210b)
Title of al-Masāʼil allatī tukassaru ʻalá ṭāʼifah wāḥidah from incipit (folio 232a)
Title of al-Risālah al-Shamsīyah fī al-qawāʻid al-manṭiqīyah from incipit (folio 266b)
Title of al-Risālah al-jāmiʻah li-khamsat ashyāʼ from incipit (folio 306b)

Incipit of Short prayer for the new Islamic year: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh muqaddir al-shuhūr wa-al-aʻwām wa-mujaddid al-duhūr wa-al-ayyām alladhī iftataḥa al-ʻām bi-al-shahr al-ḥarām. Bi-hi khalaq al-samāwāt wa-al-arḍ wa-mā baynahumā fī sittat ayyām thumma istawá ʻalá al-ʻarash munfaridan bi-al-baqāʼ wa-al-dawām ..."
Secundo folio of Short prayer for the new Islamic year: la-hu fīhā bi-al-ghudū.

Incipit of Mukhtaṣar Wiqāyat al-riwāyah fī masāʼil al-Hidāyah: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh rāfiʻ aʻlām al-sharīʻah al-gharrāʼ jāʻiluhā shajaratan aṣluhā thābit fī al-arḍ wa-farʻuhā fī al-samāʼ ..."
Secundo folio of Mukhtaṣar Wiqāyat al-riwāyah fī masāʼil al-Hidāyah: jidduhu razaqahu Allāh.

Incipit of Farāʼid al-fawāʼid li-taḥqīq maʻānī al-istiʻārah wa-aqsāmihā: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu li-wāhib al-ʻaṭīyah, wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá khayr al-barīyah wa-ʻalá ālihi dhawī al-nufūs al-zakīyah. Ammā baʻd, fa-inna maʻānī al-istiʻārah wa-mā yataʻallaqu bi-hā qad dhikrat fī al-kutub mufaṣṣalah ḥasīrat al-ḍabṭ fa-aradtu dhikrahā mujmalatan maḍbūtatan ʻalá wajh naṭaqa bi-hi kutub al-mutaqaddimīn wa-dalla ʻlayhi zabr al-mutaʼkhkhirīn, fanaẓamtu Farāʼid al-fawāʼid li-taḥqīq maʻānī al-istiʻārah wa-aqsāmihā wa-qarāʼinihā fī thalāthat ʻuqūd ..."
Secundo folio of Farāʼid al-fawāʼid li-taḥqīq maʻānī al-istiʻārah wa-aqsāmihā: bi-mutaʻalliqi maʻná al-ḥarf.

Incipit of Gloss on a commentary on al-Risālah al-Samarqandīyh: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-muftaqir ilá alṭāf rabbihi khafīyah [al-khafīyah] ʻIṣām al-Dīn ibn Muḥammad [ibn] Ibrāhīm, ḥaffahumā [Allāh] bi-maghfirah [...]: Aḥsan mā yuzādu bi-hi niʻam [al-niʻam] al-wafīyah wa-tudfaʻu bi-hi al-balīyah fī al-bukrah wa-al-ʻashīyah, al-ḥamdu lillāh al-wāhib al-ʻaṭīyah ..."
Secundo folio of Gloss on a commentary on al-Risālah al-Samarqandīyh: al-ūlá ammā baʻd.

Incipit of Tarikat al-mayyit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn ḥamda al-shākirīn wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá khayr al-barīyah Muḥammad wa-ālihi al-ṭayyibīn. [Qāla] Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam: Taʻallamū al-farāʼiḍ wa-ʻallimūhā al-nās, fa-innahā niṣf al-ʻilm. ʻIlman anna raḥmat Allāh tataʻallaqu bi-Tarikat al-mayyit, ḥuqūq arbaʻah murattabah, al-awwal yabdaʼu bi-takfīnih wa-tajhīzih min ghayr tabdhīr wa-lā taqtīr ..."
Secundo folio of Tarikat al-mayyit: lahum sihām muqaddarah.

Incipit of al-Masāʼil allatī tukassaru ʻalá ṭāʼifah wāḥidah: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Masāʼil allatī tukassaru ʻalá ṭāʼifah wāḥidah. Thalāth zawjāt wa-arbaʻ banāt wa-jaddatān wa-sittat aʻmām. 144. Imaraʼah wa-thamānī banāt wa-arbaʻ jaddāt wa-sittat akhawāt li-ab. 144 ..."
Secundo folio of al-Masāʼil allatī tukassaru ʻalá ṭāʼifah wāḥidah: ān mablagh rā ba-manzilah-ʼi.

Incipit of Treatise on the burden of proof for a claimant: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Laka al-ḥamdu wa-al-minnah, wa-ʻalá Nabīyika al-ṣalāh wa-al-taḥīyah. Idhā qulta bi-kalām, in kunta nāqilan fa-yuṭlabu minka al-ṣiḥḥah wa-muddaʻiyan fa-al-dalīl, wa-lā yumnaʻu al-naql wa-al-muddaʻá illā majāzan. Wa-al-manʻ ṭalab al-dalīl ʻalá muqaddimah ..."

Incipit of Treatise on the structure of the Arabic language: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Kalimah lafẓ wuḍiʻa li-maʻná mufrad, hiya ism wa-fiʻl wa-ḥarf, li-annahā immā an tadulla ʻalá maʻná fī nafsihā aw lā ..."
Secundo folio of Treatise on the structure of the Arabic language: ʻalam al-fāʻilīyah wa-al-naṣb.

Incipit of Treatise on the case endings in the Arabic language: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Marfūʻāt huwa [hiya] mā ishtamala ʻalá ʻalam al-fāʻilīyah, fa-minhu al-fāʻil wa-huwa mā usnida ilayhi al-fiʻl aw shibhuhu wa-quddima ʻalayhi ʻalá jihat qiyāmihi mithl qāma Zayd wa-Zayd qāʼimun abūhu wa-al-aṣl an yaliya al-fiʻl, fa-lidhālika jāza ḍarab ghulāmahu Zaydun ..."
Secundo folio of Treatise on the case endings in the Arabic language: mithl Zaydun li-man qāla.

Incipit of al-Risālah al-Shamsīyah fī al-qawāʻid al-manṭiqīyah: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-lammā ashāra ilayya man suʻida bi-luṭf al-ḥaqq wa-al-dīn bi-taḥrīr kitāb kadhā wa-kadhā fa-bādartu bi-muqtaḍá ishāratihi wa-sharaʻtu fī taḥrīrihi wa-taṣnīfih wa-sammaytuhu bi-Risālat [al-Risālah] al-Shamsīyah fī qawāʻid [al-qawāʻid] al-manṭiqīyah, wa-rattabtuhu ʻalá muqaddimah wa-thalāth maqālāt wa-khātimah muʻtaṣiman bi-ḥabl al-tawfīq min wāhib al-ʻaql wa-mutawakkilan ʻalá jūdihi al-mufīḍ lil-khayr wa-al-ʻadl ..."
