record.note: On the leaf glued to the front cover, a borrowing statement, as follows: "ʻĀriyah ʻinda al-faqīr al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Bāqī ibn al-Ḥājj ʻAbd al-Raḥmān Mughayzil."
On folio 1a: An erased ownership statement: "Mulk al-faqīr ..."
On folios 1a-2a: A biography of the author: "Tarjamat al-Qāḍī ʻIyāḍ, taghammadahu Allāh bi-raḥmatih."

On folio 3a: "Kitāb al-Shifā bi-taʻrīf ḥuqūq al-Muṣṭafā, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, taʼlīf al-Shaykh al-Imām [... ... ...] ʻIyāḍ ibn Mūsá ibn ʻIyāḍ al-Yaḥṣubī, raḍiya Allāh ʻanh."

On the upper left corner of folio 3a, an ownership statement: "al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-Mannān. Malakahu min faḍl Allāh taʻālá wa-luṭfih, ʻabduhu al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr Ramaḍān ibn Mūsá al-ʻUṭayfī al-Ḥanafī, ghafar Allāh taʻālá la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn." Probably: ʻUṭayfī, Ramaḍān ibn Mūsá ibn Maḥmūd (1610-1684). A Ḥanafī scholar from Damascus, Syria (See: Ziriklī, al-Aʻlām 3:33).
On folio 3a: Several erased ownership statements and two illegible seals.
On folio 5a: "... tarjamtuhu bi-al-Shifā bi-taʻrīf ḥuqūq al-Muṣṭafá."

On folio 216b: An ownership statement: "al-Ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá kull ḥāll. Bi-tārīkh thāmin Shawwāl sanat [illegible words] intaqala ilá mulk kātibihi ʻAlī ibn Aḥmad Imām al-Sirājīyah [could not be identified]."

Colophon: "Tamma al-kitāb bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-maʻūnatihi wa-luṭfih. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi. Wa-ḥasbunā Allāh wa-niʻma al-wakīl."

Translation of the colophon: "The book is completed by the praise of God, His help and His benevolence. Praise be to God, Lord of the Universe. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad and his family. God suffices us, He is the best advocate."

record.title: 880-03 Kashf al-asrār ʻan ḥikam al-zuhūr wa-al-aṭyār : manuscript / ʻIzz al-Dīn ʻAbd al-Salām ibn Ghānim al-Maqdisī.
record.note: Title of Kashf al-asrār ʻan ḥikam al-zuhūr wa-al-aṭyār from folio 3a.
Title of Naẓm Muthallath Quṭrub supplied by cataloger.

Incipit of Kashf al-asrār ʻan ḥikam al-zuhūr wa-al-aṭyār: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. Qāla al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah lisān al-fuṣaḥāʼ wa-al-mutakallimīn ʻIzz al-Dīn Ghānim ibn ʻAbd al-Salām al-Maqdisī, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu wa-arḍāh wa-jaʻala al-Jannah mathwāh: al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-baʻīd fī qurbih al-qarīb fī buʻdih, al-mutaʻālī fī rafīʻ majdih ʻan al-shayʼ wa-ḍiddih, alladhī awjada bi-qudratihi al-wujūd baʻda an kāna ʻadaman, wa-awjada kull mawjūd ḥukman, wa-jaʻala al-ʻaql baynahumā ḥakaman ..."
Secundo folio of Kashf al-asrār ʻan ḥikam al-zuhūr wa-al-aṭyār: wa-mā yukābiduhu min wijdān.

Incipit of Naẓm Muthallath Quṭrub: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Yā Rabbī yassir yā karīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāhi alladhī hadānā // li-millati al-Islām wa-ijtabānā ... Wa-baʻda taslīmī ʻalá khayri nabī // naẓamtu min Muthallathāt Quṭrubi. Urjūzatan ladhīdhatan fī al-mashrabi // wa-zidtuhā min kutubin ṭiwāli ..."
Secundo folio of Naẓm Muthallath Quṭrub: "Taḥīyat al-nāsi hiya al-salāmu.

On front cover a statement in Arabic and English by Duncan Black Macdonald, 1863-1943, professor of Semitic languages at Hartford Theological Seminary, as follows: "Kashf al-asrār fī ḥikam al-zuhūr wa-al-aṭyār li-ʻIzz al-Dīn al-Maqdisī. Bought at Damascus, Aug. 1908. D.B. Macdonald. Hartford."

On folio 1a: "Ḥasbiya Allāh. Kitāb al-Mukhtār li-kashf al-asrār fī munāqashat al-ṭuyūr wa-al-azʹhār lil-shaykh al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah ʻIzz al-Dīn Ghānim ibn ʻAbd al-Salām, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu, wa-ʻafá ʻanhumā."
On folio 3a: "... wa-sammaytuhu: Kashf al-asrār ʻan ḥikam al-zuhūr wa-al-aṭyār ..."
Colophon of Kashf al-asrār ʻan ḥikam al-zuhūr wa-al-aṭyār: "Tammat nuskhat hādhā al-kitāb bi-ʻawn al-Malik al-Wahhāb fī awāsiṭ shahr Jumādá al-Ākhir, sanat sabʻ wa-sittīn wa-alf."

Translation of the colophon of Kashf al-asrār ʻan ḥikam al-zuhūr wa-al-aṭyār: "The copy of this book was completed by the help of the Benevolent King, in the middle of the month of Jumādá al-Ākhir, 1067 [31 March, 1657]."

Colophon of Naẓm Muthallath Quṭrub: " Tammat wa-bi-al-khayr ʻammat ʻalá yad al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr, al-muʻtarif bi-al-ʻajz wa-al-taqṣīr Ḥusayn ibn Munlā Yūsuf al-Naqshabandī [?], ʻufiya ʻanhumā. Balagha al-muqābalah ḥasba al-ṭāqah wa-al-imkān. Wa-ḥasbunā Allāh wa-niʻma al-wakīl. Tamm."

Translation of the colophon of Naẓm Muthallath Quṭrub: "It is completed. May it be wide-spread with goodness, by the hand of the poor and despised, who confesses his inability and shortcoming, Ḥusayn ibn Munlā Yūsuf al-Naqshabandī [?], may they both be pardoned. It was collated to the best of [my] ability, as far as possible. God suffices us. He is the best advocate. It is completed."

record.title: 880-02 Bahjat al-ḥusn al-waḥīd ʻalá Jawharat al-tawḥīd : manuscript / Aḥmad al-Mīhī al-Shabīnī al-Shāfiʻī al-Nuʻmānī.
record.note: Author's colophon: "Qāla muʼallifuhā: Tammat yawm al-Jumʻah fī thānī shahr Ramaḍān min sanat 1258, thamāniyah wa-khamsīn wa-miʼatayn wa-alf, wa-dhālika min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-taslīm."

Translation of the author's colophon: "The author of the treatise said: It was completed on Friday, 2 Ramaḍān, 1258 [7 October, 1842] of the Hijrah of the Prophet, may the best of prayer and peace be upon him."

Copyist's colophon: "Tamma raqmuhu ʻalá yad afqar al-ʻibād wa-aḥwajihim ilá Allāh taʻālá Muḥammad walad Sulaymān al-Warraqī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-aḥbābihi wa-al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Yawm al-Jumʻah Ṣ [?], Sanat sittah wa-sabʻīn wa-m[iʼatayn wa-alf]."

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "The treatise was copied by the poorest of the poor and the most needy to God, may He be praised, Muḥammad walad Sulaymān al-Warraqī, may God pardon him, his parents, his loved ones and the Muslims. Amen. Praise be to God, the Lord of the Universe, on Friday Ṣ [?], [12]76, [1859 or 1860]."

record.title: 880-01 Ḥawāshin ʻalá Sharḥ al-Ujhūrī li-naẓmihi Faḍāʼil Ramaḍān : manuscript.
record.note: Text folios 1b-44b; folios 45-48 are blank.
On folio 1a: 9 verses from three poems (2, 2, 5 verses) praising "fiqh" (Islamic law) and advising on studying it.

Colophon: No colophon; text ends abruptly with "... wa-idhā naẓara Allāh ilá ʻabdihi, fa-inna al-murād jamīʻ al-khalq, kamā fahimahu al-muṣannif, wa-iḥtāja ilá al-suʼāl wa-al-jawāb, fa-inna ..."

record.title: 880-02 al-Qudūrī : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Qudūrī.
record.note: On folios 1b-2b: An index of contents.
On folios 197b-198a: Quotations from Abū Ḥanīfah (died 767 or 768) and the Ḥadīth about the leader in prayer (when to pray, or not to pray, behind him), and about he who neglects prayer.
Text folios 3b-197a.

Colophon: "Tammat al-kitāb bi-ʻawn Allāh, al-Malik al-Wahhāb, wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb, wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ wa-al-maʼāb. Ghafara Allāh kātib [li-kātib] hādhā al-kitāb wa-li-man naẓara [ilayhi] bi-al-khayr wa-al-ṣawāb, wa-wassaʻa ʻalayhi al-niʻmah wa-al-arzāq, wa-adkhala [wa-adkhalahu] al-Jannah, fa-innahu mushtāq, ʻalá yad al-ʻabd al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr, al-mudhnib al-muḥtāj, qalīl al-ʻamal kathīr al-amal, qalīl al-iḥsān kathīr al-ʻiṣyān, wa-al-rāj raḥmat Rabbihi al-ʻazīz al-laṭīf, Qanbar ibn Khalīl, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-aḥsana ilayhimā wa-ilayhi. Wa-qad fāragha hādhā al-kitāb al-musammá "al-Qudūrī" fī yawm al-Jumʻah, waqta al-ḍuḥá, fī maḥrūsat Ḥalab, fī shahr Rabīʻ al-Ākhir, min shuhūr sanat tisʻ wa-alf."

Translation of the colophon: "The book was completed by the help of God, the Abundant Giving King, but God is more knowledgeable of what is correct. To Him is the reference and returning. May God forgive the author of this book, and him who looks at it favorably and positively. May God bestow His grace upon him, enrich his livelihood and admit him into Paradise which he ardently disires. Copied by the poor and despised slave, the sinner and the needy, who does little and hopes for much, of little charity and abundant rebellion, he who longs for the mercy of his mighty and gentle Lord, Qanbar ibn Khalīl, may God forgive him and his parents and treat him and them favorably. The copy of this book titled "al-Qudūrī" was completed on Friday forenoon, at protected Aleppo, in the month of Rabīʻ al-Ākhir, 1009 [October, 1600]."

record.title: 880-02 Nūr al-hidāyah wa-al-ʻirfān fī sirr al-rābiṭah wa-al-tawajjuh wa-Khatm al-Khawājakān : manuscript / Muḥammad Asʻad ibn Maḥmūd al-Khālidī al-ʻUthmānī.
record.note: Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min naskhihā ʻan nuskhah bi-khaṭṭ muʼallifihā al-fāḍil al-amjad wa-al-fard al-awḥad, al-Ṣāḥibī al-Naqshabandī, al-Shaykh Muḥammad Asʻad, lā zāla baḥran lil-mustafīd, wa-rābiṭah fī īṣāl al-ṭālib wa-al-murīd, bi-qalam aḥqar al-anām, kathīr al-dhunūb wa-al-āthām, al-Sayyid Muḥammad ʻAlī al-Kīlānī, al-shahīr bi-al-Ẓibyānī, khādim al-fuqarāʼ al-kirām, ʻafā Allāh ʻanhu wa-ʻan wālidayhi wa-al-Muslimīn, wa-dhālika fī al-yawm al-sādis ʻashar min shahr Allāh al-Muḥarram, sanat khams wa-thalāthimiʼah wa-alf min Hijrat man khaṣṣahu Allāh bi-akmal waṣf."

Translation of the colophon: "The copy was reproduced from the autograph of its distinguished, prominent and illustrious author, al-Ṣāḥibī al-Naqshabandī, al-Shaykh Muḥammad Asʻad, who continues to be a sea of knowledge for the seekers and a means for connecting the student and the devotee, by the most despised of creatures, he who is full of sins and vices, al-Sayyid Muḥammad ʻAlī al-Kīlānī, al-shahīr bi-al-Ẓibyānī, servant of the noble poor [the sufis], may God forgive him, his parents and Muslims, on 16 Muḥarram, 1305 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [4 October, 1887], on whom God has bestowed the most perfect distinction."

record.title: 880-02 al-Anwār al-Azʹharīyah al-muḥīṭah bi-al-khuṭab al-minbarīyah : manuscript / Ibrāhīm ibn Badawī al-Naḥḥās al-Shāfiʻī al-Azʹharī.
record.note: On folio 2a: "... wa-sammaytuhu bi-al-Anwār al-Azʹharīyah al-muḥīṭah bi-al-khuṭab al-minbarīyah, wa-zidtuhu baʻda al-tamām khuṭaban sanīyah muḥtāj ilayhā al-ṭālib ʻinda ʻurūḍ al-ḥawādith al-zamānīyah, wa-khatamtu kull khuṭbah minhā bi-āyah min Kitāb Allāh taʻālá, li-takūna la-hā misk al-khitām wa-ishārah ilá mā yutlá baʻda al-Fātiḥah fī al-ṣalāh ..."

Colophon: No colophon; text ends abruptly with part of the fifth sermon for the month of Muḥarram: "... wa-ashhadu anna Sayyidanā Muḥammadan ʻabduhu wa-rasūluhu wa-ṣafīyuhu wa-khalīluhu, al-makhṣūṣ bi-jawāmiʻ al-kalim. Allāhumma, fa-ṣalli wa-sallim wa-bārik ʻalá hādhā al-Nabī al-karīm, wa-al-Rasūl al-sayyid al-sanad al-ʻaẓīm, Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi, wa-man salaka ṭarīqatahu wa-lazam ..."

record.title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyat al-Kastalī ʻalá Sharḥ al-ʻAqāʼid al-Nasafīyah lil-Taftāzānī : manuscript / Muṣliḥ al-Dīn Muṣṭafá ibn Maḥmūd al-Qasṭallānī.
record.note: On folio 1a: Several erased ownerships; one dated 1251 Hijrī (1835/1836).
At the head of folio 1a: "Kastal li-Ḥāshiyat Khayālī."
Colophon: "Ittafaqa al-farāgh min taḥrīrihi. Tamma al-kitāb bi-ʻawn Allāh taʻālá."
Translation of the colophon: "The copy is completed. The book ended by the help of God, may He be praised."

record.title: 880-02 Risālat fī al-Basmalah : manuscript / Ismāʻīl ibn Ghunaym al-Jawharī.
record.note: On the label at the front cover: "Risālah fī al-Basmalah lil-Shaykh Ismāʻīl al-Ghunaymī al-Jawharī."
Folio 1 is blank; text folios 2a-8b.

Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat hādhihi al-nuskhah al-mubārakah yawm al-Jumʻah al-mubārakah, sanat 1277, fī shahr al-Qaʻdah, ʻalá yad kātibihā al-faqīr Sulaymān ibn al-Shaykh Aḥmad Lāmūnah, al-Mālikī madhhaban, al-Shabāsī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-lil-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Tamm."

Translation of the colophon: "This blessed copy was completed on blessed Friday, [date of the day not mentioned], the year 1277, of the month of al-Qaʻdah [May/June, 1861], by the poor copyist Sulaymān ibn al-Shaykh Aḥmad Lāmūnah, al-Mālikī madhhaban, al-Shabāsī, may God pardon him, his parents and Muslims. Amen. It is completed."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Jazāʼirīyah fī ʻilm al-tawḥīd : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn ʻAbd al-Salām al-Ṣaffūrī al-Shāfiʻī.
record.note: On folio 1a: "Kitāb Sharḥ al-Jazāʼirīyah fī ʻilm al-tawḥīd lil-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, Zayn al-Dīn muftī al-Muslimīn, mufīd al-ṭālibīn, Abī Hurayrah ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn al-Shaykh al-ʻallāmah Zayn al-Dīn ʻAbd al-Salām ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn ʻUthmān ibn Nabhān al-Ṣūrī [al-Ṣaffūrī] al-Shāfiʻī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá. Āmīn."

al-Manẓūmah al-Jazāʼirīyah starts with: "al-Ḥamdu lillāh wa-huwa al-wāḥidu al-azalī // subḥānahu jalla ʻan shabhin wa-ʻan mathalī ..." and ends with: "Wa-al-āli wa-al-ṣuḥbi thumma al-tābiʻīn lahum // mimman ʻani al-ḥaqqi wa-al-iḥsāni lam yaḥuli."

Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat hādhihi al-nuskhah min nuskhah saqīmah, yawm al-Thalāth, tāsiʻ Muḥarram al-ḥarām, sanat 1132, ʻalá yad al-faqīr Aḥmad al-Masīrī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-lil-Muslimīn."

Translation of the colophon: "This copy was reproduced from a very bad copy, on Tuesday, 9 Muḥarram, 1132 [22 November, 1719], by the poor Aḥmad al-Masīrī, may God pardon him, his parents and Muslims."

record.title: 880-02 Risālah fī al-tawḥīd : manuscript / Ibrāhīm ibn Muḥammad al-Bājūrī.
record.note: On folio 1a: "Hādhihi Risālah fī al-tawḥīd li-Shaykhinā al-Shaykh Ibrāhīm al-Bājūrī, nafaʻa Allāh bi-hi al-Muslimīn. Āmīn."
On folios 6-8 are blank.
Colophon: "Wa-hādhā ākhir mā yassara Allāh taʻālá min faḍlihi wa-karamih. Wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-al-thawāb [bi-al-ṣawāb] wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ wa-al-maʼāb."
Translation of the colophon: "This is the end of what God, may He be praised, granted of his favor and generosity. God knows the truth better. To Him is the reference and returning."

record.title: 880-03 al-Mukhtār ʻalá madhhab al-Imām al-Aʻẓam : manuscript / ʻAbd Allāh ibn Maḥmūd al-Mawṣilī.
record.note: On folio 1a: An index of contents.
At the head of folio 1a: "Kitāb Mukhtār."
On folios 1b-3a: Quotations from different sources and invocations, in different hands.

On folio 2a an ownership statement: "Malaka hādhā al-kitāb al-mubārak bi-al-shirāʼ al-sharʻī al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr, al-rājī ʻafwa rabbihi al-qadīr, Yaḥyá ibn al-marḥūm al-Sayyid Ḥamdān al-Tātilī al-Ḥasanī, fī Rabīʻ al-Awwal, sanat 1132 [January/February, 1720]."
On folio 3a: "Hādhā Kitāb al-Mukhtār ʻalá madhhab al-Imām al-Aʻẓam, raḍiya Allāh ʻanh."

At the head of folio 3b two verses of poetry attributed to al-Shaykh Fatʹḥ Allāh al-Baylūnī (probably Fatʹḥ Allāh ibn Maḥmūd al-Baylūnī, 1570-1632, an author and poet from Aleppo, Syria), praising the present book: "Lillāhi matnun fī al-matānati mufradu // talwī ilayhi ʻinānahā al-akhyāru. Yā man yarūmu tafaqquhan fī dīnihi // ʻawwil ʻalayhi fa-innahu al-Mukhtāru."

At the bottom of folio 105a: "Tārīkh sanat 919 [1513/1514]." "Wa-Allāh aʻlam. al-Ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá al-tamām, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Nabīyinā Muḥammad afḍal al-anām. Tārīkh sanat tisʻ ʻashar wa-tisʻimiʼah."
At the upper margin of folio 107b, the following statement: "Jumādá al-Awwal, sanat 932 [February/March, 1526]."

On folio 107b, several statements: An ownership statement: "Ṣāḥib Kitāb Mukhtār Bakr al-Kūtalī", a popular medical recipe for treating "al-shuqāq" (wounds or ulcers), an invovation to be recited if one wants to see the Prophet or someone else in his dream.

On folio 108b: Several popular medical recipes for treating "al-bawāsīr" (hemorroids), "al-ḥāfūr" (probably tooth decay), "al-ruʻāf" (nosebleed), and "al-jarab" (scabies). Also, an invocation to be recited upon entering the mosque.
Colophon (folio 108a): "Tamma al-kitāb bi-ʻawn Allāh taʻālá wa-ḥusn tawfīqih, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-sallam."
Translation of the colophon (folio 108a): "The book is completed by the help of God and His abundant benevolence. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad and his family and grant them peace."

record.title: 880-02 Irshād al-fāriḍ ilá Kashf al-ghawāmiḍ : manuscript / Badr al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad Sibṭ al-Māridīnī.
record.note: On folio 1a: Two verses attributed to al-Shāfiʻī: "Mā wahaba Allāhu li-mriʼin hibatan // aḥsanu min ʻaqlihi wa-min adabih. Humā jamālu al-fatá fa-in sulibā // minhu fa-inna al-mawta alyaqu bi-hi."

On folio 1a: A mathematical riddle from the poetry of Abū Nuwās about his beloved Jinān, and its explanation by al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻallāmah al-Rabbānī Muḥammad al-Kilābī (could not be identified): Lahā al-thulthān min qalbī // wa-thulthā thulthihi al-bāqī. Wa-thulthā thulthi mā yabqá // wa-thulthā al-thulthi lil-sāqī. Wa-tabqá asʹhumun sittah // tufarraqu bayna ʻushshāqī."

Colophon: "Wa-Allāh subḥānahu wa-taʻālá aʻlam. Wa-li-naqtaṣir ʻalá hādhā al-qadr, fa-fīhi kifāyah lil-mubtadī wa-tadhkirah li-ghayrih. Wa-astaghfiru Allāh al-ʻaẓīm min kull dhanb, wa-aʻūdhu billāh min ʻilm lā yanfaʻ, wa-duʻāʼ lā yusmaʻ, wa-qalb lā yakhshaʻ, wa-asʼaluhu an yanfaʻanī anā bi-dhālika, wa-qāriyahu wa-kātibahu wa-al-nāẓira fīhi. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá kull ḥāl. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābatihi ʻalá yad [ism maṭmūs] ibn ʻAbd al-Ghanī [ism maṭmūs] al-Shāfiʻī, ghafara Allāh la-hu, wa-dhālika fī yawm al-Thulāth, ʻāshir shahr Allāh al-Muḥarram, sanat 965, aḥsana Allāh ʻāqibatahā bi-Muḥammad wa-ālih. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālih wa-ṣaḥbih wa-sallama taslīman kathīran."

Translation of the colophon: "God, may He be praised, knows better. We will limit ourselves to such an amount; it is sufficient for the beginner and a reminder to others. I ask forgiveness from God Almighty for all sins, and seek refuge in God from knowledge that does not benefit, and prayer that is not heard, and a heart that is not submissive. I ask Him to benefit me with this book, and benefit its reader, its copyist, and he who looks into it. Praise be to God on everything. May God pray on our Master Muhammad, His family and his companions and grant them peace. The copy was completed by [erased name] ibn ʻAbd al-Ghanī [erased name] al-Shafiʻī, may God forgive him, on Tuesday, 10 Muḥarram, the year 965 [12 November, 1557], may God end it favorably, through the intercession of Muḥammad and his family. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, His family and His companions and grant them abundant peace."

record.title: 880-03 al-Juzʼ al-thānī min Sīrat al-Ḥalabī : manuscript / ʻAlī ibn Ibrāhīm Nūr al-Dīn al-Ḥalabī.
record.note: Colophon: "Tamma al-juzʼ al-thānī min Sīrat al-Ḥalabī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá, yatlūhu al-juzʼ al-thālith."
Translation of the colophon: "The second volume of Ṣīrat al-Ḥalabī, may God have mercy upon him, is completed. It will be followed by the third volume."

record.title: 880-02 Mawlid al-Muṣṭafá : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn Ḥajar al-Haythamī.
record.note: On folio 1a: "Hādhā Mawlid al-Muṣṭafá, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, lil-Imām Ibn Ḥajar al-Haythamī, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi. Āmīn. Āmīn. M."

On folio 10b: A description and a sketch, in a different hand, of a "wafq or wifq", a magic square amulet (plural "awfāq", or "awfāq ʻadadīyah", "numerical harmonies"), harmonizing numbers with the Arabic alphabet to achieve certain objectives, used for divination and fortune-telling.
Colophon: "Tamma al-Mawlid al-Sharīf. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá man lā nabī baʻdah, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. M."

Translation of the colophon: "The copy of al-Mawlid al-Sharīf " is completed. May God pray on the Seal of the Prophets, on his family and companions. Praise be to God, the Lord of the Universe. Amen. Amen. M."

record.title: 880-02 Mawlid Rasūl Allāh : manuscript / Ḥasan ibn ʻAlī al-Madābighī.
record.note: On folio 1a: "Hādhā Mawlid Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, taʼlīf al-Shaykh al-ʻAllāmah, al-ḥabr al-baḥr al-fahhāmah, al-Shaykh Ḥasan al-Madābighī, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi. Āmīn. Āmīn."
On folio 1a: An ownership statement: "Mulk al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr ilá Mawlāhu al-ghanī ʻAlī ʻAllām al-Shāfiʻī al-Taṭlāwī al-Mālikī madhhaban, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi. Āmīn."

On folio 17b, after the end of al-Madābighī's Mawlid, in a different hand, starts the text of another "Mawlid", attributed to Aḥmad al-Dardīr (Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Dardīr, 1715-1786, an Egyptian Malikite scholar who studied at al-Azʹhar and died in Cairo, Egypt). This text is only half a page, it starts with: "Hādhā Mawlid al-Muṣṭafá, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, taʼlīf Sayyid Aḥmad al-Dardīr, raḍiya Allāh ʻanh. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi astaʻīn, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi. al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-wājib al-wujūd, al-wāsiʻ al-karam wa-al-jūd, al-munazzah ʻan al-wālid wa-al-mawlūd, alladhī baʻatha fīnā nabīyahu wa-ḥabībahu Muḥammad, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, bi-al-āyāt al-bayyināt wa-al-muʻjizāt al-bāhirāt ..." The text ends abruptly with: "... wa-qāla, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam: Anā sayyid [walad] Ādam wa-lā fakhr. Wa-qāla, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, wa-al-muṣallī ʻalayya ḥabībī, fa-man ..."

Colophon: "Tamma al-Mawlid al-Sharīf bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih wa-ḥusn tawfīqih, wa-Allāh al-muwaffiq lil-ṣawāb wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ wa-al-maʼāb. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat hādhā al-Mawlid al-Sharīf li-thamāniyat ʻashar khalat min shahr al-Ḥijjah al-mubārak alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat alf wa-miʼatayn thalāthah wa-sabʻūn, ʻalá yad kātibihi afqar al-ʻibād Ḥasanayn Ḥulwah al-Marṣifī baladan al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-mashāyikhihi wa-li-ikhwānihi wa-li-aḥbābihi wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn bi-mannihi wa-karamih. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon: "The Noble Mawlid is concluded by the praise of God, His help and His abundant generosity. God is He who directs towards truth and to Him is the reference and returning. The copy of this Noble Mawlid was completed on the eighteenth of blessed Dhū al-Ḥijjah, 1273 [Sunday, 9 August, 1857] by the poorest Ḥasanayn Ḥulwah al-Marṣifī baladan al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban, may God forgive him, his parents, his masters, his brethren, his loved ones and all Muslims by His grace and generosity. Amen.

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ Manẓūmat Ibn Faraḥ : manuscript / Yaḥyá ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Qarāfī.
record.note: On folio 1a: "Kitāb Sharḥ Manẓūmat al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻāmil al-ḥāfiẓ Ibn Faraḥ al-Ishbīlī taghammadahu Allāh bi-raḥmatih, lil-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻĀlim al-ʻallāmah, al-baḥr al-fahhāmah, faqīr rabbihi al-kāfī Yaḥyá al-Qarāfī, nafaʻanā Allāh wa-al-Muslimīn bi-barakatihi, innahu ʻalá dhālika qadīr."

On the upper left corner of folio 1a: A verse from "al-Manẓūmah al-Bayqūnīyah", a well-known treatise in verse on the terminology of Ḥadīth, by Ṭāhā ibn Muḥammad al-Bayqūnī (active 17th century), a Shāfiʻī Ḥadīth scholar, from Damascus (Syria).
Folio 13 is blank.

Colophon: "... Qāla dhālika al-faqīr al-muʻtarif bi-al-ʻajz wa-al-taqṣīr Yaḥyá ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Iṣfahānī al-Qurashī al-Zabīdī al-Asadī al-shahīr bi-al-Qarāfī al-Shāfiʻī, ajārahu Allāh taʻālá min khizy al-dunyā wa-ʻadhāb al-ākhirah, wa-kafāhu mā ahammahu wa-man ahammahu. Āmīn. Tamma hādhā al-sharḥ al-ʻaẓīm al-mubārak bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih wa-ḥusn tawfīqih, ʻalá yad kātibihi afqar al-ʻibād ilá Allāh taʻālá, Shāhīn ibn al-Shaykh Qāsim ibn Shāhīn ibn Abī al-Khayr ibn Khalīl al-Damsīsī baladan al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban, fī yawm al-Jumʻah al-mubārak, ākhir shahr Jumād al-Awwal, min shuhūr sanat wāḥid wa-sittīn wa-alf min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah."

Translation of the colophon: "... This was said by the poor, who acknowledges his incapacity and deficiency, Yaḥyá ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Iṣfahānī al-Qurashī al-Zabīdī al-Asadī al-shahīr bi-al-Qarāfī al-Shāfiʻī, may the Almighty God, protect him from the disgrace of the world and the torment of the Hereafter, and deliver him from what and from whoever troubles him. Amen. This great and blessed commentary is completed by the praise of God, His help and His abundant generosity, by the hand of the poorest of the poor to God Almighty, Shāhīn ibn al-Shaykh Qāsim ibn Shāhīn ibn Abī al-Khayr ibn Khalīl al-Damsīsī baladan al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban, on blessed Friday, the end of Jumād al-Awwal, of the year 1061 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [21 May, 1651]."

record.title: Treatises on miscellaneous Islamic doctrines : manuscript / li-Jalāl al-Dīn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Abī Bakr al-Suyūṭī.
record.note: Incipit of al-Thubūt fī ḍabṭ al-Qunūt: "al-Thubūt fī ḍabṭ al-Qunūt taʼlīf al-ʻAllāmah al-ḥāfiẓ Jalāl al-Dīn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Kamāl al-Dīn al-Suyūṭī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá. Āmīn. Āmīn. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh wa-salāmun ʻalá ʻibādihi alladhīn iṣṭafá. Warada ʻalayya suʼāl fī qawlihi, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, fī duʻāʼ al-qunūt "wa-lā yuʻizzu man ʻādayt", wa-dhakar al-sāʼil annahu qaraʼahu bi-kasr al-ʻayn min yaʻizzuhu, fa-radda ʻalayhi rajul wa-qāl innamā huwa yuʻizzu bi-ḍamm al-ʻayn min bāb naṣara yanṣuru, wa-dhakara annahu qāl yaʻizzu bi-al-kasr innamā huwa muḍāriʻ ʻazza bi-maʻná qalla, wa-ammā ʻazza min al-ʻizz alladhī huwa ḍidda al-dhull fa-inna muḍāriʻahu bi-al-ḍamm. Hādhā mā dhakarahu al-sāʼil ..."

Incipit of al-Ibāḥah fī faḍl al-sibāḥah: "al-Ibāḥah fī faḍl al-sibāḥah taʼlīf mujtahid ʻaṣrihi al-Jalāl al-Suyūṭī. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh wa-salāmun ʻalá ʻibādihi alladhīn iṣṭafá. Dhikr al-amr bi-al-sibāḥah wa-faḍlihā. Qāla al-Bayhaqī fī "Shuʻab al-īmān": Akhbaranā Abū Bakr Aḥmad ibn al-Ḥasan al-Qāḍī, thanā Abū Jaʻfar Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī ibn Ibrāhīm al-Shāmī ... ʻan Ibn ʻUmar, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhumā, qāl: Qāla Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻlayhi wa-sallam: ʻAllimū abnāʼakum al-sibāḥah wa-al-ramya, wa-al-marʼata al-mighzal ..."

Incipit of al-Maṣābīḥ fī Ṣalāt al-Tarāwīḥ: "Mā jāʼa fī 'al-Tarāwīḥ' min al-āthār wa-al-Aḥadīth lil-Jalāl al-Suyūṭī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá, wa-sammāhā 'al-Maṣābīḥ fī Ṣalāt al-Tarāwīḥ'. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh wa-kafá, wa-salāmun ʻalá ʻibādihi alladhīn iṣṭafá. Wa-baʻd, fa-qad suʼiltu marrāt hal al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, ṣallá al-Tarāwīḥ, wa-hiya al-ʻishrūn rakʻah al-maʻhūdah al-ān, wa-anā ujību bi-Lā, wa-lāmanī bi-dhālik, fa-aradtu taḥrīr al-qawl fīhā, fa-aqūl ..."
Secundo folio of al-Maṣābīḥ fī Ṣalāt al-Tarāwīḥ: wa-qāla al-Tirmidhī fīhi munkar al-Ḥadīth.

On folio 1b: "Lil-Qāḍī Muḥyī al-Dīn fī waṣf jarādah." A riddle in two verses about a locust, by al-Qāḍī Muḥyī al-Dīn (Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn al-Shahrazūrī, 519-586/1125-1190, the Judge of Mosul, Iraq).
On folios 4a-4b: Questions and answers in verse.
On folios 4a-4b: Miscellaneous anecdotes, riddles and invocations in prose and verse.
Colophon of al-Thubūt fī ḍabṭ al-Qunūt:: "Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-jundihi. Āmīn. Āmīn."
Translation of the colophon of al-Thubūt fī ḍabṭ al-Qunūt:: "Praise be to God alone, may God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family, his companions and his soldiers. Amen. Amen."
Colophon of al-Ibāḥah fī faḍl al-sibāḥah: "Tammat al-Ibāḥah fī faḍl al-sibāḥah lil-Jalāl al-Suyūṭī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá. Āmīn."
Translation of the colophon of al-Ibāḥah fī faḍl al-sibāḥah: "Concluded is 'al-Ibāḥah fī faḍl al-sibāḥah' of al-Jalāl al-Suyūṭī, may God have mercy upon him. Amen."
Colophon of al-Maṣābīḥ fī Ṣalāt al-Tarāwīḥ: "Tammat al-risālah."
Translation of the colophon of al-Maṣābīḥ fī Ṣalāt al-Tarāwīḥ: "The treatise is completed."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Isrāʼ : manuscript / Shihāb al-Dīn al-Qalyūbī al-Shāfiʻī.
record.note: On folio 1a: "Kitāb Sharḥ al-Miʻrāj taʼlīf al-ʻĀlim al-ʻallāmah al-ʻumdah al-Shaykh Shihāb al-Dīn al-Qalyūbī al-Shāfiʻī, taghammadahu Allāh bi-raḥmatihi, bi-jāh Muḥammad. Āmīn."

Colophon: No colophon; text ends abruptly with: "... fa-lammā faraghā min ṣalātihimā, lam yalbath, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, bi-fatḥ al-bāʼ, ay lam yamkuth, illā zamanan yasīran ḥattá raʼá al-Masjid qad ijtamaʻa fīhi nās kathīr min al-anbiyāʼ wa-ghayrihim min al-amwāt, bi-arwāḥihim wa-ajsādihim, ʻalá al-rājiḥ, li-anna al-anbiyāʼ aḥyāʼ fī qubūrihim, ʻalá al-rājiḥ, yuṣallūn wa-yaṣūmūn ..."

record.title: 880-02 Mawlid al-Nabī : manuscript / Jaʻfar ibn Ḥasan al-Barzanjī.
record.note: Folio 16 is blank.
On folio 1a: "Hādhā Mawlid al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻlayhi wa-sallam, taʼlīf Sayyidī Jaʻfar al-Barzanjī, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-barakātihi, wa-aʻāda ʻalaynā wa-ʻalá al-Muslimīn min khayrātihi. Āmīn."

On folio 1a: "Iʻlam ayyuhā al-wāqif ʻalá hādhihi al-nuskhah innahā nuqilat min nuskhah qadīmah ʻatīqah wa-jadtuhā bi-yad baʻḍ awlād awlād al-muṣannif, fa-mā wajadtahu minhā mukhālifan li-mā bi-yadika fī al-ḍabṭ wa-al-kalimāt fa-lā tughayyirhu, wa-khallihi ʻalá ḥālih. Wa-Allāh al-muwaffiq lil-ṣawāb."
On the margin of the colophon, the copyist wrote: "Wa-dhālika ibtidāʼ mujāwaratī. Thāniyan, wa-qad dakhaltu al-Jāmiʻ fī dhālika al-ʻām, yawm al-Thulāthāʼ, baʻda al-ẓuhr, sādis yawm min Rabīʻ Awwal."

Colophon: "Wa-qad tamma hādhā al-Mawlid al-sharīf ʻalá yaday kātibihi wa-mālikih Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad al-Badawī al-Anṣārī al-Sinnārī, bi-al-Jāmiʻ al-Azʹhar, ʻām alf wa-miʼtayn wa-thalāthah wa-sabʻīn li-tisʻ baqayna min al-Ḥijjah. M."

Translation of the colophon: "This noble Mawlid was completed by the copyist and owner, Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad al-Badawī al-Anṣārī al-Sinnārī, at al-Jāmiʻ al-Azʹhar, nine nights remaining from Dhū al-Ḥijjah, the year 1273 [12 August, 1857]."

record.title: 880-03 Sharḥ al-ʻAqāʼid al-Nasafīyah : manuscript / Masʻūd ibn ʻUmar al-Taftāzānī.
record.note: In good naskh/taʻlīq script, in black ink, on white paper; markings in red; numerous notes and commentaries on the margins and interlinear; catchwords.
On folio 99b: "Ṣadr al-Sharīʻah khazīnah-i rahndār. Ṣāḥibuhu Yūsuf."

Colophon: "Waqaʻa al-farāgh min hādhihi al-nuskhah al-sharīfah ʻalá yad al-ʻabd al-ḍaʻīf Pir Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd Allāh, fī al-shahr al-mubārak Dhī al-Ḥijjah, yawm al-arbaʻ, waqt al-ẓuhr sanat tisʻah wa-sittīn wa-thamānimiʼah, fī baldat ʻintāb. Raḥmat Allāh li-man naẓarahu wa-daʻā li-kātibihi."

Translation of the colophon: "This copy was completed by the hand of the feeble servant Pir Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd Allāh, on the noon of the fourth day of the blessed month of Dhū al-Ḥijjah, the year 869 [6 August, 1465], in the city of ʻIntāb [Gaziantep, Turkey]. May the mercy of God be on whoever looks into it and invokes God on its copyist's behalf."

record.title: 880-03 Sharḥ ʻAqāʼid al-Imām al-Nasafī : manuscript / Masʻūd ibn ʻUmar al-Taftāzānī.
record.note: Text folios 1a-68b.
On folio 1a: "Kitāb Sharḥ al-ʻAqāʼid fī uṣūl al-dīn." "Sharḥ ʻAqāʼid al-Imām al-Nasafī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá."
On folios 69a-73a: Miscellaneous anecdotes, advices, invocations and doctrines in different hands.
On the margin of folio 68b: Two illegible ownership statements, dated 951 and 953 Hijrīyah (1544/1545 and 1546/1547).
On folio 72b an ownership statement: "Ṣāḥibuhu wa-mālikuhu Ṣiyāmī ibn Ṣāliḥ."
Colophon: "Wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb. Tammat."
Translation of the colophon: "God is more knowledgeable of the truth. It is completed."

record.title: 880-02 Manẓūmat al-Ṣabbān fī muṣṭalaḥ al-Ḥadīth : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī al-Ṣabbān.
record.note: On folio 1a: "Manẓūmat al-Ṣabbān fī muṣṭalaḥ al-Ḥadīth."

Colophon: Tammat bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih wa-ḥusn tawfīqih yawm al-Arbaʻā [al-Arbiʻāʼ] al-mubārak li-sabʻah khalat min Jumād al-Ākhir, sanat 1251, iḥdá wa-khamsīn wa-miʼatayn wa-alf min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá kull ḥāl, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

Translation of the colophon: "The copy was completed by the praise of God, His help and His abundant generosity, on blessed Wednesday, 7 Jumād al-Ākhir, 1251 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [30 September, 1835], may the best of prayer and peace be upon Him. Praise be to God in all situations. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, His family and His companions and grant them peace."

record.title: 880-02 Mukhtaṣar al-Shamāʼil al-Nabawīyah : manuscript / ʻAbd Allāh ibn Ḥijāzī al-Sharqāwī.
record.note: Folios 29-30 are blank.
Colophon: "Tamma bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih."
Translation of the colophon: "The copy was completed by the praise of God and His help."

record.title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyah ʻalá Sharḥ al-Kharīdah al-bahīyah : manuscript / Muṣṭafá ibn Aḥmad al-ʻUqbāwī.
record.note: Colophon: "Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá al-tamām ... Hādhā mā sahhala Allāh bi-hi min fayḍ al-Quṭb al-kabīr Shaykhinā Sayyidī Aḥmad al-Dardīr ʻalá yad jāmiʻihi ... Muṣṭafá ibn Aḥmad al-ʻUqbāwī ... Wa-kāna al-farāgh min jamʻihi ʻusayrata al-Khamīs, awwal yawm min Dhī al-Ḥijjah, sanat 1196 min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah ... Tammat al-ʻaqīdah al-mubārakah bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih. Allāhumma [ighfir] li-kātibihā wa-qārīhā wa-sāmiʻihā wa-muʼallifihā wa-shāriḥihā wa-mālikihā wa-li-wālidīhim wa-ummat Sayyidinā Muḥammad ajmaʻīn. Āmīn. Yā Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam.

Translation of the colophon: "Praise be to God for the conclusion ... This is what God facilitated from the emanation of the great Master our teacher, Sayyidī Aḥmad al-Dardīr, by its compiler ... Muṣṭafá ibn Aḥmad al-ʻUqbāwī ... it was compiled on the afternoon of Thursday, the first day of Dhī al-Ḥijjah, the year 1196 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [7 November, 1782] ... The blessed creed is completed by the praise of God and His help. I beseech God to [pardon] its copyist, its reader, he who listens to it, its author, its commentator, its owner and their parents and the whole nation of our Master Muḥammad. Amen. O Master of the Universe. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions and grant them peace."

record.title: Clumber Park Chartier.
record.note: Modern foliation, in pencil, 1-136.
Byname: Clumber Park Chartier.

record.title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyah ʻalá Qiṣṣat al-Miʻrāj : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Dardīr.
record.note: At the head of folio 1a, in crude hand: "Hādhihi Ḥāshiyat al-ʻĀlim al-ʻallāmah, malik al-murīdīn, al-Shaykh Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Dardīr al-Mālikī, ʻalá Qiṣṣat al-Miʻrāj lil-Najm al-Ghayṭī, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-himā. Āmīn."
Folios 38-40 are blank.

Author's colophon: "Hādhā ākhir mā yassarahu Allāh taʻālá, maʻa al-ʻajalah wa-shughl al-qalb. ʻAlá annī mā jamaʻtuhā illā li-man shāʼa an yaqraʼa al-qiṣṣah bi-majlis aw majlisayn, kamā huwa ʻādat al-ʻabd al-faqīr fī qirāʼatihi la-hā bi-al-Jāmiʻ al-Azʹhar, dāma saʻduhu bi-iqrāʼ al-ʻulūm al-sharʻīyah fīhi ilá Yawm al-Dīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Āmīn. Wa-salāmun ʻalá al-mursalīn, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Tamm."

Translation of the author's colophon: "This is what God, may He be praised, facilitated, in haste and with troubles of heart. I compiled it only for those who want to read the story in one or two sessions, as it is the habit of this poor servant, who used to read it at al-Jāmiʻ al-Azʹhar, may it prosper, by teaching the religious sciences, until Judgement Day. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and companions, and grant them peace. Amen. Peace be unto the messengers and praise be to God the Lord of the Universe. It is concluded."

Copyist's colophon: "Tammat hādhihi al-nuskhah al-sharīfah al-ʻaẓīmah fī yawm al-Sabt, arbaʻat ayyām khalat min shahr Allāh Rajab al-Fard, alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat 1273, thalāthah wa-sabʻīn wa-miʼatayn wa-alf min Hijrat man la-hu atamm waṣf, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, ʻalá yad kātibihā al-faqīr, ʻAlī Aḥmad al-Bujayrimī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidihi wa-al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "This noble and magnificent copy was completed on Saturday, 4 Rajab al-Fard, 1273 [28 February, 1857] of the Hijrah of the Prophet, may God pray on Him and grant Him peace, by the poor copyist ʻAlī Aḥmad al-Bujayrimī, may God pardon him, his father, and Muslims. Amen. Amen. Amen. Amen."

record.title: 880-02 Insān al-ʻuyūn fī sīrat al-Amīn al-Maʼmūn : manuscript / Nūr al-Dīn ʻAlī ibn Ibrāhīm al-Ḥalabī.
record.note: Starts with: "... wa-maḍá fa-laḥiqāhu, wa-innahu la-yanfuru bi-him, ay, wa-amar, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, bi-iḥṣāʼ man maʻahu, wa-huwa muḥtamil li-an yakūna amara bi-dhālika thāniyan baʻda al-Rawḥāʼ, baʻda an radda Abā Lubābah, wa-baʻda ʻaddihim fī Biʼr Abī ʻUtbah, fa-idhā hum thalāthumiʼah wa-thalāthata ʻashar ..."
On the back of the front cover, in pencil: "al-Sīrah al-Ḥalabīyah."

At the end of folio 308a: "Tammat al-Sīrah al-Ḥalabīyah. Raḥima Allāh muʼallifuhā wa-kātibuhā wa-sāmiʻuhā wa-qāriyahā wa-al-dāʻī li-muʼallifihā wa-kātibihā bi-al-raḥmah. Āmīn. Yā Rabba al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Tamm."

On folios 308b-310b: A short biography of the author of "al-Sīrah al-Ḥalabīyah", probably by the copyist, and a panegyrical poem praising the book and its author which ends with a date in "ḥisāb al-jummal": Shukrī ʻalá al-itmām fī tārīkhihi // ka-al-ḥamdi lil-Mannān dhī al-iḥsāni [1165]."
On folios 310b-311a: A poem praising those for whom the copy was made.
On folio 311a: A quotation by the author from his teacher al-Shaykh Muḥammad Abū al-Mawāhib al-Bakrī al-Ṣiddīqī (could not be identified).
At the end of the colophon the copyist wrote another poem, a quadruplet (mukhammas) praising those who read the manuscript and beseech God on his behalf.

Colophon: "Tamma naskh hādhihi al-sīrah al-mubārakah bi-rāḥat afqar muʻtarif bi-dhunūbihi, muqirr bi-khaṭalihi wa-ʻuyūbihi, Muḥammad al-Ḥāfiẓ al-Najjār ibn Ḥusayn al-Ṣaydāwī, ghafara Allāh taʻālá la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-wālidayhim, wa-li-mashāyikhihi wa-mashāyikhihim, wa-li-man daʻā la-hu wa-dhakarahu bi-khayr, wa-li-sāyir al-Muslimīn wa-al-Muslimāt. Āmīn. Wa-wāfaqa al-farāgh min dhālika ẓuhr yawm al-Thulāthāʼ, al-thānī ʻashar min shahr Shawwāl al-mubārak alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat alf wa-miʼah wa-khamsah wa-sittīn, bi-ḥamd Allāh taʻālá wa-tawfīqihi. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Tamm."

Translation of the colophon: "This blessed biography was copied by the poor, who confesses his sins, and acknowledges his error and deficiencies, Muḥammad al-Ḥāfiẓ al-Najjār ibn Ḥusayn al-Ṣaydāwī, may the Almighty God pardon him, his parents, his great parents, his masters, and those who beseech God on his behalf and remember him favorably, and all Muslim men and women. Amen. It was completed on Tuesday noon, the twelfth of the blessed month of Shawwal, 1165, by the praise of God Almighty and His favor. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions and grant them peace. It is completed."

record.title: 880-02 Nihāyat al-ṭalab fī sharḥ al-Muktasab fī zirāʻat al-dhahab : manuscript / Aydamar ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Jaldakī.
record.note: On the back of the front cover, an ownership statement, as follows: "Hādhā al-kitāb nādir al-mithāl fī ʻilm al-kīmiyāʼ, lā baʼsa min ṭabʻih, li-anna al-kutub al-maṭbūʻah bi-hādhā al-fann qalīlah wa-juzʼīyah jiddan, fa-li-yuḥfaẓ. Min kutub al-faqīr Muḥammad Adīb Taqī al-Dīn."
On the back of the front cover: "Hādhā al-kitāb ismuhu 'Nihāyat al-ṭalab fī sharḥ al-Muktasab' yaẓharu min ʻibāratihi bi-anna muʼallifahu min aʼimmat hādhā al-ʻilm."

On the back of the front cover: "al-ʻAqāqīr fī hādhā al-kitab [al-kitāb] mubhamā [mubhamah] ibhām lā yafham al-ṭālib minhā shayʼ illā man ʻallamahu Allāh li-anna ... ... shurrāḥ, wa-al-tarākīb mā baynahā, wa-hādhā al-shayʼ buʻd ʻalá al-ʻaql."
On folio 1a: An alchemy recipe.
On folio 1b: An invocation of behalf of the owner of the book.
On folio 2b, the author mentions the titles of two of his alchemy books: "Bughyat al-khabīr fī qānūn ṭalab al-iksīr" and "al-Shams al-munīr fī taḥqīq al-iksīr".
On folio 3a, the author states that he does not know the name of the author of "al-Muktasab fī zirāʻat al-dhahab".
On folios 3a-4a, an elaborate index of contents of the three parts of the book.
On folio 130a, the author mentions a third title of his books on alchemy: "Miftāḥ al-raḥmah wa-kanz al-niʻmah".
On the margin of folio 130a is written that the copyist died on 21 Dhū al-Qaʻdah, 955 (1 January, 1549).
Folios 130a-140b, the copyist gives selections from the author's book "Miftāḥ al-raḥmah wa-kanz al-niʻmah" and from other authors and works
On folio 141a: An alchemy recipe.
On folio 141b: A praise for the book and its author by anonymous.

Colophon (folio 130a): "Wa-qad āna an nakhtuma al-sifr al-awwal min al-kitāb, wa-Allāh al-mustaʻān wa-la-hu al-ḥamd wa-al-minnah dāʼiman ilá Yawm al-Dīn, wa-ṣalawātuhu ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ʻalá jamīʻ al-anbiyāʼ wa-al-mursalīn wa-al-malāʼikah wa-al-ṣāliḥīn. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min naskhihi yawm al-Aḥad al-mubārak, ḥādī ʻishrīn Jumādá al-Awwal, ʻām 951. Wa-katabahu aḍʻaf al-ʻibād wa-afqaruhum ilá Allāh taʻālá, ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Ṣāliḥī. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman kathīran ilá Yawm al-Dīn."

Translation of the colophon: "It is time that we conclude the first part of the book. God is the helper. Praise and grace are His forever until Judgement Day. May God's prayers be upon our Master Muḥammad and his family and upon all prophets, messengers, the angels and the righteous. The copy was completed on blessed Sunday, 21 Jumādá al-Awwal, 951 [20 August, 1544]. Copied by the feeblest and the poorest to God Almighty, ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Ṣāliḥī. Praise be to God, the Lord of the Universe. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions and grant them abundant peace until Judgement Day."

record.title: 880-02 ʻUyūn al-ḥaqāʼiq wa-īḍāḥ al-ṭarāʼiq : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-ʻIrāqī.
record.note: On folio 1a, an ownership statement, as follows: "Hādhā Kitāb ʻUyūn al-ḥaqāʼiq wa-īḍāḥ al-ṭarāʼiq, wa-huwa min kutub al-Ḥājj Aḥmad al-Rabbāṭ."
On folio 1a: "Hādhā al-kitāb fī fann al-shaʻbadhah, wa-al-dakk, wa-al-malāʻīb, al-zāyirjah wa-al-muzaʻbarnī bi-al-tamām, wa-ʻiddat awrāqih 73 thalāthah wa-sabʻīn."
On folio 2a: "... wa-sammaynāhu ʻUyūn al-ḥaqāyiq wa-īḍāḥ al-ṭarāyiq."
On folio 67a: "... Qāla al-Shaykh Abū al-Qāsim Aḥmad al-ʻIrāqī muʼallif hādhā al-kitāb ..."

On folio 73a, a statement by a reader of the manuscript: "Naẓara fīhi wa-taʼammala maʻāniyah al-faqīr ilá rabbihi al-ghanī, al-rājī ʻafwa rabbihi al-karīm al-ʻārif [...] ʻĀrif ibn al-marḥūm ʻAlī al-Ḥallāq, fī 12 Jumād Ākhir, sanat 95."

Colophon: "Intahá kitāb ʻUyūn al-ḥaqāyiq wa-īḍāḥ al-ṭarāyiq, taʼlīf al-Shaykh Aḥmad Abū al-Qāsim al-ʻIrāqī, raḍiya Allāh ʻanh. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá man lā nabīya baʻdah."

Translation of the colophon: "The book of ʻUyūn al-ḥaqāyiq wa-īḍāḥ al-ṭarāyiq, written by al-Shaykh Aḥmad Abū al-Qāsim al-ʻIrāqī, may God be pleased with him, is completed. Praise be to God alone. May God pray on the Seal of the Prophets."

record.title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyah ʻalá Sharḥ al-Risālat al-ʻAḍudīyah : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Sālim al-Ḥifnī.
record.note: On folios 37a, 47a and 52a, an endowment statement, as follows: "Waqf lillāh taʻālá ʻalá ṭalabat al-ʻilm bi-Ḥārat al-Bashābishah."

On folio 52b, an endowment statement, as follows: "Waqf lillāh taʻālá bi-Ḥārat al-Bashābishah bi-al-Azʹhar al-anwar. Waqf al-marḥūm al-Shaykh Jād al-Mawlá, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá. Āmīn. Āmīn."

Ends with: "... wa-lā tubādir in tawahhamta khalalan bi-al-itlāf, bal aṣliḥ baʻda al-taʼammul in lam yusʻif al-taʼwīl, wa-ajmil in iʻtaraḍta, fa-fī hādhā al-muqām lā yuḥmad al-tafṣīl. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh al-muwaffiq lil-ṣawāb. Wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-al-āl wa-al-aṣḥāb ṣalātan wa-salāman dāʼimayn mutalāzimayn ilá yawm al-maʼāb."
Colophon: "Tammat bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih wa-ḥusn tawfīqih."
Translation of the colophon: "It is concluded by the praise of God and His benevolent favor."

record.title: 880-03 al-Juzʼ al-thālith min Tadhkirat al-Ḥakīm Dāwūd : manuscript / Dāʼūd ibn ʻUmar al-Anṭākī.
record.note: On folio 1a, in pencil: "Tadhkirat Dāwūd. Ṭibb. Tadhkirat ulī al-albāb."
On folios 1b-2a: Three pieces of Arabic love poetry (ghazal).
On folio 2a: "Hādhā al-kitāb al-Juzʼ al-thālith min Tadhkirat al-Ḥakīm Dāwūd, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá wa-nafaʻanā bi-barakatihi. Āmīn."
On folio 2a: Two medicinal recipes.
On folio 2a: An erased ownership statement and a statement by Muḥammad [...] al-Maydānī, dated 1300 Hijrīyah (1882/1883).
Folios 213-214 are blank.

Colophon: "Wa-qad tamma al-farāgh min hādhihi al-nuskhah al-mubārakah al-mushtamilah ʻalá aʻẓam al-fawāʼid fī yawm al-Sabat, ghurrat Muḥarram al-ḥarām, iftitāḥ sanat 1157, sabʻah wa-khamsīn wa-miʼah wa-alf min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām."

Translation of the colophon: "This blessed copy that contains the great benefits was completed on Saturday, the beginning of Muḥarram, the start of the year 1157 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [15 February, 1744], may the best of prayer and peace be upon Him."

record.title: Treatises on Islamic law : manuscript.
record.note: 1. Incipit of Ifāḍat al-anwār ʻalá uṣul al-Manār (folio 1b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-bi-hi thiqatī. Allāhumma ṣallī wa-sallim ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajamʻīn wa-sallim. Ḥamdan laka yā man nawwarta manār al-sharʻ al-sharīf bi-kitābika al-muʻjiz al-munīf, wa-ṣalātan ʻalá man khaṣaṣtahu bi-kull kamāl wa-tashrīf wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi mā nuṭiqa bi-ammā baʻdu fī kull taʼlīf. Fa-yaqūlu al-muftaqir ilá dhī al-luṭf al-khafī Muḥammad ʻAlāʼ al-Dīn ibn ʻAlī al-Ḥaṣkafī al-Muftī bi-Dimashq al-Ḥanafī: Hādhihi alfāẓ yasīrah ḥallaltu bi-hā Manār al-uṣūl ḥīna iqrāʼihi thālithan bi-Jāmiʻ Banī Umayyah sanat arbaʻ wa-khamsīn Hijrīyah murājiʻan li-ghālib shurūḥihi ka-al-Muṣannaf wa-Ibn al-Malik wa-Ibn Nujaym wa-ghayrihā ka-al-Tawḍīḥ wa-al-Talwīḥ wa-Nafīr al-Tanqīḥ wa-sammaytuhu bi-Ifāḍat al-anwār ʻalá uṣūl al-Manār ..."
Title of Ifāḍat al-anwār ʻalá uṣul al-Manār from folio 1b.
Secundo folio of Ifāḍat al-anwār ʻalá uṣul al-Manār: ʻillat al-ṭawāf qisnā ʻalayhā.

2. Incipit of Tanbīh al-ghāfil wa-al-wasnān ʻalá aḥkām hilāl Ramaḍān: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī jaʻala al-ʻilma nūran yuhtadá bi-hi ʻinda ikhtilāf al-arāʼ, wa-awḍaḥa subulahu li-sālikīh al-muttaqīn wa-in iḍṭarabat fīhi al-ahwāʼ, wa-qayyaḍa la-hu fī kull zamān rijālan hum ʻalá al-ḥaqq adillāʼ ... Ammā baʻd, fa-yaqūlu afqar al-ʻibād ilá luṭf Mawlāhu al-khafī Muḥammad ibn ʻĀbidīn al-Ḥanafī: Hādhihi risālah sammaytuhā Tanbīh al-ghāfil wa-al-wasnān ʻalá aḥkām hilāl Ramaḍān, jamaʻtuhā bi-sabab wāqiʻat waqaʻat sanat arbaʻīn wa-miʼatayn wa-alf min Hijrat Nabīyinā al-mukarram, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, fī ithbāt Ramaḍān al-muʻaẓẓam ..."
Title of Tanbīh al-ghāfil wa-al-wasnān ʻalá aḥkām hilāl Ramaḍān from folio 71b.
Secundo folio of Tanbīh al-ghāfil wa-al-wasnān ʻalá aḥkām hilāl Ramaḍān: al-nuʻmān li-anna dhālika.

3. Incipit of Rafʻ al-ishtibāh ʻan ʻibārat al-Ashbāh: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Aḥmadu Allāh ʻalá mā anʻama bi-hi wa-awlāh, wa-ashkuruhu ʻalá mā manna bi-hi wa-aʻṭāh, wa-uṣallī wa-usallimu ʻalá nabīyihi wa-muṣṭafāh wa-ʻalá aṣḥābihi al-ʻārifīn al-naẓāʼir wa-al-ashbāh wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-atbāʻihi wa-man wālāh. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-faqīr wa-al-mudhnib al-ḥaqīr al-muftaqir ilá raḥmat Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, Muḥammad Amīn ibn ʻUmar, al-shahīr bi-Ibn ʻĀbidīn, maḥá Allāh dhunūbah wa-malaʼa min al-ghufrān dhunūbah. Āmīn. Hādhihi risālah ʻamiltuhā ʻalá ʻibārh waqaʻat fī kitāb al-Ashbāh wa-al-naẓāʼir mūhimah khilāf al-murād lil-mutaʼammil al-nāẓir wa-dhālika bi-rasm Shaykhī (ay, huwa al-ʻAllāmah al-marḥūm al-Shaykh Muḥammad Shākir Muqaddam), ḥafiẓa Allāh taʻālá wujūdah wa-wāfir khayrihi wa-jūdih, ḥīna suʼila ʻanhā fī Shaʻbān min sanat alf wa-miʼatayn wa-thamāniyata ʻashar min hijrat khayr al-bashr ..."
Title of Rafʻ al-ishtibāh ʻan ʻibārat al-Ashbāh from folio 86b.
Secundo folio of Rafʻ al-ishtibāh ʻan ʻibārat al-Ashbāh: al-Ramlī raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá.

4. Incipit of Masʼalat ilqāʼ al-zibl fī al-qasāṭil: "Māʼ al-thalj idhā jará ʻalá ṭarīq fīhi sirqīn wa-najāsah, in taghayyabat al-najāsah wa-ikhtalaṭat ḥattá lā yurá atharuhā yutawaḍḍaʼ minhu wa-law kāna jamīʻ baṭn al-nahr najisan ..."
Title of Masʼalat ilqāʼ al-zibl fī al-qasāṭil from folio 92a.

5. Incipit of Maʻrifat al-alfāẓ allatī tajrī ʻalá alsinat al-fuqahāʼ fī uṣūl al-fiqh: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Ṣallá Allāh taʻālá ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn wa-al-ʻāqibah lil-muttaqīn, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Rasūlihi Muḥammad wa-ālihi ajmaʻīn. Lā budda lil-faqīh min maʻrifat al-alfāẓ al-mustaʻmalah allatī tajrī ʻalá alsun al-fuqahāʼ fī uṣūl al-fiqh, ḥattá lā yajrī fīhi al-sahw wa-al-ghalaṭ, li-anna aḥkām al-sharʻ mabnīyah ʻalá hādhihi al-alfāẓ. Wa-sammaytu hādhihi al-aḥkām Kitāb Bayān kashf al-alfāẓ al-wāqiʻah fī kutub al-fiqh wa-uṣūlih ..."
Title of Maʻrifat al-alfāẓ allatī tajrī ʻalá alsinat al-fuqahāʼ fī uṣūl al-fiqh from folio 101a.
Secundo folio of Maʻrifat al-alfāẓ allatī tajrī ʻalá alsinat al-fuqahāʼ fī uṣūl al-fiqh: sawākin al-buyūt maʼkhūdh.

On the back of the front cover, a table of contents of the codex, as follows: "Fahrasat hādhā al-majmūʻ: Sharḥ al-Manār lil-ʻAlāʼī. Tanbīh al-ghāfil wa-al-wasnān maʻa aḥkām hilāl Ramaḍān lil-ʻAllāmah Ibn ʻĀbidīn. Rafʻ al-ishtibāh ʻan ʻibārat al-ashbāh lil-madhkūr ayḍan. Risālah fī al-alfāẓ al-wāqiʻah fī kutub al-uṣūl wa-mā yajrī fī baʻḍ kutub al-fiqh. Baʻḍ masāʼil min kutub mutafarriqah. Masāʼil min al-Kullīyāt. Masʼalat ilqāʼ al-zibl fī al-qasāṭil. Ḥukm al-Durūz wa-al-Tayāminah wa-al-Matāwilah wa-al-Qarāmiṭiah wa-al-Nuṣayrīyah. Fī ḥadd al-mukthir min riwāyat al-Ḥadīth wa-kam la-hu min al-Ṣaḥābah wa-kam la-hu Aḥādīth min sharḥ al-Manīnī. Fāʼidat Abī Dujānah raḍiay Allāh ʻanhu min sharḥ al-Manīnī ayḍan. Abyāt min Itḥāf ahl al-ʻaṣr fī iqtibās Alaysa lī milk Miṣr li-Khalīl Afandī al-Murādī Muftī al-Shām. Khawāṣṣ asmāʼ ahl Badr raḍiya Allāh taʻālá ʻanhum. Tarjamat Rābiʻah al-ʻAdawīyah, min Ṭabaqāt al-Munāwī [ʻAbd al-Raʼūf ibn Tāj al-ʻĀrifīn]."
On the back of the front cover the following date: "Laylat al-tāsiʻah min Dhī al-Qaʻdah sanat 1287, wa-hiya laylat al-Ithnayn [31 January, 1871]."

On folio 1a: "Kitāb Ifāḍat al-anwār sharḥ uṣūl al-manār lil-ʻAllāmah al-muḥaqqiq wa-al-fahhāmah al-mudaqqiq Mawlānā al-marḥūm al-Shaykh Muḥammad ʻAlāʼ al-Dīn al-Ḥaṣfakī al-Ḥanafī Muftī Dimashq al-Shām ʻalayhi raḥmat al-Malik al-Salām. Āmīn."

On folio 1a: "Tanbīh al-ghāfil wa-al-wasnān ʻalá aḥkām hilāl Ramaḍān jamʻ Shaykh shuyūkhinā khātimat al-muḥaqqiqīn wa-ʻumdat al-mudaqqiqīn al-Sayyid Muḥammad Amīn ibn al-Sayyid ʻUmar ʻĀbidīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Wa-yalīhā Rafʻ al-ishtibāh ʻan ʻibārat al-ashbāh jamʻ Shaykh mashāyikhinā ... al-Syyid al-Sharīf al-ʻAllāmah Muḥammad Amīn ʻĀbidīn, ʻalayhi raḥmat al-Malik al-muʻīn. [Seal of Sulaymān]."
On folio 1a, an ownership statement: "Fī nawbat kātibihā afqar al-wará ilayhi bi-Ḥarastā al-Ḥājj Sulaymān al-shahīr bi-Ibn Jaʻfar Āghā, ghafara Allāh la-hu. [Seal of Sulaymān]."

On folio 65b: "Wa-qad tammat qirāʼat matn al-Manār ʻalá Shaykhinā al-ʻallāmah al-fāḍil wa-al-fahhāmah al-kāmil al-Sayyid Maḥmūd Afandī Ḥamzah Muftī Dimashq al-Shām [Ḥamzah, Maḥmūd ibn Muḥammad Nasīb, 1820 or 1821-1887 or 1888] fī 27 Jumād al-Thānī sanat 1289 [1 September, 1871]."

On folio 65b: "Taʻrīf al-Ṣaḥābī: Huwa man laqiya al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, muʼminan bi-hi wa-māta ʻalá dhālik ... wa-tamām al-kalām dhakarahu al-ʻAllāmah al-Shihāb Aḥmad al-Saʻdī al-Manīnī fī Sharḥ asmāʼ ahl Badr, ruḍwān Allāh ʻalayhim ajmaʻīn."

On the right margin of folio 65b: "1276 Dhī al-Ḥijjah. Wa-fī ākhir sanat sitt wa-sabʻīn ḥaṣalat ḥādithat al-Naṣārá bi-Dimashq [19 July, 1860]. Wa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻAlī al-ʻAẓīm."
On folios 66a-67b: Anecdotes quoted from "Sharḥ al-ṣadr bi-sharḥ urjūzah Istinzāl al-naṣr bi-al-tawassul bi-ahl Badr" of Aḥmad Afandī al-Manīnī al-ʻUthmānī.
On folios 68a-68b: "al-Ḥizb al-kabīr li-Sayyidinā Ibrāhīm al-Dasūqī" (a Ṣūfī invocation).
On folios 69a: Three Ḥadiths.
Folio 70 is blank.

On the left margin of folio 86a: "Balaghat hādhihi al-risālah muqābalatan ʻan aṣl muṣannifihā, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá, ṣuḥbata al-akh fī Allāh al-Shaykh Muḥammad ʻAlī al-shahīr bi-al-Dilātī, kāna Allāh la-nā wa-la-hu bi-kull khayr."

On the left margin of folio 91b: "Wa-fī tārīkh taḥrīr hādhihi al-nuskhah waqaʻat ḥādithat al-amṭār wa-al-thalj al-dāʼimayn al-shadīdayn fī Dimashq wa-Ḥimṣ bi-dhālika takhrīb akthar (baʻḍ) al-dūr, wa-istashhada bidhālika man waná ajaluh ... muddat istimrār al-maṭar wa-al-thalj fī Dimashq wa-nawāḥīhā yawm ʻiddat 45."
Folios 92b-93a are blank.
On folio 93b: A grammatical riddle and a play on words using the verb "waʼá" and its imparative mood "I".
Folios 94a-96a are blank.
On folio 96b: "Fawāʼid min sharḥ al-Imām al-Nawawī lil-humām al-ʻAllāmah ghawth al-wāṣilīn Sayyidī al-Sayyid Muṣṭafá al-Bakrī al-Ṣiddīqī."
On folio 96b: Anecdotes about the well-known Ṣufī saint "Rābiʻah al-ʻAdawīyah" (died 801?).
Folios 97a-98a are blank.
On folio 98b: Fatwá (legal opinion) of ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Muḥammad al-ʻImādī (1570 or 1571-1641 or 1642) against al-Durūz and al-Tayāminah and other esoteric sects.
On folio 100a: A quotation from Risālat al-Qushayrī, dated 26 Dhū al-Qaʻdah, 87 (1287 = 17 February, 1871).
Folio 100b is blank.
On folio 105a: Quotations from the commentary of Badr al-Dīn Maḥmūd ibn Aḥmad al-ʻAynī (1361-1451) on Ṣaḥīḥ al-Bukhārī (Bukhārī, Muḥammad ibn Ismāʻīl, 810-870. Jāmiʻ al-ṣaḥīḥ).
On folios 105b-106a: Quotations from "al-Kullīyāt" of Abū al-Baqāʼ (Kaffawī, Ayyūb ibn Mūsá, 1618 or 1619-1682 or 1683).
On folio 106b: Quotations from Arabic poetry and prose.
Folio 107a is blank.
On folios 107b-109a: Quotations from Arbic love poety (ghazals).
On folio 109b: Three verses of poetry dating the death of the the copyist's cousin "Jaʻfar Āghā" on Sunday, 16 Rabīʻ al-Thānī, 1281 Hijrī (18 September, 1864).
On folio 110a: Three verses of Arabic poetry.
On folio 110b: Miscellaneous quotations and anecdotes.

Author's colophon of Ifāḍat al-anwār ʻalá uṣul al-Manār (65a-65b): "Qāla muʼallifuhu, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá: Wa-qad waqaʻa bi-luṭf Allāh taʻālá al-farāgh min taʼlīf hādhā al-sharḥ al-mukhtaṣar al-musammá bi-Ifāḍat al-anwār ʻalá uṣul al-Manār ʻalá yad jāmiʻihi ʻAlāʼ al-Dīn ibn ʻAlī al-Imām bi-Jāmiʻ Banī Umayyah bi-Dimashq al-maḥmīyah baʻda adhān al-thālith bi-manārat al-jāmiʻ al-mazbūr laylat al-Jumʻah awāsiṭ shahr Dhī al-Ḥijjah al-ḥarām sanat arbaʻ wa-khamsīn wa-alf (1054). Wa-kuntu sharaʻtu fīhi fī awāʼil Dhī al-Qaʻdah tilka al-sanah fa-kānat muddat taʼlīfihi muddat al-muwāʻadah bi-lā rayb, dhālika faḍl Allāh yuʼtīhi man yashāʼ ..."

Translation of the author's colophon of Ifāḍat al-anwār ʻalá uṣul al-Manār: "The author, may God Almighty have mercy upon him, said: This brief commentary, titled "Ifāḍat al-anwār ʻalá uṣul al-Manār" was compiled by ʻAlāʼ al-Dīn ibn ʻAlī, the Imām at al-Jāmiʻ al-Umawī in protected Damascus, after the third adhān (call to prayer) from the minaret of the aforementioned mosque, on Friday night, the middle of Dhū al-Ḥijjah, 1054 [11 February, 1645]. I started writing it at the beginning of Dhū al-Qaʻdah, that same year [30 December, 1644], hence, it was fully completed, as was promised. This is a favor from God which He bestows on whomever He wills."

Copyist's colophon of Ifāḍat al-anwār ʻalá uṣul al-Manār: "Wa-qad intahat bi-nā maṭīyat al-aqlām wa-khalaʻat burudahā al-sūd wa-rafaʻat raʼsahā min al-rukūʻ wa-al-sujūd wa-dhālika fī laylat al-Ithnayn sābiʻ ʻashar Rabīʻ al-Thānī sanat sitt wa-sabʻīn wa-miʼatayn wa-alf 1276 min Hijrat man la-hu al-ʻizz wa-al-sharaf ... ʻalá yad afqar al-wará wa-khādim niʻāl al-fuqarā [al-Ḥājj Sulaymān al-Shahīr bi-Ibn Jaʻfar Āghā]."

Translation of the copyist's colophon of Ifāḍat al-anwār ʻalá uṣul al-Manār: "The mount of pens has carried us to our destination. It took off its black clothes and raised its head from kneeling and prostration, on the night of Monday, 17 Rabīʻ al-Thānī, 1276 [13 November, 1859] of the Hijrah of the exalted and honorable Prophet ... by the poorest of the people and servant of the sandals of the poor ones [the Ṣūfīs], [al-Ḥājj Sulaymān al-Shahīr bi-Ibn Jaʻfar Āghā]."

Author's colophon of Tanbīh al-ghāfil wa-al-wasnān ʻalá aḥkām hilāl Ramaḍān: "Wa-hādhā ākhir mā yassarahu Allāh taʻālá wa-qaḍāhu min al-kalām ʻalá aḥkām hilāl Ramaḍān wa-ruʼyāh ʻalá yad ʻabdihi al-muftaqir ilá ʻizzihi wa-ʻulāh Muḥammad ʻĀbidīn, ʻafā ʻanhu mawlāhu wa-tajāwaza ʻan masāwīhi wa-khaṭāyāhu, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad nabīyihi wa-mujtabāh wa-ḥabībihi wa-muṣṭafāh wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi wa-man wālāh, wa-dhālika fī muntaṣaf Shawwāl sanat arbaʻīn wa-miʼatayn wa-alf min hijrat man ḥāza aqṣá al-sharaf wa-aʻlāh. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."

Translation of the author's colophon of Tanbīh al-ghāfil wa-al-wasnān ʻalá aḥkām hilāl Ramaḍān: "This is the end of what God Almighty facilitated and effectuated, concerning the rules about the crescent of Ramaḍān and its appearance, by His servant who is in need of His power and exaltedness, Muḥammad ʻĀbidīn, may his Lord pardon him and forgive his iniquities and sins. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, His prophet, His selected one, His beloved and chosen one, and on his family, his companions, and those who supported him. Completed in mid Shawwāl, 1240 [2 June, 1825] of the Hijrah of the exalted and sublime Prophet. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe."

Copyist's colophon of Tanbīh al-ghāfil wa-al-wasnān ʻalá aḥkām hilāl Ramaḍān: "Qad tamma taḥrīr hādhihi al-risālah al-sharīfah wa-al-masāʼil al-laṭīfah ʻalá yad afqar al-wará wa-khādim niʻāl al-fuqarā al-ʻabd al-faqīr al-ʻājiz al-ḥaqīr al-Ḥājj Sulaymān ibn al-marḥūm Aḥmad Āghā al-shahīr bi-Ibn Jaʻfar Āghā, khatama Allāh taʻālá la-hu wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn bi-al-khātimah al-ḥusná wa-ʻafá ʻanhum ajmaʻīn, wa-dhālika fī salkh Muḥarram al-ḥarām sanat arbaʻah wa-sabʻīn wa-miʼatayn wa-alf ..."

Translation of the copyist's colophon of Tanbīh al-ghāfil wa-al-wasnān ʻalá aḥkām hilāl Ramaḍān: "This honorable epistle and elegant issues were copied by the poorest of the people and the servant of the sandals of the poor ones [the Ṣūfīs], the poor, the despised and powerless slave, al-Ḥājj Sulaymān ibn al-marḥūm Aḥmad Āghā al-shahīr bi-Ibn Jaʻfar Āghā, may God Almighty grant him and all Muslims an agreeable end and pardon all of them. Dated, the end of Muḥarram, of the year 1274 [20 September, 1857] ..."

Author's colophon of Rafʻ al-ishtibāh ʻan ʻibārat al-Ashbāh: "Ilá hunā intahá ākhir al-kalām wa-waqafat bi-nā maṭīyat al-aqlām ... wa-dhālika fī laylat al-niṣf min shahr Ramaḍān al-mukarram min sanat thamāniyata ʻashar wa-miʼatayn wa-alf min hijrat man la-hu al-ʻizz wa-al-sharaf ... ʻalá yad jāmiʻihā Muḥammad Amīn ibn ʻUmar ʻĀbidīn ..."

Translation of the author's colophon of Rafʻ al-ishtibāh ʻan ʻibārat al-Ashbāh: "This is the end of the discourse where the mount of pens stopped ... on the night of mid blessed Ramaḍān of the year 1218 of the Hijrah of the sublime and honorable Prophet [29 December, 1803] ... by its compiler Muḥammad Amīn ibn ʻUmar ʻĀbidīn ..."

Copyist's colophon of Rafʻ al-ishtibāh ʻan ʻibārat al-Ashbāh: "Wa-qad tammat kitābat hādhihi al-risālah al-sharīfah ʻalá yad afqar al-wará wa-khādim niʻāl al-fuqarā al-Ḥājj Sulaymān al-shahīr bi-Ibn Jaʻfar Āghā ... wa-dhālika fī iḥdá ʻishrīn Jumād al-Thānī min shuhūr sanat arbaʻah wa-sabʻīn wa-miʼatayn wa-alf ... sanat 1274, 21 Jā [Jumād Ākhir], nahār al-Jumʻah al-mubārak, qabla al-ṣalāh."

Translation of the copyist's colophon of Rafʻ al-ishtibāh ʻan ʻibārat al-Ashbāh: "This honorable epistle was copied by the poorest of the people and the servant of the sandals of the poor ones [the Ṣūfīs], al-Ḥājj Sulaymān al-shahīr bi-Ibn Jaʻfar Āghā ... on 21 Jumād al-Thānī, 1274 [6 February, 1858], on blessed Friday, before the start of prayer."

Masʼalat ilqāʼ al-zibl fī al-qasāṭil ends with: "... wa-qawluhu fa-al-ḥawḍ najis ilá an yaṣīra al-zibl alladhī fī asfalihi ḥamaʼan, fa-lā yakūnu najisan ḥīnaʼidhin, yaʻnī jará baʻda dhālik, lā bi-mujarrad ṣayrūrat al-zibl ḥamaʼan, kamā yuʻlamu mimmā marra. Wa-qad ḍaʻʻafa hādhihi al-masʼalah al-ʻAllāmah ʻ B fī ḥāshiyatihi ʻalá al-Durr wa-al-baḥr fa-li-yurājaʻ hunāk."

Colophon of Maʻrifat al-alfāẓ allatī tajrī ʻalá alsinat al-fuqahāʼ fī uṣūl al-fiqh: "Tammat al-risālah al-musammāh bi-Bayān kashf al-alfāẓ al-wāqiʻah fī kutub al-fiqh wa-uṣūlih ʻalá yad al-faqīr al-Ḥājj Sulaymān ibn Jaʻfar Āghā, ʻashīyat yawm al-ithnayn min shahr Jumād al-Thānī, sanat sitt wa-sabʻīn wa-miʼatayn wa-alf."

Translation of the colophon of Maʻrifat al-alfāẓ allatī tajrī ʻalá alsinat al-fuqahāʼ fī uṣūl al-fiqh: "The copy of this epistle titled 'Bayān kashf al-alfāẓ al-wāqiʻah fī kutub al-fiqh wa-uṣūlih' was completed by the poor al-Ḥājj Sulaymān ibn Jaʻfar Āghā, on the evening of 2 Jumād al-Thānī, 1276 [27 December, 1859]."

record.title: 880-02 Murshid al-mutaʼahhil : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Quṭb al-Dīn Muḥammad al-Iznīqī.
record.note: On folio 1a: "Kitāb Murshid al-mutaʼahhil."

Colophon: No colophon; text ends abruptly with: "... wa-qāla ākharūn hiya qarābat kull qurb, muḥriman kāna aw ghayrahu, dhakarahu baʻḍ al-kubarāʼ an yujāwira al-aqribāʼ, fa-inna al-mujāwarah tarfaʻu al-ḥurmah wa-al-haybah, fa-tufḍī ilá al-taqāṭuʻ ..."

record.title: Treatises on Islamic law according to the Shāfiʻī and Ḥanafī traditions : manuscript.
record.note: Title of Mukhtaṣar min Sharḥ al-Raḥbīyah fī al-farāʼiḍ from folio 2b.
Title of al-Fatāwá al-Zaynīyah fī fiqh al-Ḥanafīyah from folio 21a.

Incipit of Mukhtaṣar min Sharḥ al-Raḥbīyah fī al-farāʼiḍ: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn wa-sallam. Wa-hādhā mukhtaṣar min Sharḥ al-Raḥbīyah fī al-farāyiḍ, nafaʻa Allāh bi-hi. Āmīn. Bāb asbāb al-mīrāth. Iʻlam anna al-aṣl fī aḥkām al-mīrāth qabla al-ijmāʻ qawluhu taʻālá: Yūṣīkum Allāh fī awlādikum lil-dhakar mithl ḥaẓẓ al-unthayayn. Wa-al-unthá yalīhā walad al-kalālah. Wa-ikhtalafa al-riwāyāt fī sabab nuzūl hādhihi al-āyāt ..."
Secundo folio of Mukhtaṣar min Sharḥ al-Raḥbīyah fī al-farāʼiḍ: wa-kāna alladhī yajibu ʻalá ẓāhir al-āyah.

Incipit of al-Fatāwá al-Zaynīyah fī fiqh al-Ḥanafīyah: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá khayr khalqihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-faqīr Aḥmad, laṭafa Allāh bi-hi: Inna hādhihi asʼilah ajāb fīhā al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ajall, qudwat al-ʻulamāʼ, rāfiʻ aʻlām al-fuḍalāʼ, ʻumdat al-anām wa-minhāj al-Islām ... Mawlānā wālidī al-Shaykh Zayn al-shahīr nasabuhu al-karīm bi-Ibn Nujaym al-Ḥanafī, ʻāmalahu Allāh bi-luṭfihi al-khafī, katabtuhā suʼālan baʻda suʼāl min ibtidāʼ amrī fī shahr Rabīʻ al-Awwal, sanat khams wa-sittīn wa-tisʻimiʼah, thumma raʼaytu an urattibahā ʻalá kutub al-fiqh al-mashhūrah, li-yasʹhula al-rujūʻ ilayhā wa-al-kashf ʻanhā, wa-ʻiddatuhā arbaʻumiʼah suʼāl wa-jawāb, wa-sammaytuhā 'al-Fatāwá al-Zaynīyah fī fiqh al-Ḥanafīyah' ..."
Secundo folio of al-Fatāwá al-Zaynīyah fī fiqh al-Ḥanafīyah: suʼāl wa-jawāb wa-sammaytuhā.

The manuscripts are in good naskh/ruqʻah and naskh scripts respectively, in black ink, on white paper (the second manuscript have some leaves in light blue color) ; headings, keywords and markings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: Statements by two readers, as follows: 1. "Naẓara fīhi al-faqīr ilá Mawlāh ʻazza shaʼnuhu wa-taʻālá ismuhu wa-jalla jalāluhu, al-Sayyid ʻUthmān [...], fī 15 Shn [Shaʻbān], sanat 1242 [14 March, 1827]." 2. "Qad naẓara fīhi al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr ilayhi taʻālá Muḥammad ibn al-Shaykh Mūsá al-Miṣrī fī 15 Shn [Shaʻbān], 42 [1242] [14 March, 1827]."
On folio 1a: An ownership statement: "Malakahu al-faqīr Muḥammad [...]."
On folio 2a: "Hādhā Kitāb fī ʻilm al-farāʼiḍ min Sharḥ al-Raḥbīyah, wa-fīhi asʼilah ajāb bi-hā al-Shaykh al-Imām al-shahīr bi-Ibn Nujaym."
On folio 2a: An ownership statement: "Malakahu Naṣr Allāh al-Nābulusī al-Baytāwī. Thamanuhu rubʻ Riyāl."
Folios 18-19 are blank.
The collector of the fatwas of "al-Fatāwá al-Zaynīyah fī fiqh al-Ḥanafīyah" states in the incipit that his father, Ibn Nujaym, died on Wednesday morning, 8 Rajab, 970 Hijrī (13 March, 1563).

Colophon of Mukhtaṣar min Sharḥ al-Raḥbīyah fī al-farāʼiḍ: No colophon; text ends abruptly with: "... Bāb al-jidd maʻa al-ikhwah wa-al-akhawāt. Iʻlam anna hādhā al-bāb khaṭir. Jāʼa fī Ḥadīth Ajraʼukum ..."

Colophon of al-Fatāwá al-Zaynīyah fī fiqh al-Ḥanafīyah: No colophon; text ends abruptly with: "... wa-ḥukm al-Ḥanafī bi-ṣiḥḥat al-nikāḥ lā yamnaʻu al-Mālikī, innamā yamnaʻuhu al-Ḥanafī li-ʻadam wuqūʻ al-ṭalāq baʻdamā tanāzaʻa fīhi al-khaṣmān ..."

record.title: 880-02 Fatʹḥ al-qarīb al-mujīb fī sharḥ alfāẓ al-Taqrīb : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Qāsim al-Ghazzī.
record.note: First leaf missing; starts with "... murādih, wa-uṣallī wa-usallimu ʻalá afḍal khalqihi Muḥammad sayyid al-mursalīn, al-qāʼil 'Man yurid Allāh bi-hi khayran yufaqqihhu fī al-dīn', wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbih, muddata dhikr al-dhākirīn wa-sahw al-ghāfilīn. Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhā kitāb fī ghāyat al-ikhtiṣār wa-al-tahdhīb, wa-ḍaʻtuhu ʻalá al-kitāb al-musammá bi-al-Taqrīb li-yantfiʻa bi-hi al-muḥtāj min al-mubtadiʼīn li-furūʻ al-sharīʻah wa-al-dīn ... Wa-iʻlam innahu yūjad fī baʻḍ nusakh hādhā al-kitāb, fī ghayr khuṭbatihi, tāratan bi-al-Taqrīb, wa-tāratan bi-al-Ikhtiṣār, fa-li-dhālika sammaytuhu bi-ismayn, aḥaduhā "Fatʹḥ al-qarīb al-mujīb fī sharḥ alfāẓ al-Taqrīb", wa-al-thānī "al-Qawl al-mukhtār fī sharḥ Ghāyat al-ikhtiṣār" ..."

On folio 239b, an endowment statement by al-Ḥājj Sālim Jumʻah: "Waqafa wa-ḥabasa wa-taṣaddaqa lillāh taʻālá al-Ḥājj Sālim Jumʻah, waqfan ṣaḥīḥan, lā yubāʻu wa-lā yūhabu wa-lā yurhanu, fa-man baddalahu baʻdamā samiʻahu, fa-innamā ismuhu [ithmuhu] ʻalá alladhīna yubaddilūnahu. Inna Allāha samīʻun ʻalīm. Wa-waqafahu ʻalá ṭalabat al-ʻilm, wa-jaʻala al-naẓar fīhi lil-Shaykh Yāsīn Makhlūf [probably: Makhlūf, Yāsīn, active 1876]. Wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-dhālika. Taḥrīran fī 9 Rabīʻ Awwal, sanat 1277 [25 September, 1860]. [Seal of Sālim Jumʻah]."

Author's colophon: "... Wa-hādhā ākhir sharḥ al-kitāb wa-ghāyat al-ikhtiṣār bi-lā iṭnāb, fa-al-ḥamdu li-Rabbinā al-munʻim al-wahhāb. Wa-qad allaftuhu ʻājilan fī muddah yasīrah. Wa-al-marjū mimman iṭṭalaʻa fīhi ʻalá hafwah, ṣaghīrah aw kabīrah an yuṣliḥahā ... Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālhi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Tamm."

Translation of the author's colophon: "This is the end of the commentary on the book, very briefly and without lengthiness. Praise be to our abundantly giving Lord. I wrote it quickly in a short time. I request those who find in it an error, whether small or large, to correct it ... May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and companions and grant them abundant peace. Praise be to God the Lord of the Universe. It is completed."

record.title: 880-02 Fatʹḥ al-qarīb al-mujīb fī sharḥ alfāẓ al-Taqrīb : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Qāsim al-Ghazzī.
record.note: The codex is wrapped in a sheet which is split and serves as end paper. It has textile advertisements in Arabic, Ottoman Turkish and other languages, with the seals of J.S. Jackson of Manchester (England).
On the margins of some leaves are endowment statemets, as follows: "Waqf bi-Ruwāq al-Shuwām", and "Waqf lillāh taʻālá bi-Ruwāq al-Shuwām".

Author's colophon: "Wa-hādhā ākhir sharḥ al-kitāb Ghāyat al-ikhtiṣār, fa-al-ḥamdu li-Rabbinā al-munʻim al-wahhāb. Wa-qad allaftuhu ʻājilan fī muddah yasīrah. Wa-al-marjū mimman iṭṭalaʻa fīhi ʻalá hafwah, ṣaghīrah aw kabīrah an yuṣliḥahā, in lam yakun al-jawāb ʻanhā ʻalá wajh ḥasan ..."

Translation of the author's colophon: "This is the end of the commentary on the book "Ghāyat al-ikhtiṣār". Praise be to our abundantly giving Lord. I wrote it quickly in a short time. I request those who find in it an error, whether small or large, to correct it, if it is not well-discussed ..."

Copyist's colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat hādhihi al-nuskhah al-mubārakah allatī ʻamma nafʻuhā fī sāyir al-bilād yawm al-Khamīs al-mubārak fī ākhir yawm min shahr Rabīʻ al-Awwal, wa-dhālika bi-tārīkh sanat 1151, alf wa-miʼah wāḥid wa-khamsīn min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām. Wa-Allāh aʻlam. Wa-ḥasbunā Allāh wa-niʻma al-wakīl ..."

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "This blessed copy, whose benefit has spread in all countries, was completed on blessed Thursday, the last day of Rabīʻ al-Awwal, 1151 [18 July, 1738] of the Hijrah of the Prophet, may the best of prayer and peace be upon Him. God is more knowledgeable. God suffices us, He is the best advocate ..."

record.title: 880-02 Kifāyat al-ṭālib al-rabbānī li-Risālat Ibn Abī Zayd al-Qayrawānī : manuscript / Abū al-Ḥasan al-Mālikī.
record.note: At head of folio 1b: A decorative design in black and red.
On folio 222a: A table of contents (in twenty-one chapters).

Author's colophon: "Qāla muʼallifuhu, raḥimahu Allāh: Wa-qad faraghtu min taʼlīf hādhā al-Sharḥ sābiʻ ʻashar Dhī al-Ḥijjah al-ḥarām, sanat 925, khams wa-ʻishrīn wa-tisʻimiʼah. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Intahá."

Translation of the author's colophon: "Its author, may God have mercy upon him, said: I finished writing this commentary on 17 Dhī al-Ḥijjah, 925 [20 December, 1519]. Praise be to God, Lord of the Universe. It is completed."

Copyist's colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min khaṭṭ hādhā al-sharḥ al-laṭīf bi-yawm al-Sabt, fī awwal shahr Jumād Thānī, sanat [...] al-ḥaqīr Muḥammad Ḥasan, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-man kāna sababan ilayhi, wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "This elegant commentary was copied on Saturday, the beginning of the month of Jumād Thānī, the year [...], by the miserable Muḥammad Ḥasan, May God pardon him, his parents, those who reach out to him and all Muslims. Amen."

record.title: 880-03 al-Juzʼ al-awwal min Sharḥ al-Mukhtaṣar li-Abī al-Ḍiyāʼ Khalīl ibn Isḥāq al-Jundī : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Kharshī.
record.note: On folio 1a: "al-Juzʼ al-awwal min Sharḥ Mawlānā wa-Ustādhinā al-ʻAllāmah al-baḥr al-fahhāmah al-Shaykh Muḥammad al-Kharshī, nafaʻanā Allāh wa-al-Muslimīn bi-barakātihi. Āmīn."

On folio 1b: Two ownership statements, as follows: "Malakahu al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad ibn al-Ḥājj ʻĀmir al-Salamūnī, yawm al-Ithnayn al-mubārak, rābiʻ Rabīʻ Ākhir, sanat 1237 [29 December, 1821]". "Mulk al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá Muḥammad ibn Ḥasan ibn al-Ḥājj Ḥasan Abū Yūnus al-ʻAzzāwī."
On folio 499b: An ownership statement: "Nuqila ilá mulk al-faqīr Muḥammad ibn al-Shaykh Ḥasan ibn al-Ḥājj Ḥasan Yūnus."

Colophon: "Tamma al-juzʼ al-mubārak bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih wa-ḥusn tawfīqih, wa-in shāʼa Allāh yalīhi mā baʻduhu, ʻalá yad afqar al-ʻibād wa-aḥwajihim ilá ʻafw rabbihi al-qadīr, al-faqīr Aḥmad ibn al-Shaykh Sulaymān al-Shalshalmūnī al-Azʹharī, ghafara Allāh la-hu ... Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat hādhā al-juzʼ al-mubārak yawm al-Ithnayn, thāmin ʻashar Muḥarram al-ḥarām, min shuhūr sanat 1130 [22 December, 1717]. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Āmīn. Āmīn. Tamm."

Translation of the colophon: "The blessed part is completed by the praise of God, His help and His abundant benevolence. It will be, God willing, followed by the remaining parts, by the poorest of the servants and the most needy to the forgiveness of his Almighty Lord, the poor Aḥmad ibn al-Shaykh Sulaymān al-Shalshalmūnī al-Azʹharī, may God pardon him ... This blessed part was copied on Monday, 18 Muḥarram, 1130 [22 December, 1717]. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions and grant them peace. Amen. Amen. It is completed."

record.title: 880-02 Nawādir al-Qalyūbī : manuscript / Shihāb al-Dīn Aḥmad ibn Aḥmad al-Qalyūbī.
record.note: On folios 1b-11a: A table of contents listing the titles of two-hundred and seventeen anecdotes: "Fihrist Nawādir al-Ustādh al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah al-Shaykh Aḥmad al-Qalyūbī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá."

On folio 11a: "Tarjamat muʼallif hādhā al-kitāb. Huwa Mawlānā al-Ustādh al-Qalyūbī, raḥimahu Allāh. Hādhihi Nawādir Mawlānā al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, al-ḥabr al-baḥr al-qudwah al-fahhāmah, al-Ustādh al-Shaykh Aḥmad Shihāb al-Dīn al-Qalyūbī, raḥimahu Allāh raḥmatan wāsiʻah, wa-amaddanā min imdādātihi al-nāfiʻah wa-al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. M."
On some leaves: An endowment statement: "Waqf lillāh taʻālá."
Colophon: No colophon; text ends with: "... wa-ammā al-mamsūkhūn min banī Ādam fa-hum tisʻah wa-ʻishrūn ..."

record.title: 880-02 al-Taʻrīfāt : manuscript / ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Sayyid al-Sharīf al-Jurjānī.
record.note: In good naskh/taʻlīq script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red; many notes and comments on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: An endowment statement: "Awqafa hādhā al-kitāb Ibrāhīm Afandī al-Mudarris ʻalá ṭalabat al-ʻilm wa-yuraddu ilá makānihi bi-al-khzānah."
On the upper margin of some leaves: Endowment statements: "Waqf lillāh taʻālá".
Between folios 9b and 10a: A folded slip of proverbs and wisdom literature in Arabic poetry and prose.
On folios 66a-66b: Statements and calculations, in Ottoman Turkish, about the division of inheritance.
On folio 67b: Fatwas (legal opinions), in Ottoman Turkish, in the form of question and answer, about miscellaneous issues.

Colophon: "Tammat bi-ʻawn al-Malik al-Wahhāb. Qad waqaʻa al-farāgh ʻan taswīd hādhihi al-nuskhah fī shahr Rabīʻ al-Awwal, fī yawm Shanbah, fī waqt al-ẓuhr, ʻalá yad ʻabd al-ḍaʻīf Muḥammad ibn Yūsuf, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-jamīʻ al-muʼminīn."

Translation of the colophon: "It is completed by the help of the Generous King. This copy was written in the month of Rabīʻ al-Awwal, on Saturday noon [date of the day and year not mentioned], by the feeble servant Muḥammad ibn Yūsuf, may God forgive him, his parents and all believers."

record.title: 880-02 al-Ifṣāḥ fī ʻaqd al-nikāḥ : manuscript / Ḥusayn ibn Muḥammad al-Maḥallī.
record.note: On folios 1b-6b are miscellaneous fatwas from different sources.
Text folios 7b-30a.

Colophon: "Tammat al-nuskhah al-mubārakah yawm al-Ithnayn, arbaʻata ʻashar khalat min shahr Allāh al-Muḥarram, min shuhūr sanat 1278, ʻalá yad al-faqīr al-muʻtarif bi-al-dhanb wa-al-taqṣīr Ismāʻīl al-shahīr bi-Banī al-Ṣaghīr, kāna Allāh fī ʻawnihi. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon: "The blessed copy was completed on Monday, 14 Muḥarram, 1278 [22 July, 1861] by the poor who confesses his sin and inequity, Ismāʻīl al-shahīr bi-Banī al-Ṣaghīr, may God help him. Amen."

record.title: 880-03 Sharḥ al-Bahjah al-Wardīyah : manuscript / Zakarīyā ibn Muḥammad al-Anṣārī.
record.note: On folio 1a an endowment statement: "Awqafa hādhā al-kitāb lillāh taʻālá Aḥmad al-Bukhārī."
On folio 1a in pencil: "Sharḥ al-Bahjah al-Wardīyah."
Author's colophon: "Qāla muʼallifuhu, raḥimahu Allāh: Wa-kāna tamāmuhu yawm al-Sabt, khāmis ʻashar Shawwāl, sanat sabʻ wa-sittīn wa-thamānimiʼah."
Translation of the author's colophon: "Its author, may God have mercy upon him, said: It was completed on Saturday, 15 Shawwāl, 867 [12 July, 1463]."

Copyist's colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābatihi fī al-yawm al-mubārak al-thālith min Jumādá al-Awwal, sanat khams wa-arbaʻīn [wa-alf]. Wa-tamma ʻalá yad kātibih ʻAbd al-Qādir ibn ʻAlī al-Bardalī [?], ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-mashāyikhihi wa-al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Wa-ḥasbunā Allāh wa-niʻma al-wakīl."

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "The copy was written on the blessed third day of Jumādá al-Awwal, the year 45 [1045 of the Hijrah] [15 October, 1635], by ʻAbd al-Qādir ibn ʻAlī al-Bardalī [?], may God pardon him, his parents, his masters and the Muslims. Amen. Amen. Amen. Praise be to God. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions and grant them peace."
