record.title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyah ʻalá matn al-Sullam : manuscript / Ibrāhīm ibn Muḥammad al-Bājūrī.
record.note: On folio 1a: "Hādhā Ḥāshiyat al-Shaykh al-Bājūrī ʻalá matn al-Sullam."
Text folios 1a-26b; folios 27-30 are blank.

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with: "... inna al-mūṣil ilá al-taṣdīq yusammá ḥujjah, maʻa annahum ʻuqalāʼ, wa-kadhā yustafādu min kalām al-Shaykh al-Malawī, illā annahu qāla baʻda an fassara al-ʻuqalāʼ bi-arbāb hādhā ..."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Sullam al-murawnaq fī ʻilm al-manṭiq : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Muḥammad al-Akhḍarī.
record.note: On folio 1a: "Kitāb al-Akhḍarī ʻalá al-Sullam al-murawnaq fī ʻilm al-manṭiq nufiʻnā bi-hi. Āmīn."

On folio 1a: Three ownership statements, as follows. 1. "Mulk al-faqīr Muḥammad Ruzayq (Zurayq) ... al-Mālikī, ʻufiya ʻanhu. Āmīn." 2. "Nuqila bi-al-shirāʼ ilá mulk al-faqīr Muḥammad al-Shabrāwī al-Shāfiʻī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi. Āmīn." 3. "Nuqila bi-al-shirāʼ ilá mulk al-faqīr Sālim Ḥasan al-Jurjāwī al-Shāfiʻī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayn [wa-li-wālidayhi] wa-li-kāffat al-Muslimīn. Āmīn."

Colophon: No colophon; text ends abruptly with: "... wa-lafẓ al-abrāj jamʻ qillah, wa-al-murād al-kathrah, li-annahā ithnay [ithnā] ʻashara burjan, taqṭaʻu al-Shams kull yawm darajah, wa-taqṭaʻu al-falak fī sanah wa-yakūnu ṭūl al-maylayn wa-qiṣaruhumā bi-ḥasab al-mayl al-Shimālī wa-al-Janūbī li-ittisāʻ al-qaws wa-ḍīqihi fī al-āfāq al-māʼilah allatī la-hā ʻirḍ, wa-ammā al-Qamar fa-yuqīmu fī kull burj laylatayn wa-thulthan wa-yaqṭaʻu al-falak fī ..."

record.title: 880-02 al-Lumʻah al-Māridīnīyah fī sharḥ al-Yāsamīnīyah : manuscript / Badr al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad Sibṭ al-Mārdīnī.
record.note: The manuscript is wrapped in a folded sheet of paper taken probably from a ledger for recording agricultural data, and serves as a cover.
On folio 2a: "Hādhā Sharḥ al-Yāsamīnīyah fī ʻilm al-jabr wa-al-muqābalah lil-Shaykh al-Imām Sibṭ al-Māridīnī, raḥimahu Allāh. Āmīn."

On folio 2a: Two verses of poetry which gives in "ḥisāb al-jummal" (alphabetical reckoning) the date of birth, death and age of the four Sunnī Islamic law scholars: Abū Ḥanīfah, Anas ibn Mālik, Ibn Ḥanbal and al-Shāfiʻī), and four verses attributed to al-Imām al-Shāfiʻī about giving his knowledge to those who deserve it.
Text folios 2b-12b.
Colophon: "Wa-hādhā ākhir mā qaṣadnāh min hādhā al-taʻlīq. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah. Tamma naqluhā."
Translation of the colophon: "This is the end of what we aimed at from this commentary. Praise be to God alone. The copy is completed."

record.title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyah ʻalá Sharḥ Īsāghūjī : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Ibrāhīm al-Dalajī.
record.note: On folio 1a: "Hādhihi Ḥāshiyat al-Dalajī ʻalá Shaykh al-Islām fī al-manṭiq."

Colophon: "Wakāna al-farāgh min kitābatihā nahār al-Arbiʻāʼ li-sitt baqayn min shahr Ṣafar al-Khayr, sanat sabʻ wa-miʼatayn wa-alf, ʻalá yad al-faqīr Ibrāhīm al-Ṭūkhī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-mashāyikhihi wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon: "The copy was written on Wednesday, six days remaining from the month of Ṣafar, 1207 [11 October, 1792], by Aḥmad al-Ṣabbāgh ibn Ibrāhīm ibn al-Ṭūkhī, may God forgive him, his parents, his masters and all Muslims. Amen."

record.title: 880-02 Akhbār Ibrāhīm ibn al-Mahdī wa-ukhtihi ʻUlayyah bint al-Mahdī wa-ashʻāruhumā : manuscript / jamʻ Abū Bakr Muḥammad ibn Yaḥyá al-Ṣūlī.
record.note: On the back of the front cover: "D. B. Macdonald, 143 Sigourney Street, Hartford, Conn., u.s.a." (probably Professor Duncan Black Macdonald, 1863-1943, of Hartford Theological Seminary)
On folio 1a: "Akhbār Ibrāhīm ibn al-Mahdī wa-ukhtihi ʻUlayyah bint al-Mahdī wa-ashʻāruhumā, jamʻ Abū Bakr Muḥammad ibn Yaḥyá al-Ṣūlī, ʻufiya ʻanh."

On folio 25b, in a different hand, are written two verses of poetry attributed to Ḥātim al-Ṭāʼī (lived in the last half of the 6th century), and two verses attributed to al-Ṣalāḥ al-Ṣafadī (Khalīl ibn Aybak, approximately 1297-1363), in which he quotes the first hemistich of Ḥātim al-Ṭāʼī's verse, and a list of books housed at an unnamed location.
Colophon: "Hādhā ākhir shiʻr Abī al-Qāsim Isḥāq ibn al-Mahdī. Wa-Allāh aʻlam. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

Translation of the colophon: "This is the end of the poetry of Abū al-Qāsim Isḥāq ibn al-Mahdī. God is more knowledgeable. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and companions and grant them peace."

record.title: 880-03 Dīwān Ibn al-Fāriḍ : manuscript / edited by ʻAlī Sibṭ al-Shaykh Sharaf al-Dīn ʻUmar ibn al-Fāriḍ.
record.note: On folio 1a: "Hādhā Dīwān al-Ustādh al-ʻārif bi-rabbihi al-walī al-zāhid, Mawlānā wa-ʻazīzinā Sayyid ʻUmar ibn al-Fāriḍ, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."
On folio 77b: Eight verses of poetry (could not be identified) with the date 995 (1586/1587).
Colophon: "Tamma al-Dīwān bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih wa-ḥusn tawfīqih. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābatihi 13 Shawwāl, sanat 1270."
Translation of the colophon: "The Dīwān [Collected poems] was completed by the praise of God, His help and His abundant benevolence. Copied on 13 Shawwāl, 1270 [9 July, 1854]."

record.title: 880-02 Kanz al-dhakhāʼir wa-hadīyat al-musāfir ilá al-nūr al-sāfir : manuscript / Jalāl al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad ibn ʻAlī al-Maḥallī al-Samannūdī al-Shāfiʻī al-Rifāʻī.
record.note: On folio 1a: "Kitāb Sharḥ al-Tāʼīyah lil-Subkī, tusammá al-Dhakhāʼir wa-hadīyat al-musāfir ilá al-nūr al-sāfir. Taʼlīf al-Shaykh al-Imām, al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah muftī al-Muslimīn, baqīyat al-salaf al-ṣāliḥ Abī ʻAbd Allāh Jalāl al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī al-Maḥallī al-Samannūdī al-Shāfiʻī al-Rifāʻī. Āmīn."

The "Tāʼīyah" of al-Subkī starts with: Tayaqqaẓ li-nafsin ʻan hudāhā tawallati // wa-bādir fa-fī al-taʼkhīr aʻẓamu khaybatī. And ends with: Ka-dhāka ḍajīʻāka alladhāni takaffalā // bi-dafʻi dhawī zayghin wa-ḥifẓ al-Sharīʻati.

Colophon: "Tammat al-qaṣīdah wa-sharḥuhā bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnihi wa-ḥusn tawfīqih. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-ṣadīqihi [?], ʻalá yad kātibihā, afqar al-ʻibād li-ʻafw rabbihi al-karīm al-jawwād, al-faqīr Mḥfūẓ ibn Ḥijāzī al-Khaṭīb al-Qimnī al-Shāfiʻī al-Shādhilī, ghafara Allāh la-hu. Tārīkh, fī 22 Dhī al-Qaʻdah, 1173. [6 July, 1760]."

Translation of the colophon: "The poem and its commentary are completed by the praise of God, His help and His abundant benevolence. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, His family, his companions and his friend [?]. Copied by the poorest of the servants to the forgiveness of his generous and benevolent Lord, the poor Mḥfūẓ ibn Ḥijāzī al-Khaṭīb al-Qimnī al-Shāfiʻī al-Shādhilī, may God pardon him. Dated, 22 Dhī al-Qaʻdah, 1173 [6 July, 1760]."

record.title: 880-02 al-Minaḥ al-Makkīyah fī sharḥ al-Hamzīyah : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn Ḥajar al-Haythamī.
record.note: On folio 1a: "Kitāb al-Minaḥ al-Makkīyah fī sharḥ al-Hamzīyah lil-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah Shaykh al-Islām al-Shaykh Ibn Ḥajar al-Haythamī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá wa-nafaʻanā bi-hi wa-bi-ʻulūmihi fī al-dunyā wa-al-ākhirah. Āmīn."

On folio 1a, two ownership statements, as follows: "al-Ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah. Min niʻam Allāh subḥānahu wa-taʻālá ʻalá ʻabdihi al-faqīr ilayhi subḥānuhu ʻazza shānuhu, ʻAbd al-Ghanī al-Qādirī al-Biqāʻī mawlidan [seal]." "Fī nawbat afqar al-wará ilá ʻafw rabbihi Sulaymān ibn Aḥmad al-shahīr bi-Ibn Jaʻfar Āghā, ʻafā Allāh ʻanhu wa-khatama la-hu bi-al-ḥusná, fī 20 JĀ [Jumād Awwal], sanat 1287 [18 August, 1870], bi-thaman qadruhu 65."
The "Burdah" of al-Būṣīrī starts with: Kayfa tarqá ruqīyaka al-anbiyāʼu // yā samāʼan mā ṭāwalathā samāʼu.

On folio 4a: "Wa-sammaytuhu al-Minaḥ al-Makkīyah fī sharḥ al-Hamzīyah. Thumma balaghanī anna al-nāẓim sammāhā "Umm al-Qurá" tashbīhan la-hā bi-Makkah, bi-jāmiʻ annahā ḥawat bi-ṭarīq al-taṣrīḥ wa-al-īmāʼ ʻalá mā fī akthar al-madāʼiḥ al-Nabawīyah, wa-ḥīnaʼithin sammaytuhā 'Afḍal al-qirá li-qurrá [qurrā] Umm al-Qurá'."

On the margin of folio 303b, an ownership statement, as follows: "al-Ḥamdu lillāh waḥdahu. Min niʻam Allāh subḥānahu wa-taʻālá ʻalá ʻabdihi al-faqīr ilayhi subḥānahu wa-taʻālá Muḥammad al-Ḥanafī [... ...], ʻufiya ʻanh. [seal]."
On the margin of folio 303b, a note states that the poem of al-Būṣīri is in 455 verses: "ʻAdad abyāt al-Hamzīyah 455. Raḥima Allāh muʼallifahā."

On the margin of folio 303b, the date of death of the commentator, Ibn Ḥajar al-Haythamī, is given as Monday morning, 23 Rajab, 974 (13 February, 1567), and the date of composition of the commentary on the midnight of Friday, 2 Jumādá al-Ūlá, 966 (20 February, 1559): "Tārīkh wafāt al-shāriḥ ḍaḥwat al-Ithnayn, thālith ʻishrīn Rajab, sanat arbaʻ wa-sabʻīn wa-tisʻimiʼah, ṣulliya ʻalayhi al-ʻaṣr ʻinda al-Multazam al-Sharīf wa-dufina bi-al-Muʻallā, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu wa-raḥimahu. Āmīn. Qāla raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá: Waqaʻa al-farāgh min taṣnīfihi niṣfa laylat al-Jumʻah, thānī Jumādá al-Ūlá, sanat sitt wa-sittīn wa-tisʻimiʼah, raḥimahu Allāh. Āmīn."

Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min naskhihā tāsiʻ Dhī al-Qaʻdah li-sanat sabʻ wa-thalāthīn wa-alf min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā al-ṣalāh, ʻalá yad al-ʻabd al-faqīr al-rājī ʻafawa rabbihi wa-maghfiratah Taqī al-Dīn ibn al-Nūrī Maḥmūd al-shahīr bi-al-Ṣāliḥī, ʻafá Allāh ʻanhumā, wa-ʻan man naẓara fīhi wa-daʻā la-humā bi-al-ghufrān wa-lil-muʼminīn ajmaʻīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh."

Translation of the colophon: "The copy was completed on 9 Dhī al-Qaʻdah, 1037 of the Hijrah of the Prophet, may prayer be upon Him, by the poor servant who hopes for the pardoning and forgiveness of his Lord, Taqī al-Dīn ibn al-Nūrī Maḥmūd al-shahīr bi-al-Ṣāliḥī, may both [he and his father] be forgiven, and he who reads the copy and requests God to forgive both of them and to forgive all believers. Praise be to God."

record.title: Note : to Richard Bull, ca. 1789 September.
record.note: Dated approximately by the reference to the second edition of Pinkerton's An essay on medals, 1789. See: Yale edition of Horace Walpole's correspondence.

record.title: Album of embroidered fabric samples.
880-02 al-Ṣalawāt al-birrīyah fī al-ṣalāh ʻalá khayr al-barīyah : manuscript / Muṣṭafá ibn Kamāl al-Dīn al-Bakrī al-Ṣiddīqī.
record.note: On folio 1a: "Hādhihi al-Ṣalawāt al-birrīyah fī al-ṣalāh ʻalá khayr al-barīyah lil-Sayyid al-ḥaqīqī Muṣṭafá al-Bakrī al-Ṣiddīqī sibṭ al-Ḥasanīyah ʻalá al-kamāl wa-al-ḥamd lillāh ʻalá kull ḥāl."
On folio 3a: "Wa-qad warda al-idhn bi-tasmiyat hādhihi al-ṣalawāt al-Nabawīyah 'al-Ṣalāh al-birrīyah fī al-ṣalāh ʻalá khayr al-barīyah'."

Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat hādhihi al-nuskhah al-sharīfah yawm al-Thulāth, ʻashrun khalat min shahr Muḥarram al-ḥarām alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat alf wa-miʼatayn thamāniyah wa-sittīn, sanat 1268. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, al-Nabbī al-Ummī, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

Translation of the colophon: "This noble copy was completed on Tuesday, 10 Muḥarram, 1268 [5 November, 1851]. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad the Illiterate Prophet, his family and his companions and grant them peace."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Sullam al-murawnaq fī ʻilm al-manṭiq : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd al-Fattāḥ al-Mullawī.
record.note: On folio 95a: Two ownership statements, as follows: "Hādhā mulk al-Sayyid ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Dimashqī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidihi wa-li-kull al-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn, bi-jāh al-Amīn. Āmīn." "Thumma intaqala bi-al-shirāʼ al-sharʻī ilá mulk ʻAbd Allāh al-Ṭarābulusī al-ʻUmarī."

Colophon: "Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Wa-Allāh al-muwaffiq lil-ṣawāb, wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ wa-al-maʼāb. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá man lā nabī baʻdah. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon: "Praise be to God, the Lord of the Universe. May peace be upon our Master Muḥammad, his family and all his companions. God is the granter of truth, to Him is the reference and returning. May God pray on the Seal of the Prophets. Amen."

record.title: 880-03 al-Maṭlaʻ : Sharḥ Īsāghūjī fī al-manṭiq : manuscript / Zakarīyā ibn Muḥammad al-Anṣārī.
record.note: On folio 1a: "Kitāb al-Maṭlaʻ, Sharḥ Īsāghūjī fī al-manṭiq, taʼlīf al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah Zakarīyā al-Anṣārī, taghammadahu Allāh bi-raḥmatih, wa-aʻāda ʻalaynā min barakātihi. Āmīn."

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with: "... li-anna al-kullīyatayn qad yakdhibān, ka-qawlinā: Kull insān kātib, wa-lā shayʼ min al-insān bi-kātib. Wa-al-juzʼīyatayn qad yaṣduqān, kaqawlinā: Baʻḍ al-insān laysa bi-kātib. Wa-al-naqīḍān lā yajtamiʻān wa-lā yartafiʻān. Wa-hādhān al-mithālān lil-jumlatayn. Wa-mithāl ..."

record.title: 880-02 Mukhtaṣar fī ʻilm al-ḥisāb : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Qādir ibn ʻAlī al-Sakhāwī.
record.note: On front cover: "Matn al-Sakhāwīyah fī ʻilm al-ḥisāb."

On folio 1a: "Hādhā Kitāb Matn al-Sakhāwīyah lil-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, al-baḥr al-fahhāmah, al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Qādir ibn ʻAlī al-Sakhāwī al-Shāfiʻī, ghafara Allāh la-humā wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn. Āmīn."

On folio 10b: An anonymous treatise on arithmetic and calculation, in fifteen verses, by the same copyist, starts with: Lil-ḥalli bābun ḥifẓuhu muhimmu // wa-nafʻuhu yā dhā al-ḥijā yaʻimmu. And ends with: Thumma ikhtabir bi-ḍarbika al-aḍlāʻā // fī baʻḍihā fa-innahu qad shāʻā.

Colophon: "Wa-hādhā ākhir mā qayyadnāh wa-aradnāh. Tamma kitābatan ʻalá yad afqar al-ʻibād wa-aḥwajuhum ilayh ghafran wa-sitran, Ismāʻīl ibn al-Shaykh al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, al-Shaykh ʻAlī al-ʻAzīzī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayh wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Sanat 1168."

Translation of the colophon: "This is the end of what we wrote and what we wanted. Copied by the poorest of the poor and the neediest to the forgiveness and protection of God, Ismāʻīl son of the learned Shaykh ʻAlī al-ʻAzīzī, may God forgive him, his parents and all Muslims. Amen. In the year 1168 [1754 or 1755]."

record.title: 880-02 al-Aḍwāʼ al-bahijah fī ibrāz daqāʼiq al-Munfarijah : manuscript / Zakarīyā ibn Muḥammad al-Anṣārī.
record.note: On folio 1a: "Kitāb al-Aḍwāʼ al-bahijah fī ibrāz daqāʼiq al-Munfarijah, jamʻ Mawlānā, Shaykh mashāyikh al-Islām, qāḍī quḍāt al-Muslimīn, Abī Yaḥyá Zakarīyā al-Anṣārī al-Shāfiʻī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá. Āmīn."

On folio 1a: "Fāʼidah fī iʻrāb 'Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm'" (in ten lines); four verses of poetry attributed to al-Imām al-Shāfiʻī (about travel and its benefits); "Fāʼidah: Maktūb ʻalá sayf Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam ..."

Colophon: "Qāla muʼallifuhu ... Tamma al-sharḥ al-mubārak bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnihi fī ḥādī ʻashar Dhī al-Ḥijjah al-ḥarām, sanat iḥdá wa-thamānīn wa-thamānimiʼah, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbih, kullamā dhakarahu al-dhākirūn wa-ghafila ʻan dhikrihi al-ghāfilūn. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min taʻlīqihā fī yawm al-Khamīs al-mubārak, thālith yawm min shahr Rajab al-fard al-ḥarām, sanat 1074, arbaʻah wa-sabʻīn wa-alf min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá musharrifihā, afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah. Wa-ḥasbunā Allāh wa-niʻma al-wakīl, wa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻAlī al-ʻAẓīm."

Translation of the colophon: "Its author said ... The blessed commentary was completed by the praise of God and His help, on 11 Dhū al-Ḥijjah, 881 [5 April, 1477]. May prayer and peace be upon our Master Muḥammad, his family and His companions, whenever He is mentioned by those who remember and whenever He is not mentioned by those who do not remember. Copied on blessed Thursday, 3 Rajab, 1074 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [31 January, 1664], may the best of prayer and peace be upon Him. Praise be to God alone. God suffices us, He is the best advocate. There is no power nor might except in God, the Almighty, the All-powerful."

record.title: 880-03 Mawrid al-ẓamʼān fī marsūm khaṭṭ al-Qurʼān : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Kharrāz.
record.note: On folio 1a: "Hādhā Kitāb Mawrid al-ẓamʼān fī marsūm khaṭṭ al-Qurʼān lil-ʻAllāmah Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Kharrāzī, ʻalá al-tamām, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi fī al-dunyā wa-al-ākhirah. Āmīn."

On folio 1a: "Hādhā kitāb al-Kharrāzī fī al-rasm, lil-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah al-ʻumdah al-fahhāmah al-Ustadār Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn Ibrāhīm al-Umawī al-Sharīsī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá wa-nafaʻanā wa-al-Muslimīn min barakātihi. Āmīn."

Colophon: "Tamma wa-kamula ḍabṭ al-Kharrāzī bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih wa-ḥusn tawfīqih. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Intahá. Intahá. Intahá. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat hādhā al-kitāb al-mubārak fī yawm al-Jumʻah al-mubārak, thāmin ʻishrīn Ṣafar al-khayr, min shuhūr ʻām sanah [sic] sittah wa-thamānīn wa-alf min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām, sanat 1086, ʻalá yad al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn Ḥamad ibn Shihāb al-Dīn al-Ghayyāʼī [?] al-Sūhāy [?] al-Mālikī, ghafara Allāh la-hum ajmaʻīn bi-mannihi wa-karamih wa-khafī luṭfih. Āmīn. Wa-ḥasbunā Allāh wa-niʻma al-wakīl. Wa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻAlī al-ʻAẓīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon: "The adjustment of al-Kharrāzī is concluded and completed, by the praise of God, His help and His abundant benevolence. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and companions and grant them peace. It is ended. It is ended. It is ended. This blessed book was copied on blessed Friday, 28 Ṣafar, 1086 of the Hijrah of the Prophet, may the best of prayer and peace be upon Him, by the salve, the poor to God Almighty, Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn Ḥamad ibn Shihāb al-Dīn al-Ghayyāʼī [?] al-Sūhāy [?] al-Mālikī, may God forgive them all, by His benevolence, generosity and hidden graciousness. Amen. God suffices us. He is the best advocate. There is no power nor might except in God, the Powerful, the Almighty. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, His family and His companions and grant them peace. Amen."

record.title: 880-03 Nihāyat al-muḥtāj ilá sharḥ al-Minhāj : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad al-Ramlī.
record.note: On folio 1a: "Hādhā [... ... ...] lil-Shaykh al-Ramlī, taghammadahu Allāh bi-al-raḥmah wa-al-ruḍwān. Wa-ḥasbunā Allāh wa-niʻma al-wakīl. Āmīn."
Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with "... Faṣl fī bayān luzūm al-kitābah min jānib wa-jawāzuhā min ākhar wa-mā yatarattabu ʻalayhā ..."

record.title: 880-03 al-Juzʼ al-thānī min Sharḥ al-Nuqāyah : manuscript / al-Qāsim ibn ʻAbd Allāh ibn Quṭlūbughā.
record.note: On folio 1a: An index of contents (35 chapters).
On folio 1b: "Kitāb fiqh Ḥanafī."

On folio 1b: An ownership statement: "Fī 27 al-Ḥijjah, khitām ʻām 54, arbaʻah wa-khamsīn, akhadhtuhu min al-Shaykh Nūḥ al-Kutubī. al-Faqīr Muḥammad Wākid al-Ghazzī al-Ḥanafī al-Ḥusaynī al-ʻUmarī al-Azʹharī, ʻufiya ʻanhu. Āmīn."
At head of folio 2a: "al-Thānī min Sharḥ al-Nuqāyah lil-Shaykh Qāsim Quṭlubughā."
On folio 2a: An incantation against "al-araḍah" (paper-worms): "Iḥbis yā Kubaykij al-araḍah. Yā Ḥafīẓ. Yā Allāh. Yā Allāh. Yā Allāh."
On folio 2a: A quotation from "al-Badāʼiʻ" (probably "Badāʼiʻ al-ṣanāʼiʻ fī tartīb al-sharāʼiʻ" of Abū Bakr ibn Masʻūd al-Kāsānī (died 1191), on "Kafālat al-dayn" (security for debt).

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with "... wa-law ishtará rajulun shayʼan fa-qīla la-hu 'Innaka ishtarayta bi-thaman ghālin', fa-saʻá al-bāyiʻ ʻinda ẓālim wa-akhsarahu. In kāna ṣidqan lam yaḍman, wa-in qāla kadhiban ḍamin. Wa-fī mutafarriqāt sariqat al-Fatāwá al-Ẓahīrīyah: Rajulun iddaʻá ʻalá ākhar sariqat, wa-qaddamah ilá al-sulṭān, fa-ṭalaba al-sulṭān an yaḍribahu ḥattá yuqirra bi-al-sariqah, fa-ḍarabahu ..."

record.title: 880-03 al-Juzʼ al-thānī min Ḥāshiyat al-Ṣaʻīdī ʻalá Sharḥ al-Kharshī ʻalá Mukhtaṣar Khalīl : manuscript / ʻAlī ibn Aḥmad al-Ṣaʻīdī al-ʻAdwī.
record.note: On folio 1a: "Hādhā al-Juzʼ al-thānī min ḥāshiyat Ustādhinā wa-Shaykhinā al-Imām al-qudwah, ʻallāmat ʻaṣrihi, al-ʻāmil Shaykh al-Islām, al-Shaykh ʻAlī ibn Aḥmad al-Ṣaʻīdī al-ʻAdwī, ʻalá sharḥ Sayyidī Muḥammad al-Kharshī ʻalá matn al-ʻAllāmah Khalīl, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-him ajmaʻīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

On folio 1a: An ownership statement: "Mulk al-faqīr al-rājī min Mawlāhu al-isʻāf Sulaymān ibn Muḥammad al-ʻAllāf al-Mālikī al-Khalwatī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-lil-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn. Āmīn." Seal of Sulaymān ibn Muḥammad al-ʻAllāf.
Colophon: "Tamma al-Juzʼ al-thānī min Ḥāshiyat al-Shaykh ʻAlī al-Ṣaʻīdī ʻalá Sharḥ Sayyidī Khalīl. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

Translation of the colophon: "The second part of Ḥāshiyat al-Shaykh ʻAlī al-Ṣaʻīdī ʻalá Sharḥ Sayyidī Khalīl is completed. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, His family and companions and grant them peace."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ Umm al-barāhīn : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Manṣūr al-Hudhudī.
record.note: Folios 1b-2b are written in bluish ink, in a different hand and different kind of paper.
On folios 1b-2a: Different verses of poetry on friendship and the difficulty of finding true friends.
On folio 2a: "Hādhā Sharḥ al-Sanūsīyah Umm al-barāhīn li-Mawlānā al-Shaykh Muḥammad Manṣūr al-Hudhudī, nafaʻanā Allāh taʻālá bi-hi. Āmīn. Āmīn."

Colophon: "Tamm. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābatihi yawm al-Arbaʻ, ākhir sanat 1194, ʻalá yad al-faqīr ilá al-Malik al-Majīd, Ibrāhīm al-mulaqqab bi-Saʻīd, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-mashāyikhihi wa-li-ikhwānihi wa-lil-Muslimīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon: "It is completed. Copied on Wednesday, the end of the year 1194 [27 December, 1780] by the poor to the Glorious King, Ibrāhīm, nicknamed Saʻīd, may God forgive him, his parents, his masters, his brethren and the Muslims. Amen."

record.title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyah ʻalá sharḥ al-Sanūsī lil-ʻAqīdah al-ṣughrá : manuscript / ʻĪsá ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Saktānī.
record.note: On folios 1a: "Hādhihi ḥawāshin lil-Shaykh al-ʻAllāmah Sayyidī ʻĪsá al-Saktānī ʻalá al-muṣannif ʻalá al-Sanūsīyah fī ʻilm al-tawḥīd, nafaʻanā Allāh taʻālá wa-al-Muslimīn bi-barakatihimā ajmaʻīn. Āmīn. Āmīn."

Colophon: "Intahá mā wujida muqayyadan ʻan al-Imām, ʻalam al-aʻlām, khātimat al-muḥaqqiqīn, Abū Mahdī, Sayyidī ʻĪsá al-Saktānī, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi. Āmīn. Wa-ghafara li-kātibihā wa-li-muṭāliʻihā bi-jāh Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā Muḥammad, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam wa-ʻaẓẓam wa-sharraf. Āmīn. Āmīn. Tamm. Wa-kātibuhā Aḥmad ibn Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Bujayrimī baladan, al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon: "Concluded is what was found transmitted from al-Imām, the last authority, Abū Mahdī, Sayyidī ʻĪsá al-Saktānī, may God benefit us through him. Amen. By the intercession of our Master and Chieftain, Muḥammad, may God pray on him and grant him peace, exalt and honor him. Amen. Amen. It is completed by the copyist Aḥmad ibn Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Bujayrimī baladan, al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban, may God pardon him and his parents. Amen."

record.title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyah ʻalá sharḥ Tuḥfat al-ikhwān fī fann al-bayān : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī al-Jirjāwī.
record.note: Colophon: "Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, sayyid al-mursalīn, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi ajmaʻīn. Tammat."

Translation of the colophon: "Praise be to God Lord of the Universe. May prayer and peace be upon our Master Muḥammad, master of the messengers, and upon his family and all his companions. It is completed."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ Umm al-barāhīn : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Manṣūr al-Hudhudī.
record.note: On folio 1a: "Kitāb Sharḥ al-ʻaqīdah al-musammāh bi-Umm al-barāhīn lil-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah al-Hudhudī, ʻammat barakātuhu ʻalaynā ajmaʻīn. Yā Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Āmīn."
On folio 1a, in a crude hand, a paragraph on how to know what day of the week falls on the beginning of the Hijrī year.

Colophon: "Tammat bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih wa-ḥusn tawfīqih. Ghafar Allāh li-muʼallifihā wa-shāriḥihā wa-kātibihā wa-li-man kutibat la-hu wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Āmīn. Wa-ḥasbunā Allāh wa-niʻma al-wakīl. Wa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻAlī al-ʻAẓīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min hādhihi al-ʻaqīdah al-mubārakah yawm al-Arbiʻāʼ al-mubārak, thānī ʻishrīn Jumādá al-Ākhir, sanat 11?1 [third digit not clear, probably 1161 = 19 June, 1748]."

Translation of the colophon: "It is completed by the praise of God, His help and His abundant benevolence. May God forgive its author, its commentator, its copyist, for whom it was written and all Muslims. Praise be to God the Lord of the Universe. Amen. God suffices us, He is the best advocate. There is no power nor might except in God, the Most High and the Almighty. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions and grant them peace. This blessed treatise on doctrine was copied on blessed Wednesday, 22 Jumādá al-Ākhir, the year 11?1 [third digit not clear, probably 1161 = 19 June, 1748]."

record.title: 880-02 Shajarat al-kawn : manuscript / Muḥyī al-Dīn ibn al-ʻArabī.
record.note: On folio 1a: "Shajarat al-kawn lil-Shaykh al-akbar Sayyidī Muḥyī al-Dīn ibn al-ʻArabī, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu. Āmīn."

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with: "... wa-lā aʻrifu lil-aḥadīyah amadan, wa-lā lil-fardīyah ʻadadan. Qultu: Fa-ayna Isrāfīl? Qāl: Dhālika udkhila fī maktab al-taʻlīm yuṣāfiḥu bi-ṣafḥat wajhihi al-Lawḥ al-Maḥfūẓ wa-yastansikhu minhu mā huwa mabrūm wa-manqūḍ, thumma yaqraʼu ʻalá ṣibyān al-taʻlīm fī mithāl. Dhālik taqdīr al-ʻAzīz al-ʻAlīm. Thumma huwa fī zaman ..."

record.title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyah ʻalá Sharḥ al-Hudhudī : manuscript / ʻAlī ibn Khiḍr ibn Aḥmad al-ʻAmrūsī.
record.note: Folio 1a: An ownership statement: "Mulk al-faqīr Ibrāhīm ibn Ibrāhīm Khawājah al-Shāfiʻī."

At the end of the colophon are written nine verses of poetry, about God, His word and His attributes, attributed to muḥaqqiq al-ʻaṣr al-Qarāfī (probably Aḥmad ibn Idrīs al-Qarāfī, a leading theoretician of the Malikī tradition in Egypt, died 1285). The poem starts with: Madlūl alfāẓi kalām Allāhi // qismān fa-iḥfaẓ lā takun bi-lāhī. And ends with: Qāla jamīʻ dhālika al-Qarāfī // muḥaqqiq al-ʻaṣr bi-lā khilāfi.

Colophon: "Wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb, wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ wa-al-maʼāb. Tamma mā jamaʻahu bi-yadihi al-fāniyah al-faqīr ilá raḥmat Rabbihi ʻAlī ibn Khiḍr ibn Aḥmad al-ʻAmrūsī al-Mālikī, nafaʻa Allāh bi-hi kamā nafaʻa bi-aṣlihi, innahu ʻalá mā yashāʼ qadīr wa-bi-al-ijābah qadīr [jadīr]. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Wa-kān al-farāgh min kitābat hādhā al-jamʻ al-mubārak wa-min al-taʼlīf ayḍan yawm al-Ithnayn [al-Khamīs] al-mubārak, al-sādis wa-al-ʻishrīn min shahr Jumādá al-Ākhirah alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat 1165, alf wa-miʼah wa-khamsah wa-sittīn min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-azká al-salām."

Translation of the colophon: "God is more knowledgeable of what is true. To Him is the reference and the returning. Completed is what was compiled by the perishing hand of the poor to the mercy of his Lord, ʻAlī ibn Khiḍr ibn Aḥmad al-ʻAmrūsī al-Mālikī, may God benefit with it as He benefitted with its origin. He is able to do whatever He wills and is able [worthy] of responding. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions and grant them peace. This blessed compilation was copied and also authored on blessed Monday [Thursday], 26 of Jumādá al-Ākhirah, 1165 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [11 April, 1752], may the best of prayer and the purest of peace be upon Him."

record.title: 880-02 Ḥuṣūl al-rifq bi-uṣūl al-rizq : manuscript / Jalāl al-Dīn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Abī Bakr al-Suyūṭī.
record.note: On folio 1a: "Kitāb Ḥuṣūl al-rifq bi-uṣūl al-rizq taʼlīf al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah khātim al-muḥaqqiqīn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān Jalāl al-Dīn ibn Kamāl al-Dīn Abū al-Faḍl al-Suyūṭī, taghammadahu Allāh bi-raḥmatihi wa-askanahu fasīḥ jannatih bi-mannihi wa-karamih. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn.
On the upper left corner of folio 1a: An ownership statement: "Fī nawbat [al-faqīr] ilá Allāh taʻālá, al-ḥaqīr ʻAbd al-Jawwād ibn Muḥammad [...] al-Mālikī."

Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābatihi fī yawm al-Aḥad, khāmis ʻashar shahr Shawwāl, sanat tisʻah wa-tisʻīn wa-alf, ʻalá yad afqar al-ʻibād Muḥammad ibn Mūsá al-Ghamrī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi. Āmīn. Āmīn. Tamm."

Translation of the colophon: "The copy was completed on Sunday, 15 Shawwāl, 1099 [13 August, 1688], by the poorest of the servants, Muḥammad ibn Mūsá al-Ghamrī, may God forgive him and his parents. Amen. Amen. It is completed.

record.title: 880-03 Sharḥ al-Ushmūnī ʻalá Alfīyat Ibn Mālik : manuscript / ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Ushmūnī.
record.note: On folio 1a: "Hādhā Sharḥ al-Ushmūnī ʻalá Alfīyat Ibn Mālik."

Colophon: "Tamma hādhā al-juzʼ yawm al-Sabt, li-khams layālin baqiyat min shahr Rabīʻ al-Thānī, sanat iḥdá wa-thamānīn wa-miʼah wa-alf, ʻalá yad kātibihi, afqar al-ʻibād ilá Allāh Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd Allāh ibn ʻAbd Allāh [... ...], ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-lil-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn. Wa-al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."

Translation of the colophon: "This volume is completed on Saturday, five nights remaining from the month of Rabīʻ al-Thānī, 1181 [19 September, 1767], by the poorest of the servants to God, Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd Allāh ibn ʻAbd Allāh [... ...], may God forgive him, his parents and all Muslims. Praise be to God, Lord of the Universe."

record.title: 880-02 Taḥbīr al-muwashshīn fī al-taʻbīr bi-al-Sīn wa-al-Shīn : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Yaʻqūb al-Fīrūzābādī.
record.note: On folio 1a: "Taḥbīr al-muwashshīn fī al-taʻbīr bi-al-Sīn wa-al-Shīn lil-ʻAllāmah ṣāḥib al-Qāmūs, ʻalayhi raḥmat al-Mawlá al-Quddūs."
On folio 1a: A short biography of the author "al-Fīrūzābādī".
On folio 1b: "... Wa-sammaytuhu Taḥbīr al-muwashshīn fī al-taʻbīr bi-al-Sīn wa-al-Shīn."

Colophon: "Tamma naskhuhu ʻaṣr yawm al-Khamīs 25 J [probably Jumādá al-Thāniyah], sanat 1295 min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-atamm al-salām. Katabahu al-faqīr Ramaḍān Ḥalāwah, ʻufiya ʻanhu, wa-al-ʻudhr fī dhālika, fa-innahā manqūlah min nuskhah muḥarrafah ghāyatan wa-nihāyah, fa-ʻasá Allāh an yamanna bi-nuskhah muḥarrarah, wa-tuṣaḥḥaḥu hādhihi minhā. Wa-Allāh aʻlam."

Translation of the colophon: "Copied on the afternoon of Thursday 25 J [probably Jumādá al-Thāniyah], 1295 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [26 June, 1878], may the best prayer and the most perfect peace be upon Him, by Ramaḍān Ḥalāwah, may he be forgiven, who apologizes for any discrepancies in this copy because it was made from a completely distorted origin. May God facilitate a well-edited copy so that the present one can be corrected. God is more knowledgeable."

record.title: 880-02 al-Alfīyah : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd Allāh ibn Mālik.
record.note: On folio 1a: An endowment statement: "Awqafa hādhā al-kitāb Ḥusayn al-Maghribī [?] waqfan ṣaḥīḥan taḥta yad al-Shaykh Muḥammad al-Baḥrī [?] ʻalá ṭalabat al-ʻilm bi-al-Jāmiʻ al-Azʹhar."
On folio 1a: a partial table of contents.
Endowment statements at the head of most of the leaves: "Waqf lillāh taʻālá" and "Waqf lillāh taʻālá bi-al-Jāmiʻ al-Azʹhar."

Colophon: "Kamulat al-khulāṣah bi-ḥamd Allāh taʻālá wa-ʻawnihi ʻalá yad kātibihā al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá, Shāhīn ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Nūrī al-Anbābī, ḥāmidan Allāh taʻālá ʻalá niʻamihi, wa-muṣalliyan ʻalá Nabīyihi Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ʻitratih al-ṭāhirīn wa-sallama taslīman kathīran ilá Yawm al-Dīn. Ḥasbunā Allāh wa-niʻma al-wakīl. Bi-Tārīkh sābiʻ ʻashar shahr Allāh al-Muḥarram, sanat sabʻīn wa-thamānimiʼah. Wa-Ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

Translation of the colophon: "The compendium is completed by the praise of God and His help, by the poor to God, Shāhīn ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Nūrī al-Anbābī. Praise be to God the Most High for His blessings. May prayers and abundant peace be on God's Prophet, our Master Muḥammad, his righteous family and descendants, until Judgement Day. God suffices us, He is the best advocate. Dated 17, Muḥarram, 870 [18 September, 1465]. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and companions and grant them peace."

record.title: 880-02 al-Nukāt al-ḥisān ʻalá mā waqaʻa lil-Najm al-Ghayṭī ʻalá awāʼil Sūrat al-Dukhān wa-faḍāʼil Laylat al-Niṣf min Shaʻbān : manuscript / Nūr al-Dīn ʻAlī ibn Ibrāhīm al-Ḥalabī.
record.note: On folio 1a: "al-Nukāt al-ḥisān ʻalá mā waqaʻa lil-Najm al-Ghayṭī ʻalá awāʼil Sūrat al-Dukhān wa-faḍāʼil Laylat al-Niṣf min Shaʻbān lil-Shaykh al-ʻAllāmah Nūr al-Dīn ʻAlī al-Ḥalabī al-Shāfiʻī, taghammadahu Allāh bi-raḥmatihi wa-al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Tamm."

On folio 1a: An ownership statement: "Mulk al-faqīr Aḥmad al-Sujāʻī al-Shāfiʻī al-Azʹharī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-lil-Mslimīn bi-mannihi, bi-jāh Muḥammad, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-sallam."
At the end of folio 10b: "Balagha muqābalatan ʻalá aṣlihi bi-ḥasab al-ṭāqah. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

Colophon: "Wa-hādhā ākhir mā katabahu al-ʻAllāmah khātimat al-muḥaqqiqīn al-Shaykh ʻAlī al-Ḥalabī, rawwaḥa Allāh rūḥahu wa-nawwara ḍarīḥahu, bi-jāh Sayyidinā Muḥammad, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam."

Translation of the colophon: "This is the end of what was written by the learned scholar, the seal of the authorities, al-Shaykh ʻAlī al-Ḥalabī, may God bless his soul, and brighten his grave, by the intercession of our Master Muḥammad, may God pray on him and grant him peace."

record.title: Roger Pettiward account book, 1789 June 25 -1796 December 31 : manuscript.
record.note: Contemporary full brown sheep binding.

record.title: 880-02 al-Anwār al-bahijah fī ẓuhūr kunūz al-Munfarijah : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn al-Ḥasan al-Maqābirī.
record.note: At head of folio 1a, an endowment statement: "Awqafa hādhā al-kitāb Aḥmad Muḥammad al-Najjārī."
On folio 1a: "Hādhā Sharḥ al-Munfarijah, al-Anwār al-munbahijah fī ẓuhūr kunūz al-Munfarijah li-Ibn al-Naḥwī, ʻafá Allāh ʻanhu. Āmīn."
On folio 1b: "Wa-sammaytuhu bi-al-Anwār al-bahijah fī ẓuhūr kunūz al-Munfarijah."

Author's colophon: "Wa-hādhā mā raqamahu al-faqīr ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn al-Ḥasan al-Shāfiʻī al-Maqābiriṣī [al-Maqābirī], ʻafá Allāh ʻanhumā, ḥāmidan wa-muṣallīyan wa-musalliman. Wa-astaghfiru Allāh min al-khaṭaʼ wa-al-zalal wa-al-taqṣīr. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad alladhī huwa abhá min al-qamar al-munīr, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi ulī al-ʻazm wa-al-tadbīr, wa-ʻalá al-tābiʻīn, wa-tābiʻ al-tābiʻīn la-hum bi-iḥsān ilá yawm al-Dīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the author's colophon: "This is what was written by the poor ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn al-Ḥasan al-Shāfiʻī al-Maqābiriṣī [al-Maqābirī], may God forgive both of them, praising [God], praying and conveying peace [to His Prophet]. I ask forgiveness from God for any error, fault, or neglect. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad who is more magnificent than the brilliant Moon, His family and His companions, the men of might and disposition, and the followers, and those who graciously followed after those, until Judgment Day. Amen."

Copyist's colophon: "Wa-kataba hādhihi al-nuskhah al-mubārakah bi-yadihi al-fāniyah al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá, al-muʻtarif bi-al-ʻajz wa-al-taqṣīr ʻAbduh ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Damshaltī al-Shāfiʻī al-Azʹharī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayh wa-li-man qaraʼa fīhā wa-daʻā la-hu bi-al-maghfirah, wa-dhālika fī thānī ʻashar Rajab al-fard min shuhūr sanat 1125."

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "This blessed copy was written by the perishing hand of the poor to God, may He be praised, who acknowledges his incapacity and deficiency, ʻAbduh ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Damshaltī al-Shāfiʻī al-Azʹharī, may God forgive him, his parents and he who reads this copy and ask God to forgive him, on 12 Rajab, 1125 [4 August, 1713]."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Unmūdhaj fī al-naḥw : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd al-Ghanī al-Ardabīlī.
record.note: Colophon: "Tammat al-kitāb bi-ʻawn Allāh al-Malik al-Wahhāb, ʻalá yad ʻabd [al-ʻabd] al-ḍaʻīf. Katabahu Bakdāsh ibn Ḥājī Amīn. Ghafara Allāh [la-hu] wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-aḥsana ilayhimā wa-ilayhi. Wa-qad waqaʻa al-farāgh min hādhā al-kitāb min shahr ..."

Translation of the colophon: "The book is finished by the help of God, the abundant giving King, by the feeble servant. Written by Bakdāsh ibn Ḥājī Amīn. May God forgive him and his parents, and treat them and him favorably. The copying was completed on the month ... [no information recorded]."

record.title: 880-03 Awḍaḥ al-masālik ilá Alfīyat Ibn Mālik : manuscript / ʻAbd Allāh ibn Yūsuf ibn Hishām.
record.note: At the head of folio 1a: "al-Tawḍīḥ ʻalá al-Alfīyah."
At the head of folio 1a: An ownership statement: "Fī nawbat al-faqīr Muḥammad Manṣūr al-Yāfī al-Ḥanafī, ʻafá Allāh ʻanh."

Colophon: "Tamma al-kitāb bi-ḥamd Allāh taʻālá wa-ʻawnihi wa-ḥusn tawfīqih. ʻAllaqahu li-nafsihi wa-li-man shāʼa Allāh min baʻdihi aqall ʻabīd Allāh wa-aḥwajuhum ilá tawbatih wa-raḥmatih wa-ghufrānih, Ibrāhīm ibn Ḥasan al-Ḥanafī al-Farzalī [?] al-Azʹharī, ghafara Allāh taʻālá la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-mashāyikhihi, wa-li-man naẓara fī hādhā al-kitāb, wa-raʼá ʻayban fa-sadadahu, wa-daʻā la-hu bi-al-maghfirah wa-al-raḥmah wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min taʻlīqihi yawm al-Ithnayn, ʻāshir shahr Ramaḍān min shuhūr sanat alf wa-miʼah wa-arbaʻīn min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām, wa-dhālika ʻalá yad al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr Aḥmad Ibrāhīm al-Sarsīqī baladan, al-Mālikī madhhaban, al-Burhānī ṭarīqatan, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman kathīran dāʼiman ilá yawm al-Dīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon: "The book is completed by the praise of God, Most High, His help and His abundant benevolence, for the use of the least of God's servants, and the neediest for His repentance, His mercy and His forgiveness, Ibrāhīm ibn Ḥasan al-Ḥanafī al-Farzalī [?] al-Azʹharī, and for the use of whom ever God wills after him. May God, Most High, forgive him, his parents, his masters, and him who looks into this book and sees a blemish and corrects it, and asks God on his behalf for forgiveness and mercy, and for all Muslims. It was copied on Monday, 10 Ramaḍān, 1140 [20 April, 1728] of the Hijrah of the Prophet, may the best of prayer and peace be upon Him, by the poor and despised Aḥmad Ibrāhīm al-Sarsīqī baladan, al-Mālikī madhhaban, al-Burhānī ṭarīqatan, may God forgive him, his parents and all Muslims. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, His family and His companions and grant them abundant and continuous peace until Judgment Day. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe. Amen."

record.title: 880-03 Marāḥ al-arwāḥ : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn ʻAlī ibn Masʻūd.
record.note: On folio 1a: "Hādhā Kitāb Marāḥ al-arwāḥ."
On folio 1a: Two washed out ownership statements.

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with: "... lā yajtamiʻu sākinān bi-taqdīr al-iʻlāl, wa-makhīṭ manqūṣ min al-mikhyāṭ, fa-lā yuʻallu tibʻan. Fa-in qīla lam yuʻall al-iqāmah maʻa ḥuṣūl ijtimāʻ al-sākinayn fa-idhā ..."

record.title: 880-02 Mukhtaṣar Sharḥ Talkhīṣ al-Miftāḥ : manuscript / Masʻūd ibn ʻUmar al-Taftāzānī.
record.note: Text folios 2b-257b; folios 258-259 are blank.
On folios 1b-2a: An anonymous commentary on "al-Basmalah".
On folios 2b-18b: Numerous comments on the margins, including 3 inserts threaded to leaves 2 and 3.
Colophon: "Khatam Allāh lanā bi-al-ḥusná wa-yassara lanā al-fawz bi-al-dhukhr al-asná bi-ḥaqq al-Nabbī wa-ālihi al-akramīn, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."

Translation of the colophon: "May God seal our life with happy end, and enable us to attain the splendid treasure, by the intercession of the Prophet and his honorable family. Praise be to God the Lord of the Universe."

record.title: 880-02 Mukhtaṣar Sharḥ Talkhīṣ al-Miftāḥ : manuscript / Masʻūd ibn ʻUmar al-Taftāzānī.
record.note: In small naskh/taʻlīq script, in black ink, on white paper; many notes and corrections on the margins; markings in red; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Sharḥ li-Saʻd al-Dīn al-Taftāzānī."
Folio 166 is blank; text folios 1b-165b.

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with: "... wa-qālat al-Yahūd: Lan yadkhula al-Jannah illā man kāna Hūdan. Wa-qālat al-Naṣārá: Lan yadkhula al-Jannah illā man kāna Naṣārá. Fa-laffa bayna al-farīqayn, aw al-qawlayn ijmālan, li-ʻadam al-iltibās wa-al-thiqah bi-anna al-sāmiʻ yaruddu ilá kull farīq, aw qawl, maqūlah, lil-ʻilm bi-taḍlīl kull farīq ṣāḥibahu wa-iʻtiqādah, wa-anna dākhil al-Jannah huwa lā ṣāḥibuh ..."

record.title: 880-02 Futūḥāt al-Rashīd ʻalá Khulāṣat al-tawḥīd : manuscript / Muḥammad al-Damanhūrī.
record.note: On folio 1a: Seven verses of Sufi poetry on "waḥdat al-wujūd" (unity of existence), probably by the well-known Sufi and poet Abū Madyan al-Tilimsānī (died 1197 or 1198) which starts with: Allāha qul wa-dhari al-wujūda wa-mā ḥawá // in kunta murtādan bulūgha kamāli.

Colophon: "Ilá hunā waqafat al-aqlām. Nasʼalu Allāh al-ʻafwa ʻan zallat al-aqdām bi-jāh Sayyidinā Muḥammad khayr al-anām, wa-ṣaḥbihi al-kirām, wa-man tabiʻahum bi-amān ilá al-khitām. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min tabyīḍ muʻzam hādhā al-sharḥ al-mubārak fī Jumādá al-Awwal, sanat alf wa-miʼtayn wa-thamān wa-ʻishrīn min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām, wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-man tabiʻahum fī al-mabdaʼ wa-al-khitām." At the margin of the the colophon: "Qawluhu 'muʻẓam' ilkh: Innamā qāla dhālik, li-anna al-muʼallif lam yubayyiḍ khātimat al-taṣawwuf illā fī al-sanah allatī talī al-thāminah wa-al-ʻishrīn."

Translation of the colophon: "Here, the pens stopped. We ask God forgiveness for the slip of the feet, through the intercession of our Master Muḥammad, the best of the people, his honorable companions, and those who faithfully follow in their path until the end. Most of this blessed commentary was written in Jumādá al-Awwal, the year 1228 of the Hijrah of the Prophet, may the best of prayer and peace be upon him, and upon his family, his companions and those who followed them from the beginning to the end." At the margin of the colophon: "His saying 'most', etc.: He said this because the author did not write the conclusion of his treatise on Sufism except in the year that followed the twenty-eighth."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ Lāmīyat al-afʻāl : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad Ibn al-Nāẓim.
record.note: On folios 1a: "Hādhā Sharḥ Lāmīyat al-afʻāl li-ibn nāẓimihā, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi."
On folio 1a: Three verses of poetry about the seven different kinds of the trilateral verb in Arabic.
Folios 23-24 are blank.

Colophon: "Tamma al-sharḥ al-mubārak bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min naskhih ghurrat al-Ḥijjah, sanat 1288, ʻalá yad kātibihi al-faqīr ilá Allāh Sālim Ḥasan, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayh wa-li-mashāyikhihi wa-li-ikhwānihi fī Allāh wa-lil-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

Translation of the colophon: "The blessed commentary is concluded by the praise of God and His help. Copied at the beginning of al-Ḥijjah, the year 1288 [11 February, 1872], by the poor to God Sālim Ḥasan, may God forgive him, his parents, his masters, his brethren in God and all Muslims. Praise be to God, Lord of the Universe. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions and grant them peace."

record.title: 880-02 al-Maqṣad al-asná fī sharḥ asmāʼ Allāh al-Ḥusná : manuscript / Abū Ḥāmid Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Ghazzālī.
record.note: On folio 1a: "Kitāb al-Maqṣad al-asná fī sharḥ asmāʼ Allāh al-Ḥusná, taṣnīf al-Shaykh al-Ghazzālī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá. Tamm."

Colophon: "Tammat Asmāʼ Allāh al-Ḥusná bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih wa-ḥusn tawfīqih. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābatihā yawm al-Ithnayn al-mubārak, ākhir shahr Ṣafar alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat alf wa-miʼah wa-khamsah wa-sabʻīn. Tamm."

Translation of the colophon: "Asmāʼ Allāh al-Ḥusná [The Most Beautiful Names of God] is concluded by the praise of God, His help and His abundant benevolence. Copied on blessed Monday, the end of Ṣafar, 1175 [29 September, 1761]. It is concluded."

record.title: 880-02 Bahjat al-sāmiʻīn wa-al-nāẓirīn bi-mawlid Sayyid al-awwalīn wa-al-ākharīn : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad al-Ghayṭī.
record.note: On folio 1a: "Kitāb Bahjat al-nāẓirīn wa-al-sāmiʻīn bi-mawlid Sayyid al-Mursalīn wa-al-ākharīn, taʼlīf al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah al-ruḥalah, khādim al-Sunnah al-Nabawīyah, Najm al-Dīn al-Ghayṭī, raḥimahu Allāh wa-raḥimanā. Āmīn."
On folio 1a: A copying and ownership statement: "ʻAllaqahu li-nafsihi, thumma li-man shāʼa al-Mawlá baʻdah, Muḥammad al-Shaṭṭī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi. Āmīn."

On folio 19b: A copying and ownership statement: "ʻAllaqahu li-nafsihi, wa-li-man shāʼa al-Mawlá baʻda waḍʻihi fī ramsihi, Muḥammad al-Shaṭṭī al-Mālikī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi. Āmīn. Āmīn."

Colophon: "Qāla shaykh mashāyikhinā muʼallif hādhā al-kitāb, raḥimahu Allāh wa-raḥimanā bi-hi fī al-dunyā wa-al-ākhirah: Wāfaqa al-farāgh min tabyīḍ hādhā al-kitāb yawm al-Sabt, rābiʻ ʻishrīn Ṣafar, min shuhūr thamānīn wa-tisʻimiʼah. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-azwājihi wa-dhurrīyatihi. Āmīn. Āmīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah."

Translation of the colophon: "The master of our masters, the author of this book, may God have mercy upon him and upon us through him, in this world and in the hereafter, said: The writing of this book was completed on Saturday, 24 Ṣafar, 980 [16 July, 1572]. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family, his companions, his wives, and his descendants. Amen. Amen. Praise be to God alone."

record.title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyah ʻalá matn al-Sullam : manuscript / Ibrāhīm ibn Muḥammad al-Bājūrī.
record.note: On folio 1a: "Hādhihi ḥāshiyat al-ʻAllāmah Mawlānā Shaykh al-Islām Ibrāhīm al-Bājūrī ʻalá al-Sullam bi-al-tamām wa-al-kamāl, wa-al-ḥmadu lillāh ʻalá kull ḥāll."

Colophon: "Qāla muʼallifuhā: Wa-kāna al-farāgh min jamʻ hādhihi al-ḥāshiyah al-nafīsah fī awāʼil Jumādá al-Ūlá min shuhūr sanat alf wa-miʼatayn wa-sittah wa-ʻishrīn min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā ṣalawāt wa-taḥīyāt sharīfah. Wa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻAlī al-ʻAẓīm, wa-Huwa ḥasbī wa-niʻma al-wakīl. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam.

Translation of the colophon: "Its author said: This precious gloss was compiled at the beginning of Jumādá al-Ūlá, 1226 of the Hijrah of the Prophet, may noble prayers and greetings be upon Him. There is no might nor power except in God, the Most High, the Almighty. He suffices me. He is the best advocate. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, His family and His companions and grant the peace."

record.title: 880-02 Tashṭīr Burdat al-madīḥ : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Ḥamad al-Sharqāwī.
record.note: On folio 1a: "Hādhā Tashṭīr Burdat al-madīḥ lil-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻallāmah al-baḥr al-fahhāmah Sayyidī Aḥmad al-Sharqāwī ibn Ḥamad ibn ʻUthmān, tābiʻ al-Walī al-ʻārif billāh taʻālá al-Shams al-Ḥifnāwī."

al-Sharqāwī starts his poem with: Bismi al-Ilāhi mufīḍi al-jūdi wa-al-niʻami // badaʼtu naẓman ḥalá dhikran bi-kulli fami. And starts his "Tashṭīr" with: Amin tadhakkuri jīrānin bi-Dhī Salami // jazamta annaka maqṣūrun ʻalá al-alami. Wa-ʻindamā hājati al-dhikrá wa-lawʻatuhā // mazajta damʻan jará min muqlatin bi-dami. And ends it with: Mā rannaḥat ʻadhabāti al-bāni rīḥu ṣabā // wa-mā ṣabā qalbu mushtāqin ilá al-Ḥarami. Wa-mā atá ʻīdu waṣlin baʻda tafriqatin // wa-aṭraba al-ʻīsa ḥādī al-ʻīsi bi-al-naghami.

Colophon: "Tamma al-Tashṭīr al-mubārak ʻalá yad kātibihi al-faqīr Muḥammad al-Saʻūdī al-Yūnusī, wa-dhālika ḍaḥwat yawm al-Ithnayn al-mubārak, ḥādī ʻashar Ṣafar al-khayr alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat 1195, khamsah wa-tisʻīn wa-miʼah wa-alf. Wa-kutiba bi-rasm fakhr al-Sādah al-Ashrāf al-muʻaẓẓamīn, nukhbat Āl Ṭāhā wa-Yāsīn, farʻ al-shajarah al-zakīyah wa-aḥsanuhā, wa-ṭirāz al-ʻiṣābah al-Hāshimīyah wa-ajmaluhā, al-Sharīf al-ṭāhir, ḥāwī al-kamālāt wa-al-mafākhir, al-Sayyid Muḥammad ibn al-marḥūm al-Sayyid Ibrāhīm, ḥafiẓahu Allāh. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon: "The blessed "Tashṭīr" is completed. Copied by the poor Muḥammad al-Saʻūdī al-Yūnusī, on Monday morning, 11 Ṣafar, 1195 [6 February, 1781], for al-Sayyid Muḥammad ibn al-marḥūm al-Sayyid Ibrāhīm, the pride of the glorious al-Sādah al-Ashrāf, the epitome of Āl Ṭāhā wa-Yāsīn, the most noble scion of the pure tree, and the choicest and the finest of the Hashemite clan, the righteous Sharīf, he who is full of perfection and splendor, may God protect him. Amen."

record.title: 880-02 al-Iqtiṣād fī kifāyat al-ʻiqād : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn al-ʻImād al-Aqfahsī.
record.note: Leaf 16 is blank; text folios 1b-15b.
Brockelmann gives the title as: "al-Iqtiṣād fī kifāyat al-ʻiqād" and "al-Iqtiṣād fī kifāyat al-ʻuqqād" (GAL: G II 94; S II 111,17).

On folio 1a: "Hādhā kitāb fīhi Naẓm al-iqtiṣād fī kifāyat inʻiqād [al-ʻiqād]. Ghafara Allāh li-kātibihi. Taʼlīf al-Shaykh al-Imām, al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, waḥīd dahrihi wa-farīd ʻaṣrih, awḥad mashāyikh al-zamān, Shihāb al-Dīn, Abī al-ʻAbbās, Aḥmad ibn al-Shaykh al-ʻallāmah ʻImād al-Dīn, ʻImād al-Aqfahsī al-Shāfiʻī."

On folio 1a: Two ownership notes, as follows: "Tamallaka hādhihi al-nuskhah ʻAbd al-Qādir Shaʻbān al-Ṣiddīq." "Min niʻam Allāh ʻalá ʻAbdihi al-faqīr ʻAbd al-Qādir al-Maḥallī al-Ṣiddīqī."
On folio 15b: Ownership note: "al-Ḥamdu lillāh. Min niʻam Allāh ʻalá ʻabdihi ʻAbd al-Qādir sibṭ ibn al-Ṣiddīq. ʻUfiya ʻanhu bi-mannih. Āmīn."
On folio 16b: Ownership note: "al-Ḥamdu lillāh. Min niʻam Allāh ʻalá ʻabdihi al-faqīr ʻAbd al-Qādir al-Anṣārī al-Maḥallī al-Ṣiddīqī."

Colophon: The poem ends with: "... Wa-Ibnu al-ʻImādi ṭālibun min Dhī al-Karam // wa-Dhī al-Jalāl wa-al-Kamāl fī al-qidam. Luṭfan bi-hi fī sāyiri al-awqāt // wa-raḥmatan taʻummu fī al-mamāti. Tamma Naẓm al-Iqtiṣād fī kifāyat al-ʻiqād."

Translation of the colophon: The poem ends with:"... Ibn al-ʻImād asks the Generous One // the Glorious and Perfect one of yore. For kindness in all times // and abundant mercy after death. The poem 'al-iqtiṣād fī kifāyat al-ʻiqād' is completed."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Iqtiṣād fī kifāyat al-ʻiqād : manuscript / al-Ḥasan ibn Muḥammad al-Nassāb.
record.note: On folio 1a: "al-Iqtiṣād fī kifāyat al-ʻiqād, Sharḥ Qaṣīdat Ibn al-ʻImād, lil-Sayyid al-Nassāb, taghammadahu Allāh bi-raḥmatih."

At the end of his colophon the copyist mentions that he read in the copy he used that the author is the genealogist of "al-Sādah al-Ashrāf" (descendants of the Prophet Muḥammad from his daughter Fāṭimah), as follows: "al-Sayyid al-Sharīf, al-ḥasīb al-nasīb, al-ʻālim al-ʻāmil, al-ʻallāmh, dhū al-baṣāʼir al-bāhirah wa-al-ʻulūm al-zāhirah [...] Abū Muḥammad al-Ḥasan al-Ḥasanī al-Nassāb, nassāb al-Sādah al-Ashrāf."
On folios 151a-151b: Sayings, written in a different hand, about the characteristics of the seven days of the week and what happens if garments are cut out, or nails clipped, in each one of them.
On folio 151b: A date is mentioned, as follows: "Jumādá al-Ākhirah 1068 [March/April, 1658]."

Author's colophon: "Wa-hādhā ākhir mā yassara Allāh bi-hi min sharḥ hādhā al-kitāb. Allāhumma akhliṣ fīhi al-nīyah, wa-ṣaḥḥiḥ bi-hi al-qaṣd al-jamīl, wa-balligh fīhi al-umniyah, wa-irḥam man ʻallamanā, wa-lā tukhib rajāʼanā fīka wa-muʻtaqadanā, wa-ifʻal binā mā anta la-hu ahl, wa-lā takilnā ilá anfusinā wa-lā ilá maʻrifatinā, innaka ʻalá kull shayʼ qadīr wa-bi-al-ijābah jadīr. Wa-saʼaltu Allāh taʻālá an yajʻalahu dhakhīrah li-qārīhi wa-sāmiʻihi, wa-wasīlah li-rāwīhi wa-jāmiʻih, fa-Huwa arḥam man ajāb wa-akram man anāb ... Wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb, wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ wa-al-maʼāb. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-ḥasbunā Allāh wa-niʻma al-wakīl."

Translation of the author's colophon: "This is the end of what God facilitated concerning the commentary on this book. O God make sincere [our] intention, and trustworthy [our] motive. Fulfill in it [our] wishes. Have mercy upon those who taught us. Do not disappoint our hope and faith in You. Treat us favorably and do not let us depend on ourselves or our knowledge. You are able to do whatever You want, and to answer our requests. I ask God Almighty to make this book an asset to its reader, and he who hears it, and a mediation to its transmitter and compiler. He is the most merciful and the most compassionate ... God is more knowledgeable of what is true. To Him is the reference and returning. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions and grant them peace. Praise be to God the Lord of the Universe. God suffices us. He is the best advocate."

Copyist's colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat [... ... ...] al-mubārak min [... ... ...] faqīr raḥmat rabbih ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad ibn Bakr [...] al-Azʹharī [...], ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman kathīran. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "The copy was concluded [... ... ...] on blessed [... ... ...] by the poor to the mercy of his Lord, ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad ibn Bakr [...] al-Azʹharī [...], may God forgive him, his parents and all Muslims. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad and his companions and grant them abundant peace. Praise be to God the Lord of the Universe."

record.title: 880-02 Taḥrīr al-fatāwī fī taṣḥīḥ al-Ḥāwī : manuscript / Maḥmūd ibn ʻAlī al-Qūnawī.
record.note: In beautiful Maghribī script, in black ink, on white paper; some notes and corrections on the margins; some wormholes without loss of text; markings in red; the phrases of the original (al-Ḥāwī al-ṣaghīr) preceded by the word "qawluhu" (his saying) in red; no catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Kitāb Taḥrīr al-fatāwī fī taṣḥīḥ al-Ḥāwī, taṣnīf al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻāmil al-ʻāmil al-ʻallāmah Muḥibb al-Dīn Maḥmūd ibn al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah Abī al-Ḥasan ʻAlī al-Qūnawī, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu wa-arḍāh, wa-jaʻala al-Jannah maʼwāh. Āmīn."

On folio 1a: Two ownership statements: "Fī nawbat al-faqīr Muḥammad Salīm al-Ḥamzāwī, sanat 265 [1265] = [1848/1849]". "Dakhala fī mulk al-faqīr al-Ḥājj Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad al-Maghribī, sanat 128 [1128] = [1715/1716]".

On folio 98a: An "Ijāzah" (a license to transmit the contents of a book) by the author, Maḥmūd ibn ʻAlī al-Qūnawī, to Taqī al-Dīn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn ʻIzz al-Dīn Yūsuf, dated Wednesday, 12 Jumādá al-Ūlá, 742 (1 November, 1341). The license is written in a different hand. It is not clear whether it is in the handwriting of the author, al-Qūnawī (which constitutes an anachronism, since the manuscript was copied in 1535), or some other person: "al-Ḥamdu lillāh. Baḥatha maʻī mawāḍiʻ min hādhā al-kitāb al-Shaykh al-faqīh al-ʻālim al-fāḍil, al-muḥaṣṣil, jamāl al-fuḍalāʼ, Taqī al-Dīn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn al-Shaykh al-Imām ʻIzz al-Dīn Yūsuf al-Khaṭīb bi-Mārdīn al-maḥrūsah, wa-ajaztu la-hu an yarwiyahu ʻannī. Wa-kataba muʼallifuhu Maḥmūd ibn ʻAlī al-Qūnawī al-Shāfiʻī, ʻafā Allāh ʻanhu, fī yawm al-Arbiʻāʼ, thānī ʻashar Jumādá al-Ūlá, sanat ithnatayn wa-arbaʻīn wa-sabʻimiʼah."
On folio 98a: Ten quotations on "al-taqwá" (righteousness), attributed to different persons.
On folio 98b: An index of books housed at an unidentified location.

Colophon: "Wa-hādhā ākhir mā aradnā jamʻahu fī hādhā al-mukhtaṣar, wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb, wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ wa-al-maʼāb. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-sallam. Wa-ḥasbunā Allāh wa-niʻma al-wakīl. Nuqila min khaṭṭ al-muʼallif al-ʻālim [...] Abī al-Thanāʼ Maḥmūd al-Qūnawī, nafaʻa Allāh bi-hi al-muʼallif wa-al-qāriʼ wa-al-nāsikh wa-jamʻuhum, maʻa jamīʻ al-Muslimīn fī jannāt al-naʻīm. Āmīn. Āmīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min naskhihi fī al-ʻushr al-akhīr min shahr Rabīʻ al-Thānī, min sanat ithnayn wa-arbaʻīn wa-tisʻimiʼah. [And in a different handwriting] "Wa-min taṣnīfihi ʻalá mā qāla muʼallifuhu, ʻafā Allāh taʻālá ʻanhu, fī ākhir Rabīʻ al-Ākhir, min shuhūr sanat iḥdá wa-arbaʻīn wa-sabʻimiʼah, siwá iḍāfāt uzīdat baʻda dhālika. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah."

Translation of the colophon: "This is the end of what we wanted to compile in this compendium. God is more knowledgeable of what is correct. To Him is the reference and returning. Praise be to God, Lord of the Universe. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad and his family and grant them peace. God suffices us. He is the best advocate. Copied from the handwriting of the author, the learned [...] Abī al-Thanāʼ Maḥmūd al-Qūnawī. May God benefit with it the author, the reader, the copyist and their cohorts, and all Muslims, in the gardens of bliss. Amen. Amen. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad and his family. Praise be to God, Lord of the Universe. Copied during the last tenth of the month of Rabīʻ al-Thānī, 942 [beginning of November, 1535]. And in a different handwriting: "Written, according to what its author, may God pardon him, said, at the end of Rabīʻ al-Ākhir, 741 [30 October, 1340], excluding some additions appended thereafter. Praise be to God alone."

record.title: Pustaha : manuscript.
record.note: Illustrated with about 45 small illustrations, mostly of human figures, roosters, and chickens.

record.title: Annotations in Philosophiae naturalis principia mathematica : manuscript.
record.note: No signature or other provenance marks. The annotator refers to himself as the author of "Tria problemata geometris proposita (page c1verso) "statica nostra" (page 29) and "nostra motus geometria" (page 36), clear references to three of the ten known works by Giovanni Ceva.
Marginal lines and one short note in Latin in blue pencil in a later hand, recto of leaf b2 and pages 482-484.
Spine label text: Newton Philoso.

record.title: Inventory of plate belonging to Sir John Harrington Bart. : made by Wakelin & Garrard Goldsmiths & Jewellers Panton Street Hay Market London 12th June 1798 : manuscript.
record.note: Annotation on front cover: "Plate Book."

record.title: H. B. glossary in English and Portuguese : manuscript.
record.note: Small tabbed commercially produced pocket notebook. Inscription on front flyleaf: "Ship 'Cornelia.' / May 29, 1856 / South Pacific / Lat. 46 19 S / Long 94 56 W / H. B."

record.title: Document concerning the calculation of solstices and holy days : manuscript.
record.note: Date appears on first page as "9-Feb-1732-3."

record.title: Thomas Greene letter to Charles Lockyer, 1732 February 18 : manuscript.
record.note: Date is given as "Feb. [th]e 18th 1731/2."

record.title: Kern aller Gebetter : manuscript.
record.note: Rubricated. Decorative floral borders in red and green ink.

record.title: Von truckenen Obst : manuscript.
record.note: 19th-century shelfmark label pasted in upper left corner of front cover: "Varia 167."
Contemporary green vellum wallet binding; remains of green silk ribbon tie.

record.title: Mary Keightley album : manuscript.
record.note: Binder's tag on front pastedown: "John Jones / Bookbinder / 1 Temple Street / Liverpool."

record.title: 880-02 Nubdhah mukhtaṣarah fī al-kitāb al-musammá al-Kawākib al-durrīyah fī al-qawāʻid al-sirrīyah : manuscript.
record.note: On the back of the front cover, in pencil two names are written: "Ṣaʻb Ṣāliḥ wa-Ḥamad al-Ḥammūd."

On folio 38b: The name of a certain Ṣufī, a location, and a date are mentioned, as follows: "... Wa-hādhā takht maḍrūb fī sāḥat Shaykhinā wa-Ustādhinā al-ʻārif billāh taʻālá, qudwat al-sālikīn wa-murabbī al-murīdīn, Sayyidī Muḥammad al-Dimirdāshī [could not be identified], wa-kāna dhālika ʻalá ḥāffat al-Khalīj, qibāl Jāmiʻ al-Zāwiyah al-Ḥamrāʼ [could not be identified], qubayl al-ʻaṣr, yawm al-Khamīs al-mubārak, ʻashar Jumādá al-Thānī, sanat 1249, tisʻ wa-arbaʻīn wa-miʼatayn wa-alf [25 October, 1833] ..."

Colophon: "Tamma al-kitāb bi-ʻawn al-Malik al-Wahhāb. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min naskhihi yawm al-Aḥad, li-arbaʻat ayyām maḍat min shahr al-Ḥijjah al-ḥarām, sanat ithnayn wa-thalāthimiʼah wa-alf min Hijrat man la-hu al-majd wa-al-sharaf, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi wa-al-tābiʻīn, wa-askananā wa-īyāhum aʻlá al-ghuraf, ʻalá yad al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr Muḥammad Aḥmad al-Khūjah, ʻafā Allāh ʻanh. Tamma al-kitāb takāmalat // niʻamu al-surūri li-ṣāḥibih. Wa-ʻafā al-Ilāhu bi-faḍlihi // wa-bi-mannihi ʻan kātibih."

Translation of the colophon: "The book is completed by the help of the Generous King, on Sunday, 4 al-Ḥijjah, 1302 of the Hijrah of the glorious and honorable Prophet [14 September, 1885]. May God pray on him, his family, his companions and their followers, May He allocate to us with them the loftiest chambers [in Paradise]. Copied by the poor and despised Muḥammad Aḥmad al-Khūjah, may God forgive him. The book is completed // may the blessings of joy be perfected to its owner. May God pardon, by His favor // and generosity, its copyist."

record.title: 880-02 Ighāthat al-muḥtājīn min al-ummah al-Muḥammadīyah li-ḥall alfāẓ al-Istighāthah al-Būnīyah : manuscript / ʻAlī Makkī al-Khalwatī al-Ḥifnāwī.
record.note: On folio 1a: "Hādhihi Ighāthat al-muḥtājīn min al-ummah al-Muḥammadīyah li-ḥall alfāẓ al-Istighāthah al-Būnīyah lil-Shaykh ʻAlī Makkī al-Khalwatī al-Ḥifnāwī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá raḥmatan wāsiʻah. Tamm."

On folio 1a, around the title, a washed out endowment statement, in violet color, of which can be read "... fa-man baddalahu baʻdamā samiʻah, fa-innamā ithmuhu ʻalá alladhīna yubaddilūnah. Inna Allāh samīʻ ʻalīm. Kātibuhu Aḥmad ʻAbd al-Mutaʻāl, 3 thalāthah Shawwāl, sanat 1335 [23 July, 1917]."
On folio 1a: Three anonymous pieces of poetry, two verses each.

On folio 22a: A Ṣūfī invocation in verse: "Takhmīs laṭīf li-baʻḍihim. Mā qaṭṭu aydī al-nadá ʻan jūdikum ḥujibat // wa-kull makrumatin min faḍlikum nusibat. Wa-qultu min mundhu rūḥī lil-asá khuṭibat // Yā Āla Ṭāhā ʻalaykum ḥamlatī ḥusibat // inna al-ḍaʻīfa ʻalá al-ajwādi maḥmūlu ..."

On folio 22a-23b: The full text of the invocation of "Daʻwat Yāsīn": "Hādhihi Daʻwat Yāsīn al-mukhammasah. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Yā ʻuṣbat al-khayri bi-khayri al-milal // wa-nukhbata al-nūri al-bahīyi al-ajall ..." It ends with: "Innā daʻawnāka bi-ṣidqin ajib // qad quḍiya al-amru fa-qulnā ajal."
On folio 23b-25a: Three invocations inspired by Sūrat Yāsīn.

On folios 25a-25b: An invocation: "al-Abyāt al-aṣlīyah lil-Imām al-Suhaylī [ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn ʻAbd Allāh, 1114 or 1115-1185], wa-al-takhmīs lil-faqīh ʻIzz al-Dīn ibn Rashīq [could not be identified], raḥimahumā Allāh taʻālá: In kunta ḥaqqan min dhunūbika tajzaʻu // fa-ifzaʻa ilá al-Bārī bi-qalbin yakhshaʻu ..."

On folio 25b: An endowment statement: "Waqf lillāh taʻālá, kamā al-mūḍaḥ bi-awwal waraqah, fī 3 Shawwāl, sanat 1335, khamsah wa-thalāthūn Hijrīyah [23 July, 1917]. Kātibuhu Aḥmad ʻAbd al-Mutaʻāl. Aḥmad ʻAbd al-Mutaʻāl."
On folios 26a-27a: Another invocation by Aḥmad al-Būnī: "Hādhihi daʻwat al-Shaykh al-Būnī al-mashhūrah bi-al-nafʻ wa-al-ijābah. Wa-hiya hādhihi ..."
On folio 27b: An eschatological Ḥadīth about the End Time.

On folios 27b-29a: An invocation attributed to al-Shaykh Muḥammad al-Sammān (probably Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd al-Karīm al-Sammān, al-Madanī, al-Khalwatī, al-Qādirī al-Shādhilī, Abū ʻAbd Allāh, 1718-1775): "Wa-hādhā ḥizb al-Ustādh al-aʻẓam Sayyidī al-ʻārif billāh taʻālá al-Shaykh Muḥammad al-Sammān, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu. Wa-huwa hādhā ..."
On folios 29a-29b: Recipe for easing the difficulty in giving birth.

On folio 29b: A medicinal recipe attributed to al-Shaykh al-Shaʻrānī (probably ʻAbd al-Wahhāb ibn Aḥmad al-Shaʻrānī, approximately 1493-1565 or 1566): "... wa-hiya tukhriju min al-jism ithnayn wa-sabʻīn dāʼan [... it rids the body of seventy two ailments] ..."
On folio 30a: A list of "Āyāt al-ḥifẓ" (Verses for "protection" which are mentioned in the Qurʼān).
On folio 30b: An incantation (with a magic square) against "al-Ḥummá" (Fever).
At the upper margin of all the leaves of the codex are written endowment statements, in violet: "Waqf" or "Waqf lillāh taʻālá".

Colophon (folios 21b-22a): "Tammat hādhihi al-istighāthah bi-sharḥihā bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnihi wa-ḥusn tawfīqihi, ʻalá atamm ḥāla wa-aḥsan minwāl, wa-Allāh al-muwaffiq lil-ṣawāb, wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ wa-al-maʼāb. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam wa-sharrafa wa-karram. Katabahā al-ʻabd al-faqīr al-muqirr bi-al-ʻajz wa-al-taqṣīr, al-rājī ʻafw Mawlāhu mūhib al-minan, ʻAbd al-Mutaʻāl ibn Ḥasan, ghafar Allāh dhunūbah wa-satar fī al-dārayn ʻuyūbah. Āmīn. Fī yawm al-Arbiʻāʼ, li-sittat ayyām khalat min shahr Dhī al-Ḥijjah, ikhtitām ʻām ithnayn wa-thalāthimiʼah wa-alf min Hijrat man la-hu al-ʻzz wa-al-sharaf, ʻalayhi al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām."

Translation of the colophon: "The 'Invocation' is completed with its commentary, by the praise of God, His help and abundant benevolence, fully and thoroughly. God is the facilitator of what is right, to Him is the reference and returning. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and companions, honor and exalt them. Written by the poor servant, he who admits his disability and insufficiency, who begs the forgiveness of his Lord, the granter of blessings, ʻAbd al-Mutaʻāl ibn Ḥasan, may God forgive his sins and hide his imperfections, in the Two Abodes [here and in the thereafter]. Amen. On Wednesday, 6 Dhū al-Ḥijjah, the conclusion of the year 1302 [16 September, 1885] of the Hijrah of the honorable and exalted Prophet, may prayer and peace of God be upon him."

record.title: 880-02 Manāzil al-arwāḥ : manuscript / Abū ʻAbd Allāh Muḥammad ibn Sulaymān al-Kāfiyajī al-Ḥanafī.
record.note: On folio 1a: "Kitāb Manāzil al-arwāḥ, taʼlīf al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, shams al-aʼimmah wa-al-dīn, fakhr al-Islām wa-al-Muslimīn, Abī ʻAbd Allāh Muḥammad al-Kāfijī [al-Kāfiyajī] al-Ḥanafī, ʻāmalah Allāh bi-luṭfihi. Āmīn."
On folio 1a: An invocation in two verses of poetry.
Colophon: "Wa-li-yakun dhālika ākhir al-kitāb. Fī yawm al-Jumʻah 18 shahr Shaʻbān, sanat 1125, khamsah wa-ʻishrīn wa-miʼah wa-alf."
Translation of the colophon: "Let this be the end of the book. Dated, Friday, 18 Shaʻbān, 1125 [9 September, 1713]."

record.title: 880-01 Duʻāʼ Mnāhil al-raḥmah wa-kashf al-ghummah : manuscript.
record.note: Printed in two sizes of fonts; each of the three lines in the large font is followed by three lines in the smaller fonts; in black ink, on acidic white paper; text fully vocalized.

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends with: Wa-ikhtim lī bi-khātimat al-saʻādah wa-al-riḍā, wa-waffiqnī li-mā tuḥibbu wa-tarḍá, wa-ighfir lī mā taqaddama min dhanbī wa-mā taʼakhkhara, innaka anta al-ghafūr al-raḥīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn."

record.title: 880-03 al-Tanazzulāt al-Mawṣilīyah : manuscript / Muḥyī al-Dīn ibn al-ʻArabī.
record.note: Title of "al-Tanazzulāt al-Mawṣilīyah" from folio 1a.
Title of "Asmāʼ al-Ṣaḥābah": supplied by cataloger.

Incipit of "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Tanazzulāt al-Mawṣilīyah": "al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī waṣafa al-insān bi-mā waṣafa bi-hi nafsah, wa-munʻit al-ḥaqīqah al-kayfīyah, wa-faṭara [...] al-ṣūratayn al-lafẓīyah wa-al-muḍāfah wa-al-maʻnawīyah, thumma sammāhā bi-mā sammá bi-hi dhātah ..."
Secundo folio of "al-Tanazzulāt al-Mawṣilīyah": al-ṣuḥbah li-hādhā al-haykal.

Incipit of "Asmāʼ al-Ṣaḥābah": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Muḥammad Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, wa-sharrafa, wa-ʻaẓẓama, wa-karram. Ubayy ibn Kaʻb, al-Akhnas al-Sulamī, al-Arqam ibn Abī al-Arqam, Asʻad ibn Yazīd ..."
Secundo folio of "Asmāʼ al-Ṣaḥābah": ibn Anas, al-Ḥārith ibn Aws.
al-Tanazzulāt al-Mawṣilīyah: 11 x 16.2 cm; written surface: 7.3 x 13.5 cm; 21 lines per page.
Asmāʼ al-Ṣaḥābah: 11 x 16.2 cm; written surface: 6.5 x 13 cm; 15 lines per page.
"al-Tanazzulāt al-Mawṣilīyah": In fair naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red, some corrections on the margins; catchwords.
"Asmāʼ al-Ṣaḥābah": In beautiful naskh script, in black ink, on white paper, markings in red; text within double red frame, fully vocalized, catchwords.
On the back of the front cover, in pencil: "Tanazzul al-amlāk fī ḥarakāt al-amlāk [al-aflāk]."

On folio 1a: "Hādhā Kitāb al-Tanazzulāt al-Mawṣilīyah lil-Shaykh al-Akbar Sayyidī Muḥyī al-Dīn ibn al-ʻArabī, qaddasa Allāh sirrahu wa-nawwara ḍarīḥahu wa-nafaʻanā bi-hi wa-al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn."

On folio 1a: A partially legible ownership statement: "... al-Ḥājj Sulaymān ... ... ..." and a seal: "Innahu min Sulaymān wa-innahu Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm" (Qurʼān. Sūrat al-Naml: 30).
On folio 3b: "Hādhā Kitāb Tanazzul al-amlāk min ʻālam al-arwāḥ fī al-aflāk."

At the end of "al-Tanazzulāt al-Mawṣilīyah" (folio 62b): A reader's note: "Naẓara fīhi wa-taʼammal fī maʻānīhi al-ʻabd al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr, al-rājī al-ʻafwa min Mawlāhu al-qadīr, Muḥammad ibn Muṣṭafá, min qaryat Muʻtarim, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayh, wa-li-man allafa hādhā al-kitāb, wa-li-man katabahu, wa-li-man qará fīhi, wa-li-kull al-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻAlamīn. Ḥurrira fī tisʻah wa-ʻashar Dhī al-Ḥijjah, min sanat khamsata ʻashar wa-miʼatayn wa-alf min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalawāt wa-azká al-taḥīyah. Fī sanat 1215 [3 May, 1801]."

Colophon of "al-Tanazzulāt al-Mawṣilīyah": "Wa-qad tamma al-bāb, wa-bi-tamāmihi jamīʻ al-kitāb. Wa-jamīʻ mā fīhi min al-abyāt huwa min sunūḥ al-khāṭir, ʻalá mā aʻṭāhu al-waqt al-ḥāḍir, illā al-baytān alladhān fī al-bāb al-awwal, fa-innahumā li-ghayrī, wa-humā, Yā Rabbu, jawhar ʻilm law abūḥu bi-hi. Wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb, wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ wa-al-maʼāb. Tamma bi-ʻawn Allāh taʻālá wa-ḥusn tawfīqih."

Translation of the colophon of "al-Tanazzulāt al-Mawṣilīyah": "The chapter is completed, whereby the book is completed in its entirety. All the verses, therein, were impromptu composed by me, except for two verses in the first chapter, they are for others. They are -- O Lord! -- the essence of a science, if I were to disclose it. God is more knowledgeable of what is correct. To Him is the reference and returning. It is completed by the help of God Almighty, and His abundant benevolence."

Colophon of "Asmāʼ al-Ṣaḥābah": No colophon. Text ends with: "... Abū Marthad, Abū Masʻūd al-Badrī, Abū Mulayl, Abū al-Haytham, Abū al-Yusr, raḍiya Allāh taʻālá ʻanhum ajmaʻīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn.

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ Uṣūl al-Ḥadīth : manuscript / Dāwūd ibn Muḥammad al-Qarṣī al-Ḥanafī.
record.note: In clear and beautiful naskh/taʻlīq script, slightly tilted to the right; in black ink, on white paper; markings in red; opening pages decorated with an ornament in gold, red, blue, yellow and black; text within double red frames; catchwords.
On the front of the preliminary leaf: "Risālah fī uṣūl al-Ḥadīth al-Nabawī li-Qāḍī al-Quḍāh, Shaykh al-Islām, Dāwūd al-Qarṣī, taghammadahu Allāh bi-raḥmatih."
On folio 1a: "Uṣūl Ḥadīth / Dāwūd Qarṣī."
On folio 1a: An ownership statement: "Min kutub al-faqīr Muḥammad Yaḥyá Jamāl al-Dīn." And a seal which reads: "Ḥāfiẓ Sayyid Muḥammad Yaḥyá."

Author's colophon: "Fa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá al-khitām, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Rasūlinā, ʻalayhi al-salām, wa-ʻalá ālihi al-ʻiẓām, wa-aṣḥābihi al-kirām. Wa-qad faraghtu min taʼlīfihi sanat iḥdá wa-khamsīn wa-miʼah wa-alf, fī ʻashr Rabīʻ al-Ākhir, fī Miṣr Yūsuf, ʻalayhi al-salām. Allāhumma ikhtimnā bi-al-īmān wa-al-Islām, bi-ḥurmat Sayyid al-anām. Āmīn."

Translation of the author's colophon: "Praise be to God for the conclusion. May prayer and peace be upon our Messenger, peace be upon him, his illustrious family, and honorable companions. I finished writing it on 10 Rabīʻ al-Ākhir, 1151 [28 July, 1738], in Joseph's Egypt, may peace be upon him. We beseech You, O Lord, to seal us with faith and Islam, through the intersession of the Master of Mankind. Amen."
Copyist's colophon: "Wa-qad waqaʻa al-farāgh min kitābatihi sanat tisʻīn wa-miʼatayn wa-alf, fī salkh Jumādá al-Awwal, fī thulth al-layl."
Translation of the copyist's colophon: "It was copied on the third part of the night, the end of Jumādá al-Awwal, 1290 [26 July, 1873]."

record.title: 880-02 Kashf al-astār ʻan ʻilm ḥurūf al-ghubār : manuscript / Abū al-Ḥasan ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Qalaṣādī.
record.note: In fair Maghribī script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red, numerous notes and commentaries on the margins; some mathematical diagrams; catchwords.

On folio 1a: An ownership statement: "al-Ḥamdu lillāh. Tamallaka hādhā al-kitāb al-faqīr li-Rabbihi, al-khāʼiḍ fī biḥār dīnihi, al-muḥtāj ilayhi, al-ghanī bi-hi ʻamman siwāh, ʻAlī ʻAlwān, ʻāmalahu Allāh bi-al-iḥsān wa-al-tawbah wa-al-ghufrān. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn."
On folio 1a: "al-Qalṣādī. Kitāb Kashf al-astār ʻan ʻilm ḥurūf al-ghubār."
On folio 22b: Quotations and anecdotes from different sources, in a different hand.

Author's colophon: "Wa-hādhā ākhir mā qaṣadnāh min hādhā al-mawḍūʻ, wa-Rabbunā al-masʼūl an yanfaʻa bi-hi kull man ishtaghala bi-hi. Innahu walī al-tawfīq. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, khātim al-nabīyīn wa-imām al-mursalīn, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi, wa-sallama taslīman abadan ilá Yawm al-Dīn."

Translation of the author's colophon: "This is the end of what we aimed at from this subject. Our Lord is in charge of benefitting by it whoever calls upon Him; for He is the granter of success. Praise be to God, the Lord of the Universe. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, the Seal of the Prophets, and the leader of the messengers, on his family and on his companions, and grant them abundant and continuous peace until Judgement Day."

Copyist's colophon: "Tamma al-kitāb bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ḥusn ʻawnih ʻalá yad al-ʻabd al-faqīr ... ʻAlī ʻUlwān ... Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābatih yawm al-Khamīs, fī awāʼil Jumādá al-Awwal, sanat 1142, ithnayn wa-arbaʻīn wa-miʼah wa-alf ... Tamm."

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "The book is completed by the praise of God and His abundant benevolence, by the poor servant ... ʻAli ʻUlwan ... Copied on Thursday, the first days of Jumādá al-Awwal, 1142 [24 November, 1729] ... It is completed."

record.title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyah ʻalá matn al-Samarqandīyah : manuscript / Ibrāhīm ibn Muḥammad al-Bājūrī.
record.note: On folio 1a: "Hādhihi Ḥāshiyat Mawlānā al-Shaykh Ibrāhīm al-Bājūrī ʻalá matn al-Samarqandīyah ʻalá al-tamām wa-al-kamāl."
