record.title: Decretum (fragment).
record.note: Damage: the fragment was once used as a pastedown, which has resulted in damage and loss of text to the verso. The bottom of the fragment has been cropped, resulting in loss of text.

record.title: Who's afraid of Virginia Woolf? : a play in three scenes (1961-1962) : typescript / Edward Albee.
record.note: Title page: "Theater 1962, 26 West 8th Street, New York 11, New York."

record.title: Elizabeth Maberly arithmetic notebook : manuscript.
record.note: Manuscript initials on spine: "EM 98."

record.title: Decretals (fragment).
record.note: Disposition: the bifolium appears to have been used as a wrapper. The text is not continuous from 1v to 2r.

Later Annotations: folio 1r contains some notes in later, possibly 17th or 18th-century hands. "Eua uon Ciuer [?]anges gab a Pallant" and "1556/1560" and "B.C." all in the same ink. "K.40" in a brown ink. An illegible three or four word note in brown ink and "15" circled in pencil.

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ Umm al-barāhīn fī ʻilm al-kalām : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Manṣūr al-Hudhudī.
record.note: On folio 1a: An erased endowment statement "waqf".

Colophon: "Tammat hādhihi al-nuskhah al-mubārakah fī yawm al-Khamīs al-mubārak, fī thamāniyat ʻishrīyat shahr Safar [Ṣafar] al-ḥarām, min shuhūr sanat 1175, alf wa-miʼah wa-khamsah wa-sabʻīn min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām, wa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻAlī al-ʻAẓīm. Tamm. Tamm."

Translation of the colophon: "This blessed copy was completed on blessed Thursday, 28 Ṣafar, 1175 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [18 September, 1761], may the best of prayer and peace be upon him. There is no power nor might except in God, the Most High, the All Mighty. It is completed. It is completed."

record.title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyat al-Sharqāwī ʻalá Sharḥ al-Hudhudī ʻalá Umm al-barāhīn : manuscript / ʻAbd Allāh ibn Ḥijāzī al-Sharqāwī.
record.note: On folio 1a: "Hādhihi Ḥāshiyat al-Imām al-ʻAllāmah, al-ḥabr al-baḥr al-fahhāmah, al-Shaykh ʻAbd Allāh al-Sharqāwī, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi wa-al-Muslimīn. Āmīn."
On the right margin of the colophon the copyist wrote three verses of poetry praising learning and the pursuit of knowledge, and urging the readers to acquire them.

Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat hādhihi al-nuskhah al-sharīfah yawm al-Sabt al-mubārak, thānī ʻashar khalat min shahr Rabīʻ Awwal, sanat 1229, tisʻah wa-ʻishrīn wa-miʼatayn wa-alf min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-taslīm, ʻalá yad kātibihā al-faqīr Aḥmad Abū Ḥamāmah al-Ikhnāwī, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Tammat."

Translation of the colophon: "This noble copy was completed on blessed Saturday, 12 Rabīʻ Awwal, 1229 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [4 March, 1814], may the best of prayer and peace be upon him, by the hand of its copyist, the poor Aḥmad Abū Ḥamāmah al-Ikhnāwī. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, on his family and companions and grant them peace. It is completed."

record.title: 880-02 Itḥāf al-murīd bi-Jawharat al-tawḥīd : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Salām ibn Ibrāhīm al-Laqānī.
record.note: On the right margin of folio 1a: An endowment statement: "Waqafa jamīʻ hādhā al-kitāb ʻalá ṭalabat al-ʻilm bi-al-Maqām al-Aḥmadī al-ʻUmdah al-fāḍil al-Shaykh Ḥasan Farḥāt, wa-sharaṭ an takūn taḥt yad al-Faqīh Muḥammad Fayyāḍ al-Ḥusaynī. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad."
On folio 1a: Quotations and anecdotes in different hands.
On folio 1b: "... wa-sammaytuhu Itḥāf al-murīd bi-Jawharat al-tawḥīd ..."
Folio 68 is blank.

Colophon: "Qāla muʼallifuhu wa-jāmiʻuhu al-faqīr ilá Allāh, subḥānuhu wa-taʻālá, al-ʻālim al-fāḍil, al-bāriʻ al-kāmil, al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Salām ibn Shaykh al-Islām, farīd dahrih, wa-waḥīd ʻaṣrih, al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻallāmah, al-Shaykh Ibrāhīm al-Mālikī al-Laqānī: Faraghtu min jamʻihi yawm al-Khamīs al-mubārak, li-ʻishrīn khalat min Ramaḍān al-muʻaẓẓam qadruhu, min shuhūr al-sanah al-sābiʻah wa-al-arbaʻīn baʻda al-alf. Wa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻAlī al-ʻAẓīm. al-Farāgh min tamāmih 9 N, 1291."

Translation of the colophon: "Its author and compiler, the poor to God (the Most High, may He be praised), the honorable perfect learned scholar, al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Salām ibn Shaykh al-Islām, the unique in his time and age, the learned Imām, al-Shaykh Ibrāhīm al-Mālikī al-Laqānī, said: I finished compiling the book on blessed Thursday, the twentieth of noble Ramaḍān, the year 1047 [of the Hijrah = 5 February, 1638]. There is no power nor might except in God, the Most High, the All Powerful. Copied on 9 N [probably Shaʻbān or Ramaḍān], 1291 [of the Hijrah = 21 September, or 20 October, 1874]."

record.title: 880-02 al-Rawḍ al-unuf : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Suhaylī.
record.note: On folio 1a: "[... ...] min al-Rawḍ al-unuf lil-Suhaylī [...] Allāh taʻālá, wa-raḍiya ʻanhu bi-mannihi wa-karamih."

On folio 1a: Ownership statements: "Min mann mann mann ʻalá ʻabdihi al-faqīr Abī al-Wafā al-ʻAlamī, ʻufiya ʻanh". "Malakahu wa-mā baʻdahu al-muftaqir [... ... ...] Abū Bakr ibn Muḥammad [...] al-ʻImādī". "Qad wujida hādhā al-juzʼ min Rawḍ [... ...] kutub al-marḥūm al-Ḥājj Muḥammad ibn [... ... ...] 21 Shaʻbān, sanat [...]."

On folio 1a: Endowment statements: "Min al-kutub allatī awqafahā al-faqīr Muḥammad Raḍī al-Dīn ibn Abī al-Luṭf [...] fa-man baddalahu baʻdamā samiʻahu, fa-Allāh taʻālá khaṣmuhu. Wa-ḥasbiya Allāh wa-niʻma al-wakīl". "Naʻam, abqaytuhu ʻalá ṣiḥḥat al-waqf al-ṣaḥīḥ. Uṣaddiqu ʻalá dhālik. Fa-man baddalahu baʻdamā samiʻahu, fa-Allāh taʻālá khaṣmuhu, wa-ukhāṣimuhu bayna yaday Allāh taʻālá [...] al-faqīr Yūsuf ibn Muḥammad Raḍī al-Dīn al-Luṭfī. Laṭafa Allāh bi-hi. Āmīn. Wa-ʻafá ʻannā wa-ʻanhu. M."

On folio 1a: Two readers statements, as follows: "al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-Ḥaqq. Ṭālaʻahu al-wāthiq billāh al-Qawī, Aḥmad ibn Yūsuf al-ʻAdawī, laṭafa Allāh bi-hi wa-jaʻalahu min ḥizbih, bi-mannihi bi-mannih. Āmīn. Sanat 1005 [of the Hijrah = 1596/1597]". "Ṭālaʻa fīhi al-ʻabd al-faqīr Muṣṭafá ibn Muḥammad al-Rajjī, ʻafá Allāh ʻanh."
Folio 1b is written in a different hand.

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with the information about "Abū Kabshah": "... qīla fīhi aqwāl. Qīla innahā kānat kunyat abīh li-ummih Wahb ibn ʻAbd Munāf. Wa-qīla kunyat abīhi min al-riḍāʻah, al-Ḥārith ibn ʻAbd al-ʻUzzá. Wa-qīla inna Salmá umm ʻAbd al-Muṭṭalib kāna yukanná abūhā Abā Kabshah, wa-huwa ʻAmr ibn Labīd. Wa-ashhar min hādhihi al-aqwāl kullihā ʻinda al-nās annahum shabbahūhu bi-rajul kāna yaʻbudu al-Shiʻrá waḥdahu dūna al-ʻArab fa-nasabūhu ilayh [... ...]. Wa-dhakar al-Dāraquṭnī isma Abā Kabshah hādhā fī al-Muʼtalif wa-al-mukhtalif, qāl ..."

record.title: 880-02 Nuzʹhat al-arwāḥ fī baʻḍ awṣāf al-Jannah dār al-afrāḥ : manuscript / Yūsuf ibn Saʻīd al-Ṣafatī al-Mālikī al-Azʹharī.
record.note: On folio 1a (in pencil): "Nuzʹhat al-arwāḥ fī baʻḍ awṣāf al-Jannah."
On folio 31b (in a different hand): A riddle about kinship.
Folio 32 is blank; text folios 1b-31a.

Colophon: "Tammat hādhihi al-risālah yawm al-Sabt al-mubārak, khamast ʻashar yawman min shahr Rabīʻ al-Ākhir, alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat alf wa-miʼatayn thalāthah wa-sabʻīn. Wa-kātibuhā al-ʻabd al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr al-muʻtarif bi-al-ʻajz wa-al-taqṣīr, Naṣār ibn Manṣūr al-Saʻdīnī baladan, al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayh, wa-al-Muslimīn wa-al-Muslimāt, wa-al-muʼminīn wa-al-muʼmināt, al-aḥyāʼ minhum wa-al-amwāt, innahu samīʻ qarīb mujīb al-d[ʻawāt]."

Translation of the colophon: "This treatise was completed on blessed Saturday, 15 Rabī al-Ākhir, 1273 [of the Hijrah = 13 December, 1856]. Copied by the poor and despised servant who admits his inability and inadequacy, Naṣṣār ibn Manṣūr al-Saʻdīnī baladan, al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban, may God forgive him, his parents, Muslim men and women and the believers, men and women, the living among them and the dead. He [God] hears, and He is near and answers the invocations."

record.title: 880-03 al-Jāmiʻ al-ṣaḥīḥ. Al-Juzʼ 9 : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Ismāʻīl al-Bukhārī.
record.note: On preliminary page: "al-Juzʼ al-tāsiʻ min ithnay ʻashar min kitāb Abī ʻAbd Allāh Muḥammad ibn Ismāʻīl ibn Ibrāhīm ibn al-Mughīrah ibn Bardazbah al-Bukhārī al-Jaʻfī, raḍiya Allāh taʻālá ʻanhu wa-nafaʻanā bi-hi. Āmīn. Tammat. M."
On the lower edge of the codex: al-Juzʼ al-tāsiʻ min al-Bukhārī al-Sharīf

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with: "Bāb 'al-Taslīm wa-al-istīdhān thalāthan' ... fa-qāla: Wallāh la-nuqīmanna ʻalayhi bayyinah. Aminkum aḥadun samiʻahu min al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam? Fa-qāla Ubayy ibn Kaʻb: Wallāh la-qaūmu maʻaka, illā aṣghar al-qawm, fa-kuntu aṣghar al-qawm, qumtu maʻahu, fa-akhbara ʻUmar anna al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, qāla dhālik. Wa-qāla Ibn al-Mubārak: Akhbaranī Ibn ʻUyaynah, ḥaddathanī Zayd ibn Khuṣayfah, ʻan Yusr: Samiʻtu Abā Saʻīd bi-hādhā, idhā iddaʻá al-rajul. Tamma al-juzʼ al-tāsiʻ min ithnay ʻashar, wa-yalīhi 'Bāb idhā iddaʻá al-rajul fa-jāʼa li-ahl yastaʼdhin ..."

record.title: 880-03 Matn Alfīyat al-Shaykh al-ʻIrāqī fī muṣṭalaḥ al-Ḥadīth : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Raḥīm ibn al-Ḥusayn al-ʻIrāqī.
record.note: On folio 1a: "Hādhā Matn Alfīyat al-Shaykh al-ʻIrāqī fī muṣṭalaḥ al-Ḥadīth, nafaʻa Allāh taʻālá bi-hā ʻibādah. Āmīn."
On folio 1a: An endowment statement: "Waqf lillāh taʻālá ʻalá ahl al-ʻilm bi-al-Azʹhar, wa-maqarruhu Ruwāq al-Akrād."
On folio 37b, in a different hand, a numerical talisman.

Colophon: "Tammat al-urjūzah al-mubārakah yawm al-Arbaʻ al-mubārak, arbaʻah wa-ʻishrūn khalat min Ramaḍān al-muʻaẓẓam qadruhu, alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat 1166 min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-atamm al-taslīm. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min namqihā ʻalá yad kātibihā, afqar al-ʻibād wa-aḥwajihim ilá raḥmat Allāh, al-faqīr Ḥusayn ibn Muḥammad ibn Salāmah al-Ghadmīnī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-mashāyikhih."

Translation of the colophon: "The blessed urjūzah was completed on blessed Wednesday, the twenty-fourth of noble month of Ramaḍān, 1166 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [25 July, 1753], may the best prayer and perfect peace be upon him. Copied by th poorest of the servants and the most needy to the mercy of God, the poor Ḥusayn ibn Muḥammad ibn Salāmah al-Ghadmīnī, may God forgive him, his parents and his masters."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ Alfīyat al-Sīrah : manuscript / ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Ujhūrī.
record.note: On folio 1a: "Kitāb Sharḥ Alfīyat al-Sīrah lil-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Raḥīm ibn al-Ḥusayn, taʼlīf al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻallāmah, al-baḥr al-fahhāmah, farīd ʻaṣrih wa-waḥīd dahrih, al-Shaykh ʻAlī al-Ujhūrī al-Mālikī, taghammadahu Allāh bi-raḥmatih, wa-askanahu fasīḥ Jannatihi, bi-mannihi wa-karamih. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi, wa-sallama taslīman kathīran ilá Yawm al-Dīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Tamm. Tamm."
On folio 1a: An endowment statement: "Awqafa hādhā al-kitāb lillāh taʻālá Aḥmad Ḥamad al-Najjārī."

Colophon: "Tamma hādhā al-sharḥ al-mubārak al-Shaykh al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah ... al-Shaykh ʻAlī al-Ujhūrī al-Mālikī, taghammadahu Allāh bi-raḥmatih, wa-askanahu fasīḥ Jannatih, bi-mannihi wa-karamih, ʻalá al-Sīrah al-alfīyah lil-Shaykh al-Imām, al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Raḥīm ibn al-Ḥusayn, al-maʻrūf bi-al-ʻIrāqī, ghafara Allāh la-hu, wa-nafaʻanā bi-ʻulūmih fī al-dīn wa-al-dunyā wa-al-ākhirah. Āmīn. Wa-kāna al-farāgh minhu Yawm al-Sabt al-mubārak, khāmis ʻashar Rabīʻ al-Ākhir, min shuhūr sanat ithnayn wa-tisʻīn wa-alf, ʻalá yad kātibihi al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr ʻAbd al-Majīd ibn al-faqīr Salāmah al-Ṭunbārī al-Shāfiʻī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayh wa-li-man daʻā la-hu bi-al-maghfirah. Āmīn. Tamm."

Translation of the colophon: "This blessed commentary on 'al-Sīrah al-alfīyah' -- of the learned scholar ... al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Raḥīm ibn al-Ḥusayn, known by the epithet 'al-ʻIrāqī', may God forgive him, and benefit us by his knowledge in religion, in this world and in the hereafter. Amen -- was completed by the learned scholar ... al-Shaykh ʻAlī al-Ujhūrī al-Mālikī, may God bestow His mercy upon him, and make him dwell in His spacious Paradise, by His benevolence and generosity. Copied on blessed Saturday, 15 Rabīʻ al-Ākhir, 1092 [of the Hijrah = 4 May, 1681] by the poor and despised ʻAbd al-Majīd son of the poor Salāmah al-Ṭunbārī al-Shāfiʻī, may God forgive him, his parents and those who invoke God's forgiveness, on his behalf. Amen. It is completed."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ Gharāmī ṣaḥīḥ : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Amīr al-Kabīr.
record.note: On folio 1a: "Kitāb Sharḥ Gharāmī ṣaḥīḥ lil-Shaykh [li-Shaykh] al-Islām, al-Shaykh Muḥammad al-Amīr al-Mālikī, ʻafá Allāh ʻanhu. Āmīn."
Folios 17b-20b are blank; text folios 1b-17a.

Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābatihi yawm al-Sabt al-mubārak, fī 17 Ramaḍān alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat 1197 min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá yad kātibihā al-faqīr ilá Allāh Mūsá ibn al-marḥūm al-Shaykh Muḥammad al-Ṭilyāwī al-Mālikī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayh wa-lil-Muslimīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon: "Copied on Saturday, 17 Ramaḍān, 1197 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [16 August, 1783], by the poor to God Mūsá ibn al-marḥūm al-Shaykh Muḥammad al-Ṭilyāwī al-Mālikī, may God forgive him, his parents and Muslims. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions and grant them peace. Amen. Amen.Amen.Amen."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Manẓūmah al-Bayqūnīyah : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd al-Bāqī al-Zurqānī.
record.note: On the label on the front cover: "Sharḥ al-Bayqūnīyah fī muṣṭalaḥ al-Ḥadīth."

Author's colophon: "Wa-qad faraghtu min taswīdihā fī Yawm ʻĀshūrāʼ, fī sanat thamānīn wa-alf. Wa-ḥasbunā Allāh wa-niʻma al-wakīl. Wa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻAlī al-ʻAẓīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Āmīn."

Translation of the author's colophon: "I finished writing it on 'Yawm ʻĀshūrāʼ' [10 Muḥarram], the year 1080 [of the Hijrah = 10 June, 1669]. God suffices us, He is the best advocate. There is no power nor might except is God, the Most High, the All Mighty. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions and grant them peace. Amen."

record.title: 880-03 al-Jāmiʻ al-ṣaḥīḥ. Al-Juzʼ 9 : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Ismāʻīl al-Bukhārī.
record.note: In good, clear and large naskh script, in black ink on white paper; headings in red; text fully vocalized; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "al-Sifr al-tāsiʻ min Ṣaḥīḥ al-Bukhārī, taghammadahu Allāh bi-raḥmatih."
On the lower edge of the codex: "al-Juzʼ al-tāsiʻ min al-Bukhārī al-Sharīf."
On the upper left corner of folio 1a, in red: "Hādhā al-kitāb nāqiṣ, min 'Mīrāth al-asīr' ilá ākhirih."

On folio 1a: An endowment statement: "[Awqafa] hādhā al-kitāb, wa-huwa al-tāsiʻ min Ṣaḥīḥ al-Bukhārī, wa-mā qablahu wa-mā baʻdahu, [...] al-ʻabd al-faqīr [... ... ...] ibn al-marḥūm al-Ḥājj Khalīl ibn al-Ḥājj Ibrāhīm, Shaykh madīnat Dayrkūsh, min aʻmāl Ḥalab al-maḥrūsah ʻalá [... ... ...] al-ashhur al-thalāthah [... ... ...] fī ṣaḥāʼif al-wāqif al-madhkūr [... ... ...] al-mawqūf al-madhkūr kāna ahdā [... ... ...] bi-Darkūsh [... ... ...] wa-dahr al-dāhirīn, waqfan ṣaḥīḥan sharʻīyan, lā yubāʻu, wa-lā yurhanu, wa-lā yūhabu, fa-man baddalahu [...] fa-innamā ithmuhu ʻalá alladhīna yubaddilūnahu. Inna Allāh samīʻun ʻalīm. Wa-ashhad ʻalayhi Allāh, fī tārikh shahr Shaʻbān [sanat] arbaʻ wa-thalāthīn wa-thamānimiʼah min al-Hijrah."
Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with 'Bāb Mīrāth al-asīr' (Chapter on the Inheritance of the captive), as follows: "[... ... ...] qāl, man taraka mālan fa-li-warathatihi ..."

record.title: 880-03 Sharḥ Ṣaḥīḥ al-Bukhārī. Al-Juzʼ 8 : manuscript / Abū al-Ḥasan ʻAlī ibn Baṭṭāl al-Andalusī.
record.note: On folio 1a: "al-Juzʼ al-thāmin min Sharḥ Ṣaḥīḥ al-Bukhārī lil-Shaykh Abī al-Ḥasan al-Mālikī al-Andalusī, huwa Ibn Baṭṭāl, raḥmat Allāh ʻalayh, wa-nafaʻanā bi-ʻulūmih. Āmīn."
Folios 212-213 are blank.
Pages numbered in Indian numerals: 1-425.

Colophon: "Kamula al-juzʼ al-thāmin min Sharḥ Ṣaḥīḥ al-Bukhārī bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih wa-ḥusn tawfīqih, yatlūhu al-juzʼ al-tāsiʻ, in shāʼa Allāh taʻālá, Kitāb al-libās, wa-qawl Allāh, ʻazza wa-jall: Qul man ḥarrama zīnat Allāh allatī akhraja li-ʻibādih wa-al-ṭayyibāt min al-rizq, al-āyah ... [Sūrat al-Aʻrāf, al-āyah 32]. Ḥasbunā Allāh wa-niʻma al-wakīl."

Translation of the colophon: "The eighth part of Sharḥ Ṣaḥīḥ al-Bukhārī is completed by the praise of God, His help and His abundant benevolence. It will be followed, God willing, by the ninth part, and the saying of God, may He be glorified and praised: 'Say, Who has prohibited the adornment God has brought forth for His servants, and the wholesome things of sustenance?' ... The verse [Sūrat al-Aʻrāf, verse 32]. God suffices us, He is the best advocate."

record.title: 880-02 al-Jawhar al-munaẓẓam fī ziyārat al-qabr al-mukarram : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn Ḥajar al-Haythamī.
record.note: On folio 1a: "Kitāb al-Jawhar al-munaẓẓam fī ziyārat al-qabr al-mukarram, taʼlīf al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻĀlim al-ʻallāmah al-ʻumdah Ibn Ḥajar al-Haythamī, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-barakatihi. Āmīn."
At head of folio 1a: "Ziyārat qabr al-Mukarram."
On folio 1a: An erased endowment statement: "Waqf".
On folio 2a: "... thumma sammaytuhu al-Jawhar al-munaẓẓam fī ziyārat qabr al-mukarram."

Colophon: "Qāla muʼallifuhu Shaykh al-Islām wa-al-Muslimīn Shihāb al-Dīn Aḥmad ibn Ḥajar al-Shāfiʻī, raḥimahu Allāh wa-nafaʻanā bi-hi. Āmīn. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min nisākhatihi ḍuḥá yawm al-Khamīs min shahr Shaʻbān, ʻām thamān wa-khamsīn wa-tisʻimiʼah. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābatihi yawm al-Thulāthāʼ al-mubārak, al-sādis wa-al-ʻishrīn min shahr Rabīʻ al-Thānī, sant 1100, ʻalá yaday afqar al-ʻibād ilá Rabbihi al-Mawlá al-muʻṭī al-māniḥ, ṣāḥib al-ʻajz wa-al-taqṣīr Aḥmad Ṣāliḥ, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon: "Its author, Shaykh al-Islām wa-al-Muslimīn Shihāb al-Dīn Aḥmad ibn Ḥajar al-Shāfiʻī, may God have mercy upon him and benefit us through him. Amen, said: 'I finished writing it on Thursday morning in Shaʻbān, 958 [of the Hijrah = August/September, 1551]'. Copied on blessed Tuesday [probably Thursday], 26 Rabīʻ al-Thanī, 1100 [of the Hijrah = 17 February, 1689], by the poorest of the servants of his Lord, the Giver and Sustainer, he of disability and insufficiency, Aḥmad Ṣāliḥ, may God forgive him, his parents and all Muslims. Amen."

record.title: 880-02 Manāsik al-ḥajj : manuscript / ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Nūrī al-Ṣafāqisī.
record.note: Title of Manāsik al-ḥajj from folio 1a.
Title of Masāʼil al-ḥajj allatī lā budda minhā lil-ḥājj from incipit (folio 91b).

Incipit of Manāsik al-Ḥajj: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-sallam. Qāla al-Shaykh al-Imām, al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, al-muḥaqqiq, al-walī al-ṣāliḥ al-zāhid al-nāṣiḥ, waḥīd dahrih wa-farīd ʻaṣrih, Sayyidī ʻAlī al-Nūrī al-Ṣafāqisī, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu wa-nafaʻanā bi-hi. Āmīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī jaʻala baytahu al-mubārak alladhī bi-Bakkata hudan wa-raḥmatan wa-taṭhīran, wa-daʻā ʻibādahu ilá ziyāratihi, fa-ajābahu bi-al-talbiyah man khaṣṣahu bi-ʻināyatih, wa-aʻadda la-hu ajran kabīran ..."
Secundo folio of Manāsik al-Ḥajj: wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā.

Incipit of Masāʼil al-Ḥajj allatī lā budda minhā lil-ḥājj: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah, wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá man lā nabī baʻdah. Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhihi Masāʼil al-ḥajj allatī lā budda minhā lil-ḥājj. Idhā arāda an yuḥrima bi-al-ḥajj yuqallimu aẓāfirahu, wa-yaquṣṣa shāribahu, wa-yaḥliqa ʻānatahu, wa-yantifa ibṭahu, wa-yaghtasila aw yatawaḍḍaʼa, wa-yataṭayyiba, thumma yalbasa izāran wa-ridāʼan, thumma yuṣalliya rakʻatayn ..."
Secundo folio of Masāʼil al-ḥajj allatī lā budda minhā lil-ḥājj: sunnat al-iḥrām thumma baʻda al-ṣalāh.
In clear Maghribī script, in black ink on white paper; headings and markings in purple; no catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhihi Manāsik al-ḥajj lil-Shaykh Sayyidī ʻAlī al-Nūrī al-Ṣafāqisī, raḥimahu Allāh wa-nafaʻanā bi-hi. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn."
On the back of the front cover to preliminary page, in crude hand: Table of contents of "Manāsik al-ḥajj".
Folios 50-55a are blank.
On folios 55b-59a, in crude hand, in pencil: Scribbles, lists of items and calculations.
On folios 82a-83a, in crude and different hand: Table of contents for "Masāʼil al-ḥajj allatī lā budda minhā lil-ḥājj".
Folios 83b-91a are blank.
Colophon of Manāsik al-ḥajj: "Intahá bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ḥusn ʻawnih. Wa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻAlī al-ʻAẓīm. Wa-ākhir daʻwānā an al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Ah. Ah."

Translation of the colophon of Manāsik al-ḥajj: "It is completed by the praise of God and His benevolent assistance. There is no power nor might except in God the Most High, the All Mighty. Our concluding invocation is: Praise be to God. Lord of the Universe."

Colophon of Masāʼil al-ḥajj allatī lā budda minhā lil-ḥājj: No colophon. Text ends with: "Lā ilāha illā Allāh. Muḥammad Rasūl Allāh. Allāhumma ṣalli wa-sallim wa-bārik ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn."

record.title: 880-02 Itḥāf al-murīd bi-Jawharat al-tawḥīd : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Salām ibn Ibrāhīm al-Laqānī.
record.note: On folio 1a: "Sharḥ ʻAbd al-Salām ʻalá Jawharat al-tawḥīd ʻalá al-tamām wa-al-kamāl."
On folio 1a: Ownership statement: "Dakhala fī mulk al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá al-Ḥājj Aḥmad Qalāqiṭ [ʻufiya] ʻanh."
On folio 2a: "... wa-sammaytuhu 'Itḥāf al-murīd bi-jawharat al-tawḥīd'."

Author's colophon: "Qāla muʼallifuhu wa-jāmiʻuhu al-faqīr ilá Allāh, taʻālá subḥānuhu, al-ʻālim al-fāḍil, al-bāriʻ al-kāmil, al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Salām ibn Shaykh al-Islām, farīd dahrih, wa-waḥīd ʻaṣrih, al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, al-Shaykh Ibrāhīm al-Mālikī al-Laqānī: Faraghtu min jamʻihi yawm al-Khamīs al-mubārak, li-ʻishrīn khalat min Ramaḍān al-muʻaẓẓam qadruhu, min shuhūr al-sanah al-sābiʻah wa-al-arbaʻīn baʻda al-alf. Wa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻAlī al-ʻAẓīm. Wa-ḥasbunā Allāh wa-niʻma al-wakīl."

Translation of the author's colophon: "Its author and compiler, the poor to God (the Most High, may He be praised), the honorable, perfect, and learned scholar, al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Salām ibn Shaykh al-Islām, the unique in his time and age, the learned Imām, al-Shaykh Ibrāhīm al-Mālikī al-Laqānī, said: I finished compiling the book on blessed Thursday, the twentieth of noble Ramaḍān, the year 1047 [of the Hijrah = 5 February, 1638]. There is no power nor might except in God, the Most High, the All Powerful. God suffices us, He is the best advocate."

Copyist's colophon: "Tamma bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min naskhih fī laylat al-Jumʻah sādis ʻishrī [ʻishrīn] Rabīʻ al-Thānī, sanat sabʻ wa-sittīn wa-miʼatayn wa-alf min Hijratihi, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, ʻalá yad al-faqīr Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad Abū al-Faḍl al-Shāfiʻī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-jamīʻ al-muʼminīn."

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "It is completed by the praise of God and His help. Copied on Friday night, 26 Rabīʻ al-Thānī, 1267 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [28 February, 1851], may God pray on him and grant him peace, by the poor Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad Abū al-Faḍl al-Shāfiʻī, may God forgive him, his parents, and all the faithful." At the left margin of the colophon the copyist states that he made this copy for himself, and stamps his seal.

record.title: 880-02 Itḥāf al-murīd bi-Jawharat al-tawḥīd : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Salām ibn Ibrāhīm al-Laqānī.
record.note: On folio 1a: "Kitāb Itḥāf al-murīd bi-Jawhart al-tawḥīd, li-Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā al-ʻĀlim al-ʻallāmah Sayyidī ʻAbd al-Salām ibn al-Shaykh Ibrāhīm al-Laqānī al-Mālikī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá. wa-nafaʻanā bi-himā. Āmīn. Āmīn."
On folio 1b: "... wa-sammaytuhu 'Itḥāf al-murīd bi-jawharat al-tawḥīd'."

Author's colophon: "Qāla muʼallifuhu wa-jāmiʻuhu ʻAbd al-Salām ibn al-Shaykh Ibrāhīm al-Mālikī al-Laqānī: Faraghtu min jamʻihi yawm al-Khamīs, ʻishrīn khalat min Ramaḍān al-muʻaẓẓam qadruhu, min shuhūr al-sanah al-sābiʻah wa-al-arbaʻīn baʻda al-alf. Wa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻAlī al-ʻAẓīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-sallam."

Translation of the author's colophon: "Its author and compiler ʻAbd al-Salām ibn al-Shaykh Ibrāhīm al-Mālikī al-Laqānī, said: I finished compiling the book on Thursday, the twentieth of noble Ramaḍān, the year 1047 [of the Hijrah = 5 February, 1638]. There is no power nor might except in God, the Most High, the All Powerful. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad and grant him peace."

Copyist's colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābatihi yawm al-Arbiʻāʼ, tāsiʻ ʻashar shahr Jumādá al-ūlá, sanat 1140, ʻalá yad kātibihi, bi-yadihi al-fāniyah, al-faqīr al-fānī, Saqr al-Samānī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-al-Muslimīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "Copied on Wednesday, 19 Jumādá al-Ūlá, 1140 [of the Hijrah, 2 January, 1728], by the perishing hand of the poor and perishing servant Saqr al-Samānī, may God forgive him, his parents, and the Muslims. Amen."

record.title: 880-02 Itḥāf al-murīd bi-Jawharat al-tawḥīd : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Salām ibn Ibrāhīm al-Laqānī.
record.note: On folio 1a: "Hādhā Kitāb Sharḥ al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Salām ʻalá matn al-Jawharah, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-ʻulūmih."
On folio 1a: Ownership statement, as follows: "Dakhala fī Mulk al-ʻabd al-fānī, al-faqīr Muḥammad al-ʻAqqād ibn Aḥmad, ghafara Allāh [la-hu] wa-li-wālidayhi wa-al-Muslimīn. Āmīn."
On folio 1b: "... wa-sammaytuhu 'Itḥāf al-murīd bi-Jawharah al-tawḥīd'."
Folios 21a-32b are written in a different hand, in naskh script.
On folios 78b-80b: An invocation, in a different hand.

Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min hādhihi al-nuskhah al-mubārakah yawm al-Jumʻah al-mubārakah, sābiʻ ʻasharī Rabīʻ al-Ākhir, sanat alf wa-miʼah wa-ʻasharah min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām. Tamm." Below the colophon: "Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Ghafara Allāh li-kātibihā, aw, mālikihā, wa-man ṭālaʻa fīhā, wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon: "This blessed copy was completed on blessed Friday, 17 Rabīʻ al-Ākhir, 1110 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [23 October, 1698], may the best of prayer and peace be upon him. It is completed." Below the colophon: "May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions and grant them peace. May God forgive its copyist, or, its owner, he who reads it and all Muslims. Amen."

record.title: 880-03 al-Ṭarīqah al-Muḥammadīyah : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Bīr ʻAlī al-Burkawī.
record.note: On the preliminary leaf: "al-Ṭarīqah al-Muḥammadīyah lil-Burkawī."

On folio 1a: 1. Shahādah (Statement of faith) by Muḥammad ibn Muṣṭafá al-Jisr ibn Akwārwā. 2. Ownership statement: "Dakhala fī nawbat al-faqīr Bakr ibn [...] Bakr Sallākh, sanat 1297 [1879/1880]". 3. Seal of Bakr Ṣidqī. 4. Shahādah (Statement of faith) by Abū Bakr ibn al-marḥūm Muḥammad Ṣāliḥ Ḥammād al-Madanī. 5. Ownership statement: "Intaqala ilá ḥawz al-rājī min [Allāh] al-najāh fī yawm al-maʻād Abī Bakr ibn al-marḥūm Muḥammad Ṣāliḥ Ḥammād ghufira la-humā, taḥrīran fī awākhir Ṣafar al-khayr 229 [1229 = 20 February, 1814], wa-annā bi-Makkah al-Mukarramah." 6. A list of the abbreviations used in the treatise.

On folio 2a: "... fa-aradʹtu an uṣannifa al-Ṭarīqah al-Muḥammadīyah, wa-aḥbabtu an ubayyina al-Sīrah al-Aḥmadīyah, ḥattá yaʻriḍa ʻalyahā kull sālik, fa-yatamayyaza al-muṣīb ʻan al-mukhṭiʼ wa-al-nājī min al-hālik ..."

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with: "... fa-ḥirmān mā ʻadā al-awlād al-dhukūr wa-ʻadam al-qaḍāʼ wa-al-tanfīdh ẓulm, wa-taṣarrufuhum fīhā wa-taṣarruf man ʻayyanahum al-sulṭān in lam yakun fī al-warathah awlād dhukūr taṣarruf fī mulk al-ghayr, fa-yakūnu al-ḥāṣil minhā khabīthan. Qāla fī al-Tātārkhānīyah: Rajul ghaṣaba arḍan fa-ajjarahā wa-akhadha ghallatahu, aw, zaraʻa al-arḍ kaddan fa-kharaja thalāth akrār, yaʼkhudhu raʼs mālahu al-kurr wa-yataṣaddaqu bi-al-ghallah wa-al-kurrayn wa-yaḍmanu al-nuqṣān, wa-hādhā aqwāhum jamīʻan. Intahá. Wa-yakūnu akhdh baʻḍ ..."

record.title: De ecclesiastica potestate (fragment).
record.note: Damage: the bifolium is composed of two separate fragments with contiguous text; one fragment comprises the top half of the bifolium, while the other comprises the bottom. The fragments may have been used as a wrapper, as uneven staining and glue residue is present. Discoloration is relatively even across both fragments. There is major loss of text on 1r and 2v due to staining and tearing.

record.title: Legenda aurea (fragment).
record.note: Damage: the leaf has been heavily damaged and probably used as a pastedown; remnants of glue and paper can be observed on the verso. Text on the recto is undamaged, though there is some loss on the verso.

record.title: Robert Louis Stevenson notebook : manuscript.
record.note: Title page: "Original autograph poems."
Binding by Sangorski & Sutcliffe: full red morocco binding with gilt lettering and decoration.

record.title: Canon medicinae (fragment).
record.note: Damage: the fragment has been removed from a binding, where it possibly served as a wrapper. Glue and binding material are still attached to one side of the leaf; the other side is discolored with offsetting from the later book. A piece from the spine remains attached and reads "Bbb" [?].

record.title: Decretals (fragment).
record.note: Disposition: the leaf has been extracted from a binding; leather from the binding is still attached to the verso. The verso has near complete loss of text.

record.title: 880-03 al-Jāmiʻ al-ṣaḥīḥ. Al-Juzʼ 1 : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Ismāʻīl al-Bukhārī.
record.note: Leaf 1 seems to have been replaced with a different hand and a different kind of paper.
On the lower edge of the codex: "al-Juzʼ al-awwal min al-Bukhārī al-Sharīf."
On the preliminary page in indelible pencil: "Rubʻ al-Bukhārī al-awwal. 880."
On the upper left corner of folio 2a, in red: "al-Juzʼ al-awwal min al-Bukhārī min arbaʻat ajzāʼ."
The first volume ends with "Bāb al-muʻtakif."

Colophon: "Ākhir al-juzw al-awwal min ajzāʼ arbaʻah, wa-yatlūhu al-juzʼ al-thānī 'Bāb al-Buyūʻ', in shāʼa Allāh taʻālá. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, Khātim al-Nabīyīn wa-imām al-mursalīn. Wa-raḍiya Allāh ʻan Sādātinā aṣḥāb Rasūl Allāh ajmaʻīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. ʻAlá yad aqall ʻibād Allāh wa-aḥwajihim ilá raḥmatih, Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī al-Muqrī al-Shāfiʻī, al-nāsikh, al-shahīr bi-Ibn al-Sharīf, bi-tārīkh nahār al-Sabt, thāmin ʻasharī shahr Ṣafar al-khayr, min shuhūr sanat thamānīn wa-thamānimiʼah. Wa-ḥasbunā Allāh wa-kafá. Wa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻAlī al-ʻAẓīm. Sanat 880."

Translation of the colophon: "This is the end of the first part of the four parts. It will be followed, God willing, by the second part 'Bāb al-Buyūʻ' [Chapter on sales]. Praise be to God alone. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, the Seal of the Prophets and the leader of the messengers. May God be pleased with our Masters, all the companions of the Messenger of God. Amen. Amen. Copied by the least among the servants of God and the neediest to His mercy, Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī al-Muqrī al-Shāfiʻī, the copyist, known by Ibn al-Sharīf, on Saturday, 18 Ṣafar, the year 880 [of the Hijrah = 2 July, 1475]. God suffices us, and that is enough. There is no power nor might except in God the Most High, the All Mighty. The year 880."

record.title: Elizabeth I, Queen of England order to Sir Thomas Heneage for payment of alms money : manuscript.
record.note: Signed "Elizabeth R" at head of document.
Dated from "our manor of St. James the seventh day of Aprill in the five and thirtith yeare of oure Reigne."
Signature in lower right corner of recto: "J. Wood."
Papered seal affixed to recto.
Docketed on verso by John Dix.

record.title: Indenture between William Curtys and Geoffrey Walkeden and Thomas Walkeden.
record.note: Docketed on verso in a contemporary hand; note on verso in nineteenth-century hand.
With: red wax seal bearing the merchant's mark of William Curtys appended on parchment tag.

record.title: Indenture between John Moore and Nicholas Barbon and John Richardson : manuscript.
record.note: Signatures of John Moore and Nicholas Barbon at the foot of the document. Their paper-wrapped wax seals appended on parchment tags.
Signatures of witnesses on verso.

record.title: Tancred Robinson annotations in John Ray's Synopsis methodica stirpium Britannicarum : manuscript.
record.note: Inscription on recto of front flyleaf: "Ex dono Autoris May 19 1690 Tancred Robinson."

record.title: My first memory book : manuscript / Katharine P. Hastings.
record.note: From cover: The Keystone Note Book.

record.title: Accounts of churchwardens and overseers of the poor in Middleton, Thornham, Hopwood, Pilsworth, Birkle-cum-Bamford (Bury) : manuscript.
record.note: Textblock mostly loose in contemporary blindruled parchment.

record.title: Poems : manuscript.
record.note: Disbound section from a larger volume. Text closely trimmed, with slight loss at the top and/or bottom of some leaves.
Cropped inscription at the foot of l1r: "Kilkenny. october: 16: 17[09?]".
Inscription at the foot of l26v: "Kilkenny. April 9th 1709: John Cramer."

record.title: Evelyn Craddock Neish memoir : typescript.
record.note: Manuscript note indicates that the memoir was transcribed from audiocassettes by J. Donaldson, likely Neish's daughter Jocelyn Neish Donaldson.

record.title: The vision : manuscript.
record.note: Footnote on the first page in a later hand: "my great GrandMother."

record.title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyah ʻalá Sharḥ al-ʻAqāʼid al-Nasafīyah : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Mūsá al-Khayālī.
record.note: On folio 1a: "Hādhā Kitāb Khayālī fī Ḥāshiyat Sharḥ al-ʻAqāʼid."
Folio 77a is blank.
On folios 77b-78b: Anecdotes, quotations, poems in Arabic and Ottoman Turkish in different hands.

The text of al-Khayālī ends with: "... ṣifāt fāḍilah yaḍmaḥillu afḍal al-ʻamal fī janbihā. Qultu: Hādhā al-iddiʻāʼ mimmā lā yuqbalu fī ḥaqq al-anbiyāʼ, wa-bi-hi yaẓharu anna hādhā al-wajh ayḍan yufīdu tafḍīlahum faqaṭ, wa-anna al-faḍl bi-yad Allāh yuʼtīhi man yashāʼ, wa-Allāh dhū al-faḍl al-ʻaẓīm."

Colophon: "Qad tammat hādhā al-kitāb bi-ʻawn Allāh al-Malik al-Wahhāb ʻalá yad aḍʻaf al-ʻibād wa-al-faqīr al-mudhnib al-ḥaqīr, wa-Allāh ʻalá kull shayʼ khabīr, Allāhumma min suʼl Munkar wa-Nakīr, Ḥamzah ibn Idrīs ibn Khalīl ibn Ilyās, ghafara Allāh lahum ajmaʻīn. Tārīkhuhu sant 974."

Translation of the colophon: "This book is completed by the help of God, the Abundant Giving King, by the hand of the weakest of the servants, the poor, the sinner and despised Ḥamzah ibn Idrīs ibn Khalīl ibn Ilyās. May God forgive all of them. God is knowledgeable of everything. O God! [Spare] from the questioning of Munkar and Nakīr [the two angels questioning the dead in the grave]. Dated in the year 974 [of the Hijrah = 1566 or 1567]."

record.title: 880-03 Ḥāshiyat al-Ṣāwī ʻalá Jawharat al-tawḥīd : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Ṣāwī.
record.note: On folio 1a: "Hādhihi Ḥāshiyat al-Ṣāwī ʻalá Jawharat al-tawḥīd."
On folio 1a, in pencil: "Wa-hādhihi mufīdah jiddan li-man ṭālaʻahā wa-atqanahā itqānan jayyidan. Tamm." "Qawluhu 'Hādhihi' ay, al-muʼallafah."

Colophon: "Wa-qad tamma mā ajrāhu Allāh ʻalá yad al-faqīr min al-taqyīdāt allatī kharajat bi-ḥawl Allāh wa-qūwatih, maʻa al-ʻajz wa-al-taqṣīr, yawm al-Ithnayn al-mubārak, ākhir yawm min Ramaḍān al-mubārak, sanat ithnayn wa-ʻishrīn baʻda al-miʼatayn wa-alf min Hijrat al-Bashīr al-Nadhīr, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābatihā yawm al-Ithnayn al-mubārak, thāmin ʻashar Jumādá al-Ākhir, sanat 1261, wāḥid wa-sittūn wa-miʼatayn wa-alf min hijrat man la-hu al-ʻizz wa-al-sharaf, ʻalá yad al-faqīr Muḥammad ibn al-marḥūm al-Shaykh Muḥammad al-ʻAmrūsī laqaban, al-Mālikī madhhaban, al-Khalwatī ṭarīqatan, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Tamm."

Translation of the colophon: "Completed are what God facilitated, by the hand of the poor one, of the glosses, which were recorded by the power and might of God, despite [my] incapacity and insufficiency, on blessed Monday, the last day in blessed Ramaḍān, the year 1222 [1 December, 1807] of the Hijrah of al-Bashīr al-Nadhīr [Prophet Muḥammad], may God pray on him, his family and his companions and grant them peace. Copied on blessed Monday, 18 Jumādá al-Ākhir, 1261 [24 June, 1845] of the Hijrah of Him to whom belongs nobleness and honor, by the hand of the poor Muḥammad ibn al-marḥūm al-Shaykh Muḥammad al-ʻAmrūsī laqaban, al-Mālikī madhhaban, al-Khalwatī ṭarīqatan, may God forgive him, his parents and all Muslims. Amen. Praise be to God, Lord of the Universe. It is completed."

record.title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyah ʻalá Sharḥ al-Hudhudī ʻalá matn al-Sanūsīyah : manuscript / ʻAlī ibn Aḥmad al-Ṣaʻīdī.
record.note: On folio 1a: "Hādhihi Ḥāshiyat al-Shaykh ʻAlī al-ʻAdawī al-Ṣaʻīdī ʻalá Sharḥ al-Hudhudī ʻalá matn al-Sanūsī, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi. Āmīn."
On folio 1a: "Nimrat 6598."

On folio 1a: An ownership statement: "Mulk al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá Aḥmad [... ... ...] ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayh wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Sanat 1204 [1789/1790]". An illegible seal. "Aḥmad al-Hāshimī al-Ḥanafī."

Colophon: "Tammat bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih wa-ḥusn tawfīqih bi-al-tamām. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá kull ḥāl. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat hādhihi al-nuskhah al-sharīfah yawm al-Khamīs al-mubārak, al-tāsiʻ min shahr Ṣafar al-khayr, alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat 1164, arbaʻah wa-sittīn wa-miʼah wa-alf, min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām, ʻalá yad kātibihā al-faqīr ilá Rabbihi al-ʻAlī, ʻabduhu ʻAlī al-Manīlī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."

Translation of the colophon: "It is entirely completed, by the praise of God, His help and His abundant benevolence. Praise be to God in all situations. This noble copy was concluded on blessed Thursday, 9 Ṣafar, 1164 [7 January, 1751] of the Hijrah of the Prophet, may the best prayer and peace be upon him, by the hand of its copyist, the poor to his All Mighty Lord, His servant ʻAlī al-Manīlī, may God forgive him, his parents and all Muslims. Amen. Praise be to God, Lord of the Universe."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-ʻAqāʼid al-ʻAḍudīyah : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Asʻad al-Dawwānī.
record.note: On folio 1a: "Hādhā Sharḥ al-Jalāl al-Dawwānī ʻalá al-ʻAqāʼid al-ʻAḍudīyah. Allāhumma tammim bi-al-khayr. Āmīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-sallam."

Colophon: "Tamma hādhā al-sharḥ al-jalīl al-mansūb lil-ʻAllāmah al-Dawwānī, ṣāḥib al-taṣānīf al-ʻadīdah, ʻalá yad kātibihi al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá [... ... ... ...] fī laylat al-Thalāth, al-muwāfiqah thamāniyah wa-ʻishrīn Rabīʻ al-Awwal, sanat alf wa-miʼatayn wa-tisʻah wa-tisʻīn [1299]. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá al-khitām. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá ashraf al-anām, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Tamm."

Translation of the colophon: "This glorious commentary, attributed to the scholar al-Dawwānī, author of various works, is copied by the poor to God Most High [... ... ... ...] on Tuesday night, 28 Rabīʻ al-Awwal, 1299 [17 February, 1882]. Praise be to God on the completion. May God pray on the Most Noble of mankind [Prophet Muḥammad], his family and all his companions. It is completed."

record.title: 880-03 Ṣafwat al-Zubad fīmā ʻalayhi al-muʻtamad : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Ḥusayn ibn Raslān al-Ramlī.
record.note: On folio 1a: "Kitāb Ṣafwat al-zubad fīmā ʻalayhi al-muʻtamad, taʼlīf al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻālim al-walī al-ʻārif Shihāb al-Dīn Aḥmad ibn Raslān, taghammadahu Allāh bi-raḥmatih, wa-aʻāda ʻalaynā min barakātih. Āmin. Āmin. Āmin."

The text ends with: "Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá al-takammuli // sāʼilu tawfīqin li-ḥusni al-ʻamali. Thumma al-ṣalātu wa-al-salāmu abadā // ʻalá al-Nabī al-Hāshimī Aḥmadā. Wa-al-āli wa-al-ṣuḥbi wa-man lahum qafā // wa-ḥasbunā Allāhu taʻālá wa-kafá."
Colophon: "Tammat bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih wa-ḥusn tawfīqih. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah."
Translation of the colophon: "It is completed by the praise of God, His help and His abundant benevolence. Praise be to God alone."

record.title: 880-02 al-Ṣawāʻiq al-muḥriqah fī al-radd ʻalá al-zanādiqah wa-ahl al-ḍalāl wa-al-mubdiʻah : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn Ḥajar al-Haythamī.
record.note: At the head of several folios, an endowment statement and illegible seal: "Waqf dhurrīyah, lā yubāʻ wa-lā yushrá wa-lā yūhab."
On the back cover is exposed part of a leaf from another manuscript which seems to be dealing with "bayʻ" (sales) according to Islamic law.

On folio 1a: "Kitāb al-Ṣawāʻiq al-muḥriqah fī al-radd ʻalá al-zanādiqah wa-ahl al-ḍalāl wa-al-mubdiʻah, taʼlīf al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ḥāfiẓ, al-Shaykh Shihāb al-Dīn Aḥmad ibn Ḥajar al-Haythamī al-Shāfiʻī, taghammadahu Allāh bi-raḥmatih, wa-askanahu fasīḥ al-jinān. Āmīn."
On folio 1a: An ownership statement: "Fī mulk al-faqīr Muḥammad ibn Hidāyat [?] Allāh, aḥad khuddām al-ʻilm al-sharīf. Fī shahr Shawwāl li-sanat 1083 [January/February, 1673]".

On folio 1a: An ownership and an endowment statements, as follows: "Malakahu min faḍl Rabbihi, sātir al-ʻayb, Aḥmad ibn al-Shaykh Hudayb. Wa-min baʻdihi dakhala fī mulk al-Ḥājj [...] al-Shuḥnah, wa-huwa waqafahu waqf dhurrīyah ʻaṣabīyah, lā yubāʻu wa-lā yūhab."
On the front cover in pencil: "Hādhā al-kitāb lā yubāʻ."

Author's colophon: "Yaqūlu muʼallifuhu, raḥimahu Allāh wa-raḍiya ʻanh: Wa-kāna al-farāgh minhu fī ʻashr Shawwāl, sanat khamsīn wa-tisʻimiʼah, wa-ibtadaʼtu fīhi fī al-ʻishr al-awsaṭ min shahr Ramaḍān min al-sanah al-madhkūrah, aḥsana Allāh taqaḍḍīhā fī khayr wa-ajāranī min kull miḥan wa-fitnah. Innī in alqāhu wa-huwa ʻanī rāḍin. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Tamma bi-ʻawn Allāh al-Malik al-Muʻīn."

Translation of the author's colophon: "Its author, may God have mercy upon him and be pleased with him, says: I completed it on the tenth of Shawwāl, the year 950 [of the Hijrah = 16 January, 1544] having started writing it in the middle tenth of Ramaḍān of the aforementioned year [22 December, 1543], may God ends it well, and may He protect me from all calamities and temptations. I hope to meet Him being pleased with me. Amen. Amen. Amen. It is completed by the help of God, the Supporting King."

record.title: 880-02 Taʻlīq ʻalá al-Manẓūmah fī uṣūl al-dīn : manuscript / ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Ujuhūrī.
record.note: al-Ujuhūrī's original "Manẓūmah" (Treatise in verse) starts with: "al-Ḥamdu lillāhi wa-ṣallá Allāhu // ʻalá Nabīyihi wa-man wālāhu. Wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallamā // mā khaffa najmun aw tabaddá fī al-samā ..."

Colophon: "Tammat al-ʻAqīdah al-mubārakah bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih wa-ḥusn tawfīqih. Allāhumma ighfir li-muʼallifihā, wa-kātibihā, wa-qārīhā, wa-man ṭālaʻa fīhā, wa-daʻā lahum bi-al-maghfirah, wa-al-Muslimīn wa-al-Muslimāt, wa-al-muʼminīn wa-al-muʼmināt. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-sallam."

Translation of the colophon: "The blessed 'ʻAqīdah' [Doctrine/Statement of faith] is completed by the praise of God, His help and His abundant benevolence. O God! Forgive its author, its copyist, its reader, he who studies it, he who invokes God to forgive them, Muslim men and Muslim women, and the believers, men and women. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad and his family and grant them peace."

record.title: 880-01 Sharḥ al-Muqaddimah fī al-ṣalāh : manuscript / Naṣr ibn Muḥammad Abū al-Layth al-Samarqandī.
record.note: On folio 1a: An ownership statement: "Mulk al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá al-Fattāḥ ʻAbd Allāh ibn al-Ḥājj ʻAlī al-Jarrāḥ, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-li-man qaraʼa fīhi wa-daʻā la-hu bi-al-maghfirah. Āmīn. Āmīn."
On folio 1a: A reader's note: "Qad ṭālaʻa fīhi al-faqīr ʻAbd al-Raʼūf, al-shahīr bi-Abī Ghazālah, ʻufiya ʻanhu. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn."

On folio 1a: "Wa-baʻd, fa-qad wulida al-najl al-saʻīd Ibrāhīm ibn ʻAbd Allāh min sulālat Ṣāliḥ al-Ṣāliḥ al-mukanná Abī Ghazālah, laylat al-ʻīd, fī tisʻ wa-ʻishrīn khalat min Jumād al-Awwal, sanat 1177 baʻda al-Hijrah [5 December, 1763], ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-awf [wa-awfá] al-salām."
At the head of folio 1b, in brown ink: "Hādhā Kitāb Abū al-Layth Muqaddimasī."
On the back of the front cover and on folio 72b: An invocation to protect the book from paper worms: "Yā Kubaykij Iḥfaẓ hādhā al-kitāb min al-ʻith."

Colophon: "Katabahu al-ʻabd al-ḍaʻīf al-naḥīf, al-muḥtāj ilá raḥmat Allāh al-laṭīf, ʻUthmān ibn ʻAlī ibn Aḥmad, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-aḥsana ilayhimā wa-ilayhi. Tamm." "al-Sanah 1161."

Translation of the colophon: "Copied by the weak and feeble servant, who is in need of the mercy of the Kind God, ʻUthmān ibn ʻAlī ibn Aḥmad, may God forgive him, his parents, and be favorable to them and to him. It is completed." "The year 1161 [of the Hijrah = 1748]."

record.title: 880-02 al-ʻAqīdah al-wusṭá : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Yūsuf al-Sanūsī.
record.note: On folio 1a: "Kitāb al-ʻAqīdah al-wusṭah [al-wusṭá], taṣnīf al-Shaykh al-Imām, al-faqīh al-fāḍil al-nabīh, Muḥammad ibn Yūsuf al-Sanūsī al-Ḥusaynī, aḥsana Allāh ilayhi, wa-rafaʻa maqāmahu ladayhi, wa-nafaʻa bi-ʻulūmihi bi-hi al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."

On folio 1a: A statement indicating that the manuscript was presented to the prominent scholar and Shaykh al-Islām Abū al-Hudá al-Ṣayyādī (Muḥammad ibn Ḥasan Wādī, 1849 or 1850-1910 or 1911): "Hadīyah li-Sayyid <minhu> yuʻtamadu ʻalayhi fī ḥusn al-irshād wa-al-iʻtiqād Ṣayyādī Zādah, al-Sayyid Muḥammad Abū al-Hudá Afandī, lā zāla lil-ʻulūm. Wa-ḥarasahu Mawlāhu wa-najlahu. Āmīn."
On folio 1a: Three quotations in prose and verse, praising "ʻIlm al-kalām" (literally 'science of talking', i.e., Islamic scholastic theology).
At the upper left corner of folio 1a, a partially washed out name of: "ʻUmar al-Quṭayfānī."

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends with: "... Wa-al-qaṣd min hādhihi al-ʻujālah innamā huwa dhikr mā yukhriju al-mukallaf ʻan al-taqlīd fī al-ʻaqāʼid, wa-fahm hādhihi al-jumlah wāfin bi-dhālik, in yassara Allāh subḥānuhu, atamm wafāʼ, wa-Huwa jalla wa-ʻalā al-mustaʻān wa-al-masʼūl an yukhrijanā bi-faḍlihi, wa-yakhruju bi-nā min al-ẓulumāt ilá al-nūr wa-an yukrimanā wa-yukrima ʻalá aydīnā, bi-mā yujibu lanā wa-li-aḥibbatinā min al-naʻīm fī aʻlā al-Firdaws bi-sharīf maʻrifatihi wa-ladhīdh ruʼyatihi aʻẓam surūr. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā Muḥammad ʻadada mā dhakarahu al-dhākirūn wa-ghafila ʻan dhikrihi al-ghāfilūn. Wa-raḍiya Allāh taʻālá ʻan aṣḥāb Rasūl Allāh ajmaʻīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. M M M."

record.title: Treatises on Sufism and Islamic ethics : manuscript.
record.note: Title of al-Zahr al-fāʼiḥ fī man tanazzaha ʻan al-dhunūb wa-al-qabāʼiḥ from folio 1a.
Title of al-Zill al-mamdūd fī maʻná waḥdat al-wujūd from incipit (folio 30b).
Title of Kīmiyāʼ al-saʻādah li-ahl al-Iradah from folio 48a.
Title of Hilyat al-abdāl wa-mā yaẓharu ʻanhā min al-maʻārif wa-al-aḥwāl from incipit (folio 51b).
Title of al-Muḥkam al-marbūṭ fīmā yalzamu ahl ṭarīq Allāh min al-shurūṭ from folio 55a.
Title of Maṭlaʻ khuṣūṣ al-kilam fī maʻānī al-gharāʼib fī Fuṣūṣ al-ḥikam from folio 77a.
Title of Mawāqiʻ al-nujūm from folio 111a.
Title of Ṣalāḥ al-arwāḥ wa-al-ṭarīq ilá dār al-falāḥ from folio 191a.
Title of Ithbāt al-wājib from from folio 261a.
Title of Maqūlāt Ibn al-ʻArabī supplied by cataloger.

Incipit of al-Zahr al-fāʼiḥ fī man tanazzaha ʻan al-dhunūb wa-al-qabāʼiḥ (folio 1b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Bismillāh wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh, bi-hi aqtadī wa-bi-nabīyihi ahtadī, wa-ashhadu an lā ilāha illā Allāh waḥdah lā sharīka lahu, wa-ashhadu anna Muḥammadan ʻabduhu wa-rasūluh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallama taslīman kathīran ilá yawm al-dīn. Ammā baʻd, fa-inna ḥuqūq Allāh taʻālá aʻẓam min an yaqūma bi-hā al-ʻabd, wa-inna niʻamahu akthar min an tuḥṣá, wa-lākin ʻibād Allāh aḍḥaw nāʼiyīn, fa-inna Allāh subḥānuhu wa-taʻālá la-hu ʻalaynā ḥuqūqan, wa-sharaṭ ʻalaynā shurūṭan, fa-wajaba ʻalaynā an nuʼaddīhā. Fa-lā takun yā akhī ghāfilan ʻanhā, fa-anta muḥāsabun bi-hā yawm al-qiyāmah ..."
Secundo folio of al-Zahr al-fāʼiḥ fī man tanazzaha ʻan al-dhunūb wa-al-qabāʼiḥ: qad lāmat wa-infataḥat.

Incipit of al-Ẓill al-mamdūd fī maʻná waḥdat al-wujūd (folio 30b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá al-hidāyah, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Rasūl Allāh fī kull bidāyah wa-nihāyah, wa-ʻalá jamīʻ ālihi wa-aṣḥābih ulī al-riʻāyah wa-al-ʻināyah, wa-ʻalá al-tābiʻīn lahum wa-tābiʻ al-tābiʻīn bi-khayr wa-iḥsān fī kull makān wa-kull zamān. Ammā baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá mawlāhu al-ghanī al-khabīr ʻAbd al-Ghanī, atḥafahu Allāh bi-al-maqām al-sanī wa-al-mashrab al-hanī: Ṭalaba minī baʻḍ al-aʻizzah an ataʻarraḍa li-wajh salīmī, wa-ajdhiba ridāʼ al-malik wa-bazzah, wa-ashraḥa Risālat Waḥdat al-wujūd, ʻalá annahā min taṣnīf al-ʻārif al-kāmil fī maqām al-shuhūd al-Mullā ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Jāmī dhī al-qadr al-sāmī wa-al-fayḍ al-nāmī ... qāṣidan tasmiyat kitābī hādhā bi-al-Ẓill al-mamdūd fī maʻná waḥdat al-wujūd ..."
Secundo folio of al-Ẓill al-mamdūd fī maʻná waḥdat al-wujūd: al-ilāh min ḥaythu hiya hiya.

Incipit of Kīmiyāʼ al-saʻādah li-ahl al-Iradah (folio 48b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi thiqatī. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Qāla al-Shaykh al-Akbar wa-al-nūr al-azhar Muḥyī al-Dīn Abī ʻAbd Muḥammad ibn al-ʻArabī al-Ḥātimī al-Ṭāʼī al-Andalusī, nafaʻa Allāh bi-hi wa-bi-ʻulūmihi fī al-dunyā wa-al-ākhirah, bi-Muḥammad wa-ālih: al-Ḥamdu lillāh. Jawāb suʼāl saʼalahu baʻḍ al-ikhwān, ayyadahu Allāh taʻālá bi-rūḥ minhu ʻan maʻānī faḍāʼil 'Lā ilāha illā Allāh' bi-al-maʻná al-maʻqūl, lā bi-al-khabar al-manqūl ..."
Secundo folio of Kīmiyāʼ al-saʻādah li-ahl al-Iradah: kānat al-manfīyat khamsah.

Incipit of Ḥilyat al-abdāl wa-mā yaẓharu fīhā min al-maʻārif wa-al-aḥwāl (folio 51b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá mā alhama an ʻallamanā mā lam nakun naʻlam, wa-kāna faḍl Allāh ʻalaynā ʻaẓīman, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá al-Sayyid al-akram al-muʻṭá jawāmiʻ al-kalim bi-al-mawqif al-aʻẓam, wa-sallama taslīman kathīran. Ammā baʻd, fa-innī istakhartu Allāh taʻālá, laylat al-Ithnayn, al-thānī ʻashar min Jumādá al-Ūlá, sanat tisʻ wa-tisʻīn wa-khamsimiʼah bi-manzil Āl Umayyah, bi-al-Ṭ́āʼif, fī ziyāratinā ʻAbd Allāh ibn al-ʻAbbās ʻamm Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, wa-kāna sabab istikhāratī suʼāl ṣāḥibī Abī Muḥammad Badr ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Ḥabashī, ʻatīq Abī al-Ghanāʼim ibn Abī al-Futūḥ al-Ḥarrānī wa-Abī ʻAbd Allāh Muḥammad ibn Khālid al-Ṣadafī al-Tilimsānī, waffaqahumā Allāh, an uqayyida lahumā fī hādhihi al-ayyām, ayyām al-ziyārah, mā yantafiʻūna bi-hi fī ṭarīq al-ākhirah, fa-istakhartu Allāh fī dhālik, wa-qayyadtu lahumā hādhihi al-kurrāsah allatī wa-sammaytuhā [sammaytuhā] 'Ḥilyat al-abdāl wa-mā yaẓharu ʻanhā min al-maʻārif wa-al-aḥwāl' ..."
Secundo folio of Ḥilyat al-abdāl wa-mā yaẓharu fīhā min al-maʻārif wa-al-aḥwāl: wa-lawlā al-huwīyah la-ẓaharat al-ānīyah.

Incipit of al-Muḥkam al-marbūṭ fīmā yalzamu ahl ṭarīq Allāh min al-shurūṭ (folio 55b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-bi-hi thiqatī wa-ʻawnī. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī hadānā li-hādhā, wa-mā kunnā li-nahtadiya lawlā an hadānā Allāh. Lammā qāla Allāh taʻālá li-Nabīyihi, ʻalayhi al-salām: 'Wa-andhir ʻashīrataka al-aqrabīn', daʻá Muḥammad, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, qarābatahu wa-waqaf ʻalá al-Ṣuffá [al-Ṣuffah], wa-akhadha yundhiruhum, wa-yaqūlu mā umira bi-hi an yaqūla, ʻalá mā dhakarahu Muslim fī Ṣaḥīḥih ..."
Secundo folio of al-Muḥkam al-marbūṭ fīmā yalzamu ahl ṭarīq Allāh min al-shurūṭ: an tundhirahum wa-li-kawnihim min al-Muslimīn.

Incipit of Maṭlaʻ khuṣūṣ al-kilam fī maʻānī al-gharāʼib fī Fuṣūṣ al-ḥikam (folio 75b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad Sayyid al-Mursalīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī ʻayyana al-aʻyān bi-fayḍihi al-aqdas al-aqdam, wa-qaddarahā bi-ʻilmihi fī ghayb dhātihi wa-tammam, wa-laṭafa bi-rashsh nūr al-tajallī ʻalayhā wa-anʻam, wa-aẓharahā bi-mafātīḥ khazāʼin al-jūd wa-al-karam ʻan makāmin al-ghuyūb wa-mafāwiz al-ʻadam ..."
Secundo folio of Maṭlaʻ khuṣūṣ al-kilam fī maʻānī al-gharāʼib fī Fuṣūṣ al-ḥikam: barakat anfāsihi wa-anāra bi-maʻārifihi.

Incipit of Mawāqiʻ al-nujūm (folio 111b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Lā ilāha illā Allāh, ʻuddah li-liqāʼ Allāh. al-Ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah, wa-ṣalawātuhu ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, nabīyihi wa-ʻabdih. Qāla al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá, mustariqq al-Ḥaḍrah al-Ilāhīyah, khatama Allāh la-hu bi-al-ḥusná: al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-ḥayy al-qayyūm, al-muqsim bi-mawāqiʻ al-nujūm, wāhib al-ḥikam al-Rabbānīyah, asrār al-arwāḥ fī ghiyābāt al-jusūm, min al-ḥaḍarāt al-ʻulá ilá taḥt al-tukhūm, fayyāḍ al-nūr al-fāṣil bayna ahl al-himam wa-al-rusūm, yuʼtī al-ḥikmah man yashāʼu min ʻibādihi, lā bi-sharṭ maʻlūm ..."
Secundo folio of Mawāqiʻ al-nujūm: al-salīm wa-al-muttaṣif bi-ṣifāt al-kamāl.

Incipit of Ṣalāḥ al-arwāḥ wa-al-ṭarīq ilá dār al-falāḥ (folio 191b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī infarada bi-al-ʻizzah wa-al-baqāʼ, wa-tawaḥḥada bi-al-ʻaẓamah wa-al-kibriyāʼ, wa-tamajjada bi-al-rifʻah wa-al-sanāʼ, wa-taqaddasa ʻan al-nuẓarāʼ wa-al-sharikāʼ, wa-tanazzaha ʻan al-wālid wa-al-abnāʼ, al-mutafaḍḍil bi-al-niʻam wa-al-ālāʼ, la-hu al-ḥamd wa-al-shukr, maʻa aṭyab al-thanāʼ, subḥānuhu wa-taʻālá ... Ammā baʻd, fa-hādhā kitāb ittakhadhtuhu mawʻiẓatan li-nafsī, wa-arjū, in shāʼa Allāh taʻālá, nafʻahu yawma ramsī, wa-anā sāʼilun akhā naẓarin fīhi an yadʻwa lī wa-li-wālidayya wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn, inna raḥmat Allāh qarībun min al-muḥsinīn ..."
Secundo folio of Ṣalāḥ al-arwāḥ wa-al-ṭarīq ilá dār al-falāḥ: fa-innahu yarāka, al-Ḥadīth bi-ṭūlih.

Incipit of Ithbāt al-wājib (folio 261b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī tajallá bi-dhātihi li-dhātih, fa-taʻayyana fī bāṭin ʻilmihi majālī dhātih wa-ṣifātuh, thumma inʻakasat āthār tilka al-majālī ilá ẓāhirihi fī al-bāṭin, fa-ṣārat al-waḥdah kathrah, kamā nushāhidu wa-nuʻāyin, wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá nabīyihi alladhī bi-hi rajaʻat tilka al-kathrah ilá waḥdatihā al-ūlá, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi alladhīna lahum fī wirāthat hādhihi al-faḍīlah yadun ṭūlá. Ammā baʻd, fa-hādhihi risālah fī taḥqīq madhhab al-ṣūfīyah wa-al-mutakallimīn wa-al-ḥukamāʼ al-mutaqaddimīn wa-taqrīr aqwālihim fī wujūd al-wājib li-dhātihi, wa-ḥaqāʼiq asmāʼihi wa-ṣifātih, wa-kayfīyat ṣudūr al-kathrah ʻan waḥdatih, min ghayr nuqṣān fī kamāl qudsihi wa-ʻizzatih, wa-mā yatbaʻu dhālika min mabāḥith ukhar yuʼaddī ilayhi al-fikr wa-al-naẓar ..."
Secundo folio of Ithbāt al-wājib: hiya hādhihi al-ḥiṣaṣ.

Incipit Maqūlāt Ibn al-ʻArabī (folio 276b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qāla al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻārif billāh, al-wāqif ʻalá asrārih, Muḥyī al-Millah wa-al-Dīn, Abū ʻAbd Allāh Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī ibn al-ʻArabī al-Ḥātimī al-Ṭāʼī al-Andalusī, qaddasa Allāh sirrahu al-ʻazīz: al-Iḥāṭah bi-ʻilm al-asmāʼ in jāʼat fī al-kashf li-aḥad, lā yuʻawwalu ʻalayhā. al-Ikhlāṣ alladhī lā yuʻṭī al-ḥikmah lā yuʻawwalu ʻalayh. al-Iḥtirām bi-ghayr khidmah lā yuʻawwalu ʻlayhi. al-Adab, in lam tajmaʻ bayna al-ʻilm wa-al-ʻamal, lā yuʻawwalu ʻalayhi ..."
Secundo folio of Maqūlāt Ibn al-ʻArabī: al-tajalliyāt al-muṭābiqah li-amthilatihā.

On folio 1a: "Hādhā Kitāb al-Zahr al-fāʼiḥ fīman tanazzaha ʻan al-dhunūb wa-al-qabāʼiḥ, taʼlīf al-Shaykh al-Imām wa-al-ḥabr al-humām, al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, al-zāhid al-ʻābid Ibn Makkī [sic], taghammadahu Allāh taʻālá bi-al-raḥmah wa-al-riḍwān wa-askanahu aʻlá ghuraf al-jinān, bi-mannihi wa-karamih. Āmīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-yalīhi: Sharḥ Waḥdat al-wujūd lil-Nābulusī. Wa-yalīhi: Maṭlaʻ khuṣūṣ al-kalim fī maʻānī al-gharāʼib fī Fuṣūṣ al-ḥikam lil-Qayṣarī. Wa-yalīhi: Mawāqiʻ al-nujūm, li-Sayyidī al-Shaykh al-Akbar, raḍiya Allāh ʻanh. Wa-yalīhi: Ṣalāḥ al-arwāḥ wa-al-ṭarīq ilá dār al-falāḥ lil-ʻAllāmah Nabhān. Wa-yalīhi: Ithbāt al-wujūd lil-Jāmī. Wa-yalīhi: Kalām nafīs lil-Shaykh al-Akbar."
On folio 1a: A reader's note: "Ṭālaʻahu al-faqīr ʻAbd al-Ghanī al-Yāfī, ʻufiya ʻanhu. 14 M, sanat 68."
On folio 1a: "Yā Kubaykij. Yā Ḥafīẓ. Iḥbis. Iḥbis. Iḥbis."
On folio 1a: Three illegible seals.
On folio 48a: "Risālat Kīmiyāʼ al-saʻādah li-ahl al-irādah, taʼlīf al-Shaykh al-Akbar, Muḥyī al-Dīn ibn al-ʻArabī, qaddasa Allāh sirrah. Āmīn."

On folio 51a: "Ḥilyat al-abdāl wa-mā yaẓharu ʻanhā min al-maʻārif wa-al-aḥwāl, taʼlīf al-Shaykh al-Imām, al-ʻālim al-rabbānī, wa-al-quṭb al-ṣamadānī, Muḥyī al-Dīn ibn ʻArabī, qaddasa Allāh sirrahu al-ʻazīz. Āmīn."

At the bottom of folio 54b, after the colophon of "Ḥilyat al-abdāl wa-mā yaẓharu ʻanhā min al-maʻārif wa-al-aḥwāl": Three quotations about "ṣiffat al-Abdāl" (charachteristics of 'al-Abdāl', i.e., those of the highest rank of Ṣūfī "awliyāʼ" (holy men)), from three Ṣūfī sources: from an anonymous author, from Ibrāhīm al-Khawwāṣ (Ibrāhīm ibn Aḥmad, died 291/904), and from Sahl ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Tustarī (818 or 819-896?).
On folio 55a: "Risālat al-Muḥkam al-marbūṭ fīmā yalzamu ahl ṭarīq Allāh min al-shurūṭ, lil-Shaykh al-Imām Muḥyī al-Dīn ibn al-ʻArabī, qaddasa Allāh sirrah."
On folio 72a: scribbled quotations.
On folio 77a: "... Yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-ḍaʻīf Dāwūd ibn Maḥmūd ibn Muḥammad al-Qayṣarī ... wa-sammaytu hādhā al-kitāb bi-Maṭlaʻ khuṣūṣ al-kilam fī maʻānī al-gharāʼib fī Fuṣūṣ al-ḥikam ..."

On the margin of folio 109b: A note by ʻUmar al-ʻAṭṭār al-Dimashqī stating that he studied the epistle "Maṭlaʻ khuṣūṣ al-kilam fī maʻānī al-gharāʼib fī Fuṣūṣ al-ḥikam" with his teacher al-Shaykh Muḥammad Mawlawī Akram al-Afghānī, in the year 1279 of the Hijrah (1862/1863), and that he recorded on the margins of the epistle the explanations of his teacher, in addition to his own ideas that although the world is old and exists from time immemorial, that does not mean that it will not come to an end.
On folio 110a: A short commentary by an anonymous author on "Maṭlaʻ khuṣūṣ al-kilam fī maʻānī al-gharāʼib fī Fuṣūṣ al-ḥikam".

On folio 111a: "Kitāb Mawāqiʻ al-nujūm lil-Shaykh al-Akbar, wa-al-kibrīt al-aḥmar, al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, wa-al-baḥr al-fahhāmah, Muḥyī al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī ibn al-ʻArabī, qaddasa Allāh sirrahu al-ʻazīz, wa-nafaʻanā bi-hi wa-al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. M."

On folio 189b, at the end of the colophon, an anonymous reader quotes from "Bāb al-Ṭahārah" of "al-Futūḥāt al-Makkīyah", stating that Ibn al-ʻArabī authored his book 'Mawāqiʻ al-nujūm' in a period of eleven days, during Ramaḍān, the year 595 (July/August, 1199), in al-Marīyah (Almería, Spain): "... anna hādhā al-kitāb al-musammá bi-Mawāqiʻ al-nujūm, qad qayydahu [Ibn al-ʻArabī] fī iḥdá [aḥad] ʻashar yawman, fī Ramaḍān, bi-al-Marīyah, sanat khams wa-tisʻīn wa-khams miʼah."

On folio 190a: A quotation from Ibn al-ʻArabī and a quotation from a fatwá by Majd al-Dīn al-Fīrūzābādī (Muḥammad ibn Yaʻqūb, 1329-1414 or 1415), about the doctrines of Ibn al-ʻArabī and whether his books are legitimate to be read, stating that Ibn al-ʻArabī is a highly revered and learned scholar: "... Innahu kāna shaykh al-ṭarīqah, ḥālan wa-ʻilman, wa-imām al-taḥqīq ḥaqīqatan wa-rasman, wa-muḥyī rusūm al-maʻārif fiʻlan wa-rasman ..."

On folio 191a: "Kitāb Ṣalāḥ al-arwāḥ wa-al-ṭarīq ilá dār al-falāḥ, jamʻ al-Shaykh al-Imām, al-ḥabr al-humām, al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, al-baḥr al-mudaqqiq al-fahhāmah, al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn al-marḥūm al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Salām al-Ṣūfī al-shahīr bi-nasabihi al-mubārak bi-Ibn al-Shaykh Nabhān, al-Shāfiʻī, ghafara Allāh [al-hu] wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn. Āmīn."
On folio 261a: "Ithbāt al-wājib lil-Jāmī."

Colophon of al-Zahr al-fāʼiḥ fī man tanazzaha ʻan al-dhunūb wa-al-qabāʼiḥ (folio 27a): "Tamma al-kitāb bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih wa-ḥusn tawfīqih, ʻalá yad afqar al-ʻibād wa-aḥwajihim ilá raḥmat man ilayhi al-maʻād, Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn al-Shaykh Ḥasan al-Ṭabbākh, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-mashāyikhihi wa-li-ikhwānihi wa-muḥibbīhi wa-li-muʼallif hādhā al-kitāb wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn wa-al-Muslimāt ajmaʻīn, wa-li-man raʼá fīhi khalalan fa-aṣlaḥahu, fa-inna al-kātib laysa bi-maʻṣūm min al-ghalaṭ, wa-li-man naẓara fī hādhā al-kitāb bi-muṭālaʻah wa-daʻā li-kātibihi bi-al-ʻafw wa-al-ghufrān. Fī awāʼil Jumād al-Thānī, sanat 1174. Tamm."

Translation of the colophon of al-Zahr al-fāʼiḥ fī man tanazzaha ʻan al-dhunūb wa-al-qabāʼiḥ: "The book is completed by the praise of God, His help and his abundant benevolence, by the hand of the poorest of the servants and the neediest to the mercy of Him, who to Him is the returning, Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn al-Shaykh Ḥasan al-Ṭabbākh, may God forgive him, his parents, his masters, his brethren, his beloved, the author of this book, all Muslim men and women, him who sees a deficiency in the book and corrects it, because the copyist is not infallible from error, and he who reads this book and invokes God to forgive and pardon its copyist. Dated the beginning of Jumād al-Thānī, 1174 [of the Hijrah = 8 January, 1761]. It is completed."

Colophon of al-Ẓill al-mamdūd fī maʻná waḥdat al-wujūd (folio 45b): "Qāla muṣannifuhu, ḥafiẓahu Allāh taʻālá: Ḥarrarnāhu fī ṣabīḥat yawm al-Aḥad al-tāsiʻ wa-al-ʻishrīn min Jumādá al-Ākhir, sanat khams wa-ʻishrīn wa-miʼah wa-alf, ḥāmidan wa-muṣalliyan wa-musalliman. Wa-kadhālika wāfaqa al-farāgh min kitābat hādhihi al-nuskhah al-sharīfah ṣabīḥat yawm al-Sabt al-mubārak, sādis ʻasharī Dhī al-Qaʻdah, sanat ithnayn wa-sabʻīn wa-miʼah wa-alf, ʻalá yad al-faqīr Muḥammad ibn al-Ṭabbākh."

Translation of the colophon of al-Ẓill al-mamdūd fī maʻná waḥdat al-wujūd: "Its author, may God, Most High, protect him, said: I authored it the morning of Sunday, 29 Jumāda̐ al-Ākhir, 1125 [of the Hijrah = 23 July, 1713], praising [God] and praying. This noble copy was completed on the morning of blessed Saturday morning, 16 [probably 26] Dhī al-Qaʻdah, 1172 [of the Hijrah = 21 July, 1759], by the hand of the poor Muḥammad ibn al-Ṭabbākh."

Colophon of Kīmiyāʼ al-saʻādah li-ahl al-Iradah (folio 50b): "Tammat Kīmiyāʼ al-saʻādah bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ḥusn tawfīqhi, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Tammat. M."

Translation of the colophon of Kīmiyāʼ al-saʻādah li-ahl al-Iradah: "Kīmiyāʼ al-saʻādah is completed by the praise of God and His abundant benevolence. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions and grant them peace."

Colophon of Ḥilyat al-abdāl wa-mā yaẓharu ʻanhā min al-maʻārif wa-al-aḥwāl (folio 54b): "Tammat al-Ḥilyah bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-mannih, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman kathīran. Āmīn. Wa-raḍiya Allāh taʻālá ʻan aṣḥāb Rasūl Allāh ajmaʻīn."

Translation of Hilyat al-abdāl wa-mā yaẓharu ʻanhā min al-maʻārif wa-al-aḥwāl: "al-Ḥilyah is completed by the praise of God and his benevolence. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions and grant them abundant peace. Amen. May God be pleased with the companions of the Messenger of God."

Colophon of al-Muḥkam al-marbūṭ fīmā yalzamu ahl ṭarīq Allāh min al-shurūṭ from (folio 71a): "Tammat Risālat al-Muḥkam al-marbūṭ fīmā yajibu ʻalá ahl ṭarīq Allāh min al-shurūṭ, ʻalá yad al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá, Muḥammad ibn Ḥasan al-Baytamānī, fī shahr Dhī al-Ḥijjah, sant tisʻ wa-sittīn wa-alf. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman kathīran. Āmīn. Āmīn."

Translation of al-Muḥkam al-marbūṭ fīmā yalzamu ahl ṭarīq Allāh min al-shurūṭ: "The epistle of al-Muḥkam al-marbūṭ fīmā yajibu ʻalá ahl ṭarīq Allāh min al-shurūṭ is copied by the hand of the poor to God Most High, Muḥammad ibn Ḥasan al-Baytamānī, in the month of Dhī al-Ḥijjah, 1069 [August/September, 1659]. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions and grant them abundant peace. Amen. Amen."

Colophon of Maṭlaʻ khuṣūṣ al-kilam fī maʻānī al-gharāʼib fī Fuṣūṣ al-ḥikam (folio 109b): "Tammat hādhihi al-risālah ʻalá yad aḥqar ʻibād Allāh wa-aḍʻafihim al-faqīr Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn al-Shaykh Ḥasan al-Ṭabbākh, fī awāl [awāʼil] Dhī al-Qaʻdah, sanat 1177."

Translation of the colophon of Maṭlaʻ khuṣūṣ al-kilam fī maʻānī al-gharāʼib fī Fuṣūṣ al-ḥikam: "This epistle is copied by the hand of the most despised and the weakest among the servants of God, the poor Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn al-Shaykh Ḥasan al-Ṭabbākh, the beginning of Dhī al-Qaʻdah, 1177 [of the Hijrah = 2 May, 1764]."

Colophon of Mawāqiʻ al-nujūm (folio 189b): "Tamma al-kitāb 'Mawāqiʻ al-nujūm' ʻalá yad aḍʻaf al-ʻibād ilá Allāh, wa-aqallihim ʻamalan, Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn al-Shaykh Ḥasan al-Ṭabbākh, al-Dimashqī baladan, al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban, al-Khalwatī ṭarīqatan, ʻafá Allāh ʻanhu bi-mannihi wa-jūdih wa-karamih. Āmīn. Wa-dhālika nahār al-Khamīs, 13 Ṣafar, sanat 1170."

Translation of Mawāqiʻ al-nujūm: "The book of 'Mawāqiʻ al-nujūm' was copied by the hand of weakest of the servants of God and the least working among them, Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn al-Shaykh Ḥasan al-Ṭabbākh, al-Dimashqī baladan, al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban, al-Khalwatī ṭarīqatan, may God forgive him according to His benevolence, His Goodness and His generosity. Amen. On Thursday, 13 [probably 23] Ṣafar, 1170 [of the Hijrah = 17 November, 1756]."

Colophon of Ṣalāḥ al-arwāḥ wa-al-ṭarīq ilá dār al-falāḥ (folio 260a): "Tamma al-kitāb, bi-ʻawn al-Malik al-Wahhāb, al-mawsūm bi-Ṣalāḥ al-arwāḥ wa-al-ṭarīq ilá dār al-falāḥ, ʻalá yad al-faqīr al-muʻtarif bi-al-dhanb wa-al-taqṣīr, Muḥammad ibn al-Shaykh Muḥammad ibn al-Shaykh Ḥasan al-Ṭabbākh, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn, fī salkh Jumādá al-Ūlá, sanat 1173."

Translation of the colophon of Ṣalāḥ al-arwāḥ wa-al-ṭarīq ilá dār al-falāḥ: "The book titled Ṣalāḥ al-arwāḥ wa-al-ṭarīq ilá dār al-falāḥ, was completed by the help of the Abundant Giving King, by the hand of the poor who admits his inequity and deficiency, Muḥammad ibn al-Shaykh Muḥammad ibn al-Shaykh Ḥasan al-Ṭabbākh, may God forgive him, his parents, and all Muslims, at the end of Jumādá al-Ūlá, the year 1173 [of the Hijrah = 19 January, 1760]."
Colophon of Ithbāt al-wājib: "Tammat bi-ʻawn Allāh al-Malik al-Wahhāb."
Translation of the colophon of Ithbāt al-wājib: "It is completed by the help of God, the Abundant Giving King."
Colophon of Maqūlāt Ibn al-ʻArabī: "Tamma al-kalām bi-idhn al-Malik al-ʻAllām, ʻalá yad al-faqīr Muḥammad al-Ṭabbākh, al-rājī ʻafwa Rabbih."

Translation of the colophon of Maqūlāt Ibn al-ʻArabī: "The discourse is completed by the permission of the All Knowing King, by the hand of the poor Muḥammad al-Ṭabbākh, who aspires for the forgiveness of his Lord."

record.title: 880-02 Badīʻ al-maʻānī fī sharḥ ʻAqīdat al-Shaybānī : manuscript / Najm al-Dīn Abū al-Faḍl Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd Allāh ibn Qāḍī ʻAjlūn.
record.note: On folio 1a: "Badīʻ al-maʻānī fī sharḥ ʻAqīdat al-Shaybānī taʼlīf al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, al-mutqin al-muḥaqqiq al-mudaqqiq, farīd al-dahr wa-waḥīd al-ʻaṣr, muftī al-Muslimīn, mufīd al-ṭālibīn, Najm al-Dīn Abī al-Faḍl ibn al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, muftī al-Muslimīn, mufīd al-ṭālibīn, aqḍā al-quḍāh, Walī al-Dīn ibn Qāḍī ʻAjlūn al-Shāfiʻī, nafaʻa Allāh al-Muslimīn bi-ʻulūmihi wa-fawāʼidihi, wa-taghammadahu bi-raḥmatihi, wa-raḍiya ʻanhu wa-ʻan athlāfihi [aslāfihi]. Āmīn. Tamm."

On folio 1a: Three ownership statements, as follows: 1. "Qad dakhalat fī mulk Muḥammad al-Ṭāhā al-Ḥājj ʻAlī. 1271." 2. "Qad malaka hādhā al-kitāb min faḍl Rabbihi al-majīd Ṭālib ibn Aḥmad al-ʻUbayd fī sanat 1242." 3. "Mulk al-faqīr Saʻd al-Dīn ibn al-Shaykh Ibrāhīm al-Saʻdī."

On folio 2a: "... wa-ḥīna kāna hādhā al-sharḥ, fīmā ẓahar lanā, awwal sharḥ ullifa ʻalayhā maʻa wafāʼihi bi-ḥall maqāṣidihā wa-ibrāzihi al-maʻānī al-mustakinnah ladayhā nāsaba an yusammá Badīʻ al-maʻānī fī sharḥ ʻAqīdat al-Shaybānī ..."
On folios 39a-40b are recorded the dates of birth and death of several people in the Hijrī years: 1264, 1247, 1249, 1251, 1259, 1245.

On the right margin of folio 32b: Ownership statement: "Malakah al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr al-muʻtarif bi-al-dhanb wa-al-taqṣīr ʻĀrif ibn al-Sayyid Maḥmūd al-Ḥalawānī, raḥiamhu Allāh bi-jāh Sayyid al-awwalīn wa-al-ākharīn."
On folio 40b: Ownership statement: "Hādhā mulk al-Shaykh Saʻd al-Dīn ibn al-Shaykh Ibrāhīm al-Saʻdī."

Qaṣidat al-Shaybānī starts with: "Sa-aḥmadu Rabbī ṭāʻatan wa-taʻabbudā // wa-anẓimu ʻiqdan fī al-ʻaqīdati awḥadā," and ends with "Ka-dhāka salāmu Allāhi thumma riḍāʼuhu // ʻalá al-āli wa-al-azwāji wa-al-ṣaḥbi sarmadā."

Author's colophon: "Wa-li-yakun hādhā ākhir mā aradtu īrādahu fī hādhā al-sharḥ al-mubārak, nafaʻa Allāh bi-hi muʼallifahu wa-kātibahu wa-qārīhi, wa-ghafara lahum wa-li-man daʻā lahum bi-al-maghfirah wa-al-raḥmah, wa-li-sāʼir al-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn. Āmīn. Tamm."

Translation of the author's colophon: "Let this be the end of what I wanted to introduce in this blessed commentary. May God benefit by it its author, its copyist and its reader, and forgive him who beseeches God to forgive them and have mercy upon them, and all Muslims. Amen. It is completed."

record.title: 880-02 Shams al-maʻārif al-kubrá : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn ʻAlī al-Būnī.
record.note: On cover: "Shams al-maʻārif al-kubrá", printed in silver.

On page 1 of al-Juzʼ al-awwal: "Shams al-maʻārif al-kubrá wa-laṭāʼif al-ʻawārif, fī arbaʻat ajzāʼ, lil-Quṭb al-Imām Aḥmad ibn ʻAlī al-Būnī, wa-bi-nihāyat al-arbaʻat kutub, [al-kutub] al-ātiyah: 1. Kitāb Mīzān al-ʻadl fī maqāṣid aḥkām al-raml. 2. Kitāb Fawātiḥ al-raghāʼib fī khuṣūṣīyāt awqāt al-kawākib. 3. Kitāb Zahr al-murūj fī dalāʼil al-burūj. 4. Kitāb Laṭāʼif al-ishārah fī khaṣāʼiṣ al-kawākib al-sayyārah." "Maṭbūʻ ʻalá al-nuskhah al-Hindīyah al-aṣlīyah." These four books are not included in this codex and seem to serve as an advertisement for works to follow.
al-Juzʼ al-thānī (Part two), starts with: "al-Faṣl al-khāmis ʻashar. Fī al-shurūṭ al-lāzimah li-baʻḍ dūna baʻḍ fī al-bidāyāt wa-al-nihāyāt."
al-Juzʼ al-thālith (Part three), starts, after al-Basmalah, with: "al-Faṣl al-ḥādī wa-al-ʻishrūn. Fī Asmāʼ Allāh al-Ḥusná, wa-anmāṭihā, wa-mā li-kull namaṭ min al-daʻawāt."
al-Juzʼ al-rābiʻ (Part four), starts, after al-Basmalah, with: "al-Faṣl al-thāmin wa-al-thalāthūn. Fī istikhdāmāt al-ḥurūf wa-khalawātihā."

Colophon: "Tamma Kitāb Shams al-maʻārif al-kubrá lil-Imām al-Būnī fī ʻishrīn min Shawwāl, sanat 1291 Hijrīyah. Wa-lammā kādat shams ṭabʻihā tabzughu lil-ṭulūʻ arrakhahā baʻḍ al-madmīyīn [al-mādiḥīn] bi-qawlihi, shiʻr [in Ḥisāb al-jummal (Alphabetical reckoninig)]: ... Wa-fīhā ará al-tārīkh jāda bi-qawlihi // yufīdu al-amānī ṭabʻu Shams al-maʻārif. Sanat 1291."

Translation of the colophon: "The book 'Shams al-maʻārif al-kubrá' of al-Imām al-Būnī was completed on 20 Shawwal, 1291 of the Hijrah [30 November, 1874]. When the sun of its printing started to rise, someone praised it and mentioned the date of printing, in verse [using Ḥisāb al-jummal "Alphabetical reckoning"], saying: ... In it I see the date, saying generously: The printing of Shams al-maʻarif satisfies the wishes. The year 1291."

record.title: William Martin Johnson album of poetry and correspondence : manuscript.
record.note: Five ink silhouette portraits by Johnson on front pastedown and front flyleaf. Three identified in Johnson's hand as Samuel Johnson, Nancy Symmes, and Anna Evelina Johnson; two unidentified.

record.title: Nouvelles eclaircissemens sur la baguette divinatoire ... : manuscript.
record.note: Book stamp of Jacques-Antoine Rabaut-Pommier on title page.

record.title: Appraisement of the late Revd. Mr. Henry Mordaunt's furniture, &c. : manuscript.
record.note: Signed at the foot of the last page: "Appraised 13th and 14th days of July, 1778 by Henry Parker."

record.title: "Portrait of Anna Seward by John Opie, R.A." : manuscript.
record.note: Written on laid paper with watermaker: Etruria Italy.

record.title: Manuscript memoirs of the great Earl of Cork : manuscript.
record.note: Second leaf incorrectly bound in at the end of the manuscript.
Manuscript docketed on the verso of leaf 2: "I got this paper from my friend Mangin of the Castle," possibly in the hand of Thomas Campbell.
Spine title in gilt: "MS Memoir of the Great Earl of Cork."

record.title: Letters relaying observations of Jamaica to Lord Cornbury and the Duchess of Queensbury, 1738 November 26 : manuscript.
record.note: Provenance: Earl of Clarendon, Holywell House, Hampshire.

record.title: William Whitehead's poem to the Duchess of Queensbury, 1777.
record.note: Provenance: Earl of Clarendon, Holywell House, Hampshire.

record.title: Earl of Drumlanrig letters to the Duchess of Queensbury and Charles Douglas from Turin and Lisbon, 1755 November 5 and 8, 1748 June 18.
record.note: With an additional scrap with docket: Letter from Lord Charles Douglas to the Ds. of Queensbury after the earthquake of Lisbon 1755,

record.title: 880-03 Maqāmāt al-Ḥarīrī : manuscript / al-Qāsim ibn ʻAlī al-Ḥarīrī.
record.note: On folio 1a: Ownership statements, as follows: "Dalāl bint Naṣrī Dallāl", "Min kutub al-faqīr Jibrāʼīl ʻAbd Allāh Dallāl [1836 or 1837-1892 or 1893]. Sanat 1882", "Dakhala bi-rasm mālikihi Anṭūn Jibrāʼīl Dallāl", "Thumma ṣāra min kutub al-faqīr Jibrāʼīl ʻAbd Allāh Dallāl bi-Ḥalab, sanat 1889", On the seal: "Min mumtalakāt Jibrāʼīl ʻAbd Allāh Dallāl. Sanat 1859", Two illegible seals.
At the head of text on folio 1b: A decorative design in red.
Folios 179b-180a and folio 181 are blank.
On folio 180b: An index of the titles of the fifty Maqamahs.

Colophon (folio 179a): "Najazat hādhihi al-Maqāmāt al-khamsūn bi-asrihā, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi, ʻalá [yad] afqar ʻibād Allāh wa-aḥwajihim ilayh, Aḥmad al-ʻUbaydī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-man daʻā la-hu bi-al-maghfirah. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Tamm."

Translation of the colophon: "The fifty Maqāmahs are all completed. Praise be to God alone. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad and his family. Copied by the poorest of the servants of God and the neediest to Him, Aḥmad al-ʻUbaydī, may God forgive him and his parents and him who beseech God to forgive him. Amen. Amen. Amen. It is completed."

record.title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyat al-ʻAṭṭār ʻalá al-Maqūlāt : manuscript / Ḥasan ibn Muḥammad al-ʻAṭṭār.
record.note: On folio 1a: "Ḥāshiyat al-ʻAṭṭār ʻalá al-Maqūlāt."

Colophon: "Tammat hādhihi al-nuskhah al-mubārakah kitābatan bi-qalam al-faqīr ilá Mawlāhu al-qadīr, al-dhalīl al-ḥaqīr Aḥmad Muḥammad al-Munīrī al-Shāfiʻī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-lil-Muslimīn, qurba al-ẓuhr, yawm al-Thalāth al-mubārak, alladhī huwa tāsiʻ shahr Rabīʻ al-Ākhir, sanat alf wa-miʼatayn wāḥid wa-tisʻīn, wa-salāmun ʻalá al-mursalīn, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Āmīn. M."

Translation of the colophon: "This blessed copy was completed by the poor to his Mighty Lord, the submissive and despised, Aḥmad Muḥammad al-Munīrī al-Shāfiʻī, may God forgive him, his parents and the Muslims, around noon, on blessed Tuesday, 9 Rabīʻ al-Ākhir, 1291 [of the Hijrah = 26 May, 1874]. May peace be upon the messengers. Praise be to God, Lord of the Universe. Amen. M."

record.title: 880-02 al-Rawḍ al-bāsim fī shamāʼil al-Muṣṭafá Abī al-Qāsim : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Raʼūf ibn Tāj al-ʻĀrifīn al-Munāwī al-Ḥaddādī.
record.note: On folio 1a: "Kitāb al-Rawḍ al-bāsim fī shamāʼil Abī al-Qāsim. Yashtamilu ʻalá sabʻīn bāban, taʼlīf al-Shaykh al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, al-ḥabr al-baḥr al-fahhāmah, ʻAbd al-Raʼūf al-Munāwī, taghammadahu Allāh bi-al-raḥmah wa-al-riḍwān, wa-nafaʻanā bi-barakatihi wa-al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Tamm." "Wa-yatlūhu Manāqib al-Imām al-aʻẓam al-Imām Muḥammad ibn Idrīs al-Shāfiʻī, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu, la-hu ayḍan. Wa-yatlūhu Isfār al-badr ʻan laylat al-qadr, la-hu ayḍan. Wa-yatlūhu al-Shamāʼil lil-Tirmidhī <lil-Tirmidhī>. Wa-yatlūhu al-Itḥāfāt al-sanīyah la-hu ayḍan. Raḥimahu Allāh. Āmīn. Tamm."
On folio 1a: An endowment statement: "Awqafa hādhā al-kitāb lillāh taʻālá Aḥmad Muḥammad al-Najjārī." "Jumlat mā fīhi arbaʻ kutub."
On folio 1a: An ownership statement: "Min kutub Muḥammad al-Aḥdab."
On folios 1b-3a: The author lists the titles of the seventy chapters (abwāb) of his book.

Colophon: "Tamma Kitāb al-Shamāʼil al-sharīfah al-mubārakah bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih wa-ḥusn tawfīqih. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman kathīran dāʼiman ilá yawm al-dīn."

Translation of the colophon: "The book of the noble and blessed al-Shamāʼil is completed by the praise of God, His help and his abundant benevolence. May God pray our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions and grant them abundant and continiuous peace until Judgement Day."

record.title: 880-03 al-Shamāʼil : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn ʻĪsá al-Tirmidhī.
record.note: On the label pasted to the front cover: "Ḥadīth al-Tirmidhī fī al-Shamāʼil."
On the back of the preliminary leaf: "Mukhtaṣar al-Tirmidhī fī al-Shamāʼil. Ḥadīth."
On folio 1a: "Hādhihi Shamāʼil al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, lil-Imām al-Tirmidhī, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu. Āmīn."
On folio 1a, in curde hand: Numerous quotations, proverbs and maxims.

Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min hādhihi al-nuskhah laylat al-Thalāth, thālith shahr Rabīʻ al-awwal, sanat tisʻ wa-arbaʻīn wa-alf min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām, ʻalá yad afqar al-ʻibād ilá al-Malik al-Wahhāb, Muḥammad al-Safjadjī ibn al-Shaykh Aḥmad, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon: "This copy was completed on Tuesday night, 3 Rabīʻ al-Awwal, 1049 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [4 July, 1639], may the best of prayer and peace be upon him, by the poorest of the servants to the Abundant Giving King, Muḥammad al-Safjadjī ibn al-Shaykh Aḥmad, may God forgive him, his parents and all Muslims. Amen. Amen. Amen. Amen."

record.title: 880-03 al-Manẓūmah al-Jazāʼirīyah : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Jazāʼirī.
record.note: On folio 1a: Kitāb al-Manẓūmah al-Lāmīyah fī al-ʻaqāʼid, ʻAqīdat al-Shaykh Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Jazāʼirī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá wa-adkhalahu al-Jannah bi-mannihi wa-karamih, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman kathīran. Āmīn. M."
On folio 1a: An ownership statement: "Mulk al-faqīr ilá Allāh subḥānuhu wa-taʻālá Muḥammad Sayyid Aḥmad ʻAzzāz. M."

al-Manẓūmah al-Jazāʼirīyah ends with: "ʻAlayhi azká ṣalāt Allāhi thumma ʻalá // kulli al-nabīyīna fī al-iṣbāḥi wa-al-uṣuli. Wa-al-āli wa-al-ṣuḥbi thumma al-tābiʻīn lahum // mimman ʻani al-ḥaqqi wa-al-iḥsāni lam yaḥuli."
Colophon: "Tammat al-Jazāʼirīyah al-mubārakah bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnihi wa-ḥusn tawfīqih, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-barakātihā. Āmīn. Āmīn."
Translation of the colophon: "The blessed al-Jazāʼirīyah is concluded by the praise of God, His help and His abundant benevolence. May God benefit us by its blessings. Amen. Amen."

record.title: 880-02 Nubdhah laṭīfah fī ḥall mushkilāt ḥaḍarat fī al-suʼālāt : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn ʻAlī ibn Ḥajar al-ʻAsqalānī.
record.note: On folio 1a: "Hādhihi Nubdhah laṭīfah fī al-kalām ʻalá asʼilah rufiʻat li-Shaykh al-Islām wa-al-Muslimīn, khātimat al-ḥuffāẓ wa-al-muḥaddithīn, al-Shihāb Ibn Ḥajar al-ʻAsqallānī al-Shāfiʻī, fīmā yataʻallaqu bi-ḥāl al-mayyit fī qabrih, min ḥīn mufāraqat al-dunyā wa-nuzūlihi fīhi ilá al-baʻth, fa-ajāba, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu. M."
On folio 1a, in the upper right corner, in pencil: "Yā Kubaykij."

On folio 8b: An invocation by an owner: "Allāhumma ighfir li-mālikihi wa-li-wālidayh, wa-li-man sabaqa min uṣūli uṣūl wa-furūʻi furūʻ, wa-li-mashāyikhinā, wa-li-man ṣāfaḥanā wa-ṣāfaḥnāh, wa-irḍa ʻannā wa-ʻanhum, wa-raḍiya ʻannā Nabīyunā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-aṣḥābih, wa-jamīʻ al-aqṭāb wa-Aṣḥāb al-Nawbah."
