The copying of this book was completed on blessed Friday, 2 Jumād al-Ākhir, 1304 of the Hijrah of the Prophet, may the best prayer and the most perfect peace be upon Him. Copied and transcribed by the hand of the poor to the Generous and Abundant Giving One, His servant, Ḥassānayn Khaṭṭāb al-Nujaylī, may God forgive him, his parents and all Muslims. Amen. Amen. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, the Illiterate Prophet, and on his family and companions and grant them peace. Amen. M."

record.title: 880-03 Daqāʼiq al-ḥaqāʼiq fī ḥisāb al-daraj wa-al-daqāʼiq : manuscript / Badr al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad Sibṭ al-Māridīnī.
record.note: Title of "Daqāʼiq al-ḥaqāʼiq fī ḥisāb al-daraj wa-al-daqāʼiq" from folio 1b.
Title of "al-Rukhāmah bi-ṭarīq al-handasah" from incipit (folio 23b).

Incipit of "Daqāʼiq al-ḥaqāʼiq fī ḥisāb al-daraj wa-al-daqāʼiq": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh ḥamda al-shākirīn, wa-ashhadu an lā ilāha illā Allāh waḥdahu lā sharīka lah, shahādat al-mukhliṣīn. wa-ashhadu anna Sayyidanā Muḥammadan ʻabdahu wa-rasūlah, sayyid al-awwalīn wa-al-ākharīn, ṣalāt Allāh wa-salāmuhu ʻalayhi, wa-ʻalá ālihi al-ṭayyibīn al-ṭāhirīn. Wa-raḍiya Allāh taʻālá ʻan al-ṣaḥābah wa-al-tābiʻīn wa-tābiʻīhim ilá Yawm al-Dīn. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-faqīr ilá Rabbihi, Muḥammad Sibṭ al-Māridīnī, al-muʼaqqit al-Shāfiʻī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn: Laysa fī ḥisāb al-aʻmāl al-falakīyah aḥsan min ṭarīq ḥisāb al-nisbah al-sittīnīyah, wa-hiya al-mustaʻmalah fī ʻaṣrinā hādhā, wa-tarakū ṭarīq al-aqdamīn li-ṣuʻūbatihi wa-kathrat aʻmālihi. Wa-lam aqif ʻalá muqaddimah shāfiyah fī hādhā al-fann ghayra muqaddimat Shaykhinā al-ʻAllāmah Shihāb [al-Dīn] Aḥmad ibn al-Majdī, raḥimahu Allāh, al-musammāt [al-musammāh] bi-Kashf al-ḥaqāʼiq. Wa-lā aʻrif fī hādhā al-fann [muqaddimah] qablahā, wa-innamā yūjadu kalām ghayr shāfin fī maqāṣid hādhā al-ʻilm, lākinnahu, raḥimahu Allāh, aṭāla fīhā al-ishārah ilá ṭarīq al-aqdamīn, min al-futūḥ wa-al-ghubār, wa-ishbāʻ al-qawl fī ṭarīq al-nisbah, maʻa irādat al-ikhtiṣār ..."
Secundo folio of "Daqāʼiq al-ḥaqāʼiq fī ḥisāb al-daraj wa-al-daqāʼiq": Allāh taʻālá bi-Nabīyihi al-karīm.

Incipit of "al-Rukhāmah bi-ṭarīq al-handasah": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-taslīm ʻalá Sayyid al-Mursalīn, Muḥammad Khātim al-Nabīyīn, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn, ṣalātan wa-salāman dāʼimayn ilá Yawm al-Dīn. Wa-baʻd, fa-innī wāḍiʻun fī hādhihi al-maqāmah ʻamal al-basīṭah al-musammāt [al-musammāh] bi-al-Rukhāmah bi-ṭarīq al-handasah, li-yasʹhula ḥalluhā fī al-jāmiʻ wa-al-madrasah, wa-lā tatawaqqafu ʻalá ḥisāb wa-lā taṣaffuḥ kitāb, rājiyan min Allāh ḥusna al-thawāb, innahu karīmun wahhāb. Li-takun al-rukhāmah min jism ṣulb mustawin, wa-yanbaghī an yakūna ʻirḍuhā thuluthay ṭūlihā, li-yaḥsuna shakluhā fī al-manẓar, thumma turabbiʻu al-saṭḥ wa-taqsimahu bi-niṣfayn bi-khaṭṭ A B, fa-huwa khaṭṭ niṣf al-nahār ..."
Secundo folio of "al-Rukhāmah bi-ṭarīq al-handasah": qāʼiman ʻalá al-basīṭah.
On folio 1a: "Daqāʼiq al-ḥaqāʼiq fī ḥisāb al-daraj [wa-]al-daqāʼiq, lil-Sibṭ."
On folio 1b: "... wa-sammaytuhā Daqāʼiq al-ḥaqāʼiq fī ḥisāb al-daraj wa-al-daqāʼiq ..."
On folio 25a: A mathematical table, in 13 x 13 squares.
On folio 25b: Miscellaneous mathematical calculations.

Colophon of Daqāʼiq al-ḥaqāʼiq fī ḥisāb al-daraj wa-al-daqāʼiq (folio 23a): "Qad kamula lanā min faḍl Allāh taʻālá mā aradnā waḍʻahu fī hādhihi 'al-Muqaddimah', wa-qad taʼassasat qawāʻiduhā, wa-waḍuḥat mushkilātuhā, wa-tahadhdhabat abwābuhā, wa-infataḥat ṭuruqātuhā, wa-taḥarrarat amthāluhā. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá jamīʻ al-niʻam, thumma al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, Sayyid al-ʻArab wa-al-ʻAjam, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi ulī al-ʻazm wa-al-himam. Ghafara Allāh li-kātibihā, wa-li-qārīhā, wa-li-kull al-Muslimīn."

Translation of the colophon of Daqāʼiq al-ḥaqāʼiq fī ḥisāb al-daraj wa-al-daqāʼiq: "Completed, by the favor of God Almighty, is what we intended to present in this 'Introduction', having laid down its foundations, elucidated its problems, revised its chapters, cleared its roads and clarified its examples. Praise be to God for all the blessings. May prayer and peace upon our Master Muḥammad, the Master of the Arabs and Non-Arabs, and on his family and companions, of zeal and valor. May God forgive its author, its reader and all Muslims."

"al-Rukhāmah bi-ṭarīq al-handasah" ends with: "... wa-mā dhakartuhu aqrab al-ṭuruq. Thumma thabbit al-rukhāmah bi-al-bināʼ bi-al-jiṣṣ wa-naḥwihi. Wa-imtiḥān aʻmālihā bi-istikhrāj al-ʻamal min al-ālāt; fa-in ṭābaqat fa-ḍaʻ [fa-waḍʻ] al-rukhāmah ṣaḥīḥ, wa-kadhālika rasmuhā, wa-in khālafat tuftaqad aʻmāluhā al-sābiqah, li-iḥtimāl al-sahw wa-al-ghalaṭ."
Colophon of "al-Rukhāmah bi-ṭarīq al-handasah": "Wa-Allāh taʻālá aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb, wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ wa-al-maʼāb. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá man lā nabī baʻdah. M."

Translation of the colophon of "al-Rukhāmah bi-ṭarīq al-handasah": "God Almighty is more knowledgeable of what is correct; to Him is the reference and returning. Praise be to God alone. May God pray on Him, who no prophet comes after him [Prophet Muḥammad]. M."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ Īsāghūjī : manuscript / Khayr al-Dīn al-Ghazāwī al-Bitlīsī.
record.note: Title of Sharḥ Īsāghūjī by Khayr al-Dīn al-Ghazāwī al-Tiblīsī from folio 1a.
Title of Sharḥ Īsāghūjī by an anonymous author supplied by cataloger.
Title of Badīʻ al-bayān wa-gharīb al-tibyān fī ʻilm al-maʻānī wa-al-bayān by Ḥasan ibn ʻAlī al-Abīwardī from folio 107a.

Incipit of Sharḥ Īsāghūjī by Khayr al-Dīn al-Ghazāwī al-Tiblīsī: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi thiqatī. Naḥmaduka yā man yusʻidunā bi-al-hidāyah ilá al-ṣidq, wa-nashkuruka yā man yaʻḍudunā bi-al-iʻānah ʻalá al-nuṭq, wa-nuṣallī ʻalá Muḥammad al-muʼayyad bi-al-muʻjizāt al-sāṭiʻah, wa-ʻalá ālihi alladhīn fāzū bi-al-ḥujaj wa-al-barāhīn al-qāṭiʻah. Ammā baʻd, fa-qad iltamasa minnī baʻḍun min aṣḥābī wa-khullaṣ ikhwānī an ashraḥa lahum al-risālah al-mashhūrah bi-Īsāghūjī, al-mansūbah ilá al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻāmil, qudwat al-ḥukamāʼ, Athīr al-Dīn al-Abharī, nawwara Allāh maḍjiʻahu, sharḥan yakshifu ʻan mushkilātihā wa-yashtamilu ʻalá muʻḍilātihā, ḥāwiyan bi-akthar al-qawāʻid al-manṭiqīyah, mubayyinan lil-aqānīm al-abīyah, ẓannan minhum anna ʻindī baʻḍ dhālik, wa-in kuntu mā kuntu hunālik, fa-sharaʻtu fīmā yuṭābiqu iltimāsahum wa-yuwāfiqu iqtibāsahum, maʻa qillat al-biḍāʻah wa-kathrat al-ṣināʻah ..."
Secundo folio of Sharḥ Īsāghūjī by Khayr al-Dīn al-Ghazāwī al-Tiblīsī: al-ʻālim al-ʻāmil qudwat al-ḥukamāʼ.

Incipit of Sharḥ Īsāghūjī by an anonymous author (folio 80b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi al-ʻawn. Fa-hādhihi risālah fī al-manṭiq. al-Manṭiq ʻilm yuʻrafu [bi-hi] tamyīz al-sālim min al-fikr min fāsidihi. Wa-al-muṣannif awrada fī risālatihi ʻiddat iṣṭilāḥāt minhu tajibu [yajibu] istiḥḍāruhā li-man sharaʻa fī al-shayʼ min al-ʻulūm, li-yakūna ʻawnan la-hu fī al-taḥṣīl, minhā 'Īsāghūjī', wa-al-murād bi-hi al-kullīyāt al-khams. Wa-al-Īsāghūjī ism li-ḥakīm min ḥukamāʼ al-Yūnān yunsabu ilayhi al-kullīyāt al-khams, li-mahāratihi fīhā, wa-ʻalá al-nawʻ, wa-al-jins, wa-al-faṣl, wa-al-khāṣṣah, wa-al-ʻarḍ al-ʻāmm. Wa-hādhihi hiya al-maqṣūdah bi-al-naẓar ..."
Secundo folio of Sharḥ Īsāghūjī by an anonymous author: wa-illā fa-ʻaqlīyah ka-dalālat al-lafẓ.

Incipit of Badīʻ al-bayān wa-gharīb al-tibyān fī ʻilm al-maʻānī wa-al-bayān by Ḥasan ibn ʻAlī al-Abīwardī (folio 107b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-Huwa ḥasbī. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī anṭaqa alsinat al-maʻānī wa-al-bayān bi-asrār al-balāghah fī asālīb naẓm al-Qurʼān, wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá Rasūlihi Muḥammad alladhī dallat dalāʼil al-iʻjāz ʻalá annahu unzila ʻalayhi al-sabʻ al-mathānī fī nihāyat al-injāz, wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi, khayr ṣaḥb wa-khayr āl, mā ṭābaqat al-tarākīb li-muqtaḍayāt al-aḥwāl. Ammā baʻd, fa-hādhihi risālah namnamtu washyahā wa-sabaktu ḥalyahā lil-wuqūf ʻalá ashraf al-ʻulūm al-adabīyah wa-al-iṭṭilāʻ ʻalá dhakhāʼir asrār al-ʻArabīyah, aʻmaltu al-qarīḥah fī taḥrīrihā, wa-atʻabtu al-salīqah fī taḥbīrihā ..."
Secundo folio of Badīʻ al-bayān wa-gharīb al-tibyān fī ʻilm al-maʻānī wa-al-bayān by Ḥasan ibn ʻAlī al-Abīwardī: dhakhāʼir asrār al-ʻArabīyah.
On the back of the preliminary leaf: An illegible statement by an owner/reader bears the date 1229 (of the Hijrah = 1813/1814).
On folio 1a: "Sharḥ Īsāghūjī, taʼlīf al-Shaykh Khayr al-Dīn, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá. M."

On folio 107a: "Kitāb Badīʻ al-bayān wa-gharīb al-tibyān fī ʻilm al-maʻānī wa-al-bayān, taʼlīf al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻāmil al-ʻallāmah, murabbī al-sālikīn, shaykh shuyūkh al-ʻārifīn, aʻāda Allāh ʻalaynā min barakātih, wa-nafaʻanā bi-ṣāliḥ daʻawātih al-Ḥasan ibn ʻAlī al-Khaṭībī al-Anbawardī [al-Abīwardī], ʻafá Allāh ʻanhu wa-khatama la-hu bi-al-khayr."
On folios149a-149b: Miscellaneous quotations by the hand of the copyist of the codex (Aḥmad Karāmah), on the different times of prayer.
Folios 150-151 are blank.

Colophon of Sharḥ Īsāghūjī by Khayr al-Dīn al-Ghazāwī al-Tiblīsī: "Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá Rasūlihi Muḥammad, wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Dakhala fī silk al-taḥrīr kitābatan nahār al-Aḥad, thāmin ʻashar yawm khalat min shahr Ramaḍān al-muʻaẓẓam qadruhu, min shuhūr sanat 1080. M."

Translation of Sharḥ Īsāghūjī by Khayr al-Dīn al-Ghazāwī al-Tiblīsī: "Praise be to God Lord of the Universe. May prayer be on His Messenger Muḥammad, his family and all his companions. Edited and copied on Sunday, the eighteenth of noble Ramaḍān, of the year 1080 [of the Hijrah = 9 February, 1670]. M."
Colophon of Sharḥ Īsāghūjī by an anonymous author: "Hādhā ākhir mā awradnāhu fī sharḥ hādhā al-kitāb. Tmm."
Translation of the colophon of Sharḥ Īsāghūjī by an anonymous author: "This is the end of what we introduced of the commentary on this book. It is completed."

Colophon of Badīʻ al-bayān wa-gharīb al-tibyān fī ʻilm al-maʻānī wa-al-bayān by Ḥasan ibn ʻAlī al-Abīwardī: "Tamma bi-ʻawn al-Malik al-Wahhāb mukhtaṣar 'Badīʻ al-bayān wa-gharīb al-tibyān', ʻafā Allāh ʻan hafawāt al-banān wa-ʻatharāt al-lisān. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi al-ṭāhirīn wa-ṣaḥbihi al-muntakhabīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Katabahu Aḥmad Karāmah, ghafara Allāh li-man daʻā la-hu bi-al-maghfirah. Āmīn. 2 khalat min Dhī al-Ḥijjah min shuhūr sanat 1080."

Translation of the colophon of Badīʻ al-bayān wa-gharīb al-tibyān fī ʻilm al-maʻānī wa-al-bayān by Ḥasan ibn ʻAlī al-Abīwardī: "It is completed by the help of the Abundant Giving King the compendium of 'Badīʻ al-bayān wa-gharīb al-tibyān'. May God forgive the mistakes of the fingers and the shortcomings of the tongue. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his righteous family and his chosen companions. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe. Copied by Aḥmad Karāmah, may God forgive him who invokes Him on his behalf. Amen. [Dated], 2 Dhū al-Ḥijjah, 1080 [of the Hijrah = 23 April, 1670]."

record.title: 880-03 al-Muṭṭalaʻ : manuscript / Zakarīyā ibn Muḥammad al-Anṣārī.
record.note: On folio 1a: "Hādhā Sharḥ Īsāghūjī li-Shaykh al-Imām Zakarīyā al-Anṣārī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá, wa-aʻāda ʻalaynā wa-ʻalá al-Muslimīn min barakātihi wa-barakāt ʻulūmihi, bi-Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥābatih. Āmīn."

Author's colophon: "Wa-Allāh aʻlam. Qāla, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá: Tamma al-sharḥ bi-ḥamd Allāh taʻālá wa-ʻawnihi, fī khāmis ʻashar Ramaḍān, sanat khams [probably khamsīn] wa-thamānimiʼah. Wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá ashraf khalqih, Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbih <wa-sallam>, kullamā dhakarahu al-dhākirūn wa-ghafila ʻan dhikrihi al-ghāfilūn."

Translation of the author's colophon: "God is more knowledgeable of what is correct. He [the author], may God have mercy upon him, said: The commentary was completed by the praise of God Almighty and His help, on 15 Ramaḍān, 805 [probably 850 of the Hijrah = 13 December, 1446]. May prayer and peace be upon the most noble of God's creation, our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions, as long as he is remembered by those who remember him and as long as he is forgotten to be remembered by those who forget to remember him."

Copyist's colophon: "Tamma bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnihi wa-ḥusn tawfīqih ʻalá al-tamām wa-al-kamāl, wa-al-ʻiyādh billāh min kull sūʼ, wa-Huwa ḥasbī wa-niʻma al-wakīl. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "It is finished by the praise of God, His help and His abundant benevolence, thoroughly and completely. May refuge be in God from all evil. He suffices me. He is the best advocate. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions and grant them peace."

record.title: 880-03 al-Muṭṭalaʻ : manuscript / Zakarīyā ibn Muḥammad al-Anṣārī.
record.note: On folio 1a: "Hādhā Sharḥ Īsāghūjī li-Shaykh al-Islām, al-Qāḍī Zakarīyā al-Anṣārī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá, wa-nafaʻanā bi-hi. Āmīn."
On folio 1a: An ownership statement: "Mulk al-faqīr ilayhi taʻālá Muḥammad Sharīf Salīm. Sanat 1299 [of the Hijrah = 1881/1882]."
On folio 32b, in a different hand, three veses of poetry attributed to al-Imām al-Ghazzālī praising solitude and condemming his time in which true friendship no more exists.
Colophon: "Wa-hādhā ākhir mā yassara Allāh taʻālá ʻalá hādhā al-kitāb. Wa-Allāh yajʻaluhu khāliṣan li-wajhihi al-karīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "This is the end of what God Almighty fascilitated of [the commentary] on this book. May God, may He be praised, render it worthy of His gracious face. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions and grant them peace."

record.title: 880-03 Kitāb al-Bustān : manuscript / Naṣr ibn Muḥammad Abū al-Layth al-Samarqandī.
record.note: On the preliminary leaf 1a: Three ownership statements, as follows: 1. "Dakhala hādhā al-kitāb fī mulk al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr, al-muʻtarif bi-al-dhanb wa-al-taqṣīr, al-Ḥājj Yūsuf ibn Asʻad al-Bishtāwī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-al-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn. Āmīn." Khatm al-Ḥājj Yūsuf ibn Asʻad al-Bishtāwī. 2. "Intaqala wa-dakhala fī mulk al-faqīr li-Rabbihi Muḥammad ibn al-Ḥājj Maḥmūd al-Badawī bi-Nāblus, fī ghurrat Rabīʻ Anwar, sanat 1315 [31 July, 1897]." 3. "Wa-intaqala wa-dakhala fī mulk al-ʻabd al-faqīr al-rājī ʻafwa Rabbihi al-karīm, ʻazza shaʼnuhu, Muḥammad Shawqī ibn al-marḥūm Muṣṭafá ibn al-Sayyid Asʻad al-Shinnāwī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-al-Muslimīn."
On the preliminary leaves 1b-3a: A table of contents.
At the head of the preliminary leaf 1b: "Fahrasat Bustān al-ʻārifīn wa-nuzʹhat al-nāẓirīn."

On folio 1a: "Kitāb Bustān al-ʻārifīn wa-nuzʹhat al-nāẓirīn, taʼlīf al-Faqīh al-zāhid Abī al-Layth Naṣr ibn Muḥammad ibn Ibrāhīm al-Samarqandī, taghammadahu Allāh bi-raḥmatih, bi-Muḥammad wa-ālihi. Āmīn."

Colophon: "Najaz al-kitāb bi-ḥamd Allāh taʻālá wa-ʻawnih, ʻalá yad al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr al-muʻtarif bi-al-dhanb wa-al-taqṣīr ilá al-Mawlá al-Jalīl, al-Ḥājj Yūsuf ibn Asʻad ibn Yūsuf ibn al-Ḥājj Ṣāliḥ al-Bishtāwī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-wālid wālidayhi, wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn wa-al-Muslimāt, wa-al-muʼminīn wa-al-muʼmināt, al-aḥyāʼ minhum wa-al-amwāt. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā Muḥammad Sayyidī [Sayyid] al-Sādāt, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi, wa-tābiʻ al-tābiʻīn, ruḍwān Allāh wa-salāmuhu ʻalayhim ajmaʻīn ilá Yawm al-Dīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Āmīn." Khatm al-Ḥājj Yūsuf Asʻad al-Bishtāwī.

Translation of the colophon: "The book is completed by the praise of God Almighty and His help, by the hand of the poor and despised, who confesses his iniquity and insufficiency to the Exalted Lord, al-Ḥājj Yūsuf ibn Asʻad ibn Yūsuf ibn al-Ḥājj Ṣāliḥ al-Bishtāwī, may God forgive him, his parents and the parents of his parents, and all Muslim men and women, and the believers, men and women, the living among them and the dead. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad the Lord of Lords, and on his family and companions, and the followers of his followers, may God be pleased with all of them and grant them peace, until Judgement Day. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe." Seal of al-Ḥājj Yūsuf Asʻad al-Bishtāwī.

record.title: 880-02 al-Lumʻah al-Māridīnīyah fī sharḥ al-Yāsamīnīyah : manuscript / Badr al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad Sibṭ al-Mārdīnī.
record.note: Title of "al-Lumʻah al-Māridīnīyah fī sharḥ al-Yāsamīnīyah" from incipit (folio 1b).
Title of "Muqaddimah fī ʻilm al-jabr wa-al-muqābalah" from folio 10b.

Incipit of "al-Lumʻah al-Māridīnīyah fī sharḥ al-Yāsamīnīyah": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī aḥṣá kull al-ashyāʼ ʻadadan, wa-jaʻala al-mawāl li-man aʻṭá wa-ittaqá wa-ṣaddaqa bi-al-ḥusná saʻādatan sarmadā, wa-ʻalá man bakhula wa-istaghná wa-kadhdhaba bi-al-ḥusná kuʻūb shuʼm tūqiʻu fī al-radā [al-radá], aḥmaduhu wa-ashkuruhu an jaʻalanā ummatan wasaṭan, li-takūna ʻalá al-nās shuhadāʼ, wa-ashhadu an lā ilāha illā Allāh waḥdahu, lā sharīka lah, ʻālim al-ghayb, fa-lā yuẓhiru ʻalá ghaybihi aḥadan ... Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu faqīr raḥmat rabbihi, Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad Sibṭ al-Māridīnī: Hādhā taʻlīq ʻalá al-urjūzah al-Yāsamīnīyah fī ʻilm al-jabr, mukhtaṣar jiddan, lam yasʼalnī fīhi aḥad, wa-innamā walaghtu fīhi min al-baṭālah wa-al-kasal, hurūban min al-ishtighāl wa-al-malal, fa-jāʼa bi-ḥamd Allāh nukhbah rāʼiqah, wa-tuḥfah fāʼiqah, wa-laqqabtuhu bi-'al-Lumaʻah al-Māridīnīyah fī sharḥ al-Yāsamīnīyah' ..."
Secundo folio of "al-Lumʻah al-Māridīnīyah fī sharḥ al-Yāsamīnīyah": jinsuhumā fa-yatanāwalu al-jadhr al-wāḥid.

Incipit of "Muqaddimah fī ʻilm al-jabr wa-al-muqābalah": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi al-iʻānah. al-Jabr al-ziyādah fī kull nāqiṣ ḥattá lā yanquṣ, wa-al-muqābalah ṭarḥ kull nawʻ min naẓīrihi ḥattá lā yakūna fī al-jihah nawʻān mutaḥābbān mutajānisān, wa-al-muʻādalah an tajbura al-nāqiṣ bi-al-zāʼid, wa-taṭraḥ al-zāʼid min al-zāʼid, wa-kadhā al-nāqiṣ min al-nāqiṣ, wa-ghāyatuhu istikhrāj al-majhūlāt, wa-mawḍūʻuhu al-māl wa-al-shayʼ wa-al-ʻadad, min ḥaythu al-basāṭah wa-al-tarkīb ..."
Secundo folio of "Muqaddimah fī ʻilm al-jabr wa-al-muqābalah": No secundo folio.

On folio 1a: "Kitāb al-Lumʻah al-Māridīnīyah fī sharḥ al-Yāsimīnīyah, lil-ʻAllāmah Sibṭ al-Māridīnī, taghammadahu Allāh bi-al-raḥmah wa-al-ruḍwān wa-askanahu aʻlá farādīs al-jinān, wa-nafaʻa bi-hi al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá́ Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

al-Yāsamīnīyah of Ibn al-Yāsamīn starts with: ʻAlá thalāthatin yadūru al-jabr // al-mālu wa-al-aʻdād thumma al-jadhru. It ends with: Thumma ṣalātu Allāhi wa-al-salāmu // ʻalá al-Nabīyi mā injalā al-ẓalām.

On folio 10b: "Wa-hādhihi Muqaddimah, ayḍan, fī ʻilm al-jabr wa-al-muqābalah, manqūlah min 'Khulāṣat al-qawāʻid wa-ghāyat al-maqāṣid', lil-Shaykh al-Imām, al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, al-ḥabr al-baḥr ala-fahhāmah, Abī ʻAbd Allāh ibn Jamāʻah al-Shāfiʻī, raḥimahu Allāh wa-raḍiya ʻanhu, wa-nafaʻa bi-hi fī al-dunyā wa-al-ākhirah. Āmīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá man lā nabī baʻdah. Āmīn. Āmīn."

Colophon of "al-Lumʻah al-Māridīnīyah fī sharḥ al-Yāsamīnīyah": "Wa-hādhā ākhir mā awradnā [aradnā] īrādahu min hādhā al-taʻlīq ʻalá hādhihi 'al-urjūzah'. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah, wa-ṣallá Allāh wa-sallam ʻalá man lā nabī baʻdah. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon of "al-Lumʻah al-Māridīnīyah fī sharḥ al-Yāsamīnīyah": "This is the end of what we wanted to introduce of the commentary on this 'urjūzah'. Praise be to God alone. May God pray on Him who no prophet comes after him [Prophet Muḥammad] and grant Him peace. Amen. Amen. Amen."

Colophon of "Muqaddimah fī ʻilm al-jabr wa-al-muqābalah": "Wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ wa-al-maʼāb. Intahá min 'Khulāṣat al-qawāʻid wa-ghāyat al-maqāṣid' li-Ibn Jamāʻah, yawm al-Thalāt al-mubārak, thālith ʻashar shahr Rabīʻī [Rabīʻ] al-Awwal, sanat alf wa-miʼah thamāniyah wa-thamānīn min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá muhājirihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām, ʻalá yad afqar al-wará wa-aḥwajihim ilayhi subḥānah wa-taʻālá, Yūsuf Ruḍwān al-Jundī al-Būshī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-mashāyikhihi wa-al-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá man lā nabī baʻdah. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon of "Muqaddimah fī ʻilm al-jabr wa-al-muqābalah": "God is more knowledgeable of what is correct. To Him is the reference and returning. It is completed, extracted from 'Kulāṣat al-qawāʻid wa-ghāyat al-maqāṣid' of Ibn Jamāʻah, on blessed Tuesday, 13 Rabīʻ al-Awwal, 1188 [24 May, 1774] of the Hijrah of the Prophet, may the best prayer and peace be upon him, by the poorest of mankind and the most needy to Him, may He be praised and glorified, Yūsuf Ruḍwān al-Jundī al-Būshī, may God forgive him, his parents, his masters and all Muslims. May God pray on Him who no prophet comes after him [Prophet Muḥammad]. Amen. Amen. Amen."

record.title: 880-02 Ḥayāt al-ḥayawān : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Mūsá al-Damīrī.
record.note: At the head of folio 1a: "Kitāb Ḥayāt al-ḥayawān, li-ʻallāmat al-zamān wa-farīd al-awān al-Shaykh Shams al-Dīn, Abī ʻAbd Allāh Muḥammad al-Damīrī, raḥmat Allāh ʻalayh."
On folio 1a: A sample letter, starts with: "al-Mawlá al-mushīr al-mubajjal, wa-al-ʻālim al-kabīr al-mufaḍḍal, al-Afandī fulān, al-ḥākim al-ʻadl, bi-maḥrūsat fulānah, ḥurisa wa-dām. Āmīn ..."

Colophon: "Wa-ḥasbunā Allāh wa-kafá. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman kathīran. Wa-raḍiya Allāh ʻan aṣḥāb Rasūl Allāh ajmaʻīn. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min naskh hādhā al-kitāb al-mubārak yawm al-Sabt al-mubārak, ʻāshir shahr Muḥarram al-ḥarām, sanat tisʻ wa-sittīn wa-tisʻimiʼah min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá musharrifihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-taslīm, ʻalá yad muʻalliqihi li-nafsihi al-ʻabd al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr, al-muʻtarif bi-al-zalal wa-al-taqṣīr, al-rājī ʻafwa Rabbihi al-maḥmūd, Maḥmūd ibn Mawlānā Khalīl ibn Mawlānā al-Ḥājj Muḥammad al-Aydīnī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-ikhwānihi wa-al-Muslimīn wa-al-Muslimāt wa-al-muʼminīn wa-al-muʼmināt. Āmīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-in tajid ʻayban fa-sudda al-khalalā // fa-jalla man lā ʻayba fīhi wa-ʻalā."

Translation of the colophon: "God suffices us and that is enough. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions and grant them abundant peace. May God be pleased with all the companions of the Messenger of God. The copy of this blessed book was completed on blessed Saturday, 10 Muḥarram, 969 [30 September, 1561] of the Hijrah of the Prophet, may the best prayer and peace be upon him, by the hand of the poor and despised servant, who admits his shortcoming and inadequacy, and hopes for the forgiveness of His praiseworthy Lord, Maḥmūd ibn Mawlānā Khalīl ibn Mawlānā al-Ḥājj Muḥammad al-Aydīnī, may God forgive him, his parents, his brethren and Muslim men and Muslim women, and the believers, men and women. Amen. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe. If you were to find a blemish close the gap // Mighty and Sublime is the One in whom no blemish exists."

record.title: 880-02 al-Asrār al-Rabbānīyah : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn ʻAlī al-Būnī.
record.note: On folios 1a (in pencil): "al-Asrār al-Rabbānīyah lil-Būnī."

On folio 1a: A statement by a reader/owner: "Naẓara fīhi wa-taʼammala maʻāniyahu, dāʻiyan li-ḥāwīhi an yaftaḥa Allāh ʻalayhi futūḥ al-ʻārifīn bi-jāh al-Nabī al-amīn, ṣallá Allāh taʻālá ʻalayhi wa-sallam. Āmīn."
Colophon: "Tammat hādhihi al-Asrār al-Rabbānīyah. Wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb. Sanat 1127."
Translation of the colophon: "These Divine secrets are completed. God is more knowledgeable of what is correct. The year 1127 [of the Hijrah = 1715]."

record.title: 880-02 al-Manhaj al-maslūk fī siyāsat al-mulūk : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Naṣr al-Shayzarī.
record.note: On the preliminary leaf: "Bi-hi kharm min awwalihi ilan qawlihi 'mimman', wa-hiya al-ṣaḥīfah al-ūlá minhu."
On folios 1a: "... wa-sammaytuhu al-Manhaj al-maslūk fī siyāsat al-mulūk ..."
On folios 1a-1b: An index of the titles of the twenty chapters of the treatise.
Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min naskh hādhā al-kitāb yawm al-Jumʻah, ʻishrīn khalat min shahr Muḥarram al-ḥarām, min shuhūr ʻām 1260 min al-Hijrah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-taḥīyah."

Translation of the colophon: "The copy was completed on Friday, twenty days having passed from the month of Muḥarram, of the year 1260 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [10 February, 1844], may the best prayer and peace be upon Him."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ Mukhtaṣar al-Qānūn fī al-ṭibb : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Maḥmūd al-Āmulī.
record.note: On the preliminary leaf: The Christian "Basmalah": "Bismi al-Āb wa-al-Ibn wa-al-Rūḥ al-Qudus al-Ilāh al-Wāḥid. Āmīn."
On the preliminary leaf: "Kitāb al-Qāmūs fī al-ṭibb wa-al-ṭabīʻah."
On folios 1a-1b: Table of contents of the codex.
Folio 2 is blank.

On folio 3a: A statement by a reader/owner: "Iqrār bi-al-jamīl lil-Kaḥḥāl al-nabīl, al-Duktūr Maḥmūd Labīb Muḥarram, min ṣadīqihi al-ḥamīm, Muḥammad Khalīl, bi-Dār al-Āthār al-ʻArabīyah, bi-Miṣr al-maḥmīyah. 18 Rabīʻ Awwal, 1330 [7 March, 1912]."

Colophon: "... Wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-ḥaqāʼiq al-umūr wa-bi-khafīyāt al-ṣudūr. Wa-qad ḥaṣala al-farāgh min kitāb hādhā al-kitāb fī ʻishrīn min shahr Jumād al-Thānī, sanat 1122. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdahu. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon: "... God is more knowledgeable of the truth of matters and what is hidden in the hearts. This copy was completed on 20 Jumād al-Thāni of the year 1122 [of the Hijrah = 16 August, 1710]. Praise be to God alone. Amen."

record.title: 880-03 Rawḍat al-ṭālibīn wa-ʻumdat al-muftīn. Volume 1 : manuscript / Muḥyī al-Dīn Yaḥyá ibn Sharaf al-Nawawī.
record.note: On folio 1a: "al-Juzw al-awwal min Rawḍat al-ṭālibīn wa-ʻumdat al-muftīn, taṣnīf al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻāmil, zayn al-ʻulamāʼ, imām [al-fuqahāʼ?], Muḥyī al-Dīn, Abī Zakarīyā, Yaḥyá ibn Sharaf ibn Murrī al-Nawāwī, qaddasa Allāh rūḥahu wa-nawwara ḍarīḥahu."
On folio 1a: An endowment statement: "Awqafa hādhā al-kitāb lillāh taʻālá Aḥmad Muḥammad al-Najjārī."

On folio 1a: Three ownership statements, as follows: 1. "Malakahu min faḍl Allāh [taʻālá] Muhannā ibn Yāsīn al-Shaṭṭah fī [...]." 2. "Intaqala hādhā al-kitāb, wa-huwa thamāniyat ajzāʼ, bi-al-ibtiyāʻ [al-sharʻī], min mulk Sayyidinā al-Shaykh ʻAlam al-Dīn al-Aṣfūnī [?] ilá Sayydī al-Shaykh [... ... ...] ibn al-Ḥasan al-Qūṣī, bi-shahādat kātibihi [... ... ...] ibn Aḥmad ibn ʻUthmān al-Makkī, ʻafā Allāh ʻanhum ajmaʻīn." 3. "Malaka hādhā [hādhihi] al-mujalladāt al-thamāniyah, min awwal al-Rawḍah ilá ākhirihā, faqīr raḥmatihi wa-gharīq niʻamihi wa-ʻatīq raḥmatihi, Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī al-Ḥasanī, al-shahīr bi-Ibn [... ...]."

Colophon: "Tamma al-juzʼ al-mubārak bi-minnat Allāh [wa-ḥamdih]. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ḥamdan yuwāfī niʻamah wa-yukāfī mazīdah. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn, wa-sallama kathīran. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min naskhihi yawm al-Ithnayn, al-sādis wa-al-ʻishrīn min shahr Rabīʻ al-Awwal, sanat thalāth ʻashrah wa-sabʻ miʼah min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām. Yatlūhu fī al-juzʼ al-thānī, in shāʼa Allāh taʻālá, Kitāb al-Zakāh."

Translation of the colophon: "The blessed volume is completed by the grace of God [and His praise]. Praise be to God, a praise parallel to His graces and in accord to His abundance. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and all his companions and grant them abundant peace. Copied on Monday 26 Rabīʻ al-Awwal, 713 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [29 July, 1313], may the best prayer and peace be upon him. It will be followed in the second volume, God willing, by the Book on Zakāh [Almsgiving]."

record.title: 880-02 Rawḍat al-ṭālibīn wa-ʻumdat al-muftīn. Volume 2 : manuscript / Muḥyī al-Dīn Yaḥyá ibn Sharaf al-Nawawī.
record.note: On the label on the front cover: "al-Juzw al-thānī min al-Rawḍah."
On folio 1a: "al-Juzʼ al-thānī min al-Rawḍah, lil-Shaykh al-ʻAllāmah al-Nawawī, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi. Āmīn."
On folio 1a: An endowment statement: "Awqafa lillāh taʻālá hādhā al-kitāb Aḥmad Muḥammad al-Najjārī."

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with: "... wa-innahu law nadhara ṣawm sanah muʻayyanah, thumma qāla: 'In shafá Allāh marīḍī, fa-lillāh ʻalayya ṣawm al-Athānīn min hādhihi al-sanah.' Qāl: 'Lā yanʻaqidu al-thānī, li-anna al-zamān mustaḥiqq li-ghayrihi.' Wa-qāla al-ʻAbbādī: 'Yuʻqad, wa-yalzamuhu al-qaḍāʼ.' Qīla la-hu: 'Law kāna la-hu ʻabd, fa-qāl: In shafá Allāh marīḍī, fa-lillāh ʻalayya ʻatquhu, thumma qāl: In qadima Zayd aʻtiquhu'. Qāl: Yanʻaqid, fa-in waqaʻā maʻan aqraʻa baynahumā.' Hādhā ākhir al-qawl al-manqūl ..."

record.title: 880-02 Rawḍat al-ṭālibīn wa-ʻumdat al-muftīn. Volume 3 : manuscript / Muḥyī al-Dīn Yaḥyá ibn Sharaf al-Nawawī.
record.note: On folio 1a: "al-Juzʼ al-thālith min al-Rawḍah, lil-Shaykh al-ʻAllāmah al-Nawawī, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi. Āmīn."
On folio 1a: An endowment statement: "Awqafa hādhā al-kitāb lillāh taʻālá Aḥmad Muḥammad al-Najjārī."
At the lower left margin of folio 236a: A collation note: "Balagha muqābalatan, ḥasba al-juhd wa-al-ṭāqah. Wa-lillāh al-ḥamd ʻalá dhālik."

Colophon: "Tamma al-Juzʼ al-thālith min al-Rawḍah, bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ḥusn tawfiqih. Yatlūhu fī alladhī yalīhi 'Kitāb al-Iqrār', in shāʼa Allāh taʻālá. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min naskhihi yawm al-Sabt, al-rābiʻ wa-al-ʻishrīn min shahr Ramaḍān al-muʻaẓẓam, sanat thalāth ʻashrah wa-sabʻimiʼah min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām."

Translation of the colophon: "The Third part of al-Rawḍah is completed by the praise of God and His abundant benevolence. It will be followed, in the next volume, God willing, by 'Kitāb al-Iqrār' [Book on Confession, Admission]. Copied on Saturday, the 24th of the glorious month of Ramaḍān, the year 713 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [20 January, 1314], may the best prayer and peace be upon him."

record.title: 880-02 Rawḍat al-ṭālibīn wa-ʻumdat al-muftīn. Volume 4 : manuscript / Muḥyī al-Dīn Yaḥyá ibn Sharaf al-Nawawī.
record.note: On the label on the front cover: "al-Juzʼ al-rābiʻ min al-Rawḍah lil-Nawawī."
On folio 1a: An endowment statement: "Waqf lillāh taʻālá. Awqafa lillāh taʻālá hādhā al-kitāb Aḥmad Muḥammad al-Najjārī."

On folio 233b: An ownership statement: "Intaqala jamīʻ hādhihi al-ajzāʼ al-thamāniyah min al-Rawḍah ilá faqīr raḥmatihi, wa-gharīq niʻmatihi, wa-ʻatīq qudratihi, Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī al-Ṣawwān al-Ḥusaynī al-shahīr bi-Ibn Qamar, laṭufa Allāh bi-hi wa-bi-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn. Āmīn."

Colophon: "Tamma al-juzʼ al-rābiʻ bi-mann Allāh taʻālá wa-taʼyīdih. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Yatlūhu fī al-juzʼ al-tālī la-hu 'Kitāb al-Waṣāyā'. Nafaʻa Allāh bi-hi ṣāḥibahu wa-muṭāliʻahu wa-kātibahu, wa-ajzala al-nafʻ bi-hi li-muʼallifihi wa-li-wālidīhim ajmaʻīn, innahu jawwādun karīm, raʼūfun raḥīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ḥamdan yuwāfī niʻamah wa-yukāfī mazīdah. ʻAllaqahu al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá ʻafw Rabbihi al-ʻAlī al-Kabīr Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad ibn ʻAlī al-Lakhmī nasaban al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban, ʻafā Allāh ʻanhu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn, fī sābiʻ Dhī al-Qaʻdah, sanat thalāth ʻashrah wa-sabʻimiʼah min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām."

Translation of the colophon: "The fourth part is completed by the grace of God Almighty and His support. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and all his companions. It will be followed in the part which follows it with 'Kitāb al-Waṣāyā' [Book on Wills]. May God benefit with it its owner, its reader and its copyist, may He also abundantly benefit with it its author and all their parents. Praise be to God, a praise parallel to His graces and in accord to His abundance. Copied by the poor to the forgiveness of his Almighty and Majestic Lord, Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad ibn ʻAlī al-Lakhmī nasaban al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban, may God forgive him, his parents and all Muslims. Dated, 7 Dhī al-Qaʻdah, of the year 713 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [3 March, 1314], may the best prayer and peace be upon him."

record.title: 880-02 Rawḍat al-ṭālibīn wa-ʻumdat al-muftīn. Volume 5 : manuscript / Muḥyī al-Dīn Yaḥyá ibn Sharaf al-Nawawī.
record.note: On the preliminary leaf: An endowment statement: "Waqf lillāh taʻālá. Waqafa wa-ḥabasa hādhā al-kitāb al-faqīr ilá Mawlāh, Aḥmad Muḥammad al-Najjārī al-Muballiṭ."
On folio 1a: al-Khāmis min al-Rawḍah lil-Nawawī.
Kitāb al-Waṣāyā which was to follow volume four, as was mentioned in the colophon of the previous volume, starts in the present volume at the end of folio 22a.

Colophon. No colophon. The text ends abruptly with "Kitāb al-Rajʻah", as follows: "... al-Rakn al-thānī. al-Zawj al-murtajiʻ. Wa-yushtaraṭu fīhi ahlīyat al-nikāḥ, wa-al-istiḥlāl, wa-al-bulūgh, wa-al-ʻaql; fa-lā rajʻah li-murtadd. Wa-law ṭallaqa rajul fa-junn, fa-yanbaghī an yajūz li-walīyihi al-murājaʻah, ḥaythu yajūzu ibtidāʼ al-nikāḥ, hādhā idhā jawwaznā al-tawkīl fī al-rajʻah, wa-huwa ..."

record.title: 880-02 Kitāb al-ʻibar. Al-Juzʼ 2 : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Muḥammad ibn Khaldūn.
record.note: On the preliminary leaf (in pencil): "al-Juzʼ al-thānī."

Colophon: "Intahá al-Juzʼ al-thānī min Tārīkh al-ʻAllāmah Ibn Khaldūn, raḥimahu Allāh raḥmatan wāsiʻah, bi-ḥamd Allāh taʻālá wa-ḥusn tawfīqih. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min hādhā al-kitāb fī 25 Jumād al-Ākhir, alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat 1269, tisʻah wa-sittīn wa-miʼatayn wa-alf min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-azká al-taḥīyah, ʻalá yad al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī al-maʻrūf bi-al-Jamal al-Damshīhī al-Mālikī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn, bi-mannihi wa-karamihi. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon: "Part two of the history of the learned scholar Ibn Khaldūn, may God have abundant mercy upon him, is completed, by the praise of God Almighty and His abundant benevolence. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, and on his family and companions and grant them peace. This book was copied on 25 Jumād al-Ākhir, 1269 [5 April, 1853] of the Hijrah of the Prophet, may the best prayer and purest peace be upon him, by the hand of the poor to God Almighty, Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī al-maʻrūf bi-al-Jamal al-Damshīhī al-Mālikī, may God forgive him, his parents and all Muslims, by His grace and benevolence. Amen."

record.title: 880-02 Kitāb al-ʻibar. Al-Juzʼ 3 : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Muḥammad ibn Khaldūn.
record.note: On the preliminary leaf (in pencil): "al-Juzʼ al-thālith."

Colophon: "Intahá al-juzʼ al-thālith min Tārīkh Ibn Khaldūn, al-musammá bi-al-ʻIbar. Wa-yalīhi fī al-Juzʼ al-rābiʻ Akhbār al-Dawlah al-ʻAlawīyah wa-al-muzāḥimah li-Dawlat li-Banī [Banī] al-ʻAbbās bi-Miṣr baʻda Baghdād. Intahá al-Juzʼ al-thālith ʻalá yad kātibihi al-faqīr al-muʻtarif bi-al-ʻajz wa-al-taqṣīr al-murtajī raḥmat al-Mawlá al-jalīl, Ismāʻīl ibn Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Damshīhī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad al-Nabī al-Ummī, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman kathīran ilá Yawm al-Dīn. Taḥrīran fī 22 B, 1269, tisʻah wa-sittīn wa-miʼatayn wa-alf min Hijrat man khalaqahu Allāh ʻalá akmal waṣf."

Translation of the colophon: "Part three of the History of Ibn Khaldūn, titled 'al-ʻIbar' is completed. It will be followed by Part four, on the history of al-Dawlah al-ʻAlawīyah [State of the Alawites], which rivaled Dawlat Banī al-ʻAbbās [the State of the Abbasids], in Egypt after Baghdad. The third part is completed by the hand of its copyist, the poor, who admits his inability and insufficiency, and hopes for the mercy of the Glorious Lord, Ismāʻīl ibn Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Damshīhī, may God forgive him, his parents and all Muslims. Amen. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, the Illiterate Prophet, and on his family and his companions and grant them abundant peace, until Judgement Day. Written on 22 B [Ṣafar], 1269 of the Hijrah of Him whom God created in the most perfect stature [5 December, 1852]."

record.title: 880-02 Kitāb al-ʻibar. Al-Juzʼ 4 : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Muḥammad ibn Khaldūn.
record.note: Colophon: "Intahá al-Juzʼ al-rābiʻ min Tārīkh Qāḍī al-Quḍāh Ibn Khaldūn, al-musammá bi-al-ʻIbar. Wa-yatlūhu al-Juzʼ al-khāmis, fī Dawlat Ṭughrulbik wa-banīhi wa-ghayrihim min al-Saljūqīyah. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá al-dawām. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman kathīran. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min naskhihi yawm al-Thalāth al-mubārak, arbaʻat ayyām khalat min shahr Ramaḍān, sanat 1270, sabʻīn wa-miʼatayn wa-alf, min Hijrat man khalaqahu Allāh ʻalá akmal waṣf, ʻalá yad kātibihi al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá, Ismāʻīl ibn Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Jamal al-Damshīhī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn, bi-mannihi wa-karamihi. Āmīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon: "Part four of the History of Qāḍī al-Quḍāh [Chief Judge] Ibn Khaldūn, titled 'al-ʻIbar' is completed. It will be followed by Part five, on the State of Ṭughrulbik [Tuğrul, Sultan of the Seljuks, approximately 993-1063] and his sons and other Seljuks. Praise be to God continuously. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, and on his family and companions and grant them abundant peace. Copied on blessed Tuesday, four days having passed from the month of Ramaḍān, the year 1270 of the Hijrah of him whom God created in the most perfect stature [31 May, 1854], by the hand of its copyist, the poor to God Almighty, Ismāʻīl ibn Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Jamal al-Damshīhī, may God forgive him, his parents and all Muslims, by His grace and benevolence. Amen. Amen."

record.title: 880-02 Kitāb al-ʻibar. Al-Juzʼ 5 : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Muḥammad ibn Khaldūn.
record.note: Incipit (folio 3b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-bi-hi al-iʻānah. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. al-Khabar ʻan Dawlat al-Saljūqīyah min al-Turk al-mustawlīn ʻalá mamālik al-Islām wa-al-dawlah bi-al-Mashriq kullihā ilá ḥudūd Miṣr, mustabiddīn ʻalá al-Khalīfah bi-Baghdād, min khilāfat al-Qāʼim ilá hādhā al-zamān, wa-mā kāna lahum min al-mulk wa-al-sulṭān fī aqṭār al-ʻālam, wa-kayfa faʻalū al-ʻulamāʼ [bi-al-ʻulamāʼ] wa-ḥajazūhum, wa-mā tafarraʻa min dawlatihim min al-duwal ..."
On folios 1a-1b and folio 248b: Texts on the rule of Ṣalāḥ al-Dīn al-Ayyūbī (Saladin, Sultan of Egypt and Syria, 1137-1193) and his successors.

Colophon (folio 245b): "Wa-ilá hunā qad intahá al-juzw al-khāmis min Tārīkh al-ʻAllāmah Ibn Khaldūn, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá raḥmatan wāsiʻah, bi-mannihi wa-karamih. Wa-yalīhi al-Juzw al-sādis, alladhī awwaluhu: 'Istaqallat Muḍar wa-fursānuhā wa-anṣāruhā min al-Yaman bi-al-Dawlah al-Islāmīyah, fīman tabiʻa dīnahum, ilá ākhirihi. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min naskh hādhā al-juzʼ al-mubārak yawm al-Ithnayn al-mubārak, iḥdá ʻashar yawman khalat min shahr <Muḥarram> Ṣafar, aḥad shuhūr ʻām 1272, ithnayn wa-sabʻīn khalat baʻda al-miʼatayn wa-al-alf, min Hijrat man la-hu al-ʻizz wa-al-sharaf, ʻalayhi afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-atamm al-taslīm, ʻalá yad kātibihi al-faqīr ilá Allāh, ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Jamal al-Azʹharī al-Mālikī, ghafara Allāh la-hu. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon: "Here ends Part five of the History of the Learned scholar Ibn Khaldūn, may God Almighty have abundant mercy upon him, by His grace and generosity. It will be followed by Part six, which begins with: 'Muḍar, by its cavalry and allies from Yemen, gained mastery over the Islamic state, with those who followed their [its] religion, etc.' Praise be to God Lord of the Universe. This blessed part was copied on blessed Monday, eleven days having passed from the month of <Muḥarram> Ṣafar, of the year 1272 [23 October, 1855] of the Hijrah of Him to whom belongs nobleness and honor, may the best prayer and the most perfect peace be upon Him, by the hand of its copyist, the poor to God, ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Jamal al-Azʹharī al-Mālikī, may God forgive him. Amen."

record.title: Sigismondo Casanova lecture notes on a course in philosophy : manuscript.
record.note: Poem in Catalan addressed to St. Thomas Aquinas on recto of front flyleaf.
Title page for "Secunda pars" on recto of 1l. Title page for "tertia pars" on recto of 70l. This title page includes the date "die 19 aprillis anno 1700."
Inscribed at end of text, verso of l196: " Sigismundus Casanova. V. OBACH."
An "index questionum" follows the text.
Title in contemporary lettering on spine: "2 et 3 pars Cvr Phae."

record.title: Discourse upon Daniel : manuscript / by Rich[ar]d Wroe, D. D.
record.note: Title transcribed from title page.
1st of 4 items bound together.
Volume also includes tipped-in engraved portrait of clergyman, annotated "Warden Wroe" in a later hand.

record.title: Karl Albrecht Fugger letter to unidentified recipient, Salzburg, 1620 June 4 : manuscript.
record.note: Signed: "Carlo Foccaro."
Docket on the second leaf in a contemporary hand: "1620 Fuccaro 24 giugno."

record.title: Correction slips in the Sneyd-Gimbel copy of Samuel Johnson's Dictionary of the english language : manuscript.
record.note: Byname: Sneyd-Gimbel Dictionary; Sneyd-Gimbel Johnson.

record.title: Expedition of Lieutenant G. C. Doane : Fort Ellis, Montana to Fort Hall, Idaho October 11, 1876 to January 4, 1877 : typescript.
record.note: Note on cover: The original journal of this is in the possession of Dr. Merrill Burlingame Montana State College Bozeman, Montana and is not to be quoted or published in anyway without specific permission from him.

record.title: W. A. Eisele letter to William Elsey Connelley, 1928 December 4 : manuscript.
record.note: Letter dated 1928 December 3 accompanied by a typed transcript made by an unidentified transcriber.

record.title: 880-02 Kharīdat al-ʻajāʼib wa-farīdat al-gharāʼib : manuscript / Sirāj al-Dīn Abū Ḥafṣ ʻUmar ibn al-Wardī.
record.note: Title of Kharīdat al-ʻajāʼib wa-farīdat al-gharāʼib from colophon (folio 152a).
Title of al-Mawāʻiẓ wa-al-iʻtibār fī dhikr al-khiṭaṭ wa-al-āthār from incipit (folio 152b).

Incipit of Kharīdat al-ʻajāʼib wa-farīdat al-gharāʼib: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh ghāfir al-dhanb wa-qābil al-tawb, shadīd al-ʻiqāb, ʻālim al-ghayb, rāḥim al-shayb, munzil al-Kitāb, sātir al-ʻayb, kāshif al-rayb, mudhallil al-ṣiʻāb, mughīth al-malhūf, dāfiʻ al-maṣrūf, Rabb al-Arbāb, khāliq al-khalq, bāsiṭ al-rizq, musabbib al-asbāb, mālik al-mulk, musakhkhir al-fulk, musayyir al-saḥāb, rāfiʻ al-sabʻ al-ṭibāq mukhayyimah ʻalá al-āfāq takhyīm al-qibāb, sāṭiḥ al-ghabrāʼ ʻalá matn al-māʼ mumsakah bi-ḥikmatihi ʻan al-iḍṭriāb, minhā khalaqnākum wa-ilayhā nuʻīdukum wa-minhā nukhrijukum yawm al-ḥashr wa-al-maʼāb ..."
Secundo folio of Kharīdat al-ʻajāʼib wa-farīdat al-gharāʼib: nudibū ilayhi min al-istirʻāʼ.

Incipit of al-Mawāʻiẓ wa-al-iʻtibār fī dhikr al-khiṭaṭ wa-al-āthār: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Rabbi yassir wa-aʻin. Yā Karīm. al-Mawāʻiẓ wa-al-iʻtibār fī dhikr al-khiṭaṭ wa-al-āthār, lil-ʻAllāmah al-Shaykh Taqī al-Dīn al-Maqrīzī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá, fa-innahu qāl, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá, baʻda an dhakara Madrasat Ṣartaḥtamsh [?], thumma qāla baʻda dhālika: al-Jawharī fī al-Ṣiḥāḥ, wa-al-Mārastān, bi-fatḥ al-rāy [al-rāʼ], bayt al-marḍá, muʻarrab, ʻan Ibn al-Sikkīt. Wa-dhakar al-Ustādh Ibrāhīm ibn Waṣīf Shāh fī kitāb Akhbār Miṣr anna al-Malik Manāqiyūsh ibn Ashmūn aḥad mulūk al-Qibṭ al-uwal bi-arḍ Miṣr, awwal man ʻamila al-bīmārastānāt li-ʻilāj al-marḍá, wa-awdaʻahā al-ʻaqāqīr, wa-rattaba fīhā al-aṭibbāʼ wa-ajrá ʻalayhā mā yasaʻuhā ..."
Secundo folio of al-Mawāʻiẓ wa-al-iʻtibār fī dhikr al-khiṭaṭ wa-al-āthār: wa-kāna alladhī anfaqa ʻalá al-Mārastān wa-mustaghallih.

Kharīdat al-ʻajāʼib wa-farīdat al-gharāʼib in written in medium good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords. The fragment of "al-Mawāʻiẓ wa-al-iʻtibār fī dhikr al-khiṭaṭ wa-al-āthār" is written in a fast and crude naskhtaʻlīq script and ends abruptly.
At the upper left corner of folio 1a: "ʻAdad al-karārīs 17."
On folio 1a: "Kharīdat al-ʻajāʼib wa-jarīdat [wa-farīdat] al-gharāʼib, lil-Imām al-ʻallāmah wa-al-adīb al-fahhāmah, al-Shaykh Zayn al-Dīn ʻUmar ibn al-Wardī, raḥimahu Allāh raḥmatan wāsiʻah. Āmīn."

On folio 1a: An ownership statement: "Dakhala fī nawbat al-ʻabd al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr, al-rājī raḥmat Rabbihi, Sayyid Ṭāhā ibn al-Ḥājj ʻUthmān al-ʻAqqād ibn al-Ḥājj Aḥmad al-ʻAqqād, fī ghurrat Rabīʻ al-Awwal, sanat 1218 [of the Hijrah = 21 June, 1803]."

On folio 152a: An ownership note and an illegible seal: "Qad tamallakahu al-ʻabd al-ḥaqīr al-faqīr ilá Rabbihi al-qadīr [... ... ...] ibn Muṣṭafá [... ... ...] Ḥalab sābiqan, sanat 1198 [of the Hijrah = 1783/1784]."

Colophon of Kharīdat al-ʻajāʼib wa-farīdat al-gharāʼib: "Tamma Kitāb Kharīdat al-ʻajāʼib wa-farīdat al-gharāʼib, jamaʻahu al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻallāmah al-adīb, Sirāj al-Dīn Abī Ḥafṣ ʻUmar ibn Muẓaffar ibn Muḥammad ibn ʻUmar ibn Abī al-Fawāris ibn al-Wardī al-Qurashī al-Bakrī al-ʻUmarī, taghammadahu Allāh bi-raḥmatih, wa-ṭāba tharāh, wa-jaʻala al-Jannah mathwāh, ʻalá yaday al-faqīr ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Būrallī, wa-dhālika fī awākhir Jumādá al-Ākhir, sanat 948. Tammat al-muqāblah bi-ʻawn Allāh taʻālá wa-ḥusn tawfīqih."

Translation of the colophon of Kharīdat al-ʻajāʼib wa-farīdat al-gharāʼib: "The book of Kharīdat al-ʻajāʼib wa-farīdat al-gharāʼib is completed. It was compiled by the learned Imam and litterateur Sirāj al-Dīn Abī Ḥafṣ ʻUmar ibn Muẓaffar ibn Muḥammad ibn ʻUmar ibn Abī al-Fawāris ibn al-Wardī al-Qurashī al-Bakrī al-ʻUmarī, may God encompass him with His mercy, perfume his earth [i.e. resting place] and make Paradise his abode. Copied by the poor ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Būrallī, at the end of Jumādá al-Ākhir, the year 948 [of the Hijrah = 30 October, 1541]. The collation was completed by the help of God Almighty and His abundant benevolence."

Colophon of the fragment of al-Mawāʻiẓ wa-al-iʻtibār fī dhikr al-khiṭaṭ wa-al-āthār: No colophon. The text at the end is nearly illegible, and ends abruptly with: "... Hādhā al-Mārastān fawqa al-ṣūwah tujāha Ṭablakhānāh Qalʻat al-Jabal, ḥaythu kānat Madrasat al-Ashraf Shaʻbān ibn Ḥusayn allatī hadamahā al-Nāṣir Faraj ibn Barqūq, wa-bābuhu huwa ḥaythu kāna <kāna> bāb al-Madrasah, illā annahu aḍyaq ʻammā kān, anshaʼahu al-Muʼayyad Shaykh fī muddah awwaluhā Jumādá al-Ākhirah sanat iḥdá [wa-ʻishrīn] wa-thamānimiʼah, wa-ākhiruhā Rajab sanat thalāth wa-ʻishrīn, wa-nazala fīhi al-marḍá [fī] niṣf Shaʻbān, wa-ʻumilat maṣārifuhu min jumlat awqāf al-Jāmiʻ al-Muʼayyadī al-mujāwir [li-Bāb Zuwaylah. Fa-lammā māta] al-Malik al-Muʼayyad fī thāmin al-Muḥarram sanat [arbaʻ wa-ʻishrīn] ..."

record.title: 880-03 ʻAjāʼib al-makhlūqāt wa-gharāʼib al-mawjūdāt : manuscript / Zakarīyā ibn Muḥammad al-Qazwīnī.
record.note: On folio 1a: "Kitāb ʻAjāʼib al-makhlūqāt, taʼlīf al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, al-ḥabr al-fahhāmah, Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā, al-Shaykh al-ṣāliḥ, [Zakarīyā ibn] Muḥammad ibn Maḥmūd al-Qazwīnī al-Ḥanafī, taghammadahu Allāh bi-raḥmatih, wa-nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi wa-biʻlūmihi, wa-ḥasbunā Allāh wa-kafá. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn."

On folio 1a: Three ownership statements, as follows: 1. "Qad manna Allāh taʻālá bi-intiqāl hādhā al-kitāb al-mubārak ilá nawbat al-ʻabd al-faqīr, al-muqirr bi-al-ʻajz wa-al-taqṣīr, al-Sayyid Aḥmad Naṣūḥ Bāshā [... ...]." An illegible seal. 2. "Qad manna Allāh taʻālá bi-intiqāl hādhā al-kitāb al-mubārak ilá nawbat al-ʻabd al-faqīr, al-muqirr bi-al-ʻajz wa-al-taqṣīr al-Sayyid Muḥammad Rāghib al-Usṭuwānī, fī Rabīʻ al-Awwal, fī shahr Mawlid al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, sanat 1268 [December 1851/January 1852]." 3. "Thumma intaqala min faḍl Rabbihi al-qadīr, ilá dhimmat al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-shahīr bi-Ibn al-Ḥājj Mullā Arakillī, bi-thaman 95. 15 D [Rabīʻ al-Thānī?], sanat 1269 [26 January, 1853]."

Colophon: "Wa-li-yakun hādhā ākhir al-kalām ʻan ʻajāʼib al-makhlūqāt. Wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb. Wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ wa-al-maʼāb. Tamma Kitāb ʻAjāʼib al-makhlūqāt wa-gharāʼib al-mawjūdāt fī 7 J [Jumād] Thānī, sanat 1234. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon: "Let this be the end of the discourse on the wonderous creatures. God is more knowledgeable. To Him is the reference and returning. The book of ʻAjāʼib al-makhlūqāt wa-gharāʼib al-mawjūdāt was completed on 7 J [Jumādá] Thānī, of the year 1234 [of the Hijrah = 3 April, 1819]. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, and on his family and companions and grant them peace. Amen. Amen. Amen."

record.title: 880-02 Bāʻith al-nufūs ilá ziyārat al-Quds al-maḥrūs : manuscript / Ibrāhīm ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn al-Firkāḥ.
record.note: On folio 1a: "Hādhā al-kitāb yashtamilu ʻalá faḍāʼil Bayt al-Maqdis."
At the head of folio 1b: "Hādhā al-kitāb fī faḍāʼil Bayt al-Maqdis, sharrafahā Allāh."

Colophon: "Qad waqaʻa al-farāgh min kitābat hādhihi al-nuskhah al-sharīfah, bi-tawfīq Allāh taʻālá, ʻalá yaday al-ʻabd al-ḍaʻīf, al-rājī laṭāʼif Rabbih, al-khāʼif min ʻadhābih, kātibuhu al-mudhnib al-ḥaqīr al-dhalīl, ʻAwaḍ ibn Muḥammad ibn Ismāʻīl, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-aḥsana ilayhimā wa-ilayhi, wa-li-kāffat al-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn. Āmīn. Yā Rabba al-ʻĀlamīn."

Translation of the colophon: "This noble copy was completed by the abundant benevolence of God Almighty, by the hands of the feeble servant, who hopes for the graciousness of his Lord, he who is afraid of His torment, the sinner, despised and miserable copyist, ʻAwaḍ ibn Muḥammad ibn Ismāʼīl, may God forgive him and his parents, and treat them and all Muslims with kindness. Amen. O Lord of the Universe."

record.title: 880-03 ʻArāʼis al-majālis fī qiṣaṣ al-anbiyāʼ : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Thaʻlabī.
record.note: Incipit (folio 4b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-bi-hi thiqatī. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Qāla al-Ustādh Abū Isḥāq Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn Ibrāhīm al-Thaʻlabī: Hādhā kitāb yashtamilu ʻalá dhikr qiṣaṣ al-Qurʼān bi-al-sharḥ wa-al-bayān, wa-Allāh al-mustaʻān, wa-ʻalayhi al-tuklān, innahu al-Malik al-Dayyān. Bāb fī baʻḍ wujūh al-ḥikamah ..."

On folio 1a: Two ownership statements, as follows: "Dakhala hādhā al-kitāb fī mulk al-Sayyid Shākir al-Shuwaykī fī Jumād al-Awwal, sanat 1275 [of the Hijrah = December 1858/January 1859]. Wa-baʻdahu ishtarāh waladuhu Muḥammad Darwīsh al-Shuwaykī fī sanat thalāthmiʼah wa-wāḥid baʻda al-alf [1883/1884]."
On folios 1b-3b: An index of contents.

On folio 4a: "Kitāb ʻArāʼis al-Thaʻlabī. Muʼallif hādhā al-kitāb Abū Isḥāq Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn Ibrāhīm al-Thaʻlabī al-Nīsābūrī al-mashhūr. Kāna awḥad zamānihi fī ʻilm al-tafsīr, wa-ṣannafa 'al-Tafsīr al-kabīr' alladhī fāqa ghayrahu min al-tafāsīr. Wa-la-hu kitāb 'al-ʻArāʼis fī qiṣaṣ al-anbiyāʼ', ʻalayhim al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām, wa-ghayr dhālik. Dhakarahu al-Ṣaghānī, wa-qāl: Yuqālu la-hu al-Thaʻlabī, wa-huwa laqab laysa bi-nasab. Qālahu baʻḍ al-ʻulamāʼ. Raḥmat Allāh ʻalayh."

Colophon: "Hādhā al-kitāb ḥarrartuhu baʻdamā shābat al-liḥyah wa-al-limmah, wa-dhahabat al-qūwah wa-al-qudrah wa-al-himmah, wa-ḍaʻufat al-ḥawāss, wa-inḥaná al-ẓahr, wa-āla al-ʻaysh ilá ḍīq wa-kadar. Fa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá kull ḥāl, wa-aʻūdhu bi-hi min sūʼ mā khaṭara fī al-bāl. Wa-astaghfiru Allāh lī wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn. Wa-hā anā al-faqīr al-rājī ʻafwa Rabbihi al-matīn, al-Ḥājj Yūsuf ibn ʻAbd Allāh, al-ṭālib bi-taswīdihi wa-taḥrīrih thawāb Allāh. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min itmāmih yawm al-Sabt, min awākhir shahr Shawwāl, sanat khams wa-sabʻīn wa-miʼah baʻda al-alf min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām wa-al-ʻizz wa-al-sharaf."

Translation of the colophon: "I edited this book after the beard and locks turned white; power, energy and ability were gone; the senses weakened; the back bent; and livelihood ended in agony and distress. However, praise be to God in all circumstances. I seek refuge in Him for whatever evil crossed my mind. I invoke God's forgiveness for me and all Muslims. Here am I, the poor who hopes for the forgiveness of his Mighty Lord, al-Ḥājj Yūsuf ibn ʻAbd Allāh, requesting, for editing and copying this book, God's reward. This copy was completed on Saturday, the end of Shawwal, the year 1175 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [23 May, 1762], may prayer, peace, nobleness and honor be upon him."

record.title: 880-02 Iʻlām al-nās bi-mā waqaʻa lil-Barāmikah min Banī al-ʻAbbās. Volume 1 : manuscript / Muḥammad Diyāb al-Itlīdī.
record.note: On folio 1a: "al-Juzʼ al-awwal min kitāb Iʻlām al-nās bi-mā waqaʻa lil-Barāmikah min Banī al-ʻAbbās, mimmā ʻuniya bi-taʼlīfihi al-Shaykh al-fāḍil Sayyidī Muḥammad Diyāb al-Itlīdī al-Ṣaʻīdī, ṭāba tharāh, wa-nāla min Allāh riḍāh. Āmīn. M."

On folio 1a: Miscellaneous verses of poetry praising books and reading: Three verses attributed to ʻAbd al-ʻAzīz al-Jurjānī (could not be identified), and three and two verses, respectively, by anonymous poets.
At the head of folio 1b: A decorative geometric design in black and red.

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with: "... fa-qumtu ʻalá an ukhalliya lahumā al-makān, fa-qālat al-Sitt Budūr: Ilá ayn Yā Shaykh? Fa-qultu: Ukhallī lakumā al-makān. Fa-qālat: Lā tafʻal. Fa-qāma al-Amīr ʻUmar, wa-akhadhanā ilá majlis malīḥ, wa-quddima al-ṭaʻām fa-akalnā, wa-intaqalnā baʻda dhālika ilá majlis al-sharāb, wa-bitnā fī ladhdhah wa-ṭarab. Fa-lammā kāna al-ṣabāḥ qālat lī al-Sitt Budūr: Imḍi wātinā bi-al-qāḍī wa-al-shuhūd. Fa-aḥḍartuhum bi-surʻah. Fa-qālat lil-qāḍī: Uktub kitābī ʻalá al-Amīr ʻUmar ..."

record.title: 880-02 Tanwīr al-abṣār wa-jāmiʻ al-biḥār : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Khaṭīb al-Tamartāshī.
record.note: On folio 1a: "Kitāb Tanwīr al-abṣār wa-jāmiʻ al-biḥār, lil-ʻAllāmah Shams al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd Allāh ibn Shihāb al-Dīn Aḥmad ibn Tamartāsh, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn."

On folio 1a: Two ownership statements: 1. "al-Ḥamdu lillāh taʻālá. Malakahu afqar al-wará Muṣṭafá ibn [... ...] al-Hayṭalānī" and two illegible seals. 2. Dakhala fī nawbat [... ... ...], sanat 1124 [1712/1713]" and an illegible seal.
On folio 1b: "... wa-sammaytuhu 'Tanwīr al-abṣār wa-jāmiʻ al-biḥār' ..."

Colophon: "Tamma al-kitāb bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih wa-ḥusn tawfīqih. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá man lā nabī baʻdah, fī yawm al-Khamīs al-mubārak, sābiʻ ʻashar Rajab al-ḥarām, sanat 5 wa-thamānīn wa-alf. Tamma al-kitābu takāmalat // niʻamu al-surūr li-ṣāḥibih. Wa-ʻafá al-Ilāhu bi-jūdihi wa-bi-faḍlihi ʻan kātibih."

Translation of the colophon: "The book was completed by the praise of God, His help and His abundant benevolence. Praise be to God alone. May God pray on him who no prophet comes after him. On blessed Thursday, 17 Rajab, 1085 [of the Hijrah = 17 October, 1674]. The book is completed, and the blessings of happiness are gathered to its owner. May God, in His generosity and favor, pardon its copyist."

record.title: 880-02 al-Mustaṭraf min kull fann mustaẓraf. Al-Juzʼ 2 : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad al-Ibshīhī.
record.note: On folio 1a: "al-Juzʼ al-thānī min 'al-Mustaṭraf min kull fann mustaẓraf', nafaʻanā Allāh taʻālá bi-muʼallifihi. Āmīn. Āmīn. Ūllifat [Ullifat] hādhihi al-nuskhah taḥrīran fī shahr Dhī al-Ḥijjah al-ḥarām min shuhūr sanat alf wa-miʼah wa-iḥdá ʻashar min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām. Āmīn."

Colophon: "Wa-Allāh, subḥānuhu wa-taʻālá, aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb, wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ wa-al-maʼāb, wa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻAlī al-ʻAẓīm. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman kathīran. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Tamma al-Juzʼ al-awwal [ayy, al-thānī] min Kitāb al-Mustaṭraf, ʻalá al-tamām wa-al-kamāl. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá kull ḥāl, wa-dhālika bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnihi wa-ḥusn tawfīqihi. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah."

Translation of the colophon: "God Almighty, may He be praised, is more knowleageble of what is correct, to Him is the reference and returning. There is no power nor might except in God, the Most High, the All Powerful. Praise be to God alone. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, on his family and on his companions and grant them abundant peace. The first [i.e. The second] part of Kitāb al-Mustaṭraf, is completed in its entirety. Praise be to God in all circumstances. [Copied] by the praise of God, His help and His abundant benevolence. Praise be to God alone."

record.title: 880-02 Tuḥfat al-ʻarūs wa-nuzʹhat al-nufūs : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad al-Tijānī.
record.note: On the preliminary leaf: "Tuḥfat al-ʻarūs wa-fawāʼid al-nikāḥ, bi-khaṭṭ al-Kirmānī, raḥimahu Allāh."
On folio 1a: "Kitāb Tuḥfat al-ʻarūs wa-fawāʼid al-nikāḥ, yashtamilu ʻalá laṭāʼif wa-gharāʼib. Wa-ḥasbunā Allāh wa-niʻma al-wakīl."

On folio 1a: Ownership statements, as follows: 1. "Ḥasbiya Allāh. Min kutub [...] Aḥmad ibn Rustum al-Shirwānī" 2. "Malakahu min faḍl Allāh subḥānuhu wa-taʻālá [... ... ...]" 3. "Fī nawbat al-faqīr ilayhi, ʻazza shaʼnuhu, al-Sayyid Zayn al-ʻĀbidīn ibn al-Sayyid ʻAlī, ghafara Allāh dhunūbahumā wa-satara ʻuyūbahumā" 4. Two illegible statements.
On folio 1b: "... fa-jamaʻnā hādhā al-kitāb al-musammá bi-Tuḥfat al-ʻarūs ..."

Colophon: "Wa-hunā intahá al-kitāb. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá ḥusn maʻūnatih, wa-ṣalawātuhu al-mutawāliyah ʻalá khayr barīyatih, Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-dhurrīyatih. Wa-astaghfiru Allāh taʻālá wa-astaqīluhu mimmā khaṭṭathu yamīnī wa-naṭaqa bi-hi lisānī, wa-lafẓ [wa-laghaṭ] al-kalām wa-saqaṭih, wa-fuḍūl al-qawl wa-hadharih al-wāqiʻ fī hādhā al-kitāb. Wa-asʼaluhu, ʻazza wa-jall, al-ʻafwa ʻannī wa-ʻan muʼallifihi wa-ʻan al-nāẓir fīhi, fa-Huwa Allāhumma al-Wahhāb. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Wa-kāna al-farāgh minhu fī yawm al-Sabt, al-thānī min shahr Rabīʻ al-Thānī, sanat arbaʻ wa-sittīn wa-thamānimiʼah, ʻalá yad faqīr raḥmat Rabbihi al-ghanī, Yūsuf ibn Yaḥyá ibn Muḥammad al-Kirmānī, ʻafā Allāh ʻanhum ajmaʻīn. Wa-Allāh yaghfiru lanā wa-li-man daʻā li-nāsikhihi wa-lil-nāẓir fīhi wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn bi-al-tawbah wa-al-maghfirah. Wa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻAlī al-ʻAẓīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-sallam."

Translation of the colophon: "Herein this book has ended. Praise be to God for His abundant help. May His continuous prayers be upon the best of his creation, Muḥammad, his family and his progeny. I seek the forgiveness of God Almighty and His abrogation for what my right hand scribbled and my tongue spoke, of clamorous and foul speech, and for the patter and chatter which was introduced in this book. I beseech Him, the Almighty and the Glorious One to pardon me, and to pardon the author of this book, and he who reads it, for God is the Abundant Giver. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions and grant them peace. The copy was completed on Saturday, 2 Rabīʻ al-Thāni, 864 [of the Hijrah = 4 February 1460], by the hand of the poor to the mercy of his affluent Lord, Yūsuf ibn Yaḥyá ibn Muḥammad al-Kirmānī, may God forgive them all. May God pardon us and he who beseech God on behalf of its copyist, its reader and all Muslims, and grant them repentance and forgiveness. There is no power nor might except in God, the Almighty, the All Powerful. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad and his family and grant them peace."

record.title: 880-02 Badīʻ al-inshāʼ wa-al-ṣifāt fī al-mukātabāt wa-al-murāsalāt : manuscript / Marʻī ibn Yūsuf al-Karmī.
record.note: On the preliminary leaf: An index of contents of the fourteen chapters of the book: "Firhist [Fihrist] Inshāʼ al-Shaykh Marʻī al-Karmī al-Maqdisī al-Ḥanbalī madhhaban."
At the upper left corner of the preliminary leaf: "Mansūb ilá qaryah min qurā [qurá] Nāblus tusammá bi-Ṭur Karm."

On folio 1a: "Kitāb Badīʻ al-inshāʼ wa-al-ṣifāt fī al-mukātabāt wa-al-murāsalāt, taṣnīf al-Shaykh al-Imām wa-al-ḥabr al-humām, al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, al-ʻumdah al-fahhāmah, Shaykh al-Islām, barakat al-anām, al-Shaykh Marʻī ibn al-Shaykh al-Imām Yūsuf ibn Abī Bakr ibn Aḥmad ibn Abī Bakr ibn Aḥmad al-Maqdisī al-Ḥanbalī, raḥmat Allāh taʻālá ʻalayhim wa-ʻalayhi. Āmīn."
At the head of folio 1b: An ownership statement: "Ṣāḥibuhu Muḥammad najl al-Shaykh Masʻūd Abū Ghazlah [...] al-Naqshabandī."
On folio 2a: "... wa-sammaytuhu 'Badīʻ al-inshāʼ wa-al-ṣifāt fī al-mukātabāt wa-al-murāsalāt' ..."
On folio 68a: An ownership statement: "Dakhal hādhā al-kitāb fī mulk al-ʻabd al-faqīr [...] Abū Ghazlah, fī sant alf wa-miʼatayn wa-sabʻ wa-ʻishrīn. Sanat 1227 [1812/1813]."
On folios 68a-69a: Miscellaneous poetry and prose on letter writing.

Author's colophon (folio 67b): "Qāla muʼallifuhu, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá: Wa-kāna farāghuhu bi-al-Jāmiʻ al-Azʹhar, sanata tisʻ wa-ʻishrīn wa-alf min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah."

Translation of the author's colophon: "Its author, may God have mercy upon him, said: It was completed at al-Jāmiʻ al-Azʹhar, in the year 1029 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [1619/1620], may the best prayer and peace be upon him. Praise be to God alone."

Copyist's colophon (folio 68a): "Wa-hādhihi al-nuskhah nuqilat min nuskhat al-Ustādh al-madhkūr, bi-khaṭṭihi, fī ghurrat shahr Dhī al-Qaʻdah al-ḥarām, sanat alf wa-miʼah wa-thamāniyah wa-thalāthīn min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá man lā nabī baʻdah. Wa-ḥasbunā Allāh wa-niʻma al-wakīl. Wa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻAlī al-ʻAẓīm. Tammat bi-ḥamd Allāh."

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "This copy was transcribed from a copy in the handwriting of the aforementioned Master, at the beginning of Dhū al-Qaʻdah, the year 1128 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [1 July, 1726]. May God pray on Him who no prophet comes after him. God suffices us. He is the best advocate. There is no power nor might except in God the Almighty the All Powerful. It was completed by the praise of God."

record.title: 880-02 al-Wasāʼil ilá maʻrifat al-awāʼil : manuscript / Jalāl al-Dīn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Abī Bakr al-Suyūṭī.
record.note: Title of "al-Wasāʼil ilá maʻrifat al-awāʼil" from folio 2a.
Title of "Juzʼ fīhi Ṭuruq Ḥadīth 'Uṭlubū al-khayr ʻinda ḥisān al-wujūh'" from folio 63b.

Incipit of al-Wasāʼil ilá maʻrifat al-awāʼil: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Allāhumma Ṣalli ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallim. Qāla Sayyidunā wa-Mawlānā al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá, al-Shaykh al-Imām, al-ʻāmil al-ʻālim, al-muḥaqqiq al-mudaqqiq al-mufannan, al-qudwah al-khāshiʻ al-nāsik, al-mufīd al-mujtahid, ḥāfiẓ al-ʻaṣr, khaṭīb al-khuṭabāʼ, faṣīḥ al-bulaghāʼ, ḥujjat al-munāẓirīn, lisān al-mutakallimīn, ṣadr al-mudarrisīn, Sībawayh awānih [zamānih], ḥāfiẓ waqtihi wa-awānih, khādim Sunnat Sayyid al-Mursalīn, Jalāl al-Dīn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā al-marḥūm al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá, al-Shaykh al-Imām, al-ʻālim al-ʻāmil al-faqīh, Zayn al-Dīn Abī Bakr al-Suyūṭī al-Shāfiʻī, aʻāda Allāh ʻalaynā wa-ʻalá al-Muslimīn min barakātihimā wa-barakāt ʻulūmihimā fī al-dunyā wa-al-ākhirah, bi-Muḥammad wa-ālihi: al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-awwal fa-laysa la-hu ākhir. Wa-ashhadu an lā ilāha illā Allāh waḥdah lā sharīka lah, wa-lā tanthanī ʻalayhi al-khanāṣir. Wa-ashhadu anna Sayyidanā Muḥammadan ʻabduhu wa-rasūluh dhū al-nasab al-ṭāhir, ṣallá Allāh wa-sallama ʻalayhi wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbih dhawī al-mafākhir wa-al-maʼāthir. Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhā kitāb laṭīf jāmiʻ lil-awāʼil, lakhkhaṣtu fīhi kitāb al-Awāʼil lil-ʻAskarī, wa-zidtu ʻalayhi aḍʻāfahu, wa-rattabtuhu tartīban sahl al-tanāwul ʻalá abwāb ..."
Secundo folio of al-Wasāʼil ilá maʻrifat al-awāʼil: al-Mabʻath al-Nabawī, al-Imārah, al-ʻIlm, al-Amthāl.

Incipit of Juzʼ fīhi Ṭuruq Ḥadīth 'Uṭlubū al-khayr ʻinda ḥisān al-wujūh': "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh wa-salāmun ʻalá ʻibādihi alladhīna iṣṭafá. Hādhā juzʼ jamaʻtu fīhi Ṭuruq Ḥadīth 'Uṭlubū al-khayr ʻinda ḥisān al-wujūh', fa-naqūlu: Warada dhālika min Ḥadīth Ibn ʻAbbās, wa-Ibn ʻUmar, wa-Jābir ibn ʻAbd Allāh, wa-Anas, wa-ʻAlī, wa-Abī Hurayrah, wa-Abī Bakrah, wa-ʻAbd Allāh ibn Jarād, Wa-Raqād ibn Rabīʻah, wa-ʻĀyishah, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhum, wa-Yazīd ibn al-Ḥajjāj, wa-Abī Khuṣayfah ..."
Secundo folio of Juzʼ fīhi Ṭuruq Ḥadīth 'Uṭlubū al-khayr ʻinda ḥisān al-wujūh': ʻAbd al-Ṣamad ibn Aḥmad ibn Khanbash.

On folio 1a: "Kitāb al-Wasāʼil ilá maʻrifat al-awāʼil, taʼlīf al-Shaykh al-Imām, al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, al-muḥaqqiq al-mudaqqiq, al-qudwah al-mufīd al-mujtahid, ḥāfiẓ al-ʻaṣr, ḥujjat al-munāẓirīn, lisān al-mutakallimīn, ṣadr al-mudarrisīn, Jalāl al-Dīn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Suyūṭī, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-barakātihi. Āmīn."
On folio 2a: "... wa-sammaytuhu al-Wasāʼil ilá maʻrifat al-awāʼil ..."

The titles of the chapters of "al-Wasāʼil ilá maʻrifat al-awāʼil" are, as follows: Badʼ al-khalq (Beginnig of creation), al-Ṭahārah (Ritual purity), al-Ṣalāh (Prayer), al-Janāʼiz (Funerals), al-Zakāh (Islamic almsgiving), al-Ṣawm (Fasting), al-Ḥajj (Pilgrimage), al-Buyūʻ (Sales), al-Farāʼiḍ (Inheritance and succession), al-Nikāḥ (Marriage), al-Ḥudūd (Punishments), al-Jināyāt (Crimes), al-Jihād (War), al-Libās (Clothes), al-Asāmī wa-al-alqāb (Names and nicknames), al-Aṭʻimah (Foods), al-Mabʻath al-Nabawī (Advent of the Prophet), al-Imārah (Governorship), al-ʻIlm (Science), al-Amthāl (Proverbs), Bāb jāmiʻ al-Baʻth wa-al-Nushūr (Culminative chapter on Day of Judgement and Resurrection).
On folio 63b: "Juzʼ fīhi Ṭuruq Ḥadīth 'Uṭlubū al-khayr ʻinda ḥisān al-wujūh', lil-Ḥāfiẓ al-Suyūṭī, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-barakātihi. Āmīn."

"al-Wasāʼil ilá maʻrifat al-awāʼil" ends with: "... Akhraja Ibn Saʻd wa-Ibn Abī Shaybah ʻan Abī al-Ḍuḥá, qāl: Istanshada Abū Bakr ibn Maʻdī Karib, wa-qāl: Amā innaka awwal man istanshadtuhu fī al-Islām."
Colophon of al-Wasāʼil ilá maʻrifat al-awāʼil: "Akhir mā wujida min khaṭṭ hādhā al-muʼallif."
Translation of the colophon of al-Wasāʼil ilá maʻrifat al-awāʼil: "This is the end of what was found of the handwriting of this author."

"Juzʼ fīhi 'Ṭuruq Ḥadīth 'Uṭlubū al-khayr ʻinda ḥisān al-wujūh'" ends with: "... Wa-anshada al-Ḥusayn ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān: Laqd qāla al-Rasūlu wa-qāla ḥaqqan // wa-khayru al-qawli mā qāla al-Rasūlu. Idhā al-ḥājātu abdat fa-uṭlubūhā ilá man wajhuhu ḥasanun jamīlu."
Colophon of Juzʼ fīhi Ṭuruq Ḥadīth 'Uṭlubū al-khayr ʻinda ḥisān al-wujūh': "Tammat bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih."
Translation of the colophon of Juzʼ fīhi Ṭuruq Ḥadīth 'Uṭlubū al-khayr ʻinda ḥisān al-wujūh': "It is completed by the praise of God and His help."

record.title: 880-02 Tadhkirat ulī al-albāb wa-al-jāmiʻ lil-ʻajab al-ʻujāb. Al-Juzʼ 1 : manuscript / Dāʼūd ibn ʻUmar al-Anṭākī.
record.note: On the back of the front cover: A poem dating in alphabetical reckoning "ḥisāb al-jummal" the birth of "Nāṣir najl al-Shaykh Maḥmūd al-ʻAbd al-Hādī" in the year 1248 of the Hijrah (1832/1833).
On folio 1a: "Hādhā al-kitāb al-Juzw al-awwal min Tadhkirat ulī al-albāb li-Dāwūd al-Baṣīr, ʻafá ʻanhu al-Malik al-Qadīr. Āmīn."

On folio 1a: Three poems dating the birth of "al-Sayyid ʻAbd al-Qādir najl al-faqīr ʻAbd al-Ghanī Zayd al-Qadirī", using alphabetical reckoning "ḥisāb al-jummal", in the year 1238 of the Hijrah (1822/1823).
On folio 1b: A note dating the birth of Munīb: "Yawm al-Thalāthah, fi 18 khalat min Dhī al-Qaʻdah, sanat 1250, al-muwāfiq li-khamsat ayyam khalat min Ādhār" (Tuesday, 5 March 1835 [Julian]).

On folio 2a: Two notes dating the birth of a son and a daughter, as follows: "Tārīkh mawlid waladinā ʻAbd al-Qādir, laylat al-Ithnayn,fi 11 sāʻah, fī 20 Ṣafar, sanat 1238 [6 November, 1822]." And "Mawlid Ghuṣūn fī 10 sāʻāt, laylat al-Ithnayn, fī 5 [Rabīʻ] Awwal, sanat 1241 [18 October, 1825]."
On folio 3a: "... wa-sammaytuhu bi-Tadhkirat ulī al-albāb wa-al-jāmiʻ lil-ʻajab al-ʻujab ..."
On folios 201b-202b: Popular medicinal recipes and anecdotes.

Colophon: "Tamma al-Juzw al-awwal bi-mā ishtamala ʻalayhi min al-qawānīn al-kullīyah, wa-tafṣīl aḥwāl al-mufradāt. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá mā alhama wa-yassara wa-anʻama. Wa-li-Wāhib al-ʻaql wa-al-minnah [al-minnah] wa-al-faḍl. Innahu karīm jawwād. Wa-yatlūhu al-Juzw al-thānī, in shāʼa Allāh taʻālá. Wa-kāna al-farāgh minhu yawm al-Khamīs, sādis ʻashar Shawwāl, sanat 1219, alf wa-miʼatayn wa-tisʻata ʻashar Hijrīyah Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā azká ṣalāh wa-taḥīyah, ʻalá yad afqar al-warā <al-warā> li-raḥmat al-Malik al-Jawwād, ʻabduhu al-faqīr Ḥammād, ilá akhīhi wa-ḥabībihi wa-ṣadīqihi al-Shaykh al-aʻẓam wa-al-qudwah al-muḥtaram al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Ghanī najl al-ʻAllāmah al-Shaykh Yūsuf min Āl Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā al-Shaykh Zayd, quddisa sirruhu."

Translation of the colophon: "The First part is completed with what it encompassed of the wholistic laws and the details of the conditions of the single [drugs]. Praise be to God for what He inspired, facilitated and favored. May to the Giver of intellect be the gratitude and favor, for He is the generous and abundant giving one. It will be followed, God willing, by the Second part. It was completed on Thursday, 16 Shawwāl, 1219 of the Hijrah of the Prophet, may the best prayer and peace by upon Him, by the hand of the poorest of mankind to the mercy of the Abundant Giving King, His servant, the poor Ḥammād, [copied] for his brother, beloved and friend, the Grand Shaykh and the respected leader, al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Ghanī, son of the learned scholar, al-Shaykh Yūsuf, of the family of our Master and Chief, al-Shaykh Zayd, may his secret be sanctified."

record.title: 880-02 Murūj al-dhahab wa-maʻādin al-jawhar : manuscript / ʻAlī ibn al-Ḥusayn al-Masʻūdī.
record.note: On the preliminary leaf (in green ink): "Murūj al-dhahab lil-Masʻūdī."

Colophon of part one (folio 289b): "Tamma al-juzw al-awwal bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih wa-ḥusn tawfīqih, ʻalá yad kātibihi wa-mālikihi al-faqīr lillāh al-Ḥannān, Aḥmad al-ʻUthmān. Wa-kāna al-farāgh minhu fī 22 Dhī al-Ḥijjah, sanat 267 [i.e., 1267]. Wa-yalīhi al-juzw al-thānī; awwaluhu: Dhikr Khilāfat Amīr al-Muʼminīn ʻAlī ibn Abī Ṭālib, karrama Allāh wajhahu."

Translation of the colophon of part one: "The first part was completed by the praise of God, His help and His abundant benevolence, by the hand of its copyist and owner, the poor to the Merciful God, Aḥmad al-ʻUthmān. Completed on 22 Dhū al-Ḥijjah, the year 267 [i.e., 1267 of the Hijrah = 18 October, 1851]. It will be followed by the second part, which begins with: 'Mention of the Caliphate of the Commander of the Faithful, ʻAlī ibn Abī Ṭālib, may God honor his face."

Part two ends abruptly with: "... thumma qāla la-hu: Yā Abā ʻAbd Allāh, qad ṭabakha kull wāḥid min hāʼulāʼ qidran, wa-qad jaʻalnāka ḥakaman fī ṭabkhihā. Qāl: 'fa-li-tuḥḍar, thummā ākulu, thumma aḥkumu bi-ḥukm bi-ʻilm.' Fa-ḥumilat ilayhi al-qudūr wa-wuḍiʻat bayna yadayhi. Fa-jaʻala yaʼkulu min awwal qidr aklan tamāman. Fa-qāla la-hu al-Muʻtaṣim: 'Hādhā ẓulm'. Qāl: 'Wa-kayfa dhālik?' Qāl: 'Li-annī arāka qad amʻanta fī hādhā al-lawn wa-sataḥkumu li-ṣāḥibihi'. Qāl: 'Yā Amīra al-Muʼminīn, ʻalayya an ākula min hādhihi al-qudūr kullihā kullamā [kulla mā] akaltuhu min hādhā al-qidr'. Fa-tabassama al-Muʻtaṣim wa-qāl ..."

record.title: 880-02 Laqṭ al-marjān fī aḥkām al-Jānn : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Abī Bakr al-Suyūṭī.
record.note: On folio 1a: "Kitāb laqṭ al-marjān fī aḥkām al-Jānn, taʼlīf Shaykh al-Islām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, Zayn al-Dīn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Abī Bakr al-Usyūṭī al-Shāfiʻī, laṭafa Allāh bi-hi. Āmīn."
Judging from the catchword at leaf 1b, a leaf or more might be missing between folio 1 and 2.

Colophon: "Intahá. Wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb, wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ wa-al-maʼāb. Tamma hādhā al-kitāb, wa-huwa kitāb 'Laqṭ al-marjān fī akhbār al-Jānn', taʼlīf Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā, al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, al-Shaykh Jalāl al-Dīn al-Suyūṭī."

Translation of the colophon: "It has ended, but God is more knowledgeable of what is correct, to Him is the reference and returning. This book is completed; it is the book of 'Laqṭ al-marjān fī akhbār al-Jānn', which is authored by our Master and Leader, the learned scholar, al-Shaykh al-Imām, Jalāl al-Dīn al-Suyūṭī."

record.title: 880-02 al-Iqnāʻ fī ḥall alfāẓ Abī Shujāʻ : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad al-Shirbīnī.
record.note: On folio 1a: "Hādhā kitāb Sharḥ al-Iqnāʻ fī ḥall alfāẓ Abī Shujāʻ. Taʼlīf al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, al-ḥabr al-baḥr al-fahhāmah, rājī raḥmat al-Mujīb, Muḥammad al-Shirbīnī al-Khaṭīb, ʻalá al-tamām wa-al-kamāl. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá kull ḥāl."
On folio 1a: An ownership statement: "Mulk al-faqīr ilá Rabbihi al-Jalīl, Ṭaḥmīr al-Wakīl al-Zaʻbalāwī, ʻufiya ʻanhu. Āmīn. Āmīn."
On folio 2b: "... wa-sammaytuhu bi-al-Iqnāʻ fī ḥall alfāẓ Abī Shujāʻ ..."
Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with: "... Tanbīh. Aḥkām al-wadīʻah thalāthah. al-Ḥukm al-awwal al-amānah, wa-al-ḥukm al-thānī al-radd, wa-al-ḥukm al-thālith ..."

record.title: 880-02 Lawʻat al-shākī wa-damʻat al-bākī : manuscript / Ṣafī al-Dīn ʻAbd al-ʻAzīz ibn Sarāyā al-Ḥillī.
record.note: In good naskh/taʻlīq script, in black ink, on white paper; the poetry verses and markings in purple; some corrections on the margins; text within double red frames; some water damage on folios 31b-32a and 33b, with loss of text; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Kitāb Lawʻat al-shākī wa-damʻat al-bākī, taʼlīf al-Imām al-ʻallāmah al-Ṣafī al-Ḥillī, raḥmat Allāh ʻalayhi, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi. Āmīn. Yā Rabba al-ʻĀlamīn."
On folio 1a: An ownership statement: "Ṣāḥibuhu wa-mālikuhu ʻAlī Ṭumburkī [?], ʻufiya ʻanhu." Two illegible seals.

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with: "... Wa-kuntu min raybi dahrī jāziʻan fariqan // fa-lam uwaqqa alladhī qad kuntu ajzaʻuhu. Billāhi yā manzila al-ẓaʻni alladhī darasat // āthāruhu wa-ʻafat mudh binti arbuʻuhu."

record.title: 880-02 al-Manẓūmah al-ʻImādīyah fī ādāb al-akl wa-al-shurb : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn al-ʻImād al-Aqfahsī.
record.note: Title of al-Manẓūmah al-ʻImādīyah fī ādāb al-akl wa-al-shurb from reference sources.
Title of al-Yāsamīnīyah from reference sources.

Incipit of al-Manẓūmah al-ʻImādīyah fī ādāb al-akl wa-al-shurb: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Rabbi aʻin. al-Ḥamdu minnī li-dhī musbighi al-niʻami // wa-al-shukru thumma al-thanā lil-māniḥi al-niḥali. Yā ṭāliban li-khiṣālin sāda jāmiʻuhā // wa-sāʼilan man ḥawāhā suʼla mubtahili ..."
Secundo folio of al-Manẓūmah al-ʻImādīyah fī ādāb al-akl wa-al-shurb: man lam tabit fī ṭilāb al-ʻilm himmatuhu.
Incipit of al-Yāsamīnīyah: "ʻAlá thalāthatin yadūru al-jabru // al-mālu wa-al-aʻdād wa-al-jadhru. Fa-al-mālu kullu ʻadadin murabbaʻin // wa-jadhruhu wāḥidu tilka al-aḍluʻu ..."
Secundo folio of al-Yāsamīnīyah: Wa-idh faraghnā min bayān al-khāmisah.

"al-Manẓūmah al-ʻImādīyah fī ādāb al-akl wa-al-shurb" is written in fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; some commentaries on the margins; catchwords. "al-Yāsamīnīyah" is written in mostly good naskh script; some of the verses fully vocalized; markings in red; catchwords.
On the preliminary leaf: "Kitāb fī ādāb al-akl."
On the preliminary leaf: An ownership statement: "Fī mulk al-faqīr Iḥsayn [Ḥusayn] Abū Ghazālah."
On folio 1a: "Kitāb Ādāb al-akl li-Ibn al-ʻImād al-Afqahsī [al-Aqfahsī]."

On folio 1a: A statement by a reader/owner: "Qad ṭālaʻahu <fīhi> wa-mālikuhu li-nafsihi al-faqīr Dhikr al-Jalālah, ʻabduhu Muḥammad Ṣāliḥ ibn al-Shaykh Masʻūd Abū Ghazālah, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-ʻafá ʻanhu. Āmīn."
At the end of folio 16a "Abyātuhā 328" (al-Manẓūmah al-ʻImādīyah fī ādāb al-akl wa-al-shurb is in 328 verses).
At the head of the text on folio 17a: "Kitāb al-Yāsamnīyah [al-Yāsamīnīyah]."

Colophon of al-Manẓūmah al-ʻImādīyah fī ādāb al-akl wa-al-shurb. No colophon. Text ends with: "... Wa-baʻda qawlī li-Rabbī kullu maḥmadatin // Ṣallá al-Ilāhu ʻalá al-Mukhtāri fī al-ṭafali. Wa-al-muṣṭafayna wa-kulli al-rusli ballighuhum // Rabbī al-salāma salāman zākiya al-ʻamali. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah."

Colophon of al-Yāsamīnīyah. No colophon. Text ends with: "... Wa-ḍarbu kullu zāyidn wa-nāqiṣi // fī nawʻihi ziyādatun lil-fāḥiṣi. Wa-ḍarbuhu fī ḍiddihi nuqṣānu // fa-ifham hadāka al-Maliku al-Dayyānu. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah."

record.title: 880-02 Dhāt al-anwār : manuscript / ʻĀmir ibn ʻĀmir al-Baṣrī.
record.note: Title of Dhāt al-anwār supplied Hartford Seminary.
Title of Sharḥ Nuzʹhat al-jamʻ bayna maḥāsin al-rasāʼil al-thalāth from folio 16a.

Incipit of Dhāt al-anwār (folio 1b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-bi-hi thiqatī. Qāla al-Shaykh al-ʻālim al-fāḍil, qudwat al-muḥaqqiqīn, al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá, ʻĀmir ibn ʻĀmir al-Baṣrī, qaddasa Allāh taʻālá rūḥahu wa-nawwar ḍarīḥahu: Tajallá liya al-Maḥbūbu min kulli wijhati // fa-shāhadʹtuhu fī kull maʻnan wa-ṣūrati. Wa-khāṭabanī minnī bi-kashfi sarāʼirin // taʻālat ʻani al-aʻyāni luṭfan wa-jallati ..."
Secundo folio of Dhāt al-anwār: Abītu bi-jafnin min hawāhu musahhadin.

Incipit of Sharḥ Nuzʹhat al-jamʻ bayna maḥāsin al-rasāʼil al-thalāth: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Kull amr dhī bāl lā yubdaʼu bi-hi bi-al-Basmalah, fa-huwa ajdham maqṭūʻ al-barakah. Wa-bi-hi astaʻīn, ay, aṭlubu al-ʻawn minhu. Yaqūlu, ay, yaʼmalu, al-ʻabd al-rājī, maʼkhūdh min al-rajāʼ wa-huwa al-ṭamaʻ fī mumkin al-ḥuṣūl, ʻafwa Mawlāhu, al-ʻafuw huwa al-ṣafḥ wa-ʻadam al-muʼākhadhah min al-Sayyid al-muʻīn li-ʻibādihi, Sharaf al-Dīn Yaḥyá ibn Taqī al-Dīn al-shahīr bi-al-Ḥalabī: al-Ḥamd huwa al-thanāʼ, ʻalá al-maḥmūd bi-jamīl ṣifātih. Allāh ʻalam lil-dhāt al-wājib al-wujūd al-mustaḥiqq li-jamīʻ al-maḥāmid, wa-al-ṣalāh min Allāh al-raḥmah, wa-min al-malāʼikah al-istighfār wa-min al-ādamīyīn al-duʻāʼ wa-al-taḍarruʻ ʻalá Sayyid al-Mursalīn ..."
Secundo folio of Sharḥ Nuzʹhat al-jamʻ bayna maḥāsin al-rasāʼil al-thalāth: al-thalāth wa-hiya al-Ghunyah wa-al-Bahāʼīyah.
Thāt al-anwār: 14 x 20 cm; written surface: 7.5 x 14 cm; 23 lines per page. Sharḥ Nuzʹhat al-jamʻ bayna maḥāsin al-rasāʼil al-thalāth: 15 x 20.5 cm; written surface: 10 x 14 cm; 13 lines per page.

"Dhāt al-anwār" is written in good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings in red; some commentaries and collations on the margins; catchwords. "Sharḥ Nuzʹhat al-jamʻ bayna maḥāsin al-rasāʼil al-thalāth" is written in clear naskh script; headings in red; many geometrical figures and illustrations; catchwords.

On folio 13a: Miscellaneous quotations and invocations, and a poem in "ḥisāb al-jummal" (alphabetical reckoning), dating the building of a certain house in the year 1146 of the Hijrah (1733/1734), as follows: "Ilá al-Shaykh Muṣṭafá al-Safarjalānī muʼarrikhan bināʼ al-Sayyid Yaḥyá al-Jāliqī, wa-kāna yulaqqabu Ṭawīl al-Nijād Kathīr al-Ramād: Ṭawīl al-Nijādi baná manzilan // raṣīṣ al-binā lā ʻafá rasmuhu. Rafīʻ al-ʻimādi wa-tārīkhuhu // Kathīru al-Ramādi wa-Yaḥyá ismuhu. Sanat 1146."

On folio 13b: "Yawm al-Sabt, 17 Shawwāl, sanat 47, awwal Ādhār [?]"; and a statement dating the birth of the child Aḥmad: "Fī laylat al-Khamīs, al-sāʻah fī al-tisʻah ilá [illā] shayʼ yasīr, ijānā [jāʼanā] al-mawlūd al-saʻīd, inshāʼ Allāh, wa-sammāh, bi-an luhhimanā nusammīhi Aḥmad, bi-shahr Dhulqaʻdah [Dhū al-Qaʻdah] al-ḥarām, sanat 1221 [Thursday night in January/February, 1807]."
